Do [I]76-dick bemoan [myself]76-dick ? Not [I.]76-dick An [I]76-dick be to marry , [I]76-dick will marry dry - eyed ! But if [ye]120-matcham know [her]3403-the poor wench , prithee , of what favour is [she]3403-the poor wench ? fair or foul ? And is [she]3403-the poor wench shrewish or pleasant ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , what matters it ? "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham . " An [y]120-matcham are to marry , [ye]120-matcham can but marry . What matters foul or fair ? These be but toys . [Y]120-matcham are no milksop , [Master Richard]74-master shelton ; [ye]120-matcham will [we]3406-we d with dry eyes , anyhow . "[120-matcham]

" It is well said , "[74-master shelton] replied [Shelton]74-master shelton . " Little [I]74-master shelton reck . "[74-master shelton]

" [[Your]76-dick lady wife]3407-your lady wife is like to have [a pleasant lord]3408-a pleasant lord , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham .

" [She]3407-your lady wife shall have [the lord Heaven]3409-the lord heaven made [her]3407-your lady wife for , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " It trow there be worse as well as better . "[76-dick]

" Ah , [the poor wench]3403-the poor wench ! "[311-the other] cried [the other]311-the other .

" And why so poor ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" To [we]3406-we d [a man of wood]3411-a man of wood , "[540-his companion] replied [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion . " O [me]540-his companion , for [a wooden husband]3412-a wooden husband ! "[540-his companion]

" [I]76-dick think [I]76-dick be [a man of wood]3411-a man of wood , indeed , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " to trudge afoot the while [you]311-the other ride [my]76-dick horse ; but it is good wood , [I]76-dick trow . "[76-dick]

" [Good Dick]123-good dick , forgive [me]311-the other , "[311-the other] cried [the other]311-the other . " Nay , [y]76-dick are the best heart in [England]22-england ; [I]311-the other but laughed . Forgive [me]311-the other now , [sweet Dick]76-dick . "[311-the other]

" Nay , no fool words , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , a little embarrassed by [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion s warmth . " No harm is done . [I]76-dick am not touchy , praise [the saints]3104-the saints . "[76-dick]

And at that moment the wind , which was blowing straight behind [them]543-them as [they]543-them went , brought [them]543-them the rough flourish of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s trumpeter .

" Hark ! "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " the tucket soundeth . "[76-dick]

" Ay , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , " [they]543-them have found [my]120-matcham flight , and now [I]120-matcham am unhorsed ! "[120-matcham] and [he]120-matcham became pale as death .

" Nay , what cheer ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " [Y]3415-y have a long start , and [we]543-them are near [the ferry]3416-the ferry . And it is [I]76-dick , methinks , that am unhorsed . "[76-dick]

" Alack , [I]378-the fugitive shall be taken ! "[378-the fugitive] cried [the fugitive]378-the fugitive . " [Dick]76-dick , [kind Dick]76-dick , beseech [ye]76-dick help [me]378-the fugitive but a little ! "[378-the fugitive]

" Why , now , what aileth [thee]76-dick ? "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Methinks [I]76-dick help [you]76-dick very patently . But [my]76-dick heart is sorry for so spiritless [a fellow]3417-a fellow ! And see [ye]76-dick here , [John Matcham]119-john matcham sith [John Matcham]119-john matcham is [your]76-dick name [I]76-dick , [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton , tide what betideth , come what may , will see [you]76-dick safe in [Holywood]14-holywood . [The saints]3104-the saints so do to [me]76-dick again if [I]76-dick default [you]76-dick . Come , pick [me]76-dick up a good heart , [Sir White]124-sir white - face . The way betters here ; spur [me]76-dick the horse . Go faster ! faster ! Nay , mind not for [me]76-dick ; [I]76-dick can run like a deer . "[76-dick]

So , with the horse trotting hard , and [Dick]76-dick running easily alongside , [they]545-they crossed [the remainder of the fen]546-the remainder of the fen , and came out upon [the banks of [the river]248-the river]547-the banks of the river by [the ferryman s hut]549-the ferryman s hut .

CHAPTER III [THE FEN FERRY]550-the fen ferry

[The river Till]551-the river till was [a wide , sluggish , clayey water]552-a wide , sluggish , clayey water , oozing out of fens , and in this part of [its]551-the river till course it strained among some score of [willow - covered , marshy islets]553-willow - covered , marshy islets .

[It]551-the river till was [a dingy stream]554-a dingy stream ; but upon this bright , spirited morning everything was become beautiful . The wind and [the martens]555-the martens broke it up into innumerable dimples ; and the reflection of the sky was scattered over all the surface in crumbs of smiling blue .

[A creek]556-a creek ran up to meet [the path]506-the path , and close under the bank [the ferryman s hut]549-the ferryman s hut lay snugly . [It]549-the ferryman s hut was of wattle and clay , and the grass grew green upon the roof .

[Dick]76-dick went to the door and opened it . Within , upon a foul old russet cloak , [the ferryman]559-the ferryman lay stretched and shivering ; [a great hulk of a man , but lean and shaken by the country fever]560-a great hulk of a man , but lean and shaken by the country fever .

" Hey , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " be [ye]74-master shelton for [the ferry]3416-the ferry ? Ill times , ill times ! Look to [yourself]74-master shelton . There is [a fellowship abroad]3420-a fellowship abroad . [Ye]74-master shelton were better turn round on [your]74-master shelton two heels and try [the bridge]265-the bridge . "[76-dick]

" Nay ; time s in the saddle , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " Time will ride , [Hugh Ferryman]125-hugh . [I]76-dick am hot in haste . "[76-dick]

" [A wilful man]3422-a wilful man ! "[559-the ferryman] returned [the ferryman]559-the ferryman , rising . " An [ye]74-master shelton win safe to [the Moat House]260-the moat house , [y]74-master shelton have done lucky ; but [I]559-the ferryman say no more . "[559-the ferryman] And then catching sight of [Matcham]119-john matcham , " Who be this ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick asked , as [he]76-dick paused , blinking , on the threshold of [[his]76-dick cabin]562-his cabin .

" It is [[my]76-dick kinsman]3424-my kinsman , [Master Matcham]120-matcham , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" Give [ye]74-master shelton good day , [good ferryman]3425-good ferryman , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , who had dismounted , and now came forward , leading the horse . " Launch [me]120-matcham [[your]74-master shelton boat]3426-your boat , [I]120-matcham prithee ; [we]3427-we are sore in haste . "[120-matcham]

[The gaunt ferryman]563-the gaunt ferryman continued staring .

" By the mass ! "[563-the gaunt ferryman] [he]563-the gaunt ferryman cried at length , and laughed with open throat .

[Matcham]120-matcham coloured to [his]120-matcham neck and winced ; and [Dick]76-dick , with an angry countenance , put [his]76-dick hand on [the lout]564-the lout s shoulder .

" How now , [churl]3428-churl ! "[563-the gaunt ferryman] [he]563-the gaunt ferryman cried . " Fall to [thy]74-master shelton business , and leave mocking [thy]74-master shelton betters . "[563-the gaunt ferryman]

[Hugh Ferryman]125-hugh grumblingly undid [[his]125-hugh boat]565-his boat , and shoved [it]565-his boat a little forth into [the deep water]566-the deep water . Then [Dick]76-dick led in the horse , and [Matcham]120-matcham followed .

" [Ye]564-the lout be mortal small made , [master]3237-master , "[125-hugh] said [Hugh]125-hugh , with a wide grin ; " something o the wrong model , belike . Nay , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , [I]125-hugh am for [you]74-master shelton , "[125-hugh] [he]125-hugh added , getting to [his]125-hugh oars . " [A cat]3430-a cat may look at [a king]3431-a king . [I]125-hugh did but take a shot of the eye at [Master Matcham]120-matcham . "[125-hugh]

" [Sirrah]109-sirrah , no more words , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Bend [me]76-dick [your]109-sirrah back . "[76-dick]

[They]567-they were by that time at [the mouth of [the creek]569-the creek]568-the mouth of the creek , and the view opened up and down [the river]248-the river . [Everywhere]571-everywhere [it]248-the river was enclosed with [islands]572-islands . Clay banks were falling in , willows nodding , reeds waving , martens dipping and piping . There was no sign of [man]3147-man in [the labyrinth of waters]574-the labyrinth of waters .

" [[My]559-the ferryman master]3094-my master , "[559-the ferryman] said [the ferryman]559-the ferryman , keeping [the boat]576-the boat steady with one oar , " [I]559-the ferryman have a shrew guess that [John]119-john matcham - a - [Fenne]126-john fenne is on [the island]3433-the island . [He]126-john fenne bears [me]559-the ferryman a black grudge to all [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s. How if [I]559-the ferryman turned [me]559-the ferryman up [stream]3434-stream and landed [you]3094-my master an arrow - flight above the path ? [Ye]3094-my master were best not meddle with [John Fenne]126-john fenne . "[559-the ferryman]

" How , then ? is [he]126-john fenne of [this company]3435-this company ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" Nay , mum is the word , "[125-hugh] said [Hugh]125-hugh . " But [I]125-hugh would go up water , [Dick]76-dick . How if [Master Matcham]120-matcham came by an arrow ? "[125-hugh] and [he]125-hugh laughed again .

" Be it so , [Hugh]125-hugh , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" Look [ye]3094-my master , then , "[125-hugh] pursued [Hugh]125-hugh . " Sith it shall so be , unsling [me]125-hugh [your]3094-my master cross - bow so : now make it ready good ; place [me]125-hugh a quarrel . Ay , keep it so , and look upon [me]125-hugh grimly . "[125-hugh]

" What meaneth this ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" Why , [[my]559-the ferryman master]3094-my master , if [I]559-the ferryman steal [you]76-dick across , it must be under force or fear , "[559-the ferryman] replied [the ferryman]559-the ferryman ; " for else , if [John Fenne]126-john fenne got wind of it , [he]126-john fenne were like to prove [[my]559-the ferryman most distressful neighbour]3437-my most distressful neighbour . "[559-the ferryman]

" Do [these churls]3438-these churls ride so roughly ? "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick inquired . " Do [they]3438-these churls command [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s own ferry]3439-sir daniel s own ferry ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[559-the ferryman] whispered [the ferryman]559-the ferryman , winking . " Mark [me]559-the ferryman ! [Sir [Daniel]72-sir daniel]3440-sir daniel shall down . [His]72-sir daniel time is out . [He]72-sir daniel shall down . [Mum]127-mum ! "[559-the ferryman] And [he]559-the ferryman bent over [his]559-the ferryman oars .

[They]579-they pulled a long way up [the river]248-the river , turned the tail of [an island]581-an island , and came softly down [a narrow channel next the opposite bank]582-a narrow channel next the opposite bank . Then [Hugh]125-hugh held water in midstream .

" [I]125-hugh must land [you]76-dick here among the willows , "[125-hugh] [he]125-hugh said .

" Here is no path but [willow swamps]3441-willow swamps and quagmires , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[125-hugh] replied [Hugh]125-hugh , " [I]125-hugh dare not take [ye]76-dick nearer down , for [your]76-dick own sake now . [He]74-master shelton watcheth [me]125-hugh [the ferry]3416-the ferry , lying on [his]74-master shelton bow . All that go by and owe [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel goodwill , [he]74-master shelton shooteth down like rabbits . [I]125-hugh heard [him]74-master shelton swear it by the rood . An [I]125-hugh had not known [you]76-dick of old days ay , and from so high upward [I]125-hugh would a let [you]76-dick go on ; but for old days remembrance , and because [ye]76-dick had this toy with [you]76-dick that s not fit for wounds or warfare , [I]125-hugh did risk [my]125-hugh two poor ears to have [you]76-dick over whole . Content [you]76-dick ; [I]125-hugh can no more , on [my]125-hugh salvation ! "[125-hugh]

[Hugh]125-hugh was still speaking , lying on [his]125-hugh oars , when there came a great shout from among the willows on [the island]3433-the island , and sounds followed as of [a strong man breasting roughly through the wood]584-a strong man breasting roughly through the wood .

" A murrain ! "[125-hugh] cried [Hugh]125-hugh . " [He]584-a strong man breasting roughly through the wood was on [the upper island]3443-the upper island all the while ! "[125-hugh] [He]125-hugh pulled straight for [shore]585-shore . " Threat [me]125-hugh with [your]76-dick bow , good [Dick]76-dick ; threat [me]125-hugh with it plain , "[125-hugh] [he]125-hugh added . " [I]125-hugh have tried to save [your]76-dick skins , save [you]76-dick mine ! "[125-hugh]

[The boat]576-the boat ran into [a tough thicket of willows]587-a tough thicket of willows with a crash . [Matcham]120-matcham , pale , but steady and alert , at a sign from [Dick]76-dick , ran along [the thwarts]588-the thwarts and leaped ashore ; [Dick]76-dick , taking the horse by the bridle , sought to follow , but what with the animal s bulk , and what with the closeness of the thicket , both stuck fast . The horse neighed and trampled ; and [the boat]576-the boat , which was swinging in an eddy , came on and off and pitched with violence .

" It may not be , [Hugh]125-hugh ; here is no landing , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick ; but [he]76-dick still struggled valiantly with the obstinate thicket and the startled animal .

[A tall man]590-a tall man appeared upon [the shore of [the island]3433-the island]591-the shore of the island , a long - bow in [his]590-a tall man hand . [Dick]76-dick saw [him]590-a tall man for an instant , with the corner of [his]76-dick eye , bending the bow with a great effort , [his]590-a tall man face crimson with hurry .

" Who goes ? "[590-a tall man] [he]590-a tall man shouted . " [Hugh]125-hugh , who goes ? "[590-a tall man]

" Tis [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , [John]126-john fenne , "[559-the ferryman] replied [the ferryman]559-the ferryman .

" Stand , [Dick Shelton]76-dick ! "[3175-the man] bawled [the man]3175-the man upon [the island]3433-the island . " [Ye]76-dick shall have no hurt , upon the rood ! Stand ! Back out , [Hugh Ferryman]125-hugh . "[3175-the man]

[Dick]76-dick cried a taunting answer .

" Nay , then , [ye]76-dick shall go afoot , "[3175-the man] returned [the man]3175-the man ; and [he]3175-the man let drive an arrow .

[The horse , struck by the shaft]597-the horse , struck by the shaft , lashed out in agony and terror ; [the boat]576-the boat capsized , and the next moment [all]599-all were struggling in the eddies of [the river]248-the river .

When [Dick]76-dick came up , [he]76-dick was within a yard of [the bank]601-the bank ; and before [his]76-dick eyes were clear , [his]76-dick hand had closed on something firm and strong that instantly began to drag [him]76-dick forward . It was the riding - rod , that [Matcham]120-matcham , crawling forth upon an overhanging willow , had opportunely thrust into [his]76-dick grasp .

" By the mass ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , as [he]76-dick was helped [ashore]602-ashore , " that makes a life [I]76-dick owe [you]120-matcham . [I]76-dick swim like a cannon - ball . "[76-dick] And [he]76-dick turned instantly towards [the island]3433-the island .

Midway over , [Hugh Ferryman]125-hugh was swimming with [[his]125-hugh upturned boat]604-his upturned boat , while [John - a - Fenne]126-john fenne , furious at the ill - fortune of [his]125-hugh shot , bawled to [him]76-dick to hurry .

" Come , [Jack]128-matcham , "[76-dick] said [Shelton]76-dick , " run for it ! Ere [Hugh]125-hugh can hale [[his]125-hugh barge]3444-his barge across , or [the pair of [em]3446-em]3445-the pair of em can get it righted , [we]3447-we may be out of cry . "[76-dick]

And adding example to [his]125-hugh words , [he]76-dick began to run , dodging among the willows , and in marshy places leaping from tussock to tussock . [He]76-dick had no time to look for [his]76-dick direction ; all [he]76-dick could do was to turn [his]76-dick back upon [the river]248-the river , and put all [his]76-dick heart to running .

Presently , however , the ground began to rise , which showed [him]76-dick [he]76-dick was still in the right way , and soon after [they]606-they came forth upon [a slope of solid turf]607-a slope of solid turf , where elms began to mingle with the willows .

But here [Matcham]128-matcham , who had been dragging far into the rear , threw [himself]128-matcham fairly down .

" Leave [me]128-matcham , [Dick]76-dick ! "[128-matcham] [he]128-matcham cried , pantingly ; " [I]128-matcham can no more . "[128-matcham]

[Dick]76-dick turned , and came back to where [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion lay .

" Nay , [Jack]128-matcham , leave [thee]128-matcham ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried . " That were a knave s trick , to be sure , when [ye]128-matcham risked a shot and a ducking , ay , and a drowning too , to save [my]76-dick life . Drowning , in sooth ; for why [I]76-dick did not pull [you]128-matcham in along with [me]76-dick , [the saints alone]3448-the saints alone can tell ! "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , " [I]128-matcham would a saved [us]3449-we both , good [Dick]76-dick , for [I]128-matcham can swim . "[128-matcham]

" Can [ye]128-matcham so ? "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , with open eyes . It was the one manly accomplishment of which [he]76-dick was [himself]76-dick incapable . In the order of the things that [he]76-dick admired , next to having killed [a man in single fight]609-a man in single fight came swimming . " Well , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " here is a lesson to despise [no man]3113-no man . [I]76-dick promised to care for [you]128-matcham as far as [Holywood]14-holywood , and , by the rood , [Jack]128-matcham , [y]128-matcham are more capable to care for [me]76-dick . "[76-dick]

" Well , [Dick]76-dick , [we]3449-we re [friends]3295-friends now , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham .

" Nay , [I]76-dick never was unfriends , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " [Y]128-matcham are [a brave lad in [your]128-matcham way]3452-a brave lad in your way , albeit something of a milksop , too . [I]76-dick never met [your]128-matcham like before this day . But , prithee , fetch back [your]128-matcham breath , and let [us]3449-we on . Here is no place for [chatter]3453-chatter . "[76-dick]

" [My]128-matcham foot hurts shrewdly , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham .

" Nay , [I]76-dick had forgot [your]128-matcham foot , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " Well , [we]3449-we must go the gentlier . [I]76-dick would [I]76-dick knew rightly where [we]3449-we were . [I]76-dick have clean lost the path ; yet that may be for the better , too . An [they]3454-they watch [the ferry]3416-the ferry , [they]3454-they watch [the path]506-the path , belike , as well . [I]76-dick would [Sir [Daniel]72-sir daniel]3440-sir daniel were back with [two score men]3458-two score men ; [he]72-sir daniel would sweep [me]76-dick these rascals as the wind sweeps leaves . Come , [Jack]128-matcham , lean [ye]128-matcham on [my]76-dick shoulder , [ye]128-matcham poor shrew . Nay , [y]128-matcham are not tall enough . What age are [ye]128-matcham , for a wager ? twelve ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , [I]128-matcham am sixteen , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham .

" [Y]128-matcham are poorly grown to height , then , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " But take [my]76-dick hand . [We]610-we shall go softly , never fear . [I]76-dick owe [you]128-matcham a life ; [I]76-dick am [a good repayer]3459-a good repayer , [Jack]128-matcham , of good or evil . "[76-dick]

[They]610-we began to go forward up [the slope]611-the slope .

" [We]610-we must hit [the road]257-the road , early or late , "[76-dick] continued [Dick]76-dick ; " and then for a fresh start . By the mass ! but [y]128-matcham ave a rickety hand , [Jack]128-matcham . If [I]76-dick had a hand like that , [I]76-dick would think shame . [I]76-dick tell [you]128-matcham , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick went on , with a sudden chuckle , " [I]76-dick swear by the mass [I]76-dick believe [Hugh Ferryman]125-hugh took [you]128-matcham for [a maid]3386-a maid . "[76-dick]

" Nay , never ! "[311-the other] cried [the other]311-the other , colouring high .

" A did , though , for a wager ! "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick exclaimed . " Small blame to [him]125-hugh . [Ye]128-matcham look [liker maid]3462-liker maid than [man]3147-man ; and [I]76-dick tell [you]128-matcham more y are [a strange - looking rogue]3464-a strange - looking rogue for [a boy]3465-a boy ; but for [a hussy , Jack]3466-a hussy , jack , [ye]128-matcham would be right fair [ye]128-matcham would . " Prithee , [Dick]76-dick , stop till [I]311-the other drink , "[311-the other] said [the other]311-the other , pausing where a little clear spring welled out of the slope into a gravelled basin no bigger than a pocket . " And O , [Dick]76-dick , if [I]311-the other might come by anything to eat ! [my]311-the other very heart aches with hunger . "[311-the other]

" Why , [fool]3472-fool , did [ye]3472-fool not eat at [Kettley]75-sir daniel ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" [I]119-john matcham had made a vow it was a sin [I]119-john matcham had been led into , "[119-john matcham] stammered [Matcham]119-john matcham ; " but now , if it were but dry bread , [I]119-john matcham would eat it greedily . "[119-john matcham]

" Sit [ye]3472-fool , then , and eat , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " while that [I]76-dick scout a little forward for [the road]257-the road . "[76-dick] And [he]76-dick took a wallet from [his]76-dick girdle , wherein were bread and pieces of dry bacon , and , while [Matcham]119-john matcham fell heartily to , struck farther forth among the trees .

A little beyond there was a dip in [the ground]614-the ground , where [a streamlet soaked among dead leaves]615-a streamlet soaked among dead leaves ; and beyond that , again , the trees were better grown and stood wider , and oak and beech began to take the place of willow and elm . The continued tossing and pouring of the wind among the leaves sufficiently concealed the sounds of [his]76-dick footsteps on the mast ; it was for the ear what a moonless night is to the eye ; but for all that [Dick]76-dick went cautiously , slipping from one big trunk to another , and looking sharply about [him]76-dick as [he]76-dick went . Suddenly [a doe]616-a doe passed like a shadow through the underwood in front of [him]76-dick , and [he]76-dick paused , disgusted at the chance . [This part of [the wood]3158-the wood]617-this part of the wood had been certainly deserted , but now that [the poor deer]619-the poor deer had run , [she]619-the poor deer was like [a messenger [he]76-dick should have sent before [him]76-dick]620-a messenger he should have sent before him to announce [his]76-dick coming ; and instead of pushing farther , [he]76-dick turned [him]76-dick to the nearest well - grown tree , and rapidly began to climb .

Luck had served [him]76-dick well . The oak on which [he]76-dick had mounted was one of the tallest in [that quarter of [the wood]3158-the wood]621-that quarter of the wood , and easily out - topped [[its]623-its neighbours]624-its neighbours by a fathom and a half ; and when [Dick]76-dick had clambered into the topmost fork and clung there , swinging dizzily in the great wind , [he]76-dick saw behind [him]76-dick [the whole fenny plain]625-the whole fenny plain as far as [Kettley]75-sir daniel , and [the Till wandering among [woody islets]627-woody islets]626-the till wandering among woody islets , and in front of [him]76-dick , the white line of high - road winding through [the forest]246-the forest . [The boat]576-the boat had been righted it was even now midway on [the ferry]3416-the ferry . Beyond that there was no sign of [man]3147-man , nor aught moving but the wind . [He]76-dick was about to descend , when , taking a last view , [his]76-dick eye lit upon a string of moving points about [the middle of [the fen]3323-the fen]632-the middle of the fen . Plainly a small troop was threading [the causeway]634-the causeway , and that at a good pace ; and this gave [him]76-dick some concern as [he]76-dick shinned vigorously down the trunk and returned across [the wood]3158-the wood for [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion .

[CHAPTER IV A GREENWOOD COMPANY

Matcham]130-chapter iv a greenwood company matcham was well rested and revived ; and [the two lads]416-the two lads , winged by what [Dick]76-dick had seen , hurried through the remainder of [the outwood]638-the outwood , crossed [the road]257-the road in safety , and began to mount into [the high ground of [Tunstall Forest]12-tunstall forest]522-the high ground of tunstall forest . The trees grew more and more in groves , with heathy places in between , sandy , gorsy , and dotted with old yews . [The ground]614-the ground became more and more uneven , full of pits and hillocks . And with every step of the ascent the wind still blew the shriller , and the trees bent before the gusts like fishing - rods .

[They]416-the two lads had just entered [one of [the clearings]643-the clearings]642-one of the clearings , when [Dick]76-dick suddenly clapped down upon [his]76-dick face among the brambles , and began to crawl slowly backward towards the shelter of the grove . [Matcham]130-chapter iv a greenwood company matcham , in great bewilderment , for [he]130-chapter iv a greenwood company matcham could see no reason for this flight , still imitated [his]130-chapter iv a greenwood company matcham companion s course ; and it was not until [they]416-the two lads had gained the harbour of a thicket that [he]130-chapter iv a greenwood company matcham turned and begged [him]130-chapter iv a greenwood company matcham to explain .

For all reply , [Dick]76-dick pointed with [his]76-dick finger .

At [the far end of [the clearing]645-the clearing]644-the far end of the clearing , a fir grew high above [the neighbouring wood]646-the neighbouring wood , and planted its black shock of foliage clear against the sky . For about fifty feet above the ground the trunk grew straight and solid like a column . At that level , it split into two massive boughs ; and in the fork , like [a mast - headed seaman]647-a mast - headed seaman , there stood [a man in a green tabard]648-a man in a green tabard , spying far and wide . The sun glistened upon [his]648-a man in a green tabard hair ; with one hand [he]648-a man in a green tabard shaded [his]648-a man in a green tabard eyes to look abroad , and [he]648-a man in a green tabard kept slowly rolling [his]648-a man in a green tabard head from side to side , with the regularity of a machine .

[The lads]649-the lads exchanged glances .

" Let [us]416-the two lads try to the left , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " [We]416-the two lads had near fallen foully , [Jack]128-matcham . "[76-dick]

Ten minutes afterwards [they]416-the two lads struck into [a beaten path]650-a beaten path .

" Here is [a piece of forest that]3474-a piece of forest that [I]76-dick know not , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick remarked . " Where goeth [me]76-dick this track ? "[76-dick]

" Let [us]416-the two lads even try , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham .

A few yards further , [the path]506-the path came to the top of a ridge and began to go down abruptly into [a cup - shaped hollow]652-a cup - shaped hollow . At the foot , out of a thick wood of flowering hawthorn , two or three roofless gables , blackened as if by fire , and a single tall chimney marked the ruins of [a house]653-a house .

" What may this be ? "[128-matcham] whispered [Matcham]128-matcham .

" Nay , by the mass , [I]76-dick know not , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " [I]76-dick am all at [sea]3475-sea . Let [us]416-the two lads go warily . "[76-dick]

With beating hearts , [they]416-the two lads descended through the hawthorns . Here and there , [they]416-the two lads passed signs of recent cultivation ; fruit trees and pot herbs ran wild among the thicket ; a sun - dial had fallen in the grass ; it seemed [they]416-the two lads were treading what once had been [a garden]654-a garden . Yet a little farther and [they]416-the two lads came forth before [the ruins of [the house]321-the house]655-the ruins of the house .

[It]321-the house had been [a pleasant mansion]657-a pleasant mansion and a strong . A dry ditch was dug deep about [it]321-the house ; but [it]321-the house was now choked with masonry , and bridged by a fallen rafter . The two farther walls still stood , the sun shining through [their]416-the two lads empty windows ; but [the remainder of [the building]659-the building]658-the remainder of the building had collapsed , and now lay in a great cairn of ruin , grimed with fire . Already in the interior a few plants were springing green among the chinks .

" Now [I]76-dick bethink [me]76-dick , "[76-dick] whispered [Dick]76-dick , " this must be [Grimstone]91-grimstone . It was a hold of one [Simon Malmesbury]99-simon malmesbury ; [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel was [his]99-simon malmesbury bane ! Twas [Bennet Hatch]77-bennet that burned [it]321-the house , now five years agone . In sooth , twas pity , for it was [a fair house]3476-a fair house . "[76-dick]

Down in [the hollow]660-the hollow , where no wind blew , it was both warm and still ; and [Matcham]128-matcham , laying one hand upon [Dick]76-dick s arm , held up a warning finger .

" Hist ! "[128-matcham] [he]128-matcham said .

Then came a strange sound , breaking on the quiet . It was twice repeated ere [they]416-the two lads recognised its nature . It was the sound of [a big man]661-a big man clearing [his]661-a big man throat ; and just then a hoarse , untuneful voice broke into singing .

" Then up and spake [the master]275-the master , [the king of [the outlaws]3479-the outlaws]3478-the king of the outlaws : What make [ye]416-the two lads here , [[my]661-a big man merry men]3480-my merry men , among the greenwood shaws ? And [Gamelyn]131-gamelyn made answer [he]661-a big man looked never adown : O , [they]416-the two lads must need to walk in wood that may not walk in [town]3118-town ! "[661-a big man]

[The singer]662-the singer paused , a faint clink of iron followed , and then silence .

[The two lads]416-the two lads stood looking at [each other]664-each other . Whoever [he]661-a big man might be , [[their]416-the two lads invisible neighbour]665-their invisible neighbour was just beyond [the ruin]666-the ruin . And suddenly the colour came into [Matcham]128-matcham s face , and next moment [he]128-matcham had crossed the fallen rafter , and was climbing cautiously on the huge pile of lumber that filled the interior of [the roofless house]667-the roofless house . [Dick]76-dick would have withheld [him]128-matcham , had [he]128-matcham been in time ; as it was , [he]128-matcham was fain to follow .

Right in the corner of [the ruin]666-the ruin , two rafters had fallen crosswise , and protected a clear space no larger than a pew in [church]669-church . Into this [the lads]649-the lads silently lowered [themselves]649-the lads . There [they]649-the lads were perfectly concealed , and through an arrow - loophole commanded a view upon the farther side .

Peering through this , [they]649-the lads were struck stiff with terror at [their]649-the lads predicament . To retreat was impossible ; [they]649-the lads scarce dared to breathe . Upon the very margin of [the ditch]671-the ditch , not thirty feet from where [they]649-the lads crouched , an iron caldron bubbled and steamed above a glowing fire ; and close by , in an attitude of listening , as though [he]128-matcham had caught some sound of [their]649-the lads clambering among [the ruins]672-the ruins , [a tall , red - faced , battered - looking man]673-a tall , red - faced , battered - looking man stood poised , an iron spoon in [his]673-a tall , red - faced , battered - looking man right hand , a horn and a formidable dagger at [his]673-a tall , red - faced , battered - looking man belt . Plainly this was [the singer]662-the singer ; plainly [he]673-a tall , red - faced , battered - looking man had been stirring the caldron , when some incautious step among the lumber had fallen upon [his]673-a tall , red - faced , battered - looking man ear . A little further off , [another man]675-another man lay slumbering , rolled in a brown cloak , with a butterfly hovering above [his]675-another man face . All this was in [a clearing]676-a clearing white with daisies ; and at the extreme verge , a bow , a sheaf of arrows , and part of a deer s carcase , hung upon a flowering hawthorn .

Presently [the fellow]677-the fellow relaxed from [his]677-the fellow attitude of attention , raised the spoon to [his]677-the fellow mouth , tasted its contents , nodded , and then fell again to stirring and singing .

" O , [they]649-the lads must need to walk in wood that may not walk in [town]3118-town , "[677-the fellow] [he]677-the fellow croaked , taking up [his]677-the fellow song where [he]677-the fellow had left it .

" O , [sir]3184-sir , [we]649-the lads walk not here at all an evil thing to do . But if [we]649-the lads meet with the good king s deer to shoot a shaft into . "[677-the fellow]

Still as [he]677-the fellow sang , [he]677-the fellow took from time to time , another spoonful of the broth , blew upon it , and tasted it , with all the airs of [an experienced cook]678-an experienced cook . At length , apparently , [he]677-the fellow judged the mess was ready ; for taking the horn from [his]677-the fellow girdle , [he]677-the fellow blew three modulated calls .

[The other fellow]679-the other fellow awoke , rolled over , brushed away the butterfly , and looked about [him]677-the fellow .

" How now , [brother]3484-brother ? "[677-the fellow] [he]677-the fellow said . " Dinner ? "[677-the fellow]

" Ay , sot , "[680-the cook] replied [the cook]680-the cook , " dinner it is , and a dry dinner , too , with neither ale nor bread . But there is little pleasure in [the greenwood]3485-the greenwood now ; time was when [a good fellow]3486-a good fellow could live here like [a mitred abbot]3487-a mitred abbot , set aside the rain and the white frosts ; [he]3486-a good fellow had [his]3486-a good fellow heart s desire both of ale and wine . But now are [men]3205-men s spirits dead ; and this John Amend - All , save [us]649-the lads and guard [us]649-the lads ! but a stuffed booby to scare crows withal . "[680-the cook]

" Nay , "[311-the other] returned [the other]311-the other , " [y]3484-brother are too set on meat and drinking , [Lawless]132-lawless . Bide [ye]3484-brother a bit ; the good time cometh . "[311-the other]

" Look [ye]3484-brother , "[680-the cook] returned [the cook]680-the cook , " [I]680-the cook have even waited for this good time sith that [I]680-the cook was so high . [I]680-the cook have been [a grey friar]3489-a grey friar ; [I]680-the cook have been [a king s archer]3490-a king s archer ; [I]680-the cook have been [a shipman]3491-a shipman , and sailed [the salt seas]3492-the salt seas ; and [I]680-the cook have been in [greenwood]3493-greenwood before this , forsooth ! and shot [the king]3103-the king s deer . What cometh of it ? Naught ! [I]680-the cook were better to have bided in [the cloister]3495-the cloister . [John Abbot]133-john abbot availeth more than [John]133-john abbot Amend - All . By [r Lady]3496-r lady ! here [they]683-tall , likely fellows come . "[680-the cook]

One after another , [tall , likely fellows]683-tall , likely fellows began to stroll into [the lawn]684-the lawn . [Each]685-each as [he]685-each came produced a knife and a horn cup , helped [himself]685-each from the caldron , and sat down upon the grass to eat . [They]683-tall , likely fellows were very variously equipped and armed ; some in rusty smocks , and with nothing but a knife and an old bow ; others in the height of forest gallantry , all in Lincoln green , both hood and jerkin , with dainty peacock arrows in [their]683-tall , likely fellows belts , a horn upon a baldrick , and a sword and dagger at [their]683-tall , likely fellows sides . [They]683-tall , likely fellows came in the silence of hunger , and scarce growled a salutation , but fell instantly to meat .

There were , perhaps , a score of [them]683-tall , likely fellows already gathered , when a sound of suppressed cheering arose close by among the hawthorns , and immediately after [five or six woodmen carrying a stretcher debauched upon the lawn]686-five or six woodmen carrying a stretcher debauched upon the lawn . [A tall , lusty fellow]687-a tall , lusty fellow , somewhat grizzled , and as brown as a smoked ham , walked before [them]683-tall , likely fellows with an air of some authority , [his]687-a tall , lusty fellow bow at [his]687-a tall , lusty fellow back , a bright boar - spear in [his]687-a tall , lusty fellow hand .

" [Lads]3497-lads ! "[687-a tall , lusty fellow] [he]687-a tall , lusty fellow cried , " [good fellows all]3498-good fellows all , and [[my]687-a tall , lusty fellow right merry friends]3499-my right merry friends , [y]3497-lads have sung this while on a dry whistle and lived at little ease . But what said [I]687-a tall , lusty fellow ever ? Abide [Fortune]134-fortune constantly ; [she]3500-she turneth , turneth swift . And lo ! here is [her]3500-she little firstling even that good creature , ale ! "[687-a tall , lusty fellow]

There was a murmur of applause as [the bearers]688-the bearers set down the stretcher and displayed a goodly cask .

" And now haste [ye]3497-lads , [boys]3334-boys , "[3175-the man] [the man]3175-the man continued . " There is work toward . [A handful of [archers]3503-archers]3502-a handful of archers are but now come to [the ferry]3416-the ferry ; murrey and blue is [their]3502-a handful of archers wear ; [they]3502-a handful of archers are [our]3505-our butts [they]3502-a handful of archers shall all taste arrows [no man of [them]3502-a handful of archers]3506-no man of them shall struggle through [this wood]3507-this wood . For , [lads]3497-lads , [we]3505-our are here some fifty strong , [each man of [us]3505-our most foully wronged]3509-each man of us most foully wronged ; for some [they]3502-a handful of archers have lost lands , and [some friends]3510-some friends ; and [some]3511-some [they]3502-a handful of archers have been outlawed all oppressed ! Who , then , hath done this evil ? [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel , by the rood ! Shall [he]75-sir daniel then profit ? shall [he]75-sir daniel sit snug in [[our]3505-our houses]3512-our houses ? shall [he]75-sir daniel till [[our]3505-our fields]3513-our fields ? shall [he]75-sir daniel suck the bone [he]75-sir daniel robbed [us]3505-our of ? [I]3175-the man trow not . [He]75-sir daniel getteth [him]75-sir daniel strength at law ; [he]75-sir daniel gaineth cases ; nay , there is one case [he]75-sir daniel shall not gain [I]3175-the man have a writ here at [my]3175-the man belt that , please [the saints]3104-the saints , shall conquer [him]75-sir daniel . "[3175-the man]

[Lawless the cook]690-lawless the cook was by this time already at [his]690-lawless the cook second horn of ale . [He]690-lawless the cook raised it , as if to pledge [the speaker]691-the speaker .

" [Master Ellis]135-ellis , "[690-lawless the cook] [he]690-lawless the cook said , " [y]135-ellis are for vengeance well it becometh [you]135-ellis ! but [[your]135-ellis poor brother o the greenwood , that had never lands to lose nor [friends]3295-friends to think upon]3515-your poor brother o the greenwood , that had never lands to lose nor friends to think upon , looketh rather , for [his]75-sir daniel poor part , to the profit of the thing . [He]75-sir daniel had liever [a gold noble]3517-a gold noble and a pottle of canary wine than all the vengeances in purgatory . "[690-lawless the cook]

" [Lawless]132-lawless , "[311-the other] replied [the other]311-the other , " to reach [the Moat House]260-the moat house , [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel must pass [the forest]246-the forest . [We]3520-we shall make that passage dearer , pardy , than any battle . Then , when [he]75-sir daniel hath got to [earth]3521-earth with such ragged handful as escapeth [us]3520-we all [[his]75-sir daniel great friends]3522-his great friends fallen and fled away , and none to give [him]75-sir daniel aid [we]3520-we shall beleaguer that old fox about , and great shall be the fall of [him]75-sir daniel . Tis [a fat buck]3523-a fat buck ; [he]75-sir daniel will make a dinner for [us]3520-we all . "[311-the other]

" Ay , "[132-lawless] returned [Lawless]132-lawless , " [I]132-lawless have eaten many of these dinners beforehand ; but the cooking of them is hot work , good [Master Ellis]135-ellis . And meanwhile what do [we]3520-we ? [We]3520-we make black arrows , [we]3520-we write rhymes , and [we]3520-we drink fair cold water , that discomfortable drink . "[132-lawless]

" [Y]3524-y are untrue , [Will Lawless]132-lawless . [Ye]3524-y still smell of the Grey Friars buttery ; greed is [your]3524-y undoing , "[135-ellis] answered [Ellis]135-ellis . " [We]3520-we took twenty pounds from [Appleyard]121-appleyard . [We]3520-we took seven marks from [the messenger]484-the messenger last night . A day ago [we]3520-we had fifty from [the merchant]3526-the merchant . "[135-ellis]

" And to - day , "[693-one of the men] said [one of [the men]405-the men]693-one of the men , " [I]693-one of the men stopped [a fat pardoner]3527-a fat pardoner riding apace for Holywood . Here is [his]3527-a fat pardoner purse . "[693-one of the men]

[Ellis]135-ellis counted the contents .

" Five score shillings ! "[135-ellis] [he]135-ellis grumbled . " [Fool]3472-fool , [he]3527-a fat pardoner had more in [his]3527-a fat pardoner sandal , or stitched into [his]3527-a fat pardoner tippet . [Y]3472-fool are but [a child]3529-a child , [Tom Cuckow]136-tom ; [ye]3472-fool have lost the fish . "[135-ellis]

But , for all that , [Ellis]135-ellis pocketed the purse with nonchalance . [He]135-ellis stood leaning on [his]135-ellis boar - spear , and looked round upon the rest . [They]405-the men , in various attitudes , took greedily of the venison pottage , and liberally washed it down with ale . This was a good day ; [they]405-the men were in luck ; but business pressed , and [they]405-the men were speedy in [their]405-the men eating . [The first - comers]695-the first - comers had by this time even despatched [their]695-the first - comers dinner . [Some]3511-some lay down upon the grass and fell instantly asleep , like boa - constrictors ; [others]237-others talked together , or overhauled [their]237-others weapons : and [one , whose humour was particularly gay , holding forth an ale - horn]698-one , whose humour was particularly gay , holding forth an ale - horn , began to sing :

" Here is no law in good green shaw , Here is no lack of meat ; Tis merry and quiet , with deer for [our]416-the two lads diet , In summer , when all is sweet .[698-one , whose humour was particularly gay , holding forth an ale - horn]

Come winter again , with wind and rain Come winter , with snow and sleet , Get [home]699-home to [your]700-your places , with hoods on [your]700-your faces , And sit by the fire and eat . "[129-sir richard]

All this while [the two lads]416-the two lads had listened and lain close ; only [Richard]129-sir richard had unslung [his]129-sir richard cross - bow , and held ready in one hand the windac , or grappling - iron that [he]129-sir richard used to bend it . Otherwise [they]416-the two lads had not dared to stir ; and this scene of forest life had gone on before [their]416-the two lads eyes like a scene upon [a theatre]702-a theatre . But now there came a strange interruption . The tall chimney which over - topped [the remainder of [the ruins]672-the ruins]703-the remainder of the ruins rose right above [their]416-the two lads hiding - place . There came a whistle in the air , and then a sounding smack , and the fragments of a broken arrow fell about [their]416-the two lads ears . [Some one from [the upper quarters of the wood]706-the upper quarters of the wood , perhaps [the very sentinel [they]416-the two lads saw posted in the fir]707-the very sentinel they saw posted in the fir]705-some one from the upper quarters of the wood , perhaps the very sentinel they saw posted in the fir , had shot an arrow at the chimney - top .

[Matcham]128-matcham could not restrain a little cry , which [he]128-matcham instantly stifled , and even [Dick]76-dick started with surprise , and dropped the windac from [his]76-dick fingers . But to [the fellows on [the lawn]684-the lawn]708-the fellows on the lawn , this shaft was an expected signal . [They]708-the fellows on the lawn were all afoot together , tightening [their]708-the fellows on the lawn belts , testing [their]708-the fellows on the lawn bow - strings , loosening sword and dagger in the sheath . [Ellis]135-ellis held up [his]135-ellis hand ; [his]135-ellis face had suddenly assumed a look of savage energy ; the white of [his]135-ellis eyes shone in [his]135-ellis sun - brown face .

" [Lads]3497-lads , "[135-ellis] [he]135-ellis said , " [ye]3497-lads know [[your]3497-lads places]3531-your places . Let [not one man]3532-not one man s soul escape [you]3497-lads . Appleyard was a whet before a meal ; but now [we]3533-we go to table . [I]135-ellis have three men whom [I]135-ellis will bitterly avenge [Harry Shelton]105-harry shelton , [Simon Malmesbury]99-simon malmesbury , and "[135-ellis] striking [his]135-ellis broad bosom " and [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis , by the mass ! "[135-ellis]

[Another man]675-another man came , red with hurry , through the thorns .

" Tis not [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel ! "[675-another man] [he]675-another man panted . " [They]714-the men of the black arrow are but seven . Is the arrow gone ? "[675-another man]

" It struck but now , "[100-ellis] replied [Ellis]100-ellis .

" A murrain ! "[484-the messenger] cried [the messenger]484-the messenger . " Methought [I]484-the messenger heard it whistle . And [I]484-the messenger go dinnerless ! "[484-the messenger]

In the space of a minute , some running , [some walking sharply]712-some walking sharply , according as [their]713-their stations were nearer or farther away , [the men of the Black Arrow]714-the men of the black arrow had all disappeared from [the neighbourhood of [the ruined house]716-the ruined house]715-the neighbourhood of the ruined house ; and the caldron , and the fire , which was now burning low , and [the dead deer s carcase]717-the dead deer s carcase on the hawthorn , remained alone to testify [they]713-their had been [there]718-there .

CHAPTER V " BLOODY AS [THE HUNTER]3534-the hunter "[649-the lads]

[The lads]649-the lads lay quiet till the last footstep had melted on the wind . Then [they]649-the lads arose , and with many an ache , for [they]649-the lads were weary with constraint , clambered through [the ruins]672-the ruins , and recrossed the ditch upon the rafter . [Matcham]128-matcham had picked up the windac and went first , [Dick]76-dick following stiffly , with [his]76-dick cross - bow on [his]76-dick arm .

" And now , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , " forth to [Holywood]14-holywood . "[128-matcham]

" To [Holywood]14-holywood ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , " when [good fellows]3535-good fellows stand shot ? Not [I]76-dick ! [I]76-dick would see [you]76-dick hanged first , [Jack]128-matcham ! "[76-dick]

" [Ye]128-matcham would leave [me]128-matcham , would [ye]128-matcham ? "[128-matcham] [Matcham]128-matcham asked .

" Ay , by [my]76-dick sooth ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " An [I]76-dick be not in time to warn [these lads]3536-these lads , [I]76-dick will go die with [them]3536-these lads . What ! would [ye]128-matcham have [me]76-dick leave [[my]76-dick own men that [I]76-dick have lived among]3537-my own men that i have lived among . [I]76-dick trow not ! Give [me]76-dick [my]76-dick windac . "[76-dick]

But there was nothing further from [Matcham]128-matcham s mind .

" [Dick]76-dick , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " [ye]128-matcham sware before [the saints]3104-the saints that [ye]128-matcham would see [me]76-dick safe to [Holywood]14-holywood . Would [ye]128-matcham be forsworn ? Would [you]128-matcham desert [me]76-dick [a perjurer]3539-a perjurer ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , [I]76-dick sware for the best , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " [I]76-dick meant it too ; but now ! But look [ye]128-matcham , [Jack]128-matcham , turn again with [me]76-dick . Let [me]76-dick but warn [these men]3540-these men , and , if needs must , stand shot with [them]3540-these men ; then shall all be clear , and [I]76-dick will on again to [Holywood]14-holywood and purge [mine]76-dick oath . "[76-dick]

" [Ye]128-matcham but deride [me]128-matcham , "[128-matcham] answered [Matcham]128-matcham . " [These men [ye]128-matcham go to succour]3541-these men ye go to succour are the [I]128-matcham same that hunt [me]128-matcham to [my]128-matcham ruin . "[128-matcham]

[Dick]76-dick scratched [his]76-dick head .

" [I]76-dick can not help it , [Jack]128-matcham , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said . " Here is no remedy . What would [ye]128-matcham ? [Ye]128-matcham run no great peril , [man]3147-man ; and these are in the way of death . Death ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added . " Think of it ! What [a murrain]3543-a murrain do [ye]128-matcham keep [me]76-dick here for ? Give [me]76-dick the windac . [Saint George]90-saint george ! shall [they]3544-they all die ? "[76-dick]

" [Richard Shelton]129-sir richard , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , looking [him]76-dick squarely in the face , " would [ye]128-matcham , then , join party with [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel ? Have [ye]128-matcham not ears ? Heard [ye]128-matcham not this [Ellis]100-ellis , what [he]75-sir daniel said ? or have [ye]128-matcham no heart for [your]128-matcham own kindly blood and [the father that men]3545-the father that men slew ? [Harry Shelton]105-harry shelton , [he]75-sir daniel said ; and [Sir Harry Shelton]105-harry shelton was [[your]128-matcham father]3306-your father , as the sun shines in heaven . "[128-matcham]

" What would [ye]128-matcham ? "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick cried again . " Would [ye]128-matcham have [me]76-dick credit [thieves]3254-thieves ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , [I]128-matcham have heard it before now , "[128-matcham] returned [Matcham]128-matcham . " [The fame]3548-the fame goeth currently , it was [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel slew [him]75-sir daniel . [He]75-sir daniel slew [him]75-sir daniel under oath ; in [[his]75-sir daniel own house]3549-his own house [he]75-sir daniel shed the innocent blood . Heaven wearies for the avenging on t ; and [you]128-matcham [the man s son]3550-the man s son [ye]128-matcham go about to comfort and defend [the murderer]3551-the murderer ! "[128-matcham]

" [Jack]128-matcham , "[309-the lad] cried [the lad]309-the lad " [I]128-matcham know not . It may be ; what know [I]128-matcham ? But , see here : [This man]3552-this man hath bred [me]128-matcham up and fostered [me]128-matcham , and [[his]3552-this man men]417-his men [I]128-matcham have hunted with and played among ; and to leave [them]417-his men in the hour of peril O , [man]3147-man , if [I]128-matcham did that , [I]128-matcham were stark dead to honour ! Nay , [Jack]128-matcham , [ye]128-matcham would not ask it ; [ye]128-matcham would not wish [me]128-matcham to be base . "[128-matcham]

" But [[your]128-matcham father]3306-your father , [Dick]76-dick ? "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , somewhat wavering . " [[Your]128-matcham father]3306-your father ? and [your]128-matcham oath to [me]128-matcham ? [Ye]128-matcham took [the saints]3104-the saints to witness . "[128-matcham]

" [[My]76-dick father]3558-my father ? "[76-dick] cried [Shelton]76-dick . " Nay , [he]3558-my father would have [me]76-dick go ! If [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel slew [him]3558-my father , when the hour comes [this hand]3559-this hand shall slay [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel ; but neither [him]3558-my father nor [his]3558-my father will [I]76-dick desert in peril . And for [mine]76-dick oath , [good Jack]128-matcham , [ye]128-matcham shall absolve [me]76-dick of it here . For the lives sake of [many men that hurt [you]128-matcham not]3560-many men that hurt you not , and for [mine]76-dick honour , [ye]128-matcham shall set [me]76-dick free . "[76-dick]

" [I]128-matcham , [Dick]76-dick ? Never ! "[128-matcham] returned [Matcham]128-matcham . " An [ye]128-matcham leave [me]128-matcham , [y]128-matcham are forsworn , and so [I]128-matcham shall declare it . "[128-matcham]

" [My]76-dick blood heats , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Give [me]76-dick the windac ! Give it [me]76-dick ! "[76-dick]

" [I]128-matcham ll not , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham . " [I]128-matcham ll save [you]128-matcham in [your]128-matcham teeth . "[128-matcham]

" Not ? "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " [I]76-dick ll make [you]128-matcham ! "[76-dick]

" Try it , "[311-the other] said [the other]311-the other .

[They]723-they stood , looking in [each other]664-each other s eyes , each ready for a spring . Then [Dick]76-dick leaped ; and though [Matcham]128-matcham turned instantly and fled , in two bounds [he]128-matcham was over - taken , the windac was twisted from [his]128-matcham grasp , [he]128-matcham was thrown roughly to the ground , and [Dick]76-dick stood across [him]128-matcham , flushed and menacing , with doubled fist . [Matcham]128-matcham lay where [he]128-matcham had fallen , with [his]128-matcham face in the grass , not thinking of resistance .

[Dick]76-dick bent [his]76-dick bow .

" [I]76-dick ll teach [you]128-matcham ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried , fiercely . " Oath or no oath , [ye]128-matcham may go hang for [me]76-dick ! "[76-dick]

And [he]76-dick turned and began to run . [Matcham]128-matcham was on [his]128-matcham feet at once , and began running after [him]128-matcham .

" What d [ye]128-matcham want ? "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , stopping . " What make [ye]128-matcham after [me]76-dick ? Stand off ! "[76-dick]

" Will follow an [I]128-matcham please , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham . " [This wood]3507-this wood is free to [me]128-matcham . "[128-matcham]

" Stand back , by [r Lady]3496-r lady ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , raising [his]76-dick bow .

" Ah , [y]76-dick are [a brave boy]3563-a brave boy ! "[128-matcham] retorted [Matcham]128-matcham . " Shoot ! "[128-matcham]

[Dick]76-dick lowered [his]76-dick weapon in some confusion .

" See here , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said . " [Y]76-dick have done [me]76-dick ill enough . Go , then . Go [your]76-dick way in fair wise ; or , whether [I]76-dick will or not , [I]76-dick must even drive [you]76-dick to it . "[76-dick]

" Well , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , doggedly , " [y]76-dick are the stronger . Do [your]76-dick worst . [I]128-matcham shall not leave to follow [thee]76-dick , [Dick]76-dick , unless [thou]76-dick makest [me]128-matcham , "[128-matcham] [he]128-matcham added .

[Dick]76-dick was almost beside [himself]76-dick . It went against [his]76-dick heart to beat a creature so defenceless ; and , for the life of [him]76-dick , [he]76-dick knew no other way to rid [himself]76-dick of this unwelcome and , as [he]76-dick began to think , perhaps untrue companion .

" [Y]76-dick are mad , [I]76-dick think , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried . " [Fool - fellow]3564-fool - fellow , [I]76-dick am hasting to [[your]76-dick foes]3565-your foes ; as fast as foot can carry [me]76-dick , go [I]76-dick thither . "[76-dick]

" [I]309-the lad care not , [Dick]76-dick , "[309-the lad] replied [the lad]309-the lad . " If [y]76-dick are bound to die , [Dick]76-dick , [I]309-the lad ll die too . [I]309-the lad would liever go with [you]76-dick to prison than to go free without [you]76-dick . "[309-the lad]

" Well , "[311-the other] returned [the other]311-the other , " [I]311-the other may stand no longer prating . Follow [me]311-the other , if [ye]76-dick must ; but if [ye]76-dick play [me]311-the other false , it shall but little advance [you]76-dick , mark [ye]76-dick that . Shalt have a quarrel in thine inwards , [boy]3344-boy . "[311-the other]

So saying , [Dick]76-dick took once more to [his]76-dick heels , keeping in the margin of the thicket and looking briskly about [him]76-dick as [he]76-dick went . At a good pace [he]76-dick rattled out of [the dell]727-the dell , and came again into [the more open quarters of [the wood]3158-the wood]728-the more open quarters of the wood . To the left a little eminence appeared , spotted with golden gorse , and crowned with a black tuft of firs .

" [I]76-dick shall see from there , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick thought , and struck for it across [a heathy clearing]730-a heathy clearing .

[He]76-dick had gone but a few yards , when [Matcham]128-matcham touched [him]76-dick on the arm , and pointed . To the eastward of [the summit]731-the summit there was a dip , and , as it were , [a valley]732-a valley passing to the other side ; [the heath]733-the heath was not yet out ; all the ground was rusty , like an unscoured buckler , and dotted sparingly with yews ; and there , one following another , [Dick]76-dick saw [half a score green jerkins mounting the ascent]734-half a score green jerkins mounting the ascent , and marching at [their]734-half a score green jerkins mounting the ascent head , conspicuous by [his]76-dick boar - spear , [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis in person . [One after another]735-one after another gained the top , showed for a moment against the sky , and then dipped upon the further side , until the last was gone .

[Dick]76-dick looked at [Matcham]128-matcham with a kindlier eye .

" So [y]128-matcham are to be true to [me]76-dick , [Jack]128-matcham ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick asked . " [I]76-dick thought [ye]128-matcham were of [the other party]3567-the other party . "[76-dick]

[Matcham]128-matcham began to sob .

" What cheer ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " Now [the saints]3104-the saints behold [us]3569-us ! would [ye]128-matcham snivel for a word ? "[76-dick]

" [Ye]128-matcham hurt [me]128-matcham , "[128-matcham] sobbed [Matcham]128-matcham . " [Ye]128-matcham hurt [me]128-matcham when [ye]128-matcham threw [me]128-matcham down . [Y]128-matcham are a coward to abuse [your]128-matcham strength . "[128-matcham]

" Nay , that is fool s talk , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , roughly . " [Y]128-matcham had no title to [[my]76-dick windac]3570-my windac , [Master John]113-master john . [I]76-dick would a done right to have well basted [you]128-matcham . If [ye]128-matcham go with [me]76-dick , [ye]128-matcham must obey [me]76-dick ; and so , come . "[76-dick]

[Matcham]128-matcham had half a thought to stay behind ; but , seeing that [Dick]76-dick continued to scour full - tilt towards the eminence and not so much as looked across [his]76-dick shoulder , [he]76-dick soon thought better of that , and began to run in turn . But the ground was very difficult and steep ; [Dick]76-dick had already a long start , and had , at any rate , the lighter heels , and [he]76-dick had long since come to [the summit]731-the summit , crawled forward through the firs , and ensconced [himself]76-dick in a thick tuft of gorse , before [Matcham]128-matcham , panting like a deer , rejoined [him]76-dick , and lay down in silence by [his]76-dick side .

Below , in [the bottom of [a considerable valley]738-a considerable valley]737-the bottom of a considerable valley , the short cut from [[Tunstall]5-tunstall hamlet]253-tunstall hamlet wound downwards to [the ferry]3416-the ferry . [It]741-it was well beaten , and the eye followed it easily from point to point . [Here]742-here [it]741-it was bordered by open glades ; there [the forest]246-the forest closed upon [it]741-it ; every hundred yards [it]741-it ran beside an ambush . Far down [the path]506-the path , the sun shone on seven steel salets , and from time to time , as the trees opened , [Selden]108-selden and [[his]108-selden men]417-his men could be seen riding briskly , still bent upon [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel s mission . The wind had somewhat fallen , but still tussled merrily with the trees , and , perhaps , had [Appleyard]121-appleyard been there , [he]75-sir daniel would have drawn a warning from the troubled conduct of the birds .

" Now , [mark]3571-mark , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick whispered . " [They]3572-they be already well advanced into the wood ; [their]3572-they safety lieth rather in continuing forward . But see [ye]3571-mark where [this wide glade runneth down before [us]3574-us]3573-this wide glade runneth down before us , and in [the midst of [it]3573-this wide glade runneth down before us]3575-the midst of it , these two score trees make like [an island]581-an island ? There were [their]3572-they safety . An [they]3572-they but come sound as far as that , [I]76-dick will make shift to warn [them]3572-they . But [my]76-dick heart misgiveth [me]76-dick ; [they]3572-they are but seven against so many , and [they]3572-they but carry cross - bows . The long - bow , [Jack]128-matcham , will have the uppermost ever . "[76-dick]

Meanwhile , [Selden]108-selden and [[his]108-selden men]417-his men still wound up [the path]506-the path , ignorant of [their]417-his men danger , and momently drew nearer hand . Once , indeed , [they]417-his men paused , drew into a group , and seemed to point and listen . But it was something from far away across [the plain]748-the plain that had arrested [their]417-his men attention a hollow growl of cannon that came , from time to time , upon the wind , and told of the great battle . It was worth a thought , to be sure ; for if the voice of the big guns were thus become audible in [Tunstall Forest]12-tunstall forest , the fight must have rolled ever eastward , and the day , by consequence , gone sore against [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel and [the lords of the dark]749-the lords of the dark rose .

But presently [the little troop]750-the little troop began again to move forward , and came next to [a very open , heathy portion of the way , where but [a single tongue of forest]752-a single tongue of forest ran down to join [the road]257-the road]751-a very open , heathy portion of the way , where but a single tongue of forest ran down to join the road . [They]417-his men were but just abreast of this , when an arrow shone flying . [One of [the men]405-the men]693-one of the men threw up [his]693-one of the men arms , [his]693-one of the men horse reared , and both fell and struggled together in a mass . Even from where [the boys]756-the boys lay [they]417-his men could hear the rumour of [the men]405-the men s voices crying out ; [they]417-his men could see the startled horses prancing , and , presently , as [the troop]368-the troop began to recover from [their]368-the troop first surprise , [one fellow]759-one fellow beginning to dismount . A second arrow from somewhat farther off glanced in a wide arch ; [a second rider]760-a second rider bit the dust . [The man who was dismounting]761-the man who was dismounting lost hold upon the rein , and [his]761-the man who was dismounting horse fled galloping , and dragged [him]761-the man who was dismounting by the foot along [the road]257-the road , bumping from stone to stone , and battered by the fleeing hoofs . [The four who still kept the saddle]763-the four who still kept the saddle instantly broke and scattered ; one wheeled and rode , shrieking , towards [the ferry]3416-the ferry ; [the other three , with loose rein and flying raiment]765-the other three , with loose rein and flying raiment , came galloping up [the road]257-the road from [Tunstall]5-tunstall . From [every clump]767-every clump [they]763-the four who still kept the saddle passed an arrow sped . Soon a horse fell , but [the rider]768-the rider found [his]768-the rider feet and continued to pursue [[his]768-the rider comrades]769-his comrades till a second shot despatched [him]768-the rider . [Another man]675-another man fell ; then another horse ; out of [the whole troop]771-the whole troop there was but [one fellow left]772-one fellow left , and [he]768-the rider on foot ; only , in different directions , the noise of the galloping of three riderless horses was dying fast into the distance .

All this time [not one of [the assailants]774-the assailants]773-not one of the assailants had for a moment shown [himself]773-not one of the assailants . Here and there along [the path]506-the path , horse or [man]3147-man rolled , undespatched , in [his]773-not one of the assailants agony ; but [no merciful enemy]777-no merciful enemy broke cover to put [them]763-the four who still kept the saddle from [their]763-the four who still kept the saddle pain .

[The solitary survivor]778-the solitary survivor stood bewildered in [the road]257-the road beside [his]778-the solitary survivor fallen charger . [He]778-the solitary survivor had come the length of that broad glade , with the island of timber , pointed out by [Dick]76-dick . [He]778-the solitary survivor was not , perhaps , five hundred yards from where [the boys]756-the boys lay hidden ; and [they]756-the boys could see [him]778-the solitary survivor plainly , looking to and fro in deadly expectation . But nothing came ; and [the man]3175-the man began to pluck up [his]3175-the man courage , and suddenly unslung and bent [his]3175-the man bow . At the same time , by something in [his]76-dick action , [Dick]76-dick recognised [Selden]108-selden .

At this offer of resistance , from all about [him]778-the solitary survivor in [the covert of [the woods]783-the woods]782-the covert of the woods there went up the sound of laughter . [A score of [men]3205-men]356-a score of men , at least , for this was the very thickest of the ambush , joined in this cruel and untimely mirth . Then an arrow glanced over [Selden]108-selden s shoulder ; and [he]108-selden leaped and ran a little back . Another dart struck quivering at [his]108-selden heel . [He]108-selden made for the cover . A third shaft leaped out right in [his]108-selden face , and fell short in front of [him]108-selden . And then the laughter was repeated loudly , rising and reechoing from different thickets .

It was plain that [[his]108-selden assailants]786-his assailants were but baiting [him]108-selden , as [men]3205-men , in those days , baited [the poor bull]788-the poor bull , or as the cat still trifles with the mouse . The skirmish was well over ; farther down [the road]257-the road , [a fellow in green]790-a fellow in green was already calmly gathering the arrows ; and now , in the evil pleasure of [their]3205-men hearts , [they]3205-men gave [themselves]3205-men the spectacle of [[their]3205-men poor fellow - sinner]791-their poor fellow - sinner in [his]791-their poor fellow - sinner torture .

[Selden]108-selden began to understand ; [he]108-selden uttered a roar of anger , shouldered [his]108-selden cross - bow , and sent a quarrel at a venture into the wood . [Chance]137-chance favoured [him]108-selden , for a slight cry responded . Then , throwing down [his]108-selden weapon , [Selden]108-selden began to run before [him]108-selden up [the glade]792-the glade , and almost in a straight line for [Dick]76-dick and [Matcham]128-matcham .

[The companions of the Black Arrow]793-the companions of the black arrow now began to shoot in earnest . But [they]793-the companions of the black arrow were properly served ; [their]793-the companions of the black arrow chance had past ; most of [them]793-the companions of the black arrow had now to shoot against the sun ; and [Selden]108-selden , as [he]108-selden ran , bounded from side to side to baffle and deceive [their]793-the companions of the black arrow aim . Best of all , by turning up [the glade]792-the glade [he]108-selden had defeated [their]793-the companions of the black arrow preparations ; there were [no marksmen posted higher up than the one whom [he]108-selden had just killed or wounded]795-no marksmen posted higher up than the one whom he had just killed or wounded ; and the confusion of [the foresters counsels]796-the foresters counsels soon became apparent . A whistle sounded thrice , and then again twice . It was repeated from another quarter . [The woods on either side]797-the woods on either side became full of the sound of [people bursting through the underwood]798-people bursting through the underwood ; and a bewildered deer ran out into the open , stood for a second on three feet , with nose in air , and then plunged again into the thicket .

[Selden]108-selden still ran , bounding ; ever and again an arrow followed [him]108-selden , but still would miss . It began to appear as if [he]108-selden might escape . [Dick]76-dick had [his]76-dick bow armed , ready to support [him]76-dick ; even [Matcham]128-matcham , forgetful of [his]76-dick interest , took sides at heart for [the poor fugitive]799-the poor fugitive ; and [both lads]800-both lads glowed and trembled in the ardour of [their]800-both lads hearts .

[He]108-selden was within fifty yards of [them]800-both lads , when an arrow struck [him]108-selden and [he]108-selden fell . [He]108-selden was up again , indeed , upon the instant ; but now [he]108-selden ran staggering , and , like [a blind man]801-a blind man , turned aside from [his]108-selden direction .

[Dick]76-dick leaped to [his]76-dick feet and waved to [him]76-dick .

" Here ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried . " This way ! here is help ! Nay , run , fellow run ! "[76-dick]

But just then a second arrow struck [Selden]108-selden in the shoulder , between the plates of [his]108-selden brigandine , and , piercing through [his]108-selden jack , brought [him]108-selden , like a stone , to earth .

" O , [the poor heart]3577-the poor heart ! "[128-matcham] cried [Matcham]128-matcham , with clasped hands .

And [Dick]76-dick stood petrified upon [the hill]314-the hill , a mark for archery .

Ten to one [he]76-dick had speedily been shot for [the foresters]803-the foresters were furious with [themselves]803-the foresters , and taken unawares by [Dick]76-dick s appearance in the rear of [their]803-the foresters position but instantly , out of a quarter of the wood surprisingly near to [the two lads]416-the two lads , a stentorian voice arose , the voice of [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis .

" Hold ! "[95-john amend] it roared . " Shoot not ! Take [him]76-dick alive ! [It]76-dick is [young [Shelton Harry]3579-shelton harry s son]3578-young shelton harry s son . "[95-john amend]

And immediately after a shrill whistle sounded several times , and was again taken up and repeated farther off . The whistle , it appeared , was [John Amend - All]95-john amend s battle trumpet , by which [he]76-dick published [his]76-dick directions .

" Ah , foul fortune ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " [We]805-the pair are undone . Swiftly , [Jack]128-matcham , come swiftly ! "[76-dick]

And [the pair]805-the pair turned and ran back through the open pine clump that covered [the summit of [the hill]314-the hill]806-the summit of the hill .

[CHAPTER VI TO THE DAY S END]138-chapter vi to the day s end

It was , indeed , high time for [them]805-the pair to run . On every side [the company of the Black Arrow]808-the company of the black arrow was making for [the hill]314-the hill . Some , being better runners , or having open ground to run upon , had far outstripped the others , and were already close upon the goal ; [some]3511-some , following [valleys]811-valleys , had spread out to right and left , and outflanked [the lads on either side]812-the lads on either side .

[Dick]76-dick plunged into the nearest cover . It was [a tall grove of oaks]813-a tall grove of oaks , firm under foot and clear of underbrush , and as [it]813-a tall grove of oaks lay down hill , [they]805-the pair made good speed . There followed next a piece of open , which [Dick]76-dick avoided , holding to [his]76-dick left . Two minutes after , and the same obstacle arising , [the lads]649-the lads followed the same course . Thus it followed that , while [the lads , bending continually to the left]815-the lads , bending continually to the left , drew nearer and nearer to [the high road]816-the high road and [the river]248-the river which [they]649-the lads had crossed an hour or two before , [the great bulk of [their]649-the lads pursuers]818-the great bulk of their pursuers were leaning to the other hand , and running towards [Tunstall]5-tunstall .

[The lads]649-the lads paused to breathe . There was no sound of pursuit . [Dick]76-dick put [his]76-dick ear to the ground , and still there was nothing ; but the wind , to be sure , still made a turmoil in the trees , and it was hard to make certain .

" On again , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick ; and , tired as [they]805-the pair were , and [Matcham]128-matcham limping with [his]128-matcham injured foot , [they]805-the pair pulled [themselves]805-the pair together , and once more pelted down [the hill]314-the hill .

Three minutes later , [they]805-the pair were breasting through a low thicket of evergreen . High overhead , the tall trees made a continuous roof of foliage . It was a pillared grove , as high as [a cathedral]821-a cathedral , and except for the hollies among which [the lads]649-the lads were struggling , open and smoothly swarded .

On the other side , pushing through the last fringe of evergreen , [they]805-the pair blundered forth again into the open twilight of [the grove]823-the grove .

" Stand ! "[824-a stout fellow in green , sore blown with running , who instantly drew an arrow to the head] cried a voice .

And there , between the huge stems , not fifty feet before [them]805-the pair , [they]805-the pair beheld [a stout fellow in green , sore blown with running , who instantly drew an arrow to the head]824-a stout fellow in green , sore blown with running , who instantly drew an arrow to the head and covered [them]805-the pair . [Matcham]128-matcham stopped with a cry ; but [Dick]76-dick , without a pause , ran straight upon [the forester]825-the forester , drawing [his]76-dick dagger as [he]76-dick went . The other , whether [he]76-dick was startled by the daring of the onslaught , or whether [he]76-dick was hampered by [his]76-dick orders , did not shoot ; [he]76-dick stood wavering ; and before [he]76-dick had time to come to [himself]76-dick , [Dick]76-dick bounded at [his]76-dick throat , and sent [him]76-dick sprawling backward on the turf . The arrow went one way and the bow another with a sounding twang . [The disarmed forester]826-the disarmed forester grappled [[his]76-dick assailant]827-his assailant ; but the dagger shone and descended twice . Then came a couple of groans , and then [Dick]76-dick rose to [his]76-dick feet again , and [the man]3175-the man lay motionless , stabbed to the heart .

" On ! "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick ; and [he]76-dick once more pelted forward , [Matcham]128-matcham trailing in the rear . To say truth , [they]829-they made but poor speed of it by now , labouring dismally as [they]829-they ran , and catching for [their]829-they breath like fish . [Matcham]128-matcham had a cruel stitch , and [his]128-matcham head swam ; and as for [Dick]76-dick , [his]76-dick knees were like lead . But [they]829-they kept up the form of running with undiminished courage .

Presently [they]829-they came to [the end of [the grove]823-the grove]830-the end of the grove . It stopped abruptly ; and there , a few yards before [them]829-they , was [the high road from [Risingham]184-lord risingham to [Shoreby]20-shoreby]832-the high road from risingham to shoreby , lying , at this point , between two even walls of forest .

At the sight [Dick]76-dick paused ; and as soon as [he]76-dick stopped running , [he]76-dick became aware of a confused noise , which rapidly grew louder . It was at first like the rush of a very high gust of wind , but soon it became more definite , and resolved itself into the galloping of horses ; and then , in a flash , [a whole company of men - at - arms]833-a whole company of men - at - arms came driving round the corner , swept before [the lads]649-the lads , and were gone again upon the instant . [They]833-a whole company of men - at - arms rode as for [their]833-a whole company of men - at - arms lives , in complete disorder ; some of [them]833-a whole company of men - at - arms were wounded ; riderless horses galloped at [their]833-a whole company of men - at - arms side with bloody saddles . [They]833-a whole company of men - at - arms were plainly fugitives from the great battle .

The noise of [their]829-they passage had scarce begun to die away towards [Shoreby]20-shoreby , before fresh hoofs came echoing in [their]829-they wake , and [another deserter]835-another deserter clattered down [the road]257-the road ; this time [a single rider]837-a single rider and , by [his]837-a single rider splendid armour , [a man of high degree]838-a man of high degree . Close after [him]76-dick there followed [several baggage - waggons]839-several baggage - waggons , fleeing at an ungainly canter , [the drivers]840-the drivers flailing at the horses as if for life . These must have run early in the day ; but [their]833-a whole company of men - at - arms cowardice was not to save [them]833-a whole company of men - at - arms . For just before [they]829-they came abreast of where [the lads]649-the lads stood wondering , [a man in hacked armour]842-a man in hacked armour , and seemingly beside [himself]842-a man in hacked armour with fury , overtook [the waggons]843-the waggons , and with the truncheon of a sword , began to cut [the drivers]840-the drivers down . [Some]3511-some leaped from [their]3511-some places and plunged into the wood ; the others [he]76-dick sabred as [they]829-they sat , cursing [them]829-they the while for [cowards]846-cowards in a voice that was scarce human .

All this time the noise in the distance had continued to increase ; the rumble of carts , the clatter of horses , the cries of [men]3205-men , a great , confused rumour , came swelling on the wind ; and it was plain that the rout of [a whole army]848-a whole army was pouring , like an inundation , down [the road]257-the road .

[Dick]76-dick stood sombre . [He]76-dick had meant to follow [the highway]850-the highway till the turn for [Holywood]14-holywood , and now [he]76-dick had to change [his]76-dick plan . But above all , [he]76-dick had recognised the colours of [Earl Risingham]139-earl risingham , and [he]76-dick knew that the battle had gone finally against [the rose of [Lancaster]7-lancaster]851-the rose of lancaster . Had [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel joined , and was [he]75-sir daniel now [a fugitive and ruined]852-a fugitive and ruined ? or had [he]75-sir daniel deserted to the side of [York]8-york , and was [he]75-sir daniel forfeit to honour ? It was an ugly choice .

" Come , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , sternly ; and , turning on [his]76-dick heel , [he]76-dick began to walk forward through [the grove]823-the grove , with [Matcham]128-matcham limping in [his]76-dick rear .
