For some time [they]854-they continued to thread [the forest]246-the forest in silence . It was now growing late ; the sun was setting in [the plain beyond [Kettley]75-sir daniel]856-the plain beyond kettley ; the tree - tops overhead glowed golden ; but the shadows had begun to grow darker and the chill of the night to fall .

" If there were anything to eat ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , suddenly , pausing as [he]76-dick spoke .

[Matcham]128-matcham sat down and began to weep .

" [Ye]128-matcham can weep for [your]128-matcham own supper , but when it was to save [men]3205-men s lives , [your]128-matcham heart was hard enough , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , contemptuously . " [Y]128-matcham ave seven deaths upon [your]128-matcham conscience , [Master John]113-master john ; [I]76-dick ll ne er forgive [you]128-matcham that . "[76-dick]

" Conscience ! "[128-matcham] cried [Matcham]128-matcham , looking fiercely up . " [Mine]128-matcham ! And [ye]128-matcham have [the man]3175-the man s red blood upon [your]128-matcham dagger ! And wherefore did [ye]128-matcham slay [him]3175-the man , [the poor soul]3582-the poor soul ? [He]3175-the man drew [his]3175-the man arrow , but [he]3175-the man let not fly ; [he]3175-the man held [you]128-matcham in [his]3175-the man hand , and spared [you]128-matcham ! [Tis]3583-tis as brave to kill a kitten , as [a man that not defends [himself]3584-a man that not defends himself]3584-a man that not defends himself . "[128-matcham]

[Dick]76-dick was struck dumb .

" [I]76-dick slew [him]3175-the man fair . [I]76-dick ran [me]76-dick in upon [his]3175-the man bow , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried .

" It was a coward blow , "[128-matcham] returned [Matcham]128-matcham . " [Y]128-matcham are but [a lout and bully]3585-a lout and bully , [Master Dick]76-dick ; [ye]128-matcham but abuse advantages ; let there come a stronger , [we]3586-we will see [you]128-matcham truckle at [his]3175-the man boot ! [Ye]128-matcham care not for vengeance , neither for [[your]128-matcham father]3306-your father s death that goes unpaid , and [[his]3175-the man poor ghost]3588-his poor ghost that clamoureth for justice . But if there come but [a poor creature in [your]128-matcham hands that lacketh skill and strength , and would befriend [you]128-matcham]3589-a poor creature in your hands that lacketh skill and strength , and would befriend you , down [she]3589-a poor creature in your hands that lacketh skill and strength , and would befriend you shall go ! "[128-matcham]

[Dick]76-dick was too furious to observe that " [she]3589-a poor creature in your hands that lacketh skill and strength , and would befriend you . "[76-dick]

" Marry ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried , " and here is news ! Of [any two]3590-any two [the one]3591-the one will still be stronger . [The better man]3592-the better man throweth the worse , and the worse is well served . [Ye]128-matcham deserve a belting , [Master Matcham]120-matcham , for [your]128-matcham ill - guidance and unthankfulness to [meward]120-matcham ; and what [ye]128-matcham deserve [ye]128-matcham shall have . "[76-dick]

And [Dick]76-dick , who , even in [his]76-dick angriest temper , still preserved the appearance of composure , began to unbuckle [his]76-dick belt .

" Here shall be [your]76-dick supper , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , grimly . [Matcham]120-matcham had stopped [his]120-matcham tears ; [he]120-matcham was as white as a sheet , but [he]120-matcham looked [Dick]76-dick steadily in the face , and never moved . [Dick]76-dick took a step , swinging the belt . Then [he]76-dick paused , embarrassed by the large eyes and the thin , weary face of [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion . [His]76-dick courage began to subside .

" Say [ye]76-dick were in the wrong , then , "[120-matcham] [he]120-matcham said , lamely .

" Nay , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , " [I]120-matcham was in the right . Come , cruel ! [I]120-matcham be lame ; [I]120-matcham be weary ; [I]120-matcham resist not ; [I]120-matcham ne er did [thee]76-dick hurt ; come , beat [me]120-matcham [coward]3593-coward ! "[120-matcham]

[Dick]76-dick raised the belt at this last provocation , but [Matcham]120-matcham winced and drew [himself]120-matcham together with so cruel an apprehension , that [his]120-matcham heart failed [him]120-matcham yet again . The strap fell by [his]120-matcham side , and [he]120-matcham stood irresolute , feeling like [a fool]858-a fool .

" A plague upon [thee]76-dick , shrew ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said . " An [ye]76-dick be so feeble of hand , [ye]76-dick should keep the closer guard upon [your]76-dick tongue . But [I]76-dick ll be hanged before [I]76-dick beat [you]76-dick ! "[76-dick] and [he]76-dick put on [his]76-dick belt again . " Beat [you]76-dick [I]76-dick will not , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick continued ; " but forgive [you]76-dick ? never . [I]76-dick knew [ye]76-dick not ; [ye]76-dick were [[my]76-dick master]3094-my master s enemy ; [I]76-dick lent [you]76-dick [my]76-dick horse ; [my]76-dick dinner [ye]76-dick have eaten ; [y]76-dick ave called [me]76-dick [a man o wood]3595-a man o wood , [a coward]3596-a coward , and [a bully]3597-a bully . Nay , by the mass ! the measure is filled , and runneth over . Tis a great thing to be weak , [I]76-dick trow : [ye]76-dick can do [your]76-dick worst , yet shall none punish [you]76-dick ; [ye]76-dick may steal [a man]3107-a man s weapons in the hour of need , yet may [the man]3175-the man not take [his]3175-the man own again ; [y]76-dick are weak , forsooth ! Nay , then , if [one]3600-one cometh charging at [you]76-dick with a lance , and crieth [he]3600-one is weak , [ye]76-dick must let [him]3600-one pierce [your]76-dick body through ! Tut ! fool words ! "[76-dick]

" And yet [ye]76-dick beat [me]120-matcham not , "[120-matcham] returned [Matcham]120-matcham .

" Let be , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick " let be . [I]76-dick will instruct [you]76-dick . [Y]76-dick ave been ill - nurtured , methinks , and yet [ye]76-dick have the makings of some good , and , beyond all question , saved [me]76-dick from [the river]248-the river . Nay , [I]76-dick had forgotten it ; [I]76-dick am as thankless as [thyself]3602-thyself . But , come , let [us]3603-we on . An [we]3603-we be for Holywood this night , ay , or to - morrow early , [we]3603-we had best set forward speedily . "[76-dick]

But though [Dick]76-dick had talked [himself]76-dick back into [his]76-dick usual good - humour , [Matcham]120-matcham had forgiven [him]76-dick nothing . [His]76-dick violence , the recollection of [the forester whom [he]76-dick had slain above all , the vision of the upraised belt]859-the forester whom he had slain above all , the vision of the upraised belt , were things not easily to be forgotten .

" [I]120-matcham will thank [you]76-dick , for the form s sake , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham . " But , in sooth , good [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , [I]120-matcham had liever find [my]120-matcham way alone . Here is a wide wood ; prithee , let each choose [his]76-dick path ; [I]120-matcham owe [you]76-dick a dinner and a lesson . Fare [ye]76-dick well ! "[120-matcham]

" Nay , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , " if that be [your]76-dick tune , so be it , and a plague be with [you]76-dick ! "[76-dick]

[Each]140-each turned aside , and [they]140-each began walking off severally , with no thought of the direction , intent solely on [their]140-each quarrel . But [Dick]76-dick had not gone ten paces ere [his]76-dick name was called , and [Matcham]120-matcham came running after .

" [Dick]76-dick , "[120-matcham] [he]120-matcham said , " it were unmannerly to part so coldly . Here is [my]120-matcham hand , and [my]120-matcham heart with it . For all that wherein [you]76-dick have so excellently served and helped [me]120-matcham not for the form , but from the heart , [I]120-matcham thank [you]76-dick . Fare [ye]76-dick right well . "[120-matcham]

" Well , [lad]3604-lad , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , taking the hand which was offered [him]76-dick , " good speed to [you]3604-lad , if speed [you]3604-lad may . But [I]76-dick misdoubt it shrewdly . [Y]3604-lad are too disputatious . "[76-dick] So then [they]140-each separated for the second time ; and presently it was [Dick]76-dick who was running after [Matcham]120-matcham .

" Here , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " take [my]76-dick cross - bow ; shalt not go unarmed . "[76-dick]

" A cross - bow ! "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham . " Nay , [boy]3344-boy , [I]120-matcham have neither the strength to bend nor yet the skill to aim with it . It were no help to [me]120-matcham , [good boy]3318-good boy . But yet [I]120-matcham thank [you]3604-lad . "[120-matcham]

The night had now fallen , and under the trees [they]140-each could no longer read [each other]664-each other s face .

" [I]76-dick will go some little way with [you]3604-lad , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " The night is dark . [I]76-dick would fain leave [you]3604-lad on [a path]3607-a path , at least . [My]76-dick mind misgiveth [me]76-dick , [y]3604-lad are likely to be lost . "[76-dick]

Without any more words , [he]76-dick began to walk forward , and [the other]311-the other once more followed [him]76-dick . The blackness grew thicker and thicker . Only here and there , in open places , [they]140-each saw the sky , dotted with small stars . In the distance , the noise of the rout of [the Lancastrian army]862-the lancastrian army still continued to be faintly audible ; but with every step [they]140-each left it farther in the rear .

At the end of half an hour of silent progress [they]140-each came forth upon [a broad patch of heathy open]863-a broad patch of heathy open . [It]863-a broad patch of heathy open glimmered in the light of the stars , shaggy with fern and islanded with clumps of yew . And here [they]140-each paused and looked upon [each other]664-each other .

" [Y]3604-lad are weary ? "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick said .

" Nay , [I]120-matcham am so weary , "[120-matcham] answered [Matcham]120-matcham , " that methinks [I]120-matcham could lie down and die . "[120-matcham]

" [I]76-dick hear the chiding of [a river]3608-a river , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " Let [us]140-each go so far forth , for [I]76-dick am sore athirst . "[76-dick]

[The ground]614-the ground sloped down gently ; and , sure enough , in the bottom , [they]140-each found [a little murmuring river]866-a little murmuring river , running among willows . Here [they]140-each threw [themselves]140-each down together by the brink ; and putting [their]140-each mouths to the level of [a starry pool]867-a starry pool , [they]140-each drank [their]140-each fill .

" [Dick]76-dick , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , " it may not be . [I]120-matcham can no more . "[120-matcham]

" [I]76-dick saw a pit as [we]140-each came down , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Let [us]140-each lie down therein and sleep . "[76-dick]

" Nay , but with all [my]120-matcham heart ! "[120-matcham] cried [Matcham]120-matcham .

[The pit]868-the pit was sandy and dry ; a shock of brambles hung upon one hedge , and made a partial shelter ; and there [the two lads]416-the two lads lay down , keeping close together for the sake of warmth , [their]416-the two lads quarrel all forgotten . And soon sleep fell upon [them]416-the two lads like a cloud , and under the dew and stars [they]416-the two lads rested peacefully .

CHAPTER VII THE HOODED FACE

[They]416-the two lads awoke in the grey of the morning ; the birds were not yet in full song , but twittered here and there among [the woods]783-the woods ; the sun was not yet up , but the eastern sky was barred with solemn colours . Half starved and over - weary as [they]416-the two lads were , [they]416-the two lads lay without moving , sunk in a delightful lassitude . And as [they]416-the two lads thus lay , the clang of a bell fell suddenly upon [their]416-the two lads ears .

" A bell ! "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , sitting up . " Can [we]140-each be , then , so near to [Holywood]14-holywood ? "[76-dick]

A little after , the bell clanged again , but this time somewhat nearer hand ; and from that time forth , and still drawing nearer and nearer , it continued to sound brokenly abroad in the silence of the morning .

" Nay , what should this betoken ? "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , who was now broad awake .

" It is [some one walking]3609-some one walking , "[120-matcham] returned [Matcham]120-matcham , and " the bell tolleth ever as [he]3609-some one walking moves . "[120-matcham]

" [I]76-dick see that well , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " But wherefore ? What maketh [he]3609-some one walking in [Tunstall Woods]29-tunstall woods ? [Jack]128-matcham , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added , " laugh at [me]76-dick an [ye]128-matcham will , but [I]76-dick like not the hollow sound of it . "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , with a shiver , " it hath a doleful note . An the day were not come "[120-matcham]

But just then the bell , quickening its pace , began to ring thick and hurried , and then it gave a single hammering jangle , and was silent for a space .

" It is as though [the bearer]3610-the bearer had run for a pater - noster while , and then leaped [the river]248-the river , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick observed .

" And now beginneth [he]3609-some one walking again to pace soberly forward , "[120-matcham] added [Matcham]120-matcham .

" Nay , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick " nay , not so soberly , [Jack]128-matcham . Tis [a man that walketh [you]128-matcham right speedily . Tis a man in some fear of [his]3612-a man that walketh you right speedily . tis a man in some fear of his life , or about some hurried business life , or about some hurried business]3612-a man that walketh you right speedily . tis a man in some fear of his life , or about some hurried business . See [ye]128-matcham not how swift the beating draweth near ? "[120-matcham]

" It is now close by , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham .

[They]871-us were now on the edge of [the pit]868-the pit ; and as the pit itself was on a certain eminence , [they]871-us commanded a view over the greater proportion of [the clearing]645-the clearing , up to [the thick woods that closed]874-the thick woods that closed [it]645-the clearing in .

The daylight , which was very clear and grey , showed [them]871-us a riband of white footpath wandering among [the gorse]875-the gorse . It passed some hundred yards from [the pit]868-the pit , and ran the whole length of [the clearing]645-the clearing , east and west . By the line of its course , [Dick]76-dick judged it should lead more or less directly to [the Moat House]260-the moat house .

Upon [this path]879-this path , stepping forth from [the margin of the wood]880-the margin of the wood , a white figure now appeared . [It]881-it paused a little , and seemed to look about ; and then , at a slow pace , and bent almost double , it began to draw near across [the heath]733-the heath . At every step the bell clanked . Face , it had none ; a white hood , not even pierced with eye - holes , veiled the head ; and as the creature moved , it seemed to feel its way with the tapping of a stick . Fear fell upon [the lads]649-the lads , as cold as death .

" [A leper]3613-a leper ! "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , hoarsely .

" [His]3613-a leper touch is death , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham . " Let [us]871-us run . "[120-matcham]

" Not so , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " See [ye]120-matcham not ? [he]3613-a leper is stone blind . [He]3613-a leper guideth [him]3613-a leper with a staff . Let [us]871-us lie still ; the wind bloweth towards [the path]506-the path , and [he]3613-a leper will go by and hurt [us]871-us not . Alas , [poor soul]3615-poor soul , and [we]871-us should rather pity [him]3613-a leper ! "[76-dick]

" [I]120-matcham will pity [him]3613-a leper when [he]3613-a leper is by , "[120-matcham] replied [Matcham]120-matcham .

[The blind leper]884-the blind leper was now about halfway towards [them]885-them , and just then the sun rose and shone full on [his]884-the blind leper veiled face . [He]884-the blind leper had been [a tall man]590-a tall man before [he]884-the blind leper was bowed by [his]884-the blind leper disgusting sickness , and even now [he]884-the blind leper walked with a vigorous step . The dismal beating of [his]884-the blind leper bell , the pattering of the stick , the eyeless screen before [his]884-the blind leper countenance , and the knowledge that [he]884-the blind leper was not only doomed to death and suffering , but shut out for ever from the touch of [[his]884-the blind leper fellow - men]887-his fellow - men , filled [the lads]649-the lads bosoms with dismay ; and at every step that brought [him]884-the blind leper nearer , [their]649-the lads courage and strength seemed to desert [them]649-the lads .

As [he]884-the blind leper came about level with the pit , [he]884-the blind leper paused , and turned [his]884-the blind leper face full upon [the lads]649-the lads .

" [Mary]93-mary be [my]120-matcham shield ! [He]890-the leper sees [us]649-the lads ! "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , faintly .

" Hush ! "[76-dick] whispered [Dick]76-dick . " [He]890-the leper doth but hearken . [He]890-the leper is blind , [fool]3472-fool ! "[76-dick]

[The leper]890-the leper looked or listened , whichever [he]890-the leper was really doing , for some seconds . Then [he]884-the blind leper began to move on again , but presently paused once more , and again turned and seemed to gaze upon [the lads]649-the lads . Even [Dick]76-dick became dead - white and closed [his]76-dick eyes , as if by the mere sight [he]76-dick might become infected . But soon the bell sounded , and this time , without any farther hesitation , [the leper]890-the leper crossed [the remainder of [the little heath]894-the little heath]893-the remainder of the little heath and disappeared into [the covert of [the woods]783-the woods]782-the covert of the woods .

" [He]890-the leper saw [us]649-the lads , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham . " [I]120-matcham could swear it ! "[120-matcham]

" Tut ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , recovering some sparks of courage . " [He]890-the leper but heard [us]649-the lads . [He]890-the leper was in fear , [poor soul]3615-poor soul ! An [ye]649-the lads were blind , and walked in a perpetual night , [ye]649-the lads would start [yourself]649-the lads , if ever a twig rustled or a bird cried Peep . "[76-dick]

" [Dick]76-dick , [good Dick]3618-good dick , [he]890-the leper saw [us]649-the lads , "[120-matcham] repeated [Matcham]120-matcham . " When [a man]3107-a man hearkeneth , [he]3107-a man doth not as [this man]3552-this man ; [he]3107-a man doth otherwise , [Dick]76-dick . This was seeing ; it was not hearing . [He]890-the leper means foully . Hark , else , if [his]890-the leper bell be not stopped ! "[120-matcham]

Such was the case . The bell rang no longer .

" Nay , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick like not that . Nay , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried again , " [I]76-dick like that little . What may this betoken ? Let [us]649-the lads go , by the mass ! "[76-dick]

" [He]890-the leper hath gone [east]3621-east , "[120-matcham] added [Matcham]120-matcham . " Good [Dick]76-dick , let [us]649-the lads go westward straight ; [I]120-matcham shall not breathe till [I]120-matcham have [my]120-matcham back turned upon [that leper]3622-that leper . "[120-matcham]

" [Jack]128-matcham , [y]128-matcham are too cowardly , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick . " [We]649-the lads shall go fair for [Holywood]14-holywood , or as fair , at least , as [I]76-dick can guide [you]128-matcham , and that will be due north . "[76-dick]

[They]897-they were afoot at once , passed [the stream]898-the stream upon some stepping - stones , and began to mount on the other side , which was steeper , towards the margin of [the wood]3158-the wood . [The ground]614-the ground became very uneven , full of knolls and hollows ; trees grew scattered or in clumps ; it became difficult to choose a path , and [the lads]649-the lads somewhat wandered . [They]897-they were weary , besides , with yesterday s exertions and the lack of food , and [they]897-they moved but heavily and dragged [their]897-they feet among the sand .

Presently , coming to the top of [a knoll]266-a knoll , [they]897-they were aware of [the leper]890-the leper , some hundred feet in front of [them]897-they , crossing the line of [their]897-they march by a hollow . [His]890-the leper bell was silent , [his]890-the leper staff no longer tapped the ground , and [he]890-the leper went before [him]890-the leper with the swift and assured footsteps of [a man who sees]904-a man who sees . Next moment [he]890-the leper had disappeared into a little thicket .

[The lads]649-the lads , at the first glimpse , had crouched behind [a tuft of gorse]906-a tuft of gorse ; there [they]649-the lads lay , horror - struck .

" Certain , [he]890-the leper pursueth [us]649-the lads , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick " certain ! [He]890-the leper held the clapper of [his]890-the leper bell in one hand , saw [ye]649-the lads ? that it should not sound . Now may [the saints]3104-the saints aid and guide [us]649-the lads , for [I]76-dick have no strength to combat pestilence ! "[76-dick]

" What maketh [he]890-the leper ? "[120-matcham] cried [Matcham]120-matcham . " What doth [he]890-the leper want ? Who ever heard the like , that [a leper , out of mere malice]3624-a leper , out of mere malice , should pursue [unfortunates]3625-unfortunates ? Hath [he]890-the leper not [his]890-the leper bell to that very end , that [people]249-people may avoid [him]890-the leper ? [Dick]76-dick , there is below this something deeper . "[120-matcham]

" Nay , [I]76-dick care not , "[76-dick] moaned [Dick]76-dick ; " the strength is gone out of [me]76-dick ; [my]76-dick legs are like water . [The saints]3104-the saints be [mine]76-dick assistance ! "[76-dick]

" Would [ye]76-dick lie there idle ? "[120-matcham] cried [Matcham]120-matcham . " Let [us]3628-us back into the open . [We]3628-us have the better chance ; [he]890-the leper can not steal upon [us]3628-us unawares . "[120-matcham]

" Not [I]76-dick , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " [My]76-dick time is come , and peradventure [he]890-the leper may pass [us]3628-us by . "[76-dick]

" Bend [me]311-the other , then , [your]76-dick bow ! "[311-the other] cried [the other]311-the other . " What ! will [ye]76-dick be [a man]3107-a man ? "[311-the other]

[Dick]76-dick crossed [himself]76-dick . " Would [ye]76-dick have [me]76-dick shoot upon [a leper]3613-a leper ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried . " The hand would fail [me]76-dick . Nay , now , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added " nay , now , let be ! With [sound men]3631-sound men [I]76-dick will fight , but not with [ghosts]3632-ghosts and [lepers]3633-lepers . Which this is , [I]76-dick wot not . One or other , Heaven be [our]3634-our protection ! "[76-dick]

" Now , "[120-matcham] said [Matcham]120-matcham , " if this be [man]3147-man s courage , what [a poor thing]3636-a poor thing is [man]3147-man ! But sith [ye]76-dick will do naught , let [us]3634-our lie close . "[120-matcham]

Then came a single , broken jangle on the bell .

" [He]890-the leper hath missed [his]890-the leper hold upon [the clapper]3638-the clapper , "[120-matcham] whispered [Matcham]120-matcham . " [Saints]141-saints ! how near [he]890-the leper is ! "[120-matcham]

But [Dick]76-dick answered never a word ; [his]76-dick teeth were near chattering .

Soon [they]908-they saw a piece of the white robe between some bushes ; then [the leper]890-the leper s head was thrust forth from behind a trunk , and [he]890-the leper seemed narrowly to scan [the neighbourhood]910-the neighbourhood before [he]890-the leper once again withdrew . To [their]908-they stretched senses , the whole bush appeared alive with rustlings and the creak of twigs ; and [they]908-they heard the beating of [each other]664-each other s heart .

Suddenly , with a cry , [the leper]890-the leper sprang into the open close by , and ran straight upon [the lads]649-the lads . [They]908-they , shrieking aloud , separated and began to run different ways . But [[their]908-they horrible enemy]914-their horrible enemy fastened upon [Matcham]120-matcham , ran [him]120-matcham swiftly down , and had [him]120-matcham almost instantly [a prisoner]915-a prisoner . [The lad]309-the lad gave one scream that echoed high and far over [the forest]246-the forest , [he]309-the lad had one spasm of struggling , and then all [his]309-the lad limbs relaxed , and [he]309-the lad fell limp into [[his]309-the lad captor]918-his captor s arms .

[Dick]76-dick heard the cry and turned . [He]76-dick saw [Matcham]120-matcham fall ; and on the instant [his]120-matcham spirit and [his]120-matcham strength revived ; With a cry of pity and anger , [he]120-matcham unslung and bent [his]120-matcham arblast . But ere [he]120-matcham had time to shoot , [the leper]890-the leper held up [his]890-the leper hand .

" Hold [your]120-matcham shot , [Dickon]142-dickon ! "[120-matcham] cried a familiar voice . " Hold [your]120-matcham shot , [mad wag]3639-mad wag ! Know [ye]120-matcham not [a friend]3640-a friend ? "[120-matcham]

And then laying down [Matcham]120-matcham on the turf , [he]120-matcham undid the hood from off [his]120-matcham face , and disclosed the features of [Sir Daniel Brackley]72-sir daniel .

" [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick .

" Ay , by the mass , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ! "[438-the knight] returned [the knight]438-the knight . " Would [ye]120-matcham shoot upon [[your]120-matcham guardian]3641-your guardian , [rogue]3260-rogue ? But here is this "[120-matcham] And there [he]120-matcham broke off , and pointing to [Matcham]120-matcham , asked : " How call [ye]120-matcham [him]3641-your guardian , [Dick]76-dick ? "[120-matcham]

" Nay , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick call [him]120-matcham [Master Matcham]120-matcham . Know [ye]120-matcham [him]120-matcham not ? [He]120-matcham said [ye]120-matcham knew [him]120-matcham ! "[76-dick]

" Ay , "[72-sir daniel] replied [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " [I]72-sir daniel know [the lad]309-the lad ; "[72-sir daniel] and [he]72-sir daniel chuckled . " But [he]309-the lad has fainted ; and , by [my]72-sir daniel sooth , [he]309-the lad might have had less to faint for ! Hey , [Dick]76-dick ? Did [I]72-sir daniel put the fear of death upon [you]76-dick ? "[72-sir daniel]

" Indeed , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , [ye]72-sir daniel did that , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , and sighed again at the mere recollection . " Nay , [sir]3184-sir , saving [your]3184-sir respect , [I]76-dick had as lief a met the devil in person ; and to speak truth , [I]76-dick am yet [all a - quake]3645-all a - quake . But what made [ye]72-sir daniel , [sir]3184-sir , in such a guise ? "[76-dick]

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s brow grew suddenly black with anger .

" What made [I]72-sir daniel ? "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel said . " [Ye]3184-sir do well to mind [me]921-i of it ! What ? [I]921-i skulked for [my]921-i poor life in [[my]921-i own wood of [Tunstall]5-tunstall]3647-my own wood of tunstall , [Dick]76-dick . [We]3648-we were ill sped at the battle ; [we]3648-we but got there to be swept among [the rout]3649-the rout . Where be all [[my]921-i good men - at - arms]3650-my good men - at - arms ? [Dick]76-dick , by the mass , [I]921-i know not ! [We]3648-we were swept down ; the shot fell thick among [us]3648-we ; [I]921-i have not seen one man in [my]921-i own colours since [I]921-i saw three fall . For [myself]921-i , [I]921-i came sound to [Shoreby]143-lord shoreby , and being mindful of [the Black Arrow]69-the black arrow , got [me]921-i this gown and bell , and came softly by the path for [the Moat House]17-the moat house . There is no disguise to be compared with it ; the jingle of this bell would scare [me]921-i [the stoutest outlaw in [the forest]246-the forest]3651-the stoutest outlaw in the forest ; [they]3651-the stoutest outlaw in the forest would all turn pale to hear it . At length [I]921-i came by [you]76-dick and [Matcham]120-matcham . [I]921-i could see but evilly through this same hood , and was not sure of [you]76-dick , being chiefly , and for many a good cause , astonished at the finding [you]76-dick together . Moreover , in the open , where [I]921-i had to go slowly and tap with [my]921-i staff , [I]921-i feared to disclose [myself]921-i . But see , "[921-i] [he]921-i added , " [this poor shrew]3653-this poor shrew begins a little to revive . [A little good canary]3654-a little good canary will comfort [me]921-i the heart of it . "[921-i]

[The knight]438-the knight , from under [his]438-the knight long dress , produced a stout bottle , and began to rub the temples and wet the lips of [the patient , who returned gradually to consciousness , and began to roll dim eyes from one to another]923-the patient , who returned gradually to consciousness , and began to roll dim eyes from one to another .

" What cheer , [Jack]128-matcham ! "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " [It]3653-this poor shrew was [no leper]3655-no leper , after all ; it was [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ! See ! "[76-dick]

" Swallow [me]438-the knight a good draught of this , "[438-the knight] said [the knight]438-the knight . " This will give [you]76-dick manhood . Thereafter , [I]921-i will give [you]76-dick both a meal , and [we]3656-we shall all three on to [Tunstall]5-tunstall . For , [Dick]76-dick , "[921-i] [he]921-i continued , laying forth bread and meat upon the grass , " [I]921-i will avow to [you]76-dick , in all good conscience , it irks [me]921-i sorely to be safe between four walls . Not since [I]921-i backed a horse have [I]921-i been pressed so hard ; peril of life , jeopardy of land and livelihood , and to sum up , all these losels in the wood to hunt [me]921-i down . But [I]921-i be not yet shent . [Some of [[my]921-i lads]3658-my lads]3657-some of my lads will pick [me]921-i [their]3657-some of my lads way [home]699-home . [Hatch]77-bennet hath [ten fellows]3660-ten fellows ; [Selden]108-selden , [he]108-selden had six . Nay , [we]3661-we shall soon be strong again ; and if [I]921-i can but buy [my]921-i peace with [[my]921-i right fortunate and undeserving Lord of [York]8-york]3662-my right fortunate and undeserving lord of york , why , [Dick]76-dick , [we]3661-we ll be [a man]3107-a man again and go a - horseback ! "[921-i]

And so saying , [the knight]438-the knight filled [himself]438-the knight a horn of canary , and pledged [his]438-the knight ward in dumb show .

" [Selden]108-selden , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick faltered " Selden "[76-dick] And [he]76-dick paused again .

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel put down the wine untasted .

" How ! "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel cried , in a changed voice . " [Selden]108-selden ? Speak ! What of [Selden]108-selden ? "[72-sir daniel]

[Dick]76-dick stammered forth the tale of the ambush and the massacre .

[The knight]438-the knight heard in silence ; but as [he]438-the knight listened , [his]438-the knight countenance became convulsed with rage and grief .

" Now here , "[438-the knight] [he]438-the knight cried , " on [my]438-the knight right hand , [I]438-the knight swear to avenge it ! If that [I]438-the knight fail , if that [I]438-the knight spill not ten men s souls for each , may this hand wither from [my]438-the knight body ! [I]438-the knight broke [this Duckworth]3664-this duckworth like a rush ; [I]438-the knight beggared [him]438-the knight to [his]438-the knight door ; [I]438-the knight burned the thatch above [his]438-the knight head ; [I]438-the knight drove [him]438-the knight from [this country]3189-this country ; and now , cometh [he]438-the knight back to beard [me]438-the knight ? Nay , but , [Duckworth]100-ellis , this time it shall go bitter hard ! "[438-the knight]

[He]438-the knight was silent for some time , [his]438-the knight face working .

" Eat ! "[438-the knight] [he]438-the knight cried , suddenly . " And [you]128-matcham here , "[438-the knight] [he]438-the knight added to [Matcham]128-matcham , " swear [me]438-the knight an oath to follow straight to [the Moat House]260-the moat house . "[438-the knight]

" [I]128-matcham will pledge [mine]128-matcham honour , "[128-matcham] replied [Matcham]128-matcham .

" What make [I]438-the knight with [your]438-the knight honour ? "[438-the knight] cried [the knight]438-the knight . " Swear [me]438-the knight upon [[your]438-the knight mother]3469-your mother s welfare ! "[438-the knight]

[Matcham]128-matcham gave the required oath ; and [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel re - adjusted the hood over [his]72-sir daniel face , and prepared [his]72-sir daniel bell and staff . To see [him]72-sir daniel once more in that appalling travesty somewhat revived the horror of [[his]72-sir daniel two companions]928-his two companions . But [the knight]438-the knight was soon upon [his]438-the knight feet .

" Eat with despatch , "[438-the knight] [he]438-the knight said , " and follow [me]438-the knight yarely to [[mine]438-the knight house]3668-mine house . "[438-the knight]

And with that [he]438-the knight set forth again into [the woods]783-the woods ; and presently after the bell began to sound , numbering [his]438-the knight steps , and [the two lads]416-the two lads sat by [their]416-the two lads untasted meal , and heard it die slowly away up hill into the distance .

" And so [ye]416-the two lads go to [Tunstall]5-tunstall ? "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick inquired .

" Yea , verily , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , " when needs must ! [I]128-matcham am braver behind [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s back than to [his]72-sir daniel face . "[128-matcham]

[They]416-the two lads ate hastily , and set forth along the path through [the airy upper levels of [the forest]246-the forest]932-the airy upper levels of the forest , where great beeches stood apart among green lawns , and the birds and squirrels made merry on the boughs . Two hours later , [they]416-the two lads began to descend upon the other side , and already , among the tree - tops , saw before [them]416-the two lads the red walls and roofs of [Tunstall House]30-tunstall house .

" Here , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham , pausing , " [ye]416-the two lads shall take [your]416-the two lads leave of [[your]416-the two lads friend]3669-your friend [Jack]128-matcham , whom [y]416-the two lads are to see no more . Come , [Dick]76-dick , forgive [him]128-matcham what [he]128-matcham did amiss , as [he]128-matcham , for [his]128-matcham part , cheerfully and lovingly forgiveth [you]416-the two lads . "[128-matcham]

" And wherefore so ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick . " An [we]416-the two lads both go to [Tunstall]5-tunstall , [I]76-dick shall see [you]416-the two lads yet again , [I]76-dick trow , and that right often . "[76-dick]

" [Ye]416-the two lads ll never again see poor [Jack Matcham]128-matcham , "[311-the other] replied [the other]311-the other , " that was so fearful and burthensome , and yet plucked [you]416-the two lads from [the river]248-the river ; [ye]416-the two lads ll not see [him]128-matcham more , [Dick]76-dick , by [mine]311-the other honour ! "[311-the other] [He]311-the other held [his]311-the other arms open , and [the lads]649-the lads embraced and kissed . " And , [Dick]76-dick , "[128-matcham] continued [Matcham]128-matcham , " [my]128-matcham spirit bodeth ill . [Y]416-the two lads are now to see a new [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ; for heretofore hath all prospered in [his]72-sir daniel hands exceedingly , and fortune followed [him]72-sir daniel ; but now , methinks , when [his]72-sir daniel fate hath come upon [him]72-sir daniel , and [he]72-sir daniel runs the adventure of [his]72-sir daniel life , [he]72-sir daniel will prove but [a foul lord to both of [us]936-us]3671-a foul lord to both of us . [He]72-sir daniel may be brave in battle , but [he]72-sir daniel hath the liar s eye ; there is fear in [his]72-sir daniel eye , [Dick]76-dick , and fear is as cruel as the wolf ! [We]936-us go down into [that house]3672-that house , [Saint Mary]93-mary guide [us]936-us forth again ! "[128-matcham]

And so [they]936-us continued [their]936-us descent in silence , and came out at last before [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s forest stronghold]937-sir daniel s forest stronghold , where [it]937-sir daniel s forest stronghold stood , low and shady , flanked with [round towers]938-round towers and stained with moss and lichen , in [the lilied waters of [the moat]940-the moat]939-the lilied waters of the moat . Even as [they]936-us appeared , the doors were opened , the bridge lowered , and [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel [himself]72-sir daniel , with [Hatch]77-bennet and [the parson]346-the parson at [his]72-sir daniel side , stood ready to receive [them]936-us .

BOOK II [THE MOAT HOUSE]17-the moat house

CHAPTER I [DICK]76-dick ASKS QUESTIONS

[The Moat House]260-the moat house stood not far from [the rough forest road]943-the rough forest road . Externally , [it]260-the moat house was a compact rectangle of red stone , flanked at each corner by [a round tower , pierced for archery and battlemented at the top]944-a round tower , pierced for archery and battlemented at the top . Within , [it]260-the moat house enclosed [a narrow court]945-a narrow court . [The moat]940-the moat was perhaps twelve feet wide , crossed by a single drawbridge . [It]260-the moat house was supplied with water by a trench , leading to [a forest pool]947-a forest pool and commanded , through [its]260-the moat house whole length , from the battlements of [the two southern towers]948-the two southern towers . Except that one or two tall and thick trees had been suffered to remain within half a bowshot of the walls , [the house]321-the house was in a good posture for defence .

In [the court]950-the court , [Dick]76-dick found [a part of [the garrison , busy with preparations for defence , and gloomily discussing the chances of a siege]952-the garrison , busy with preparations for defence , and gloomily discussing the chances of a siege]951-a part of the garrison , busy with preparations for defence , and gloomily discussing the chances of a siege . [Some]3511-some were making arrows , some sharpening swords that had long been disused ; but even as [they]3511-some worked , [they]3511-some shook [their]3511-some heads .

[Twelve of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s party]954-twelve of sir daniel s party had escaped the battle , run the gauntlet through [the wood]3158-the wood , and come alive to [the Moat House]17-the moat house . But out of this dozen , three had been gravely wounded : two at [Risingham]184-lord risingham in the disorder of the rout , one by [John Amend]95-john amend - [All s marksmen]956-all s marksmen as [he]95-john amend crossed [the forest]246-the forest . This raised the force of [the garrison]3201-the garrison , counting [Hatch]77-bennet , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , and [young Shelton]74-master shelton , to [twenty - two effective men]959-twenty - two effective men . And more might be continually expected to arrive . The danger lay not therefore in the lack of [men]3205-men .

It was the terror of the Black Arrow that oppressed [the spirits of [the garrison]3201-the garrison]961-the spirits of the garrison . For [[their]3205-men open foes of [the party of [York]8-york]964-the party of york]963-their open foes of the party of york , in these most changing times , [they]3205-men felt but a far - away concern . " [The world]235-the world , "[249-people] as [people]249-people said in those days , " might change again "[249-people] before harm came . But for [[their]3205-men neighbours]966-their neighbours in [the wood]3158-the wood , [they]3205-men trembled . It was not [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel alone who was a mark for hatred . [[His]72-sir daniel men]417-his men , conscious of impunity , had carried [themselves]417-his men cruelly through all [the country]363-the country . Harsh commands had been harshly executed ; and of [the little band that now sat talking in [the court]950-the court]970-the little band that now sat talking in the court , there was [not one but had been guilty of some act of oppression or barbarity]972-not one but had been guilty of some act of oppression or barbarity . And now , by the fortune of war , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had become powerless to protect [his]72-sir daniel instruments ; now , by the issue of some hours of battle , at which many of [them]417-his men had not been present , [they]417-his men had all become [punishable traitors to the State , outside the buckler of the law , a shrunken company in [a poor fortress that was hardly tenable , and exposed upon all sides to the just resentment of]974-a poor fortress that was hardly tenable , and exposed upon all sides to the just resentment of [[their]417-his men victims]975-their victims]973-punishable traitors to the state , outside the buckler of the law , a shrunken company in a poor fortress that was hardly tenable , and exposed upon all sides to the just resentment of their victims . Nor had there been lacking grisly advertisements of what [they]417-his men might expect .

At different periods of the evening and the night , no fewer than seven riderless horses had come neighing in terror to the gate . Two were from [[Selden]108-selden s troop]976-selden s troop ; five belonged to [men who had ridden with [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel to [the field]306-the field]977-men who had ridden with sir daniel to the field . Lastly , a little before dawn , [a spearman]979-a spearman had come staggering to the moat side , pierced by three arrows ; even as [they]417-his men carried [him]979-a spearman in , [his]979-a spearman spirit had departed ; but by the words that [he]979-a spearman uttered in [his]979-a spearman agony , [he]979-a spearman must have been [the last survivor of a considerable company of men]980-the last survivor of a considerable company of men .

[Hatch]77-bennet [himself]77-bennet showed , under [his]77-bennet sun - brown , the pallour of anxiety ; and when [he]77-bennet had taken [Dick]76-dick aside and learned the fate of [Selden]108-selden , [he]77-bennet fell on a stone bench and fairly wept . [The others]379-the others , from where [they]379-the others sat on stools or doorsteps in [the sunny angle of [the court]950-the court]982-the sunny angle of the court , looked at [him]77-bennet with wonder and alarm , but [none]3268-none ventured to inquire the cause of [his]77-bennet emotion .

" Nay , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[77-bennet] said [Hatch]77-bennet , at last " nay , but what said [I]77-bennet ? [We]3674-we shall all go . [Selden]108-selden was [a man of [his]108-selden hands]3675-a man of his hands ; [he]108-selden was like [a brother to [me]77-bennet]3676-a brother to me . Well , [he]108-selden has gone second ; well , [we]3674-we shall all follow ! For what said [their]985-their knave rhyme ? A black arrow in each black heart . Was it not so it went ? [Appleyard]121-appleyard , [Selden]108-selden , [Smith]144-smith , [old Humphrey]145-old humphrey gone ; and there lieth poor [John Carter]146-carter , crying , [poor sinner]3677-poor sinner , for [the priest]338-the priest . "[77-bennet]

[Dick]76-dick gave ear . Out of a low window , hard by where [they]985-their were talking , groans and murmurs came to [his]76-dick ear .

" Lieth [he]108-selden there ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick asked .

" Ay , in [the second porter s chamber]3679-the second porter s chamber , "[77-bennet] answered [Hatch]77-bennet . " [We]3674-we could not bear [him]108-selden further , soul and body were so bitterly at odds . At every step [we]3674-we lifted [him]108-selden , [he]108-selden thought to wend . But now , methinks , it is the soul that suffereth . Ever for [the priest]338-the priest [he]108-selden crieth , and [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , [I]77-bennet wot not why , still cometh not . Twill be a long shrift ; but [poor Appleyard]121-appleyard and poor [Selden]108-selden , [they]3674-we had none . "[77-bennet]

[Dick]76-dick stooped to the window and looked in . [The little cell]986-the little cell was low and dark , but [he]76-dick could make out [the wounded soldier]987-the wounded soldier lying moaning on [his]987-the wounded soldier pallet .

" [Carter]146-carter , [poor friend]3681-poor friend , how goeth it ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick asked .

" [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[3175-the man] returned [the man]3175-the man , in an excited whisper , " for [the dear light of heaven]3682-the dear light of heaven , bring [the priest]338-the priest . [Alack]147-alack , [I]3175-the man am sped ; [I]3175-the man am brought very low down ; [my]3175-the man hurt is to the death . [Ye]146-carter may do [me]3175-the man no more service ; this shall be the last . Now , for [my]3175-the man poor soul s interest , and as [a loyal gentleman]3684-a loyal gentleman , bestir [you]146-carter ; for [I]3175-the man have that matter on [my]3175-the man conscience that shall drag [me]3175-the man deep . "[3175-the man]

[He]987-the wounded soldier groaned , and [Dick]76-dick heard the grating of [his]76-dick teeth , whether in pain or terror .

Just then [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel appeared upon the threshold of [the hall]989-the hall . [He]72-sir daniel had a letter in one hand .

" [Lads]3497-lads , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel said , " [we]3686-we have had a shog , [we]3686-we have had a tumble ; wherefore , then , deny it ? Rather it imputeth to get speedily again to saddle . [This old Harry the Sixt]3687-this old harry the sixt has had the undermost . Wash [we]3686-we , then , [our]3686-we hands of [him]3687-this old harry the sixt . [I]72-sir daniel have [a good friend]3174-a good friend that rideth next [the duke]3689-the duke , [the Lord of [Wensleydale]31-wensleydale]3690-the lord of wensleydale . Well , [I]72-sir daniel have writ a letter to [[my]72-sir daniel friend]3691-my friend , praying [[his]3691-my friend good lordship]3692-his good lordship , and offering large satisfaction for the past and reasonable surety for the future . Doubt not but [he]3691-my friend will lend a favourable ear . A prayer without gifts is like a song without music : [I]72-sir daniel surfeit [him]3691-my friend with promises , [boys]3334-boys [I]72-sir daniel spare not to promise . What , then , is lacking ? Nay , a great thing wherefore should [I]72-sir daniel deceive [you]3694-ye ? a great thing and a difficult : [a messenger to bear it]3695-a messenger to bear it . [The woods y]3696-the woods y are not ignorant of that lie thick with [[our]3697-our ill - willers]3698-our ill - willers . Haste is most needful ; but without sleight and caution all is naught . Which , then , of [this company]3435-this company will take [me]72-sir daniel this letter , bear [me]72-sir daniel it to [[my]72-sir daniel Lord of [Wensleydale]31-wensleydale]3700-my lord of wensleydale , and bring [me]72-sir daniel the answer back ? "[72-sir daniel]

[One man]990-one man instantly arose .

" [I]990-one man will , an t like [you]3694-ye , "[990-one man] said [he]990-one man . " [I]990-one man will even risk [my]990-one man carcase . "[990-one man]

" Nay , [Dicky Bowyer]81-bowyer , not so , "[438-the knight] returned [the knight]438-the knight . " It likes [me]438-the knight not . [Y]3694-ye are sly indeed , but not speedy . [Ye]3694-ye were [a laggard]3701-a laggard ever . "[438-the knight]

" An t be so , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , here am [I]992-another , "[992-another] cried [another]992-another .

" [The saints]3104-the saints forfend ! "[438-the knight] said [the knight]438-the knight . " [Y]3694-ye are speedy , but not sly . [Ye]3694-ye would blunder [me]438-the knight headforemost into [John Amend - All]95-john amend s camp . [I]438-the knight thank [you]3694-ye both for [your]3694-ye good courage ; but , in sooth , it may not be . "[438-the knight]

Then [Hatch]77-bennet offered [himself]77-bennet , and [he]77-bennet also was refused .

" [I]438-the knight want [you]3694-ye here , [good Bennet]77-bennet ; [y]3694-ye are [my]438-the knight right hand , indeed , "[438-the knight] returned [the knight]438-the knight ; and then [several coming forward in a group]995-several coming forward in a group , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel at length selected [one]3600-one and gave [him]3600-one the letter .

" Now , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel said , " upon [your]3694-ye good speed and better discretion [we]3703-we do all depend . Bring [me]72-sir daniel a good answer back , and before three weeks , [I]72-sir daniel will have purged [[my]72-sir daniel forest]3704-my forest of [these vagabonds that brave [us]3703-we to [our]3703-we faces]3705-these vagabonds that brave us to our faces . But mark it well , [Throgmorton]148-throgmorton : the matter is not easy . [Ye]3694-ye must steal forth under night , and go like a fox ; and how [ye]3694-ye are to cross Till [I]72-sir daniel know not , neither by [the bridge]265-the bridge nor [ferry]3707-ferry . "[72-sir daniel]

" [I]148-throgmorton can swim , "[148-throgmorton] returned [Throgmorton]148-throgmorton . " [I]148-throgmorton will come soundly , fear not . "[148-throgmorton]

" Well , [friend]3100-friend , get [ye]3100-friend to the buttery , "[72-sir daniel] replied [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . " [Ye]3694-ye shall swim first of all in nut - brown ale . "[72-sir daniel] And with that [he]72-sir daniel turned back into [the hall]989-the hall .

" [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel hath a wise tongue , "[77-bennet] said [Hatch]77-bennet , aside , to [Dick]76-dick . " See , now , where [many a lesser man]3709-many a lesser man had glossed the matter over , [he]3709-many a lesser man speaketh it out plainly to [[his]3709-many a lesser man company]3710-his company . Here is [a danger]3711-a danger , a saith , and here difficulty ; and jesteth in the very saying . Nay , by [Saint Barbary]149-saint barbary , [he]3709-many a lesser man is [a born captain]3712-a born captain ! Not [a man]3107-a man but [he]3709-many a lesser man is some deal heartened up ! See how [they]3710-his company fall again to work . "[77-bennet]

This praise of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel put a thought in [the lad]309-the lad s head .

" [Bennet]77-bennet , "[309-the lad] [he]309-the lad said , " how came [[my]309-the lad father]3558-my father by [his]3558-my father end ? "[309-the lad]

" Ask [me]77-bennet not that , "[77-bennet] replied [Hatch]77-bennet . " [I]77-bennet had no hand nor knowledge in it ; furthermore , [I]77-bennet will even be silent , [Master Dick]76-dick . For look [you]76-dick , in [a man]3107-a man s own business there [he]3107-a man may speak ; but of hearsay matters and of common talk , not so . Ask [me]77-bennet [Sir Oliver ay]73-sir oliver , or [Carter]146-carter , if [ye]76-dick will ; not [me]77-bennet . "[77-bennet]

And [Hatch]77-bennet set off to make the rounds , leaving [Dick]76-dick in a muse .

" Wherefore would [he]3107-a man not tell [me]309-the lad ? "[309-the lad] thought [the lad]309-the lad . " And wherefore named [he]3107-a man [Carter]146-carter ? [Carter]146-carter nay , then [Carter]146-carter had a hand in it , perchance . "[309-the lad]

[He]77-bennet entered [the house]321-the house , and passing some little way along [a flagged and vaulted passage]1001-a flagged and vaulted passage , came to the door of [the cell where [the hurt man]1003-the hurt man lay groaning]1002-the cell where the hurt man lay groaning . At [his]77-bennet entrance [Carter]146-carter started eagerly .

" Have [ye]76-dick brought [the priest]338-the priest ? "[146-carter] [he]146-carter cried .

" Not yet awhile , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " [Y]76-dick ave a word to tell [me]76-dick first . How came [[my]76-dick father]3558-my father , [Harry Shelton]105-harry shelton , by [his]105-harry shelton death ? "[76-dick]

[The man]3175-the man s face altered instantly .

" [I]3175-the man know not , "[3175-the man] [he]3175-the man replied , doggedly .

" Nay , [ye]3175-the man know well , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " Seek not to put [me]76-dick by . "[76-dick]

" [I]146-carter tell [you]76-dick [I]146-carter know not , "[146-carter] repeated [Carter]146-carter .

" Then , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [ye]3175-the man shall die unshriven . Here am [I]76-dick , and here shall stay . There shall [no priest]3718-no priest come near [you]3175-the man , rest assured . For of what avail is penitence , an [ye]3175-the man have no mind to right those wrongs [ye]3175-the man had a hand in ? and without penitence , confession is but mockery . "[76-dick]

" [Ye]3175-the man say what [ye]3175-the man mean not , [Master Dick]76-dick , "[146-carter] said [Carter]146-carter , composedly . " [It]3719-it is ill threatening the dying , and becometh [you]3175-the man to speak truth little . And for as little as it commends [you]3175-the man , it shall serve [you]3175-the man less . Stay , an [ye]3175-the man please . [Ye]3175-the man will condemn [my]146-carter soul [ye]3175-the man shall learn nothing ! There is [my]146-carter last word to [you]3175-the man . "[146-carter] And [the wounded man]1005-the wounded man turned upon the other side .

Now , [Dick]76-dick , to say truth , had spoken hastily , and was ashamed of [his]76-dick threat . But [he]76-dick made one more effort .

" [Carter]146-carter , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " mistake [me]76-dick not . [I]76-dick know [ye]146-carter were but an instrument in the hands of [others]237-others ; [a churl]3721-a churl must obey [[his]3721-a churl lord]3722-his lord ; [I]76-dick would not bear heavily on [such an one]3723-such an one . But [I]76-dick begin to learn upon many sides that this great duty lieth on [my]76-dick youth and ignorance , to avenge [[my]76-dick father]3558-my father . [Prithee]115-prithee , then , good [Carter]146-carter , set aside the memory of [my]76-dick threatenings , and in pure goodwill and honest penitence give [me]76-dick a word of help . "[76-dick]

[The wounded man]1005-the wounded man lay silent ; nor , say what [Dick]76-dick pleased , could [he]76-dick extract another word from [him]1005-the wounded man .

" Well , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick will go call [the priest]338-the priest to [you]1005-the wounded man as [ye]1005-the wounded man desired ; for howsoever [ye]1005-the wounded man be in fault to [me]76-dick or [mine]76-dick , [I]76-dick would not be willingly in fault to any , least of all to one upon the last change . "[76-dick]

Again [the old soldier]307-the old soldier heard [him]76-dick without speech or motion ; even [his]76-dick groans [he]76-dick had suppressed ; and as [Dick]76-dick turned and left [the room]430-the room , [he]76-dick was filled with admiration for that rugged fortitude .

" And yet , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick thought , " of what use is courage without wit ? Had [his]72-sir daniel hands been clean , [he]72-sir daniel would have spoken ; [his]72-sir daniel silence did confess the secret louder than words . Nay , upon all sides , proof floweth on [me]76-dick . [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , [he]72-sir daniel or [[his]72-sir daniel men]417-his men , hath done this thing . "[76-dick]

[Dick]76-dick paused in [the stone passage]1009-the stone passage with a heavy heart . At that hour , in the ebb of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s fortune , when [he]72-sir daniel was beleaguered by the archers of the Black Arrow and proscribed by [the victorious Yorkists]1010-the victorious yorkists , was [Dick]76-dick , also , to turn upon [the man who had nourished and taught [him]72-sir daniel , who had severely punished , indeed , but yet unwearyingly protected [his]72-sir daniel youth]1011-the man who had nourished and taught him , who had severely punished , indeed , but yet unwearyingly protected his youth ? The necessity , if it should prove to be one , was cruel .

" Pray Heaven [he]72-sir daniel be innocent ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said .

And then steps sounded on the flagging , and [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver came gravely towards [the lad]309-the lad .

" One seeketh [you]73-sir oliver earnestly , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick .

" [I]338-the priest am upon the way , good [Richard]74-master shelton , "[338-the priest] said [the priest]338-the priest . " It is [this poor [Carter]146-carter]3727-this poor carter . [Alack]147-alack , [he]146-carter is beyond cure . "[338-the priest]

" And yet [his]146-carter soul is sicker than [his]146-carter body , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" Have [ye]73-sir oliver seen [him]146-carter ? "[73-sir oliver] asked [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , with a manifest start .

" [I]76-dick do but come from [him]146-carter , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick .

" What said [he]146-carter ? what said [he]146-carter ? "[338-the priest] snapped [the priest]338-the priest , with extraordinary eagerness .

" [He]146-carter but cried for [you]76-dick the more piteously , [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver . It were well done to go the faster , for [his]146-carter hurt is grievous , "[309-the lad] returned [the lad]309-the lad .

" [I]338-the priest am straight for [him]146-carter , "[338-the priest] was the reply . " Well , [we]3728-we have all [our]3728-we sins . [We]3728-we must all come to [our]3728-we latter day , good [Richard]74-master shelton . "[338-the priest]

" Ay , [sir]3184-sir ; and it were well if [we]3728-we all came fairly , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

[The priest]338-the priest dropped [his]338-the priest eyes , and with an inaudible benediction hurried on .

" [He]146-carter , too ! "[76-dick] thought [Dick]76-dick " [he]146-carter , that taught [me]76-dick in piety ! Nay , then , what a world is this , if all that care for [me]76-dick be blood - guilty of [[my]76-dick father]3558-my father s death ? Vengeance ! Alas ! what a sore fate is [mine]76-dick , if [I]76-dick must be avenged upon [[my]76-dick friends]3375-my friends ! "[76-dick]

The thought put [Matcham]128-matcham in [his]128-matcham head . [He]128-matcham smiled at the remembrance of [[his]128-matcham strange companion]1017-his strange companion , and then wondered where [he]1017-his strange companion was . Ever since [they]1018-they had come together to the doors of [the Moat House]260-the moat house [the younger lad]1020-the younger lad had disappeared , and [Dick]76-dick began to weary for a word with [him]1017-his strange companion .

About an hour after , mass being somewhat hastily run through by [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , [the company]1021-the company gathered in [the hall]989-the hall for dinner . [It]1023-it was [a long , low apartment , strewn with green rushes]1024-a long , low apartment , strewn with green rushes , and the walls hung with arras in a design of [savage men]1025-savage men and questing bloodhounds ; here and there hung spears and bows and bucklers ; a fire blazed in the big chimney ; there were arras - covered benches round the wall , and in the midst the table , fairly spread , awaited the arrival of [the diners]1026-the diners . Neither [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel nor [[his]72-sir daniel lady]1027-his lady made [their]1018-they appearance . [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver [himself]73-sir oliver was absent , and here again there was no word of [Matcham]128-matcham . [Dick]76-dick began to grow alarmed , to recall [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion s melancholy forebodings , and to wonder to [himself]76-dick if any foul play had befallen [him]76-dick in [that house]3672-that house .

After dinner [he]76-dick found [Goody Hatch]150-goody hatch , who was hurrying to [[my]0-i Lady]1030-my lady [Brackley]72-sir daniel .

" [Goody]150-goody hatch , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " where is [Master Matcham]120-matcham , [I]76-dick prithee ? [I]76-dick saw [ye]1031-the old woman go in with [him]120-matcham when [we]3732-we arrived . "[76-dick]

[The old woman]1031-the old woman laughed aloud .

" Ah , [Master Dick]76-dick , "[1031-the old woman] [she]1031-the old woman said , " [y]76-dick have a famous bright eye in [your]76-dick head , to be sure ! "[1031-the old woman] and laughed again .

" Nay , but where is [he]120-matcham , indeed ? "[76-dick] persisted [Dick]76-dick .

" [Ye]76-dick will never see [him]120-matcham more , "[1031-the old woman] [she]1031-the old woman returned " never . It is sure . "[1031-the old woman]

" An [I]309-the lad do not , "[309-the lad] returned [the lad]309-the lad , " [I]309-the lad will know the reason why . [He]120-matcham came not hither of [his]120-matcham full free will ; such as [I]309-the lad am , [I]309-the lad am [[his]120-matcham best protector]3733-his best protector , and [I]309-the lad will see [him]120-matcham justly used . There be too many mysteries ; [I]309-the lad do begin to weary of the game ! "[309-the lad]

But as [Dick]76-dick was speaking , a heavy hand fell on [his]76-dick shoulder . It was [Bennet Hatch]77-bennet that had come unperceived behind [him]76-dick . With a jerk of [his]76-dick thumb , [the retainer]329-the retainer dismissed [[his]76-dick wife]1034-his wife .

" [Friend Dick]151-friend dick , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , as soon as [they]1035-they were alone , " are [ye]151-friend dick a moon - struck natural ? An [ye]151-friend dick leave not certain things in peace , [ye]151-friend dick were better in [the salt sea]3734-the salt sea than here in [Tunstall Moat House]4-tunstall moat house . [Y]151-friend dick have questioned [me]76-dick ; [y]151-friend dick have baited [Carter]146-carter ; [y]151-friend dick have frighted [the Jack - priest]3232-the jack - priest with hints . Bear [ye]151-friend dick more wisely , [fool]3472-fool ; and even now , when [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel calleth [you]151-friend dick , show [me]76-dick a smooth face for the love of wisdom . [Y]151-friend dick are to be sharply questioned . Look to [your]151-friend dick answers . "[76-dick]

" [Hatch]77-bennet , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " in all this [I]76-dick smell a guilty conscience . "[76-dick]

" An [ye]151-friend dick go not the wiser , [ye]151-friend dick will soon smell blood , "[77-bennet] replied [Bennet]77-bennet . " [I]77-bennet do but warn [you]151-friend dick . And here cometh one to call [you]151-friend dick . "[77-bennet]

And indeed , at that very moment , [a messenger]482-a messenger came across [the court]950-the court to summon [Dick]76-dick into the presence of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel .

CHAPTER II THE TWO OATHS

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel was in [the hall]989-the hall ; there [he]72-sir daniel paced angrily before the fire , awaiting [Dick]76-dick s arrival . None was by except [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , and [he]73-sir oliver sat discreetly backward , thumbing and muttering over [his]73-sir oliver breviary .

" [Y]74-master shelton have sent for [me]74-master shelton , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ? "[74-master shelton] said [young Shelton]74-master shelton .

" [I]438-the knight have sent for [you]151-friend dick , indeed , "[438-the knight] replied [the knight]438-the knight . " For what cometh to [mine]438-the knight ears ? Have [I]438-the knight been to [you]151-friend dick so heavy [a guardian]3737-a guardian that [ye]151-friend dick make haste to credit ill of [me]438-the knight ? Or sith that [ye]151-friend dick see [me]438-the knight , for the nonce , some worsted , do [ye]151-friend dick think to quit [my]438-the knight party ? By the mass , [[your]151-friend dick father]3306-your father was not so ! Those [he]3306-your father was near , those [he]3306-your father stood by , come wind or weather . But [you]151-friend dick , [Dick]76-dick , [y]151-friend dick are [a fair - day friend]3739-a fair - day friend , it seemeth , and now seek to clear [yourself]151-friend dick of [your]151-friend dick allegiance . "[438-the knight]

" An t please [you]151-friend dick , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , not so , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , firmly . " [I]76-dick am grateful and faithful , where gratitude and faith are due . And before more is said , [I]76-dick thank [you]151-friend dick , and [I]76-dick thank [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver ; [y]151-friend dick have great claims upon [me]76-dick both none can have more ; [I]76-dick were a hound if [I]76-dick forgot [them]3740-them . "[76-dick]

" It is well , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ; and then , rising into anger : " Gratitude and faith are words , [Dick Shelton]76-dick , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel continued ; " but [I]72-sir daniel look to deeds . In this hour of [my]72-sir daniel peril , when [my]72-sir daniel name is attainted , when [[my]72-sir daniel lands]3741-my lands are forfeit , when [this wood]3507-this wood is full of men that hunger and thirst for [my]72-sir daniel destruction , what doth gratitude ? what doth faith ? [I]72-sir daniel have but [a little company]3743-a little company remaining ; is it grateful or [faithful]3744-faithful to poison [me]72-sir daniel [their]3740-them hearts with [your]76-dick insidious whisperings ? Save [me]72-sir daniel from such gratitude ! But , come , now , what is it [ye]76-dick wish ? Speak ; [we]3745-we are here to answer . If [ye]76-dick have aught against [me]72-sir daniel , stand forth and say it . "[72-sir daniel]

" [Sir]3184-sir , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , " [[my]76-dick father]3558-my father fell when [I]76-dick was yet [a child]3529-a child . It hath come to [mine]76-dick ears that [he]3558-my father was foully done by . It hath come to [mine]76-dick ears for [I]76-dick will not dissemble that [ye]76-dick had a hand in [his]3558-my father undoing . And in all verity , [I]76-dick shall not be at peace in [mine]76-dick own mind , nor very clear to help [you]72-sir daniel , till [I]76-dick have certain resolution of these doubts . "[76-dick]

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel sat down in a deep settle . [He]72-sir daniel took [his]72-sir daniel chin in [his]72-sir daniel hand and looked at [Dick]76-dick fixedly .

" And [ye]76-dick think [I]72-sir daniel would be guardian to [[the man]3175-the man s son]3550-the man s son that [I]72-sir daniel had murdered ? "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel asked .

" Nay , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " pardon [me]76-dick if [I]76-dick answer churlishly ; but indeed [ye]72-sir daniel know right well a wardship is most profitable . All these years have [ye]72-sir daniel not enjoyed [my]76-dick revenues , and led [[my]76-dick men]3751-my men ? Have [ye]72-sir daniel not still [my]76-dick marriage ? [I]76-dick wot not what it may be worth it is worth something . Pardon [me]76-dick again ; but if [ye]72-sir daniel were base enough to slay [a man under trust]3752-a man under trust , here were , perhaps , reasons enough to move [you]72-sir daniel to the lesser baseness . "[76-dick]

" When [I]72-sir daniel was lad of [your]72-sir daniel years , "[72-sir daniel] returned [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , sternly , " [my]76-dick mind had not so turned upon suspicions . And [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver here , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added , " why should [he]73-sir oliver , [a priest]3753-a priest , be guilty of this act ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " but where [the master]275-the master biddeth there will the dog go . It is well known [this priest]3755-this priest is but [your]72-sir daniel instrument . [I]76-dick speak very freely ; the time is not for courtesies . Even as [I]76-dick speak , so would [I]76-dick be answered . And answer get [I]76-dick none ! [Ye]72-sir daniel but put more questions . [I]76-dick rede [ye]72-sir daniel be ware , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ; for in this way [ye]72-sir daniel will but nourish and not satisfy [my]76-dick doubts . "[76-dick]

" [I]438-the knight will answer [you]72-sir daniel fairly , [Master Richard]74-master shelton , "[438-the knight] said [the knight]438-the knight . " Were [I]438-the knight to pretend [ye]72-sir daniel have not stirred [my]438-the knight wrath , [I]438-the knight were [no honest man]3756-no honest man . But [I]438-the knight will be just even in anger . Come to [me]438-the knight with these words when [y]72-sir daniel are grown and come to [[man]3147-man s estate]3758-man s estate , and [I]438-the knight am no longer [[your]72-sir daniel guardian]3641-your guardian , and so helpless to resent them . Come to [me]438-the knight then , and [I]438-the knight will answer [you]72-sir daniel as [ye]72-sir daniel merit , with a buffet in the mouth . Till then [ye]72-sir daniel have two courses : either swallow [me]438-the knight down these insults , keep a silent tongue , and fight in the meanwhile for [the man that fed and fought for [your]72-sir daniel infancy]3760-the man that fed and fought for your infancy ; or else the door standeth open , [the woods]783-the woods are full of mine enemies go . "[438-the knight]

[The spirit with which these words were uttered , the looks with which they were accompanied]1041-the spirit with which these words were uttered , the looks with which they were accompanied , staggered [Dick]76-dick ; and yet [he]76-dick could not but observe that [he]76-dick had got no answer .

" [I]76-dick desire nothing more earnestly , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , than to believe [you]72-sir daniel , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick replied . " Assure [me]76-dick [ye]72-sir daniel are free from this . "[76-dick]

" Will [ye]72-sir daniel take [my]438-the knight word of honour , [Dick]76-dick ? "[438-the knight] inquired [the knight]438-the knight .

" That would [I]309-the lad , "[309-the lad] answered [the lad]309-the lad .

" [I]72-sir daniel give it [you]72-sir daniel , "[72-sir daniel] returned [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . " Upon [my]72-sir daniel word of honour , upon the eternal welfare of [my]72-sir daniel spirit , and as [I]72-sir daniel shall answer for [my]72-sir daniel deeds hereafter , [I]72-sir daniel had no hand nor portion in [[your]72-sir daniel father]3306-your father s death . "[72-sir daniel]

[He]72-sir daniel extended [his]72-sir daniel hand , and [Dick]76-dick took it eagerly . [Neither of [them]1045-them]1044-neither of them observed [the priest]338-the priest , who , at the pronunciation of that solemn and false oath , had half arisen from [his]338-the priest seat in an agony of horror and remorse .

" Ah , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , " [ye]72-sir daniel must find it in [your]72-sir daniel great - heartedness to pardon [me]76-dick ! [I]76-dick was a churl , indeed , to doubt of [you]72-sir daniel . But [ye]72-sir daniel have [my]76-dick hand upon it ; [I]76-dick will doubt no more . "[76-dick]

" Nay , [Dick]76-dick , "[72-sir daniel] replied [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " [y]72-sir daniel are forgiven . [Ye]72-sir daniel know not [the world]235-the world and its calumnious nature . "[72-sir daniel]

" [I]76-dick was the more to blame , "[76-dick] added [Dick]76-dick , " in that [the rogues]3764-the rogues pointed , not directly at [yourself]72-sir daniel , but at [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver . "[76-dick]

As [he]72-sir daniel spoke , [he]72-sir daniel turned towards [the priest]338-the priest , and paused in the middle of the last word . [This tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man had fallen , [you]1049-you might say , to pieces ; [his]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man colour was gone , [his]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man limbs were relaxed , [his]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man lips stammered prayers ; and now , when [Dick]76-dick s eyes were fixed upon [him]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man suddenly , [he]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man cried out aloud , like some wild animal , and buried [his]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man face in [his]1048-this tall , ruddy , corpulent , high - stepping man hands .

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel was by [him]76-dick in two strides , and shook [him]76-dick fiercely by the shoulder . At the same moment [Dick]76-dick s suspicions reawakened .

" Nay , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel said , " [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver may swear also . Twas [him]73-sir oliver [they]3765-they accused . "[72-sir daniel]

" [He]73-sir oliver shall swear , "[438-the knight] said [the knight]438-the knight .

[Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver speechlessly waved [his]73-sir oliver arms .

" Ay , by the mass ! but [ye]72-sir daniel shall swear , "[72-sir daniel] cried [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , beside [himself]72-sir daniel with fury . " Here , upon this book , [ye]72-sir daniel shall swear , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel continued , picking up the breviary , which had fallen to the ground . " What ! [Ye]72-sir daniel make [me]72-sir daniel doubt [you]72-sir daniel ! Swear , [I]72-sir daniel say ; swear ! "[72-sir daniel]

But [the priest]338-the priest was still incapable of speech . [His]338-the priest terror of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , [his]338-the priest terror of perjury , risen to about an equal height , strangled [him]338-the priest .

And just then , through the high , stained - glass window of [the hall]989-the hall , a black arrow crashed , and struck , and stuck quivering , in the midst of the long table .

[Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , with a loud scream , fell fainting on the rushes ; while [the knight]438-the knight , followed by [Dick]76-dick , dashed into [the court]950-the court and up the nearest corkscrew stair to [the battlements]1055-the battlements . [The sentries]1056-the sentries were all on the alert . The sun shone quietly on green lawns dotted with trees , and on [the wooded hills of [the forest]246-the forest]1057-the wooded hills of the forest which enclosed the view . There was no sign of [a besieger]1059-a besieger .

" Whence came that shot ? "[438-the knight] asked [the knight]438-the knight .

" From [yonder clump]3766-yonder clump , [Sir Daniel]3440-sir daniel , "[1061-a sentinel] returned [a sentinel]1061-a sentinel .

[The knight]438-the knight stood a little , musing . Then [he]438-the knight turned to [Dick]76-dick . " [Dick]76-dick , "[438-the knight] [he]438-the knight said , " keep [me]438-the knight an eye upon [these men]3540-these men ; [I]438-the knight leave [you]76-dick in charge here . As for [the priest]338-the priest , [he]338-the priest shall clear [himself]338-the priest , or [I]438-the knight will know the reason why . [I]438-the knight do almost begin to share in [your]76-dick suspicions . [He]338-the priest shall swear , trust [me]438-the knight , or [we]3770-we shall prove [him]338-the priest guilty . "[438-the knight]

[Dick]76-dick answered somewhat coldly , and [the knight]438-the knight , giving [him]76-dick a piercing glance , hurriedly returned to [the hall]989-the hall . [His]438-the knight first glance was for the arrow . It was the first of these missiles [he]438-the knight had seen , and as [he]438-the knight turned it to and fro , the dark hue of it touched [him]438-the knight with some fear . Again there was some writing : one word " Earthed . "[73-sir oliver]

" Ay , "[438-the knight] [he]438-the knight broke out , " [they]3771-they know [I]438-the knight am [home]699-home , then . [Earthed]152-earthed ! Ay , but there is not a dog among [them]3771-they fit to dig [me]438-the knight out . "[438-the knight]

[Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver had come to [himself]73-sir oliver , and now scrambled to [his]73-sir oliver feet .

" Alack , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ! "[73-sir oliver] [he]73-sir oliver moaned , " [y]72-sir daniel ave sworn a dread oath ; [y]72-sir daniel are doomed to the end of time . "[73-sir oliver]

" Ay , "[438-the knight] returned [the knight]438-the knight , " [I]438-the knight have sworn an oath , indeed , [thou]3773-thou chucklehead ; but [thyself]3773-thou shalt swear a greater . It shall be on the blessed cross of Holywood . Look to it ; get the words ready . It shall be sworn to - night . "[438-the knight]

" Now , may [Heaven]162-heaven lighten [you]72-sir daniel ! "[338-the priest] replied [the priest]338-the priest ; " may [Heaven]162-heaven incline [your]72-sir daniel heart from this iniquity ! "[338-the priest]

" Look [you]72-sir daniel , [[my]72-sir daniel good father]3774-my good father , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " if [y]72-sir daniel are for piety , [I]72-sir daniel say no more ; [ye]72-sir daniel begin late , that is all . But if [y]72-sir daniel are in any sense bent upon wisdom , hear [me]72-sir daniel . [This lad]3775-this lad beginneth to irk [me]72-sir daniel like a wasp . [I]72-sir daniel have a need for [him]3775-this lad , for [I]72-sir daniel would sell [his]3775-this lad marriage . But [I]72-sir daniel tell [you]72-sir daniel , in all plainness , if that [he]3775-this lad continue to weary [me]72-sir daniel , [he]3775-this lad shall go join [[his]3775-this lad father]3776-his father . [I]72-sir daniel give orders now to change [him]3775-this lad to [the chamber above [the chapel]3778-the chapel]3777-the chamber above the chapel . If that [ye]72-sir daniel can swear [your]72-sir daniel innocency with a good , solid oath and an assured countenance , it is well ; [the lad]309-the lad will be at peace a little , and [I]72-sir daniel will spare [him]3775-this lad . If that [ye]72-sir daniel stammer or blench , or anyways boggle at the swearing , [he]3775-this lad will not believe [you]72-sir daniel ; and by the mass , [he]3775-this lad shall die . There is for [your]72-sir daniel thinking on . "[72-sir daniel]

" [The chamber above [the chapel]3778-the chapel]3777-the chamber above the chapel ! "[338-the priest] gasped [the priest]338-the priest .

" That same , "[438-the knight] replied [the knight]438-the knight . " So if [ye]72-sir daniel desire to save [him]3775-this lad , save [him]3775-this lad ; and if [ye]72-sir daniel desire not , prithee , go to , and let [me]438-the knight be at peace ! For an [I]438-the knight had been [a hasty man]3782-a hasty man , [I]438-the knight would already have put [my]438-the knight sword through [you]72-sir daniel , for [your]72-sir daniel intolerable cowardice and folly . Have [ye]72-sir daniel chosen ? Say ! "[438-the knight]

" [I]338-the priest have chosen , "[338-the priest] said [the priest]338-the priest . " Heaven pardon [me]338-the priest , [I]338-the priest will do evil for good . [I]338-the priest will swear for [the lad]309-the lad s sake . "[338-the priest]

" So is it best ! "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . " Send for [him]309-the lad , then , speedily . [Ye]72-sir daniel shall see [him]309-the lad alone . Yet [I]72-sir daniel shall have an eye on [you]72-sir daniel . [I]72-sir daniel shall be here in [the panel room]3784-the panel room . "[72-sir daniel]

[The knight]438-the knight raised the arras and let it fall again behind [him]438-the knight . There was the sound of a spring opening ; then followed the creaking of [trod stairs]1071-trod stairs .

[Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , left alone , cast a timorous glance upward at the arras - covered wall , and crossed [himself]73-sir oliver with every appearance of terror and contrition .

" Nay , if [he]309-the lad is in [the chapel room]3785-the chapel room , "[338-the priest] [the priest]338-the priest murmured , " were it at [my]338-the priest soul s cost , [I]338-the priest must save [him]309-the lad . "[338-the priest]
