Three minutes later , [Dick]76-dick , who had been summoned by [another messenger]1073-another messenger , found [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver standing by the hall table , resolute and pale .

" [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " [ye]74-master shelton have required an oath from [me]76-dick . [I]76-dick might complain , [I]76-dick might deny [you]74-master shelton ; but [my]76-dick heart is moved toward [you]74-master shelton for the past , and [I]76-dick will even content [you]74-master shelton as [ye]74-master shelton choose . By the true cross of [Holywood]14-holywood , [I]76-dick did not slay [[your]74-master shelton father]3306-your father . "[76-dick]

" [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " when first [we]3787-we read [John Amend]95-john amend - All s paper , [I]76-dick was convinced of so much . But suffer [me]76-dick to put two questions . [Ye]74-master shelton did not slay [him]3306-your father ; granted . But had [ye]74-master shelton no hand in it ? "[76-dick]

" None , "[73-sir oliver] said [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver . And at the same time [he]73-sir oliver began to contort [his]73-sir oliver face , and signal with [his]73-sir oliver mouth and eyebrows , like [one who desired to convey a warning , yet dared not utter a sound]1074-one who desired to convey a warning , yet dared not utter a sound .

[Dick]76-dick regarded [him]73-sir oliver in wonder ; then [he]76-dick turned and looked all about [him]76-dick at [the empty hall]1075-the empty hall .

" What make [ye]74-master shelton ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick inquired .

" Why , naught , "[338-the priest] returned [the priest]338-the priest , hastily smoothing [his]338-the priest countenance . " [I]338-the priest make naught ; [I]338-the priest do but suffer ; [I]338-the priest am sick . [I]338-the priest [I]338-the priest prithee , [Dick]76-dick , [I]338-the priest must begone . On the true cross of [Holywood]14-holywood , [I]338-the priest am [clean innocent alike of violence or treachery]3788-clean innocent alike of violence or treachery . Content [ye]76-dick , [good lad]3789-good lad . Farewell ! "[338-the priest]

And [he]338-the priest made [his]338-the priest escape from [the apartment]1077-the apartment with unusual alacrity .

[Dick]76-dick remained rooted to the spot , [his]76-dick eyes wandering about [the room]430-the room , [his]76-dick face a changing picture of various emotions , wonder , doubt , suspicion , and amusement . Gradually , as [his]76-dick mind grew clearer , suspicion took the upper hand , and was succeeded by certainty of the worst . [He]76-dick raised [his]76-dick head , and , as [he]76-dick did so , violently started . High upon the wall there was the figure of [a savage hunter woven in the tapestry]1079-a savage hunter woven in the tapestry . With one hand [he]76-dick held a horn to [his]76-dick mouth ; in the other [he]76-dick brandished a stout spear . [His]76-dick face was dark , for [he]76-dick was meant to represent [an African]1080-an african .

Now , here was what had startled [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton . The sun had moved away from [the hall]989-the hall windows , and at the same time the fire had blazed up high on the wide hearth , and shed a changeful glow upon the roof and hangings . In this light the figure of [the black hunter]1082-the black hunter had winked at [him]76-dick with a white eyelid .

[He]76-dick continued staring at the eye . The light shone upon it like a gem ; it was liquid , it was alive . Again the white eyelid closed upon it for a fraction of a second , and the next moment it was gone .

There could be no mistake . The live eye that had been watching [him]76-dick through a hole in the tapestry was gone . The firelight no longer shone on a reflecting surface .

And instantly [Dick]76-dick awoke to the terrors of [his]76-dick position . Hatch s warning , the mute signals of [the priest]338-the priest , this eye that had observed [him]76-dick from the wall , ran together in [his]76-dick mind . [He]76-dick saw [he]76-dick had been put upon [his]76-dick trial , that [he]76-dick had once more betrayed [his]76-dick suspicions , and that , short of some miracle , [he]76-dick was lost .

" If [I]76-dick can not get [me]76-dick forth out of [this house]3790-this house , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick thought , " [I]76-dick am [a dead man]3791-a dead man ! And [this poor Matcham]3792-this poor matcham , too to what [a cockatrice s nest]3793-a cockatrice s nest have [I]76-dick not led [him]3792-this poor matcham ! "[76-dick]

[He]76-dick was still so thinking , when there came one in haste , to bid [him]76-dick help in changing [his]76-dick arms , [his]76-dick clothing , and [his]76-dick two or three books , to [a new chamber]1084-a new chamber .

" [A new chamber]1084-a new chamber ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick repeated . " Wherefore so ? [What chamber]3795-what chamber ? "[76-dick]

" Tis one above [the chapel]3778-the chapel , "[484-the messenger] answered [the messenger]484-the messenger .

" [It]3795-what chamber hath stood long empty , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , musing . " What manner of room is [it]3795-what chamber ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , [a brave room]3797-a brave room , "[3175-the man] returned [the man]3175-the man . " But yet "[3175-the man] lowering [his]3175-the man voice " [they]3798-they call it haunted . "[3175-the man]

" Haunted ? "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick , with a chill . " [I]76-dick have not heard of it . Nay , then , and by whom ? "[76-dick]

[The messenger]484-the messenger looked about [him]76-dick ; and then , in a low whisper , " By [the sacrist of [St. John s]33-st. john s]3799-the sacrist of st. john s , "[484-the messenger] [he]484-the messenger said . " [They]3798-they had [him]76-dick [there]718-there to sleep one night , and in the morning whew ! [he]76-dick was gone . [The devil]3801-the devil had taken [him]76-dick , [they]3798-they said ; the more betoken , [he]76-dick had drunk late the night before . "[484-the messenger]

[Dick]76-dick followed [the man]3175-the man with black forebodings .

CHAPTER III [THE ROOM OVER [THE CHAPEL]3778-the chapel]1089-the room over the chapel

From the battlements nothing further was observed . The sun journeyed westward , and at last went down ; but , to the eyes of [all these eager sentinels]1091-all these eager sentinels , no living thing appeared in [the neighbourhood of [Tunstall House]30-tunstall house]1092-the neighbourhood of tunstall house .

When the night was at length fairly come , [Throgmorton]148-throgmorton was led to [a room overlooking an angle of [the moat]940-the moat]1093-a room overlooking an angle of the moat . Thence [he]148-throgmorton was lowered with every precaution ; the ripple of [his]148-throgmorton swimming was audible for a brief period ; then [a black figure]1095-a black figure was observed to land by the branches of a willow and crawl away among the grass . For some half hour [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel and [Hatch]77-bennet stood eagerly giving ear ; but all remained quiet . [The messenger]484-the messenger had got away in safety .

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s brow grew clearer . [He]72-sir daniel turned to [Hatch]77-bennet .

" [Bennet]77-bennet , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel said , " this [John Amend]95-john amend - All is no more than [a man]3107-a man , [ye]77-bennet see . [He]95-john amend sleepeth . [We]3803-we will make a good end of [him]95-john amend , go to ! "[72-sir daniel]

All the afternoon and evening , [Dick]76-dick had been ordered hither and thither , one command following another , till [he]76-dick was bewildered with the number and the hurry of commissions . All that time [he]76-dick had seen no more of [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , and nothing of [Matcham]120-matcham ; and yet both [the priest]338-the priest and [the young lad]1098-the young lad ran continually in [his]76-dick mind . It was now [his]76-dick chief purpose to escape from [Tunstall Moat House]4-tunstall moat house as speedily as might be ; and yet , before [he]76-dick went , [he]76-dick desired a word with both of these .

At length , with a lamp in one hand , [he]76-dick mounted to [[his]76-dick new apartment]1099-his new apartment . [It]1099-his new apartment was large , low , and somewhat dark . The window looked upon [the moat]940-the moat , and although [it]1099-his new apartment was so high up , it was heavily barred . The bed was luxurious , with one pillow of down and one of lavender , and a red coverlet worked in a pattern of roses . All about the walls were cupboards , locked and padlocked , and concealed from view by hangings of dark - coloured arras . [Dick]76-dick made the round , lifting the arras , sounding the panels , seeking vainly to open the cupboards . [He]76-dick assured [himself]76-dick that the door was strong and the bolt solid ; then [he]76-dick set down [his]76-dick lamp upon a bracket , and once more looked all around .

For what reason had [he]76-dick been given [this chamber]1101-this chamber ? [It]1101-this chamber was larger and finer than [his]76-dick own . Could it conceal a snare ? Was there a secret entrance ? Was it , indeed , haunted ? [His]76-dick blood ran a little chilly in [his]76-dick veins .

Immediately over [him]76-dick the heavy foot of [a sentry]1102-a sentry trod the leads . Below [him]76-dick , [he]76-dick knew , was the arched roof of [the chapel]3778-the chapel ; and next to [the chapel]3778-the chapel was [the hall]989-the hall . Certainly there was a secret passage in [the hall]989-the hall ; the eye that had watched [him]76-dick from the arras gave [him]76-dick proof of that . Was it not more than probable that [the passage]1107-the passage extended to [the chapel]3778-the chapel , and , if so , that [it]1107-the passage had an opening in [[his]76-dick room]1109-his room ?

To sleep in such a place , [he]76-dick felt , would be foolhardy . [He]76-dick made [his]76-dick weapons ready , and took [his]76-dick position in a corner of [the room behind the door]1110-the room behind the door . If ill was intended , [he]76-dick would sell [his]76-dick life dear .

The sound of many feet , the challenge , and the password , sounded overhead along the battlements ; the watch was being changed .

And just then there came a scratching at the door of [the chamber]1111-the chamber ; it grew a little louder ; then a whisper :

" [Dick]76-dick , [Dick]76-dick , it is [I]311-the other ! "[311-the other]

[Dick]76-dick ran to the door , drew the bolt , and admitted [Matcham]120-matcham . [He]120-matcham was very pale , and carried a lamp in one hand and a drawn dagger in the other .

" Shut [me]120-matcham the door , "[120-matcham] [he]120-matcham whispered . " [Swift]153-swift , [Dick]76-dick ! [This house]3790-this house is full of [spies]3805-spies ; [I]120-matcham hear [their]3805-spies feet follow [me]120-matcham in [the corridors]3806-the corridors ; [I]120-matcham hear [them]3805-spies breathe behind the arras . "[120-matcham]

" Well , content [you]120-matcham , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " [it]3790-this house is closed . [We]3807-we are safe for this while , if there be safety anywhere within these walls . But [my]76-dick heart is glad to see [you]120-matcham . By the mass , [lad]3604-lad , [I]76-dick thought [ye]120-matcham were sped ! Where hid [ye]120-matcham ? "[76-dick]

" It matters not , "[120-matcham] returned [Matcham]120-matcham . " Since [we]3807-we be met , it matters not . But , [Dick]76-dick , are [your]76-dick eyes open ? Have [they]3805-spies told [you]76-dick of to - morrow s doings ? "[120-matcham]

" Not [they]3805-spies , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick . " What make [they]3805-spies to - morrow ? "[76-dick]

" To - morrow , or to - night , [I]311-the other know not , "[311-the other] said [the other]311-the other , " but one time or other , [Dick]76-dick , [they]3805-spies do intend upon [your]76-dick life . [I]311-the other had the proof of it ; [I]311-the other have heard [them]3805-spies whisper ; nay , [they]3805-spies as good as told [me]311-the other . "[311-the other]

" Ay , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " is it so ? [I]76-dick had thought as much . "[76-dick]

And [he]76-dick told [him]76-dick the day s occurrences at length .

When it was done , [Matcham]120-matcham arose and began , in turn , to examine [the apartment]1077-the apartment .

" No , "[120-matcham] [he]120-matcham said , " there is no entrance visible . Yet tis a pure certainty there is one . [Dick]76-dick , [I]120-matcham will stay by [you]76-dick . An [y]76-dick are to die , [I]120-matcham will die with [you]76-dick . And [I]120-matcham can help look ! [I]120-matcham have stolen a dagger [I]120-matcham will do [my]120-matcham best ! And meanwhile , an [ye]76-dick know of any issue , any sally - port [we]3809-we could get opened , or any window that [we]3809-we might descend by , [I]120-matcham will most joyfully face any jeopardy to flee with [you]76-dick . "[120-matcham]

" [Jack]128-matcham , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " by the mass , [Jack]128-matcham , [y]128-matcham are [the best soul]3810-the best soul , and the truest , and the bravest in all [England]22-england ! Give [me]76-dick [your]128-matcham hand , [Jack]128-matcham . "[76-dick]

And [he]76-dick grasped the other s hand in silence .

" [I]76-dick will tell [you]76-dick , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick resumed . " There is a window , out of which [the messenger]484-the messenger descended ; the rope should still be in [the chamber]1111-the chamber . Tis a hope . "[76-dick]

" [Hist]3813-hist ! "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham .

[Both]3369-both gave ear . There was a sound below the floor ; then it paused , and then began again .

" [Some one]3814-some one walketh in [the room below]3815-the room below , "[128-matcham] whispered [Matcham]128-matcham .

" Nay , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " there is [no room below]3816-no room below ; [we]3817-we are above [the chapel]3778-the chapel . It is [[my]128-matcham murderer]3819-my murderer in [the secret passage]3820-the secret passage . Well , let [him]3819-my murderer come ; it shall go hard with [him]3819-my murderer ; "[128-matcham] and [he]128-matcham ground [his]128-matcham teeth .

" Blow [me]311-the other the lights out , "[311-the other] said [the other]311-the other . " Perchance [he]3819-my murderer will betray [himself]3819-my murderer . "[311-the other]

[They]3369-both blew out both the lamps and lay still as death . The footfalls underneath were very soft , but they were clearly audible . Several times [they]3369-both came and went ; and then there was a loud jar of a key turning in a lock , followed by a considerable silence .

Presently the steps began again , and then , all of a sudden , a chink of light appeared in the planking of [the room]430-the room in a far corner . It widened ; a trap - door was being opened , letting in a gush of light . [They]3369-both could see the strong hand pushing it up ; and [Dick]76-dick raised [his]76-dick cross - bow , waiting for the head to follow .

But now there came an interruption . From [a distant corner of [the Moat House]260-the moat house]1117-a distant corner of the moat house shouts began to be heard , and first one voice , and then several , crying aloud upon a name . This noise had plainly disconcerted [the murderer]3551-the murderer , for the trap - door was silently lowered to its place , and the steps hurriedly returned , passed once more close below [the lads]649-the lads , and died away in the distance .

Here was a moment s respite . [Dick]76-dick breathed deep , and then , and not till then , [he]76-dick gave ear to the disturbance which had interrupted the attack , and which was now rather increasing than diminishing . All about [the Moat House]260-the moat house feet were running , doors were opening and slamming , and still the voice of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel towered above all this bustle , shouting for " [Joanna]117-joanna . "[72-sir daniel]

" [Joanna]117-joanna ! "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick . " Why , who [the murrain]3821-the murrain should this be ? Here is [no Joanna]3822-no joanna , nor ever hath been . What meaneth it ? "[76-dick]

[Matcham]128-matcham was silent . [He]128-matcham seemed to have drawn further away . But only a little faint starlight entered by the window , and at the far end of [the apartment]1077-the apartment , where [the pair]805-the pair were , the darkness was complete .

" [Jack]128-matcham , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick wot not where [ye]128-matcham were all day . Saw [ye]128-matcham this [Joanna]117-joanna ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[128-matcham] returned [Matcham]128-matcham , " [I]128-matcham saw [her]117-joanna not . "[128-matcham]

" Nor heard tell of [her]117-joanna ? "[128-matcham] [he]128-matcham pursued .

[The steps]1124-the steps drew nearer . [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel was still roaring the name of [Joanna]117-joanna from [the courtyard]1125-the courtyard .

" Did [ye]128-matcham hear of [her]117-joanna ? "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick .

" [I]128-matcham heard of [her]117-joanna , "[128-matcham] said [Matcham]128-matcham .

" How [your]128-matcham voice twitters ! What aileth [you]128-matcham ? "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Tis a most excellent good fortune , [this Joanna]117-joanna ; it will take [their]3823-they minds from [us]3824-us . "[76-dick]

" [Dick]76-dick , "[128-matcham] cried [Matcham]128-matcham , " [I]128-matcham am lost ; [we]3824-us are both lost . Let [us]3824-us flee if there be yet time . [They]3823-they will not rest till [they]3823-they have found [me]128-matcham . Or , see ! let [me]128-matcham go forth ; when [they]3823-they have found [me]128-matcham , [ye]1126-y may flee . Let [me]128-matcham forth , [Dick good Dick]76-dick , let [me]128-matcham away ! "[128-matcham]

[She]1126-y was groping for the bolt , when [Dick]76-dick at last comprehended .

" By the mass ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried , " [y]1126-y are no [Jack]128-matcham ; [y]1126-y are [Joanna Sedley]117-joanna ; [y]1126-y are [the maid that would not marry [me]76-dick]3825-the maid that would not marry me ! "[76-dick]

[The girl]1127-the girl paused , and stood silent and motionless . [Dick]76-dick , too , was silent for a little ; then [he]76-dick spoke again .

" [Joanna]117-joanna , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " [y]1126-y ave saved [my]76-dick life , and [I]76-dick have saved [yours]117-joanna ; and [we]3826-we have seen blood flow , and been [friends]3295-friends and [enemies]3828-enemies ay , and [I]76-dick took [my]76-dick belt to thrash [you]117-joanna ; and all that time [I]76-dick thought [ye]117-joanna were [a boy]3465-a boy . But now death has [me]76-dick , and [my]76-dick time s out , and before [I]76-dick die [I]76-dick must say this : [Y]1126-y are [the best maid]3830-the best maid and [the bravest under heaven]3831-the bravest under heaven , and , if only [I]76-dick could live , [I]76-dick would marry [you]117-joanna blithely ; and , live or die , [I]76-dick love [you]117-joanna . "[76-dick]

[She]1128-she answered nothing .

" Come , "[1129-he] [he]1129-he said , " speak up , [Jack]128-matcham . Come , be [a good maid]3832-a good maid , and say [ye]128-matcham love [me]1129-he ! "[1129-he]

" Why , [Dick]76-dick , "[1128-she] [she]1128-she cried , " would [I]1128-she be here ? "[1128-she]

" Well , see [ye]128-matcham here , "[76-dick] continued [Dick]76-dick , " an [we]3833-we but escape whole [we]3833-we ll marry ; and an [we]3833-we re to die , [we]3833-we die , and there s an end on t. But now that [I]76-dick think , how found [ye]128-matcham [[my]76-dick chamber]3834-my chamber ? "[76-dick]

" [I]1128-she asked it of [Dame Hatch]155-dame hatch , "[1128-she] [she]1128-she answered .

" Well , [the dame]3835-the dame s staunch , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick answered ; " [she]3835-the dame ll not tell upon [you]1127-the girl . [We]3833-we have time before [us]3833-we . "[76-dick]

And just then , as if to contradict [his]76-dick words , feet came down [the corridor]1130-the corridor , and a fist beat roughly on the door .

" [Here]742-here ! "[1127-the girl] cried a voice . " Open , [Master Dick]76-dick ; open ! "[1127-the girl] [Dick]76-dick neither moved nor answered .

" It is all over , "[1127-the girl] said [the girl]1127-the girl ; and [she]1127-the girl put [her]1127-the girl arms about [Dick]76-dick s neck .

One after another , [men]3205-men came trooping to the door . Then [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel arrived [himself]72-sir daniel , and there was a sudden cessation of the noise .

" [Dick]76-dick , "[438-the knight] cried [the knight]438-the knight , " be not [an ass]3837-an ass . [The Seven Sleepers]156-the seven sleepers had been awake ere now . [We]3838-we know [she]1127-the girl is within [there]718-there . Open , then , the door , [man]3147-man . "[438-the knight]

[Dick]76-dick was again silent .

" Down with it , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . And immediately [[his]72-sir daniel followers]1134-his followers fell savagely upon the door with foot and fist . Solid as it was , and strongly bolted , it would soon have given way ; but once more fortune interfered . Over the thunderstorm of blows the cry of [a sentinel]1061-a sentinel was heard ; it was followed by another ; shouts ran along the battlements , shouts answered out of the wood . In the first moment of alarm it sounded as if [the foresters]803-the foresters were carrying [the Moat House]260-the moat house by assault . And [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel and [[his]72-sir daniel men]417-his men , desisting instantly from [their]417-his men attack upon [[Dick]76-dick s chamber]1139-dick s chamber , hurried to defend the walls .

" Now , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , " [we]417-his men are saved . "[76-dick]

[He]76-dick seized the great old bedstead with both hands , and bent [himself]76-dick in vain to move it .

" Help [me]76-dick , [Jack]128-matcham . For [your]128-matcham life s sake , help [me]76-dick stoutly ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried .

Between [them]417-his men , with a huge effort , [they]417-his men dragged the big frame of oak across [the room]430-the room , and thrust it endwise to the chamber door .

" [Ye]117-joanna do but make things worse , "[117-joanna] said [Joanna]117-joanna , sadly . " [He]72-sir daniel will then enter by the trap . "[117-joanna]

" Not so , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick . " [He]72-sir daniel durst not tell [his]72-sir daniel secret to [so many]3841-so many . It is by the trap that [we]417-his men shall flee . Hark ! The attack is over . Nay , it was none ! "[76-dick]

[It]1141-it had , indeed , been no attack ; it was the arrival of [another party of stragglers from the defeat of [Risingham]184-lord risingham]1142-another party of stragglers from the defeat of risingham that had disturbed [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . [They]417-his men had run the gauntlet under cover of the darkness ; [they]417-his men had been admitted by the great gate ; and now , with a great stamping of hoofs and jingle of accoutrements and arms , [they]417-his men were dismounting in [the court]950-the court .

" [He]76-dick will return anon , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " To the trap ! "[76-dick]

[He]76-dick lighted a lamp , and [they]417-his men went together into the corner of [the room]430-the room . The open chink through which some light still glittered was easily discovered , and , taking a stout sword from [his]76-dick small armoury , [Dick]76-dick thrust it deep into the seam , and weighed strenuously on the hilt . The trap moved , gaped a little , and at length came widely open . Seizing it with [their]417-his men hands , [the two young folk]1145-the two young folk threw it back . [It]1146-it disclosed a few steps descending , and at the foot of [them]417-his men , where [the would - be murderer]1147-the would - be murderer had left [it]1146-it , a burning lamp .

" Now , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " go first and take the lamp . [I]76-dick will follow to close the trap . "[76-dick]

So [they]417-his men descended one after the other , and as [Dick]76-dick lowered the trap , the blows began once again to thunder on the panels of the door .

CHAPTER IV [THE PASSAGE

The passage in which [Dick]76-dick and [Joanna]117-joanna now found [themselves]417-his men]1148-the passage the passage in which dick and joanna now found themselves was narrow , dirty , and short . At the other end of [it]1148-the passage the passage in which dick and joanna now found themselves , a door stood partly open ; the same door , without doubt , that [they]417-his men had heard [the man]3175-the man unlocking . Heavy cobwebs hung from the roof ; and the paved flooring echoed hollow under the lightest tread .

Beyond the door there were two branches , at right angles . [Dick]76-dick chose one of them at random , and [the pair]805-the pair hurried , with echoing footsteps , along the hollow of [the chapel]3778-the chapel roof . The top of the arched ceiling rose like a whale s back in the dim glimmer of the lamp . Here and there were spyholes , concealed , on the other side , by the carving of the cornice ; and looking down through one of these , [Dick]76-dick saw the paved floor of [the chapel]3778-the chapel the altar , with [its]1153-its burning tapers and stretched before [it]1153-its on the steps , the figure of [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver praying with uplifted hands .

At the other end , [they]417-his men descended a few steps . [The passage]1107-the passage grew narrower ; the wall upon one hand was now of wood ; the noise of [people]249-people talking , and a faint flickering of lights , came through the interstices ; and presently [they]417-his men came to a round hole about the size of [a man]3107-a man s eye , and [Dick]76-dick , looking down through it , beheld the interior of [the hall]989-the hall , and [some half a dozen men]1158-some half a dozen men sitting , in [their]1158-some half a dozen men jacks , about the table , drinking deep and demolishing a venison pie . These were certainly [some of [the late arrivals]1160-the late arrivals]1159-some of the late arrivals .

" Here is no help , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Let [us]417-his men try back . "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[117-joanna] said [Joanna]117-joanna ; " maybe [the passage]1107-the passage goeth farther . "[117-joanna]

And [she]117-joanna pushed on . But a few yards farther [the passage]1107-the passage ended at the top of a short flight of steps ; and it became plain that , as long as [the soldiers]470-the soldiers occupied [the hall]989-the hall , escape was impossible upon that side .

[They]417-his men retraced [their]417-his men steps with all imaginable speed , and set forward to explore the other branch . [It]1164-it was exceedingly narrow , scarce wide enough for [a large man]1165-a large man ; and it led [them]417-his men continually up and down by little break - neck stairs , until even [Dick]76-dick had lost all notion of [his]76-dick whereabouts .

At length it grew both narrower and lower ; the stairs continued to descend ; the walls on either hand became damp and slimy to the touch ; and far in front of [them]417-his men [they]417-his men heard the squeaking and scuttling of the rats .

" [We]417-his men must be in [the dungeons]3843-the dungeons , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick remarked .

" And still there is no outlet , "[117-joanna] added [Joanna]117-joanna .

" Nay , but an outlet there must be ! "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick answered . Presently , sure enough , [they]417-his men came to a sharp angle , and then [the passage]1107-the passage ended in [a flight of steps]1167-a flight of steps . On the top of that there was a solid flag of stone by way of trap , and to this [they]417-his men both set [their]417-his men backs . It was immovable . " Some one holdeth it , "[117-joanna] suggested [Joanna]117-joanna .

" Not so , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick ; " for were [a man]3107-a man strong as ten , [he]3107-a man must still yield a little . But this resisteth like dead rock . There is a weight upon the trap . Here is no issue ; and , by [my]76-dick sooth , good [Jack]128-matcham , [we]417-his men are here as fairly prisoners as though the gyves were on [our]417-his men ankle bones . Sit [ye]128-matcham then down , and let [us]417-his men talk . After a while [we]417-his men shall return , when perchance [they]417-his men shall be less carefully upon [their]417-his men guard ; and , who knoweth ? [we]417-his men may break out and stand a chance . But , in [my]76-dick poor opinion , [we]417-his men are as good as shent . "[76-dick]

" [Dick]76-dick ! "[117-joanna] [she]117-joanna cried , " alas the day that ever [ye]76-dick should have seen [me]117-joanna ! For like [a most unhappy and unthankful maid]3845-a most unhappy and unthankful maid , it is [I]117-joanna have led [you]76-dick hither . "[117-joanna]

" What cheer ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " It was all written , and that which is written , willy nilly , cometh still to pass . But tell [me]76-dick a little what manner of [a maid]3386-a maid [ye]128-matcham are , and how [ye]128-matcham came into [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s hands ; that will do better than to bemoan [yourself]128-matcham , whether for [your]128-matcham sake or [mine]76-dick . "[76-dick]

" [I]117-joanna am [an orphan]3847-an orphan , like [yourself]76-dick , of [father]3848-father and [mother]3849-mother , "[117-joanna] said [Joanna]117-joanna ; " and for [my]117-joanna great misfortune , [Dick]76-dick , and hitherto for [yours]76-dick , [I]117-joanna am a rich marriage . [[My]117-joanna Lord [Foxham]157-lord foxham]3850-my lord foxham had [me]117-joanna to ward ; yet it appears [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel bought the marriage of [me]117-joanna from [the king]3103-the king , and a right dear price [he]157-lord foxham paid for it . So here was [I]117-joanna , [poor babe]3852-poor babe , with [two great and rich men]3853-two great and rich men fighting which should marry [me]117-joanna , and [I]117-joanna still at nurse ! Well , then [the world]235-the world changed , and there was [a new chancellor]3855-a new chancellor , and [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel bought the warding of [me]117-joanna over [the Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s head . And then [the world]235-the world changed again , and [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham bought [my]117-joanna marriage over [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s ; and from then to now it went on ill betwixt [the two of [them]3857-the two of them]3857-the two of them . But still [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham kept [me]117-joanna in [his]157-lord foxham hands , and was [a good lord]3858-a good lord to [me]117-joanna . And at last [I]117-joanna was to be married or sold , if [ye]3859-ye like it better . Five hundred pounds [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham was to get for [me]117-joanna . [Hamley]158-hamley was [the groom]3860-the groom s name , and to - morrow , [Dick]76-dick , of all days in the year , was [I]117-joanna to be betrothed . Had it not come to [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , [I]117-joanna had been wedded , sure and never seen [thee]3859-ye , [Dick dear Dick]76-dick ! "[117-joanna]

And here [she]1168-me took [his]1169-his hand , and kissed it , with the prettiest grace ; and [Dick]76-dick drew [her]1168-me hand to [him]1169-his and did the like .

" Well , "[1168-me] [she]1168-me went on , " [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel took [me]1168-me unawares in [the garden]3861-the garden , and made [me]1168-me dress in [these men]3540-these men s clothes , which is a deadly sin for [a woman]283-a woman ; and , besides , they fit [me]1168-me not . [He]72-sir daniel rode with [me]1168-me to [Kettley]75-sir daniel , as [ye]3859-ye saw , telling [me]1168-me [I]1168-me was to marry [you]3859-ye ; but [I]1168-me , in [my]1168-me heart , made sure [I]1168-me would marry [Hamley]158-hamley in [his]158-hamley teeth . "[1168-me]

" Ay ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , " and so [ye]3859-ye loved [this Hamley]158-hamley ! "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[117-joanna] replied [Joanna]117-joanna , " not [I.]117-joanna [I]117-joanna did but hate [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel . And then , [Dick]76-dick , [ye]76-dick helped [me]117-joanna , and [ye]76-dick were right kind , and very bold , and [my]117-joanna heart turned towards [you]76-dick in [mine]117-joanna own despite ; and now , if [we]3864-we can in any way compass it , [I]117-joanna would marry [you]76-dick with right goodwill . And if , by cruel destiny , it may not be , still [ye]76-dick ll be dear to [me]117-joanna . While [my]117-joanna heart beats , it ll be true to [you]76-dick . "[117-joanna]

" And [I]76-dick , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " that never cared a straw for any manner of [woman]3397-woman until now , [I]1170-i took to [you]76-dick when [I]1170-i thought [ye]76-dick were [a boy]3465-a boy . [I]1170-i had a pity to [you]76-dick , and knew not why . When [I]1170-i would have belted [you]76-dick , the hand failed [me]1170-i . But when [ye]76-dick owned [ye]76-dick were [a maid]3386-a maid , [Jack]128-matcham for still [I]1170-i will call [you]76-dick [Jack]128-matcham [I]1170-i made sure [ye]76-dick were [the maid for [me]1170-i]3868-the maid for me . Hark ! "[1170-i] [he]1170-i said , breaking off " one cometh . "[1170-i]

And indeed a heavy tread was now audible in [the echoing passage]1171-the echoing passage , and the rats again fled in armies .

[Dick]76-dick reconnoitred [his]76-dick position . The sudden turn gave [him]76-dick a post of vantage . [He]76-dick could thus shoot in safety from the cover of the wall . But it was plain the light was too near [him]76-dick , and , running some way forward , [he]76-dick set down the lamp in the middle of [the passage]1107-the passage , and then returned to watch .

Presently , at the far end of [the passage]1107-the passage , [Bennet]77-bennet hove in sight . [He]77-bennet seemed to be alone , and [he]77-bennet carried in [his]77-bennet hand a burning torch , which made [him]77-bennet the better mark .

" Stand , [Bennet]77-bennet ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " Another step , and [y]77-bennet are dead . "[76-dick]

" So here [ye]77-bennet are , "[77-bennet] returned [Hatch]77-bennet , peering forward into the darkness . " [I]77-bennet see [you]77-bennet not . Aha ! [y]77-bennet ave done wisely , [Dick]76-dick ; [y]77-bennet ave put [your]77-bennet lamp before [you]77-bennet . By [my]77-bennet sooth , but , though it was done to shoot [my]77-bennet own knave body , [I]77-bennet do rejoice to see [ye]77-bennet profit of [my]77-bennet lessons ! And now , what make [ye]77-bennet ? what seek [ye]77-bennet here ? Why would [ye]77-bennet shoot upon [an old , kind friend]3869-an old , kind friend ? And have [ye]77-bennet [the young gentlewoman]3870-the young gentlewoman [there]718-there ? "[77-bennet]

" Nay , [Bennet]77-bennet , it is [I]76-dick should question and [you]77-bennet answer , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick . " Why am [I]76-dick in this jeopardy of [my]76-dick life ? Why do [men]3205-men come privily to slay [me]76-dick in [my]76-dick bed ? Why am [I]76-dick now fleeing in [[mine]76-dick own guardian s strong house]3873-mine own guardian s strong house , and from [the friends that [I]76-dick have lived among and never injured]3874-the friends that i have lived among and never injured ? "[76-dick]

" [Master Dick]76-dick , [Master Dick]76-dick , "[77-bennet] said [Bennet]77-bennet , " what told [I]77-bennet [you]76-dick ? [Y]76-dick are brave , but [the most uncrafty lad that [I]77-bennet can think upon]3875-the most uncrafty lad that i can think upon ! "[77-bennet]

" Well , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick see [ye]76-dick know all , and that [I]76-dick am doomed indeed . It is well . Here , where [I]76-dick am , [I]76-dick stay . Let [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel get [me]76-dick out if [he]75-sir daniel be able ! "[76-dick]

[Hatch]77-bennet was silent for a space .

" Hark [ye]76-dick , "[77-bennet] [he]77-bennet began , " return to [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel , to tell [him]75-sir daniel where [ye]76-dick are , and how posted ; for , in truth , it was to that end [he]75-sir daniel sent [me]77-bennet . But [you]76-dick , if [ye]76-dick are [no fool]3876-no fool , had best be gone ere [I]77-bennet return . "[77-bennet]

" Begone ! "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick . " [I]76-dick would be gone already , an [I]76-dick wist how . [I]76-dick can not move the trap . "[76-dick]

" Put [me]77-bennet [your]76-dick hand into the corner , and see what [ye]76-dick find there , "[77-bennet] replied [Bennet]77-bennet . " [Throgmorton]148-throgmorton s rope is still in [the brown chamber]3877-the brown chamber . Fare [ye]76-dick well . "[77-bennet]

And [Hatch]77-bennet , turning upon [his]77-bennet heel , disappeared again into the windings of [the passage]1107-the passage .

[Dick]76-dick instantly returned for [his]76-dick lamp , and proceeded to act upon the hint . At one corner of the trap there was a deep cavity in the wall . Pushing [his]76-dick arm into the aperture , [Dick]76-dick found an iron bar , which [he]76-dick thrust vigorously upwards . There followed a snapping noise , and the slab of stone instantly started in its bed .

[They]1175-they were free of [the passage]1107-the passage . A little exercise of strength easily raised the trap ; and [they]1175-they came forth into [a vaulted chamber]1177-a vaulted chamber , opening on one hand upon [the court]950-the court , where [one or two fellows , with bare arms]1179-one or two fellows , with bare arms , were rubbing down the horses of [the last arrivals]1180-the last arrivals . A torch or two , each stuck in an iron ring against the wall , changefully lit up the scene .

CHAPTER V HOW [DICK CHANGED SIDES

Dick]76-dick , blowing out [his]76-dick lamp lest it should attract attention , led the way up - stairs and along [the corridor]1130-the corridor . In [the brown chamber]3877-the brown chamber the rope had been made fast to the frame of an exceeding heavy and ancient bed . It had not been detached , and [Dick]76-dick , taking the coil to the window , began to lower it slowly and cautiously into the darkness of the night . [Joan]117-joanna stood by ; but as the rope lengthened , and still [Dick]76-dick continued to pay it out , extreme fear began to conquer [her]117-joanna resolution .

" [Dick]76-dick , "[117-joanna] [she]117-joanna said , " is it so deep ? [I]117-joanna may not essay it . [I]117-joanna should infallibly fall , good [Dick]76-dick . "[117-joanna]

It was just at the delicate moment of the operations that [she]117-joanna spoke . [Dick]76-dick started ; the remainder of the coil slipped from [his]76-dick grasp , and the end fell with a splash into [the moat]940-the moat . Instantly , from the battlement above , the voice of [a sentinel]1061-a sentinel cried , " Who goes ? "[1061-a sentinel]

" [A murrain]3543-a murrain ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " [We]3879-we are paid now ! Down with [you]117-joanna take the rope . "[76-dick]

" [I]117-joanna can not , "[117-joanna] [she]117-joanna cried , recoiling .

" An ye can not , no more can [I]76-dick , "[76-dick] said [Shelton]76-dick . " How can [I]76-dick swim [the moat]940-the moat without [you]117-joanna ? Do [you]117-joanna desert [me]76-dick , then ? "[76-dick]

" [Dick]76-dick , "[117-joanna] [she]117-joanna gasped , " [I]117-joanna can not . The strength is gone from [me]117-joanna . "[117-joanna]

" By the mass , then , [we]3881-we are all shent ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick shouted , stamping with [his]76-dick foot ; and then , hearing steps , [he]76-dick ran to [the room]430-the room door and sought to close it .

Before [he]76-dick could shoot the bolt , strong arms were thrusting it back upon [him]76-dick from the other side . [He]76-dick struggled for a second ; then , feeling [himself]76-dick overpowered , ran back to the window . [The girl]1127-the girl had fallen against the wall in the embrasure of the window ; [she]1127-the girl was more than half insensible ; and when [he]76-dick tried to raise [her]1127-the girl in [his]76-dick arms , [her]1127-the girl body was limp and unresponsive .

At the same moment [the men who had forced the door against [him]76-dick]1187-the men who had forced the door against him laid hold upon [him]76-dick . The first [he]76-dick poinarded at a blow , and [the others]379-the others falling back for a second in some disorder , [he]76-dick profited by the chance , bestrode the window - sill , seized the cord in both hands , and let [his]76-dick body slip .

The cord was knotted , which made it the easier to descend ; but so furious was [Dick]76-dick s hurry , and so small [his]76-dick experience of such gymnastics , that [he]76-dick span round and round in mid - air like [a criminal upon a gibbet]1189-a criminal upon a gibbet , and now beat [his]76-dick head , and now bruised [his]76-dick hands , against the rugged stonework of the wall . The air roared in [his]76-dick ears ; [he]76-dick saw the stars overhead , and the reflected stars below [him]76-dick in [the moat]940-the moat , whirling like dead leaves before the tempest . And then [he]76-dick lost hold , and fell , and soused head over ears into the icy water .

When [he]76-dick came to the surface [his]76-dick hand encountered the rope , which , newly lightened of [his]76-dick weight , was swinging wildly to and fro . There was a red glow overhead , and looking up , [he]76-dick saw , by the light of several torches and a cresset full of burning coals , the battlements lined with faces . [He]76-dick saw [the men]405-the men s eyes turning hither and thither in quest of [him]76-dick ; but [he]76-dick was too far below , the light reached [him]76-dick not , and [they]405-the men looked in vain .

And now [he]76-dick perceived that the rope was considerably too long , and [he]76-dick began to struggle as well as [he]76-dick could towards the other side of [the moat]940-the moat , still keeping [his]76-dick head above water . In this way [he]76-dick got much more than halfway over ; indeed [the bank]601-the bank was almost within reach , before the rope began to draw [him]76-dick back by its own weight . Taking [his]76-dick courage in both hands , [he]76-dick left go and made a leap for the trailing sprays of willow that had already , that same evening , helped [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel s messenger to land . [He]76-dick went down , rose again , sank a second time , and then [his]76-dick hand caught a branch , and with the speed of thought [he]76-dick had dragged [himself]76-dick into the thick of the tree and clung there , dripping and panting , and still half uncertain of [his]76-dick escape .

But all this had not been done without a considerable splashing , which had so far indicated [his]76-dick position to [the men along the battlements]1194-the men along the battlements . Arrows and quarrels fell thick around [him]76-dick in the darkness , thick like driving hail ; and suddenly a torch was thrown down flared through the air in its swift passage stuck for a moment on the edge of [the bank]601-the bank , where it burned high and lit up [its]1196-its whole surroundings like a bonfire and then , in a good hour for [Dick]76-dick , slipped off , plumped into [the moat]940-the moat , and was instantly extinguished .

It had served its purpose . [The marksmen]1198-the marksmen had had time to see [the willow]1199-the willow , and [Dick]76-dick ensconced among [its]1199-the willow boughs ; and though [the lad]309-the lad instantly sprang higher up [the bank]601-the bank , and ran for [his]309-the lad life , [he]309-the lad was yet not quick enough to escape a shot . An arrow struck [him]309-the lad in the shoulder , another grazed [his]309-the lad head .

The pain of [his]309-the lad wounds lent [him]309-the lad wings ; and [he]309-the lad had no sooner got upon the level than [he]309-the lad took to [his]309-the lad heels and ran straight before [him]309-the lad in the dark , without a thought for the direction of [his]309-the lad flight .

For a few steps missiles followed [him]309-the lad , but these soon ceased ; and when at length [he]309-the lad came to a halt and looked behind , [he]309-the lad was already a good way from [the Moat House]260-the moat house , though [he]309-the lad could still see the torches moving to and fro along [its]260-the moat house battlements .

[He]309-the lad leaned against a tree , streaming with blood and water , bruised , wounded , alone , and unarmed . For all that , [he]309-the lad had saved [his]309-the lad life for that bout ; and though [Joanna]117-joanna remained behind in the power of [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel , [he]309-the lad neither blamed [himself]309-the lad for an accident that it had been beyond [his]309-the lad power to prevent , nor did [he]309-the lad augur any fatal consequences to [the girl]1127-the girl [herself]1127-the girl . [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel was cruel , but [he]75-sir daniel was not likely to be cruel to [a young gentlewoman who had other protectors , willing and able to bring [him]75-sir daniel to account]1204-a young gentlewoman who had other protectors , willing and able to bring him to account . It was more probable [he]75-sir daniel would make haste to marry [her]1127-the girl to [some friend of [his]75-sir daniel own]1205-some friend of his own .

" Well , "[76-dick] thought [Dick]76-dick , " between then and now [I]76-dick will find [me]76-dick the means to bring [that traitor]3882-that traitor under ; for [I]76-dick think , by the mass , that [I]76-dick be now absolved from any gratitude or obligation ; and when war is open , there is a fair chance for all . "[76-dick]

In the meanwhile , here [he]76-dick was in a sore plight .

For some little way farther [he]76-dick struggled forward through [the forest]246-the forest ; but what with the pain of [his]76-dick wounds , the darkness of the night , and the extreme uneasiness and confusion of [his]76-dick mind , [he]76-dick soon became equally unable to guide [himself]76-dick or to continue to push through the close undergrowth , and [he]76-dick was fain at length to sit down and lean [his]76-dick back against a tree .

When [he]76-dick awoke from something betwixt sleep and swooning , the grey of the morning had begun to take the place of night . A little chilly breeze was bustling among the trees , and as [he]76-dick still sat staring before [him]76-dick , only half awake , [he]76-dick became aware of something dark that swung to and fro among the branches , some hundred yards in front of [him]76-dick . The progressive brightening of the day and the return of [his]76-dick own senses at last enabled [him]76-dick to recognise the object . It was a man hanging from the bough of a tall oak . [His]76-dick head had fallen forward on [his]76-dick breast ; but at every stronger puff of wind [his]76-dick body span round and round , and [his]76-dick legs and arms tossed , like some ridiculous plaything .

[Dick]76-dick clambered to [his]76-dick feet , and , staggering and leaning on the tree - trunks as [he]76-dick went , drew near to this grim object .

The bough was perhaps twenty feet above the ground , and [the poor fellow]1207-the poor fellow had been drawn up so high by [[his]1207-the poor fellow executioners]1208-his executioners that [his]1207-the poor fellow boots swung clear above [Dick]76-dick s reach ; and as [his]76-dick hood had been drawn over [his]76-dick face , it was impossible to recognise [the man]3175-the man .

[Dick]76-dick looked about [him]76-dick right and left ; and at last [he]76-dick perceived that the other end of the cord had been made fast to the trunk of a little hawthorn which grew , thick with blossom , under the lofty arcade of the oak . With [his]76-dick dagger , which alone remained to [him]76-dick of all [his]76-dick arms , [young Shelton]76-dick severed the rope , and instantly , with a dead thump , the corpse fell in a heap upon the ground .

[Dick]76-dick raised the hood ; it was [Throgmorton]148-throgmorton , [[Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel s messenger]1210-sir daniel s messenger . [He]76-dick had not gone far upon [his]76-dick errand . A paper , which had apparently escaped the notice of [the men of [the Black Arrow]69-the black arrow]714-the men of the black arrow , stuck from the bosom of [his]76-dick doublet , and [Dick]76-dick , pulling it forth , found it was [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel s letter to [Lord Wensleydale]159-lord wensleydale .

" Come , "[76-dick] thought [he]76-dick , " if [the world]235-the world changes yet again , [I]76-dick may have here the wherewithal to shame [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel nay , and perchance to bring [him]1212-the dead man to the block . "[76-dick]

And [he]76-dick put the paper in [his]76-dick own bosom , said a prayer over [the dead man]1212-the dead man , and set forth again through [the woods]783-the woods .

[His]76-dick fatigue and weakness increased ; [his]76-dick ears sang , [his]76-dick steps faltered , [his]76-dick mind at intervals failed [him]76-dick , so low had [he]76-dick been brought by loss of blood . Doubtless [he]76-dick made many deviations from [his]76-dick true path , but at last [he]76-dick came out upon [the high - road]1214-the high - road , not very far from [Tunstall hamlet]5-tunstall .

A rough voice bid [him]76-dick stand .

" Stand ? "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick . " By the mass , but [I]76-dick am nearer falling . "[76-dick]

And [he]76-dick suited the action to the word , and fell all [his]76-dick length upon [the road]257-the road .

[Two men]1216-two men came forth out of the thicket , each in green forest jerkin , each with long - bow and quiver and short sword .

" Why , [Lawless]132-lawless , "[1217-the younger of the two] said [the younger of [the two]1218-the two]1217-the younger of the two , " it is [young Shelton]76-dick . "[1217-the younger of the two]

" Ay , this will be as good as bread to [John Amend - All]95-john amend , "[311-the other] returned [the other]311-the other . " Though , faith , [he]76-dick hath been to the wars . Here is a tear in [his]76-dick scalp that must a cost [him]76-dick many a good ounce of blood . "[311-the other]

" And here , "[160-greensheve] added [Greensheve]160-greensheve , " is a hole in [his]76-dick shoulder that must have pricked [him]76-dick well . Who hath done this , think [ye]132-lawless ? If it be one of [ours]3884-ours , [he]76-dick may all to prayer ; [Ellis]100-ellis will give [him]76-dick a short shrift and a long rope . "[160-greensheve]

" Up with the cub , "[132-lawless] said [Lawless]132-lawless . " Clap [him]309-the lad on [my]132-lawless back . "[132-lawless]

And then , when [Dick]76-dick had been hoisted to [his]76-dick shoulders , and [he]76-dick had taken [the lad]309-the lad s arms about [his]76-dick neck , and got a firm hold of [him]309-the lad , [the ex - Grey Friar]1221-the ex - grey friar added :

So [Greensheve]160-greensheve returned to [his]160-greensheve ambush on the wayside , and [Lawless]132-lawless trudged down [the hill]314-the hill , whistling as [he]132-lawless went , with [Dick]76-dick , still in a dead faint , comfortably settled on [his]76-dick shoulders .

The sun rose as [he]132-lawless came out of the skirts of the wood and saw [Tunstall hamlet]5-tunstall straggling up [the opposite hill]1223-the opposite hill . All seemed quiet , but [a strong post of some half a score of [archers]3503-archers]1224-a strong post of some half a score of archers lay close by [the bridge on either side of [the road]257-the road]1226-the bridge on either side of the road , and , as soon as [they]1228-they perceived [Lawless]132-lawless with [his]132-lawless burthen , began to bestir [themselves]1228-they and set arrow to string like [vigilant sentries]1229-vigilant sentries .

" Who goes ? "[1230-the man in command] cried [the man in command]1230-the man in command .

" Give the word , [Lawless]132-lawless , "[311-the other] returned [the other]311-the other .

" [Lawless]132-lawless , [ye]132-lawless but show an ill example ; give [us]3888-us the word , [fool jester]3889-fool jester , "[1233-the commander of the post] said [the commander of the post]1233-the commander of the post .

" And if [I]311-the other had forgotten it ? "[311-the other] asked [the other]311-the other .

"[132-lawless]

" [He]95-john amend holdeth [a court]3891-a court , by the mass , and taketh rents as to the manner born ! "[1238-another of the company] cried [another of the company]1238-another of the company .

So it proved . When [Lawless]132-lawless got as far up [the village]261-the village as [the little inn]1240-the little inn , [he]132-lawless found [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis surrounded by [[Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel s tenants]1241-sir daniel s tenants , and , by the right of [[his]100-ellis good company of [archers]3503-archers]1242-his good company of archers , coolly taking rents , and giving written receipts in return for [them]1241-sir daniel s tenants . By the faces of [the tenants]426-the tenants , it was plain how little this proceeding pleased [them]426-the tenants ; for [they]426-the tenants argued very rightly that [they]426-the tenants would simply have to pay [them]426-the tenants twice .

As soon as [he]100-ellis knew what had brought [Lawless]132-lawless , [Ellis]100-ellis dismissed [the remainder of [the tenants]426-the tenants]1245-the remainder of the tenants , and , with every mark of interest and apprehension , conducted [Dick]76-dick into [an inner chamber of [the inn]459-the inn]1247-an inner chamber of the inn . There [the lad]309-the lad s hurts were looked to ; and [he]309-the lad was recalled , by simple remedies , to consciousness .

" [Dear lad]3892-dear lad , "[100-ellis] said [Ellis]100-ellis , pressing [his]100-ellis hand , " [y]3892-dear lad are in [a friend s hands that loved [[your]3892-dear lad father]3306-your father , and loves [you]3892-dear lad for [his]3306-your father sake]3893-a friend s hands that loved your father , and loves you for his sake . "[100-ellis]

A little later in the day , and after [Dick]76-dick had awakened from a comfortable slumber to find [himself]76-dick still very weak , but clearer in mind and easier in body , [Ellis]100-ellis returned , and sitting down by the bedside , begged [him]76-dick , in the name of [[his]76-dick father]3776-his father , to relate the circumstance of [his]76-dick escape from [Tunstall Moat House]4-tunstall moat house . There was something in the strength of [Duckworth]100-ellis s frame , in the honesty of [his]100-ellis brown face , in the clearness and shrewdness of [his]100-ellis eyes , that moved [Dick]76-dick to obey [him]100-ellis ; and from first to last [the lad]309-the lad told [him]100-ellis the story of [his]100-ellis two days adventures .

" Well , "[100-ellis] said [Ellis]100-ellis , when [he]100-ellis had done , " see what [the kind saints]3896-the kind saints have done for [you]76-dick , [Dick Shelton]76-dick , not alone to save [your]76-dick body in so numerous and deadly perils , but to bring [you]76-dick into [my]100-ellis hands that have no dearer wish than to assist [[your]76-dick father s son]3897-your father s son . "[100-ellis]

" Will [ye]76-dick assault [the house]321-the house ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" [I]100-ellis were mad , indeed , to think of it , "[100-ellis] returned [Ellis]100-ellis . " [He]3899-that false - heart traitor hath too much power ; [[his]3899-that false - heart traitor men]417-his men gather to [him]3899-that false - heart traitor ; those that gave [me]100-ellis the slip last night , and by the mass came in so handily for [you]76-dick those have made [him]3899-that false - heart traitor safe . "[100-ellis]

" [My]309-the lad mind misgiveth [me]309-the lad for [Jack]128-matcham , "[309-the lad] said [the lad]309-the lad .

But [our]3904-we four eyes , [Dick]76-dick , shall follow [him]75-sir daniel right close , and [our]3904-we four hands so help [us]3904-we all [the army of [the saints]3104-the saints]3908-the army of the saints ! shall bring [that traitor]3882-that traitor low ! "[100-ellis]

Two days later [[Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel s garrison]1253-sir daniel s garrison had grown to such a strength that [he]75-sir daniel ventured on a sally , and at the head of [some two score horsemen]1254-some two score horsemen , pushed without opposition as far as [Tunstall hamlet]5-tunstall . Not an arrow flew , not [a man stirred in the thicket]1255-a man stirred in the thicket ; [the bridge]265-the bridge was no longer guarded , but stood open to all corners ; and as [Sir Daniel]75-sir daniel crossed [it]265-the bridge , [he]75-sir daniel saw [the villagers]1257-the villagers looking timidly from [their]1257-the villagers doors .

Presently one of [them]1257-the villagers , taking heart of grace , came forward , and with the lowliest salutations , presented a letter to [the knight]438-the knight .

[His]438-the knight face darkened as [he]438-the knight read the contents . It ran thus :

To [the most untrue and cruel gentylman]1259-the most untrue and cruel gentylman , [Sir Daniel Brackley]72-sir daniel , Knyght , [These]163-these :

[I]0-i fynde [ye]72-sir daniel were untrue and unkynd fro the first . [Ye]72-sir daniel have [[my]0-i father]3558-my father s blood upon [your]72-sir daniel hands ; let be , it will not wasshe . Some day [ye]72-sir daniel shall perish by [my]0-i procurement , so much [I]0-i let [you]72-sir daniel to wytte ; and [I]0-i let [you]72-sir daniel to [wytte]35-wytte farther , that if [ye]72-sir daniel seek to [we]1261-we d to any other [the gentylwoman]1262-the gentylwoman , [Mistresse Joan Sedley]117-joanna , whom that [I]0-i am bound upon a great oath to [we]1261-we d [myself]0-i , the blow will be very swift . The first step therinne will be [thy]72-sir daniel first step to the grave .

[Ric . Shelton]164-ric . shelton .

BOOK III [[MY]0-i LORD]3102-my lord [FOXHAM]36-foxham

CHAPTER I [THE HOUSE]37-the house BY [THE SHORE

Months]38-the shore months had passed away since [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton made [his]74-master shelton escape from the hands of [[his]74-master shelton guardian]287-his guardian . These months had been eventful for [England]22-england . [The party of Lancaster , which was then in the very article of death]1265-the party of lancaster , which was then in the very article of death , had once more raised [its]1265-the party of lancaster , which was then in the very article of death head . [The Yorkists]165-the yorkists defeated and dispersed , [[their]165-the yorkists leader]1266-their leader butchered on [the field]306-the field , it seemed , for a very brief season in the winter following upon the events already recorded , as if [the House of [Lancaster]7-lancaster]1268-the house of lancaster had finally triumphed over [its foes]1269-its foes .

[The small town of [Shoreby - on - the - Till]39-shoreby - on - the - till]1270-the small town of shoreby - on - the - till was full of [the Lancastrian nobles of [the neighbourhood]910-the neighbourhood]1271-the lancastrian nobles of the neighbourhood . [Earl Risingham]139-earl risingham was [there]718-there , with [three hundred men]1274-three hundred men - at - arms ; [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby , with two hundred ; [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel [himself]72-sir daniel , high in favour and once more growing rich on confiscations , lay in [a house of [his]72-sir daniel own]1275-a house of his own , on [the main street]487-the main street , with [three - score men]1277-three - score men . [The world]235-the world had changed indeed .

It was a black , bitter cold evening in the first week of January , with a hard frost , a high wind , and every likelihood of snow before the morning .

In [an obscure alehouse in [a by - street]1280-a by - street near [the harbour]1281-the harbour]1279-an obscure alehouse in a by - street near the harbour , [three or four men]1282-three or four men sat drinking ale and eating a hasty mess of eggs . [They]1282-three or four men were [all likely , lusty , weather - beaten fellows , hard of hand , bold of eye]1283-all likely , lusty , weather - beaten fellows , hard of hand , bold of eye ; and though [they]1282-three or four men wore plain tabards , like [country ploughmen]1284-country ploughmen , even [a drunken soldier]1285-a drunken soldier might have looked twice before [he]1285-a drunken soldier sought a quarrel in [such company]1286-such company .

A little apart before the huge fire sat [a younger man]1287-a younger man , almost [a boy]3465-a boy , dressed in much the same fashion , though it was easy to see by [his]1287-a younger man looks that [he]1287-a younger man was better born , and might have worn a sword , had the time suited .

" Nay , "[1289-one of the men at the table] said [one of [the men at the table]1290-the men at the table]1289-one of the men at the table , " [I]1289-one of the men at the table like it not . Ill will come of it . This is no place for [jolly fellows]3911-jolly fellows . [A jolly fellow]3912-a jolly fellow loveth [open country]3913-open country , good cover , and [scarce foes]3914-scarce foes ; but here [we]3915-we are shut in [a town]3916-a town , girt about with [enemies]3828-enemies ; and , for the bull s - eye of misfortune , see if it snow not ere the morning . "[1289-one of the men at the table]

" Tis for [Master Shelton]74-master shelton [there]718-there , "[1291-his] said another , nodding [his]1291-his head towards [the lad before the fire]1292-the lad before the fire .

" [I]1235-the first will do much for [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[1235-the first] returned [the first]1235-the first ; " but to come to the gallows for [any man]3919-any man nay , [brothers]3920-brothers , not that ! "[1235-the first]

The door of [the inn]459-the inn opened , and [another man]675-another man entered hastily and approached [the youth before the fire]1296-the youth before the fire .

" [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[675-another man] [he]675-another man said , " [Sir [Daniel]72-sir daniel]3440-sir daniel goeth forth with a pair of links and [four archers]3922-four archers . "[675-another man]

[Dick]76-dick for this was [[our]1297-they young friend]1298-our young friend rose instantly to [his]1298-our young friend feet .

" [Lawless]132-lawless , "[675-another man] [he]675-another man said , " [ye]132-lawless will take [John Capper]166-capper s watch . [Greensheve]160-greensheve , follow with [me]675-another man . [Capper]166-capper , lead forward . [We]1297-they will follow [him]166-capper this time , an [he]166-capper go to [York]8-york . "[675-another man]

The next moment [they]1297-they were outside in [the dark street]1299-the dark street , and [Capper]166-capper , [the man who had just come]1300-the man who had just come , pointed to where two torches flared in the wind at a little distance .

[The town]1301-the town was already sound asleep ; [no one]1302-no one moved upon [the streets]1303-the streets , and there was nothing easier than to follow [the party without observation]1304-the party without observation . [The two link - bearers]1305-the two link - bearers went first ; next followed [a single man]1306-a single man , whose long cloak blew about [him]1306-a single man in the wind ; and the rear was brought up by [the four archers]1307-the four archers , each with [his]1306-a single man bow upon [his]1306-a single man arm . [They]1297-they moved at a brisk walk , threading [the intricate lanes]1308-the intricate lanes and drawing nearer to [the shore]1309-the shore .

" [He]72-sir daniel hath gone each night in this direction ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick , in a whisper .

" This is the third night running , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[166-capper] returned [Capper]166-capper , " and still at the same hour and with the same small following , as though [his]72-sir daniel end were secret . "[166-capper]

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel and [[his]72-sir daniel six men]501-his six men were now come to [the outskirts of [the country]363-the country]1311-the outskirts of the country . [Shoreby]20-shoreby was [an open town]1313-an open town , and though [the Lancastrian lords who lay there]1314-the lancastrian lords who lay there kept [a strong guard]1315-a strong guard on [the main roads]1316-the main roads , it was still possible to enter or depart unseen by any of [the lesser streets]1317-the lesser streets or across [the open country]1318-the open country .

[The lane which [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had been following]1319-the lane which sir daniel had been following came to an abrupt end . Before [him]72-sir daniel there was [a stretch of rough down]1320-a stretch of rough down , and the noise of [the sea - surf]1321-the sea - surf was audible upon one hand . There were [no guards]1322-no guards in [the neighbourhood]910-the neighbourhood , nor any light in [that quarter of [the town]1301-the town]1324-that quarter of the town .

[Dick]76-dick and [[his]76-dick two outlaws]1326-his two outlaws drew a little closer to the object of [their]1327-their chase , and presently , as [they]1327-their came forth from between [the houses]1328-the houses and could see a little farther upon either hand , [they]1327-their were aware of another torch drawing near from another direction .

" Hey , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick smell treason . "[76-dick]

Meanwhile , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had come to a full halt . The torches were stuck into the sand , and [the men]405-the men lay down , as if to await the arrival of [the other party]3567-the other party .

This drew near at a good rate . It consisted of [four men]1331-four men only [a pair of archers]1332-a pair of archers , [a varlet with a link]1333-a varlet with a link , and [a cloaked gentleman]1334-a cloaked gentleman walking in [their]1327-their midst .

" Is it [you]1334-a cloaked gentleman , [[my]72-sir daniel lord]3102-my lord ? "[72-sir daniel] cried [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel .

" It is [I]1335-the leader of the second troop , indeed ; and if ever [true knight]3924-true knight gave proof [I]1335-the leader of the second troop am [that man]3925-that man , "[1335-the leader of the second troop] replied [the leader of [the second troop]1336-the second troop]1335-the leader of the second troop ; " for who would not rather face [giants]3926-giants , [sorcerers]3927-sorcerers , or [pagans , than this pinching cold]3928-pagans , than this pinching cold ? "[1335-the leader of the second troop]

" [[My]72-sir daniel lord]3102-my lord , "[72-sir daniel] returned [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " beauty will be [the more beholden]3930-the more beholden , misdoubt it not . But shall [we]3931-we forth ? for the sooner [ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman have seen [my]72-sir daniel merchandise , the sooner shall [we]3931-we both get [home]699-home . "[72-sir daniel]

" But why keep [ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman [her]3933-her here , [good knight]3252-good knight ? "[311-the other] inquired [the other]311-the other . " An [she]3933-her be so young , and so fair , and so wealthy , why do [ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman not bring [her]3933-her forth among [[her]3933-her mates]3935-her mates ? [Ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman would soon make [her]3933-her a good marriage , and no need to freeze [your]1334-a cloaked gentleman fingers and risk arrow - shots by going abroad at such untimely seasons in the dark . "[311-the other]

" [I]72-sir daniel have told [you]1334-a cloaked gentleman , [[my]72-sir daniel lord]3102-my lord , "[72-sir daniel] replied [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " the reason thereof concerneth [me]72-sir daniel only . Neither do [I]72-sir daniel purpose to explain it farther . Suffice it , that if [ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman be weary of [your]1334-a cloaked gentleman old gossip , [Daniel Brackley]72-sir daniel , publish it abroad that [y]1334-a cloaked gentleman are to [we]3937-we d [Joanna Sedley]117-joanna , and [I]72-sir daniel give [you]1334-a cloaked gentleman [my]72-sir daniel word [ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman will be quit of [him]76-dick right soon . [Ye]1334-a cloaked gentleman will find [him]76-dick with an arrow in [his]76-dick back . "[72-sir daniel]

Meantime [the two gentlemen]1338-the two gentlemen were walking briskly forward over the down ; the three torches going before [them]1338-the two gentlemen , stooping against the wind and scattering clouds of smoke and tufts of flame , and the rear brought up by [the six archers]1339-the six archers .

Close upon the heels of these , [Dick]76-dick followed . [He]76-dick had , of course , heard no word of this conversation ; but [he]76-dick had recognised in the second of the speakers old Lord Shoreby [himself]76-dick , [a man of an infamous reputation , whom even [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel affected , in public , to condemn]1340-a man of an infamous reputation , whom even sir daniel affected , in public , to condemn .

Presently [they]1338-the two gentlemen came close down upon [the beach]1341-the beach . The air smelt salt ; the noise of the surf increased ; and here , in [a large walled garden]1342-a large walled garden , there stood [a small house of two storeys]1343-a small house of two storeys , with [stables and other offices]1344-stables and other offices .

[The foremost torch - bearer]1345-the foremost torch - bearer unlocked a door in the wall , and after [the whole party]343-the whole party had passed into [the garden]3861-the garden , again closed and locked [it]1348-it on the other side .

[Dick]76-dick and [[his]76-dick men]417-his men were thus excluded from any farther following , unless [they]1338-the two gentlemen should scale the wall and thus put [their]1338-the two gentlemen necks in a trap .

[They]1338-the two gentlemen sat down in a tuft of furze and waited . The red glow of the torches moved up and down and to and fro within [the enclosure]1350-the enclosure , as if [the link bearers]1351-the link bearers steadily patrolled [the garden]3861-the garden .

Twenty minutes passed , and then [the whole party]343-the whole party issued forth again upon the down ; and [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel and [the baron]1354-the baron , after an elaborate salutation , separated and turned severally homeward , each with [his]76-dick own following of [men]3205-men and lights .

As soon as the sound of [their]1338-the two gentlemen steps had been swallowed by the wind , [Dick]76-dick got to [his]76-dick feet as briskly as [he]76-dick was able , for [he]76-dick was stiff and aching with the cold .

" [Capper]166-capper , [ye]166-capper will give [me]76-dick a back up , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said .

[They]1338-the two gentlemen advanced , all three , to the wall ; [Capper]166-capper stooped , and [Dick]76-dick , getting upon [his]76-dick shoulders , clambered on to the cope - stone .

" Now , [Greensheve]160-greensheve , "[76-dick] whispered [Dick]76-dick , " follow [me]76-dick up here ; lie flat upon [your]160-greensheve face , that [ye]160-greensheve may be the less seen ; and be ever ready to give [me]76-dick a hand if [I]76-dick fall foully on the other side . "[76-dick]

And so saying [he]76-dick dropped into [the garden]3861-the garden .

It was all pitch dark ; there was no light in [the house]321-the house . The wind whistled shrill among the poor shrubs , and the surf beat upon [the beach]1341-the beach ; there was no other sound . [Cautiously Dick]76-dick footed it forth , stumbling among bushes , and groping with [his]76-dick hands ; and presently the crisp noise of gravel underfoot told [him]76-dick that [he]76-dick had struck upon [an alley]1359-an alley .

Here [he]76-dick paused , and taking [his]76-dick crossbow from where [he]76-dick kept it concealed under [his]76-dick long tabard , [he]76-dick prepared it for instant action , and went forward once more with greater resolution and assurance . [The path]506-the path led [him]76-dick straight to [the group of buildings]1361-the group of buildings .

All seemed to be sorely dilapidated : the windows of [the house]321-the house were secured by crazy shutters ; [the stables]1363-the stables were open and empty ; there was no hay in [the hay - loft]1364-the hay - loft , no corn in the corn - box . [Any one]1365-any one would have supposed [the place]3130-the place to be deserted . But [Dick]76-dick had good reason to think otherwise . [He]76-dick continued [his]76-dick inspection , visiting [the offices]1367-the offices , trying all the windows . At length [he]76-dick came round to the sea - side of [the house]321-the house , and there , sure enough , there burned a pale light in one of the upper windows .

[He]76-dick stepped back a little way , till [he]76-dick thought [he]76-dick could see the movement of a shadow on the wall of [the apartment]1077-the apartment . Then [he]76-dick remembered that , in [the stable]3349-the stable , [his]76-dick groping hand had rested for a moment on a ladder , and [he]76-dick returned with all despatch to bring it . The ladder was very short , but yet , by standing on the topmost round , [he]76-dick could bring [his]76-dick hands as high as the iron bars of the window ; and seizing these , [he]76-dick raised [his]76-dick body by main force until [his]76-dick eyes commanded the interior of [the room]430-the room .

[Two persons]1372-two persons were within ; the first [he]76-dick readily knew to be [Dame Hatch]155-dame hatch ; [the second]1373-the second , [a tall and beautiful and grave young lady]1374-a tall and beautiful and grave young lady , in a long , embroidered dress could that be [Joanna Sedley]117-joanna ? [[his]76-dick old wood - companion]1375-his old wood - companion , [Jack]128-matcham , whom [he]76-dick had thought to punish with a belt ?

[He]76-dick dropped back again to the top round of the ladder in a kind of amazement . [He]76-dick had never thought of [[his]76-dick sweetheart]1376-his sweetheart as of [so superior a being]1377-so superior a being , and [he]76-dick was instantly taken with a feeling of diffidence . But [he]76-dick had little opportunity for thought . A low " Hist ! "[76-dick] sounded from close by , and [he]76-dick hastened to descend the ladder .

" Who goes ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick whispered .

" [Greensheve]160-greensheve , "[76-dick] came the reply , in tones similarly guarded .

" What want [ye]1231-the outlaw ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" [The house]321-the house is watched , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[1231-the outlaw] returned [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw . " [We]3939-we are not alone to watch it ; for even as [I]1231-the outlaw lay on [my]1231-the outlaw belly on the wall [I]1231-the outlaw saw [men prowling in the dark]3940-men prowling in the dark , and heard [them]3940-men prowling in the dark whistle softly one to the other . "[1231-the outlaw]

" By [my]76-dick sooth , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " but this is passing strange ! Were [they]3940-men prowling in the dark not [men of [Sir Daniel s]3942-sir daniel s]3941-men of sir daniel s ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , [sir]3184-sir , that [they]3940-men prowling in the dark were not , "[160-greensheve] returned [Greensheve]160-greensheve ; " for if [I]160-greensheve have eyes in [my]160-greensheve head , [every man - Jack of [them]3940-men prowling in the dark]3944-every man - jack of them weareth [me]160-greensheve a white badge in [his]3944-every man - jack of them bonnet , something chequered with dark . "[160-greensheve]

" White , chequered with dark , "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick . " Faith , tis a badge [I]76-dick know not . It is none of [this country]3189-this country s badges . Well , an that be so , let [us]3946-we slip as quietly forth from [this garden]3947-this garden as [we]3946-we may ; for here [we]3946-we are in an evil posture for defence . Beyond all question there are [men of]3948-men of [Sir Daniel s]3942-sir daniel s in [that house]3672-that house , and to be taken between two shots is [a beggarman]3951-a beggarman s position . Take [me]76-dick this ladder ; [I]76-dick must leave it where [I]76-dick found it . "[76-dick]

[They]1379-they returned the ladder to [the stable]3349-the stable , and groped [their]1379-they way to the place where [they]1379-they had entered .

[Capper]166-capper had taken [Greensheve]160-greensheve s position on the cope , and now [he]166-capper leaned down [his]166-capper hand , and , first one and then the other , pulled [them]1379-they up .

Cautiously and silently , [they]1379-they dropped again upon the other side ; nor did [they]1379-they dare to speak until [they]1379-they had returned to [[their]1379-they old ambush in [the gorse]875-the gorse]1381-their old ambush in the gorse .

" Now , [John Capper]166-capper , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " back with [you]166-capper to [Shoreby]20-shoreby , even as for [your]166-capper life . Bring [me]1383-i instantly what [men]3205-men [ye]166-capper can collect . Here shall be the rendezvous ; or if [the men]405-the men be scattered and the day be near at hand before [they]405-the men muster , let [the place]3130-the place be something farther back , and by the entering in of [the town]1301-the town . [Greensheve]160-greensheve and [I]1383-i lie here to watch . Speed [ye]166-capper , [John Capper]166-capper , and [the saints]3104-the saints aid [you]166-capper to despatch . And now , [Greensheve]160-greensheve , "[1383-i] [he]1383-i continued , as soon as [Capper]166-capper had departed , " let [thou]3957-thou and [I]1383-i go round about [the garden]3861-the garden in a wide circuit . [I]1383-i would fain see whether thine eyes betrayed [thee]166-capper . "[1383-i]

Keeping well outwards from the wall , and profiting by every height and hollow , [they]1384-they passed about two sides , beholding nothing . On the third side the garden wall was built close upon [the beach]1341-the beach , and to preserve the distance necessary to [their]1384-they purpose , [they]1384-they had to go some way down upon [the sands]1386-the sands . Although the tide was still pretty far out , the surf was so high , and [the sands]1386-the sands so flat , that at each breaker a great sheet of froth and water came careering over the expanse , and [Dick]76-dick and [Greensheve]160-greensheve made this part of [their]1384-they inspection wading , now to the ankles , and now as deep as to the knees , in the salt and icy waters of [the German Ocean]40-the german ocean .

Suddenly , against the comparative whiteness of the garden wall , the figure of [a man]3107-a man was seen , like a faint Chinese shadow , violently signalling with both arms . As [he]3107-a man dropped again to the earth , another arose a little farther on and repeated the same performance . And so , like a silent watch word , these gesticulations made the round of [the beleaguered garden]1389-the beleaguered garden .

" [They]1384-they keep good watch , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick whispered .

" Let [us]1384-they back to [land]3959-land , [good master]3960-good master , "[160-greensheve] answered [Greensheve]160-greensheve . " [We]1384-they stand here too open ; for , look [ye]3960-good master , when the seas break heavy and white out there behind [us]1384-they , [they]1384-they shall see [us]1384-they plainly against the foam . "[160-greensheve]

" [Ye]3960-good master speak sooth , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " Ashore with [us]1384-they , right speedily . "[76-dick]

CHAPTER II [A SKIRMISH IN THE DARK

Thoroughly drenched and chilled]1390-a skirmish in the dark thoroughly drenched and chilled , [the two adventurers]1391-the two adventurers returned to [their]1391-the two adventurers position in [the gorse]875-the gorse .
