This tryst [I]311-the other am not like to keep , but [I]311-the other pray [you]4169-you , of courtesy , to keep it in [my]311-the other stead ; and see that not pleasure , nor pain , tempest , wound , nor pestilence withhold [you]4169-you from the hour and place , for the welfare of [England]22-england lieth upon this cast . "[311-the other]

" [I]76-dick do soberly take this up on [me]76-dick , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " In so far as in [me]76-dick lieth , [your]4169-you purpose shall be done . "[76-dick]

" It is good , "[1005-the wounded man] said [the wounded man]1005-the wounded man . " [[My]1005-the wounded man lord duke]4170-my lord duke shall order [you]4169-you farther , and if [ye]4169-you obey [him]4170-my lord duke with spirit and good will , then is [your]4169-you fortune made . Give [me]1005-the wounded man the lamp a little nearer to [mine]1005-the wounded man eyes , till that [I]1005-the wounded man write these words for [you]4169-you . "[1005-the wounded man]

[He]1005-the wounded man wrote a note " to [[his]4170-my lord duke worshipful kinsman]4171-his worshipful kinsman , [Sir John Hamley]158-hamley ; "[76-dick] and then a second , which [he]1005-the wounded man - left without external superscripture .

" This is for [the duke]3689-the duke , "[1005-the wounded man] [he]1005-the wounded man said . " The word is [England]22-england and [Edward]179-edward , and the counter , [England]22-england and [York]8-york . "[1005-the wounded man]

" And [Joanna]117-joanna , [[my]76-dick lord]3102-my lord ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" Nay , [ye]4169-you must get [Joanna]117-joanna how [ye]4169-you can , "[1354-the baron] replied [the baron]1354-the baron . " [I]1354-the baron have named [you]4169-you for [my]1354-the baron choice in both these letters ; but [ye]4169-you must get [her]117-joanna for [yourself]4169-you , [boy]3344-boy . [I]1354-the baron have tried , as [ye]4169-you see here before [you]4169-you , and have lost [my]1354-the baron life . More could [no man]3113-no man do . "[1354-the baron]

By this time [the wounded man]1005-the wounded man began to be very weary ; and [Dick]76-dick , putting the precious papers in [his]1005-the wounded man bosom , bade [him]1005-the wounded man be of good cheer , and left [him]1005-the wounded man to repose .

The day was beginning to break , cold and blue , with flying squalls of snow . Close under the lee of [the Good Hope]4065-the good hope , [the coast]1802-the coast lay in [alternate rocky headlands]1803-alternate rocky headlands and [sandy bays]1804-sandy bays ; and further inland [the wooded hill - tops of [Tunstall]5-tunstall]1805-the wooded hill - tops of tunstall showed along the sky . Both the wind and [the sea]1479-the sea had gone down ; but [the vessel]1554-the vessel wallowed deep , and scarce rose upon the waves .

[Lawless]132-lawless was still fixed at the rudder ; and by this time nearly all [the men]405-the men had crawled on [deck]1809-deck , and were now gazing , with blank faces , upon [the inhospitable coast]1810-the inhospitable coast .

" Are [we]405-the men going [ashore]602-ashore ? "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick .

" Ay , "[132-lawless] said [Lawless]132-lawless , " unless [we]405-the men get first to the bottom . "[132-lawless]

And just then [the ship]4061-the ship rose so languidly to meet [a sea]1812-a sea , and the water weltered so loudly in [her]4061-the ship hold , that [Dick]76-dick involuntarily seized [the steersman]1766-the steersman by the arm .

" By the mass ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , as the bows of [the Good Hope]172-the good hope reappeared above the foam , " [I]76-dick thought [we]405-the men had foundered , indeed ; [my]76-dick heart was at [my]76-dick throat . "[76-dick]

In the waist , [Greensheve]160-greensheve , [Hawksley]170-hawksley , and [the better men of both companies]1814-the better men of both companies were busy breaking up [the deck]1753-the deck to build [a raft]1816-a raft ; and to these [Dick]76-dick joined [himself]76-dick , working the harder to drown the memory of [his]76-dick predicament . But , even as [he]76-dick worked , every sea that struck [the poor ship]1817-the poor ship , and every one of [her]4061-the ship dull lurches , as [she]4061-the ship tumbled wallowing among the waves , recalled [him]76-dick with a horrid pang to the immediate proximity of death .

Presently , looking up from [his]76-dick work , [he]76-dick saw that [they]1818-us were close in below [a promontory]1819-a promontory ; [a piece of ruinous cliff]1820-a piece of ruinous cliff , against the base of which [the sea]1479-the sea broke white and heavy , almost overplumbed [the deck]1753-the deck ; and , above that , again , [a house]653-a house appeared , crowning a down .

Inside [the bay]1824-the bay the seas ran gayly , raised the Good Hope upon [their]1818-us foam - flecked shoulders , carried [her]4061-the ship beyond the control of [the steersman]1766-the steersman , and in a moment dropped [her]4061-the ship , with a great concussion , on the sand , and began to break over [her]4061-the ship half - mast high , and roll [her]4061-the ship to and fro . Another great wave followed , raised [her]4061-the ship again , and carried [her]4061-the ship yet farther in ; and then a third succeeded , and left [her]4061-the ship far inshore of the more dangerous breakers , wedged upon [a bank]1826-a bank .

" Now , [boys]3334-boys , "[132-lawless] cried [Lawless]132-lawless , " [the saints]3104-the saints have had a care of [us]1818-us , indeed . The tide ebbs ; let [us]1818-us but sit down and drink a cup of wine , and before half an hour [ye]3334-boys may all march [me]132-lawless ashore as safe as on [a bridge]258-a bridge . "[132-lawless]

A barrel was broached , and , sitting in what shelter [they]1818-us could find from the flying snow and spray , [the shipwrecked company]1827-the shipwrecked company handed the cup around , and sought to warm [their]1818-us bodies and restore [their]1818-us spirits .

[Dick]76-dick , meanwhile , returned to [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham , who lay in great perplexity and fear , the floor of [[his]157-lord foxham cabin]562-his cabin washing knee - deep in water , and the lamp , which had been [his]157-lord foxham only light , broken and extinguished by the violence of the blow .

" [[My]74-master shelton lord]3102-my lord , "[74-master shelton] said [young Shelton]74-master shelton , " fear not at all ; [the saints]3104-the saints are plainly for [us]1818-us ; [the seas]4182-the seas have cast [us]1818-us high upon a shoal , and as soon as the tide hath somewhat ebbed , [we]1818-us may walk ashore upon [our]1818-us feet . "[74-master shelton]

It was nearly an hour before [the vessel]1554-the vessel was sufficiently deserted by [the ebbing sea]1830-the ebbing sea ; and [they]1818-us could set forth for [the land]1831-the land , which appeared dimly before [them]1818-us through a veil of driving snow .

Upon [a hillock]1832-a hillock on one side of [their]1818-us way [a party of [men]3205-men]1833-a party of men lay huddled together , suspiciously observing the movements of [the new arrivals]1835-the new arrivals .

" [They]3104-the saints might draw near and offer [us]1818-us some comfort , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick remarked .

" Well , an [they]3104-the saints come not to [us]1818-us , let [us]1818-us even turn aside to [them]3104-the saints , "[170-hawksley] said [Hawksley]170-hawksley . " The sooner [we]1818-us come to a good fire and a dry bed the better for [[my]170-hawksley poor lord]4183-my poor lord . "[170-hawksley]

But [they]1818-us had not moved far in the direction of [the hillock]1836-the hillock , before [the men]405-the men , with one consent , rose suddenly to [their]405-the men feet , and poured a flight of well - directed arrows on [the shipwrecked company]1827-the shipwrecked company .

" Back ! back ! "[1511-his lordship] cried [[his]170-hawksley lordship]1511-his lordship . " Beware , in Heaven s name , that [ye]4184-ye reply not . "[1511-his lordship]

" Nay , "[160-greensheve] cried [Greensheve]160-greensheve , pulling an arrow from [his]160-greensheve leather jack . " [We]1818-us are in no posture to fight , it is certain , being drenching wet , dog - weary , and three - parts frozen ; but , for the love of [old England]22-england , what aileth [them]3104-the saints to shoot thus cruelly on [[their]3104-the saints poor country people]4185-their poor country people in distress ? "[160-greensheve]

" [They]3104-the saints take [us]1818-us to be [French pirates]4186-french pirates , "[157-lord foxham] answered [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " In these most troublesome and degenerate days [we]1818-us can not keep [[our]1818-us own shores of [England]22-england]4187-our own shores of england ; but [[our]1818-us old enemies]4188-our old enemies , whom [we]1818-us once chased on [sea and land]4189-sea and land , do now range at pleasure , robbing and slaughtering and burning . It is the pity and reproach of [this poor land]4190-this poor land . "[157-lord foxham]

[The men]405-the men upon [the hillock]1836-the hillock lay , closely observing [them]405-the men , while [they]405-the men trailed upward from [the beach]1341-the beach and wound inland among [desolate sand - hills]1843-desolate sand - hills ; for a mile or so [they]405-the men even hung upon the rear of the march , ready , at a sign , to pour another volley on [the weary and dispirited fugitives]1844-the weary and dispirited fugitives ; and it was only when , striking at length upon [a firm high - road]1845-a firm high - road , [Dick]76-dick began to call [[his]76-dick men]417-his men to some more martial order , that [these jealous guardians of [the coast of [England]22-england]1848-the coast of england]1847-these jealous guardians of the coast of england silently disappeared among the snow . [They]417-his men had done what [they]417-his men desired ; [they]417-his men had protected [[their]417-his men own homes]1849-their own homes and [farms]1850-farms , [[their]417-his men own families]1851-their own families and cattle ; and [their]417-his men private interest being thus secured , it mattered not the weight of a straw to [any one of [them]417-his men]1852-any one of them , although [the Frenchmen]1853-the frenchmen should carry blood and fire to [every other parish in [the realm of [England]22-england]3352-the realm of england]1854-every other parish in the realm of england .

BOOK IV THE DISGUISE

CHAPTER I THE DEN

[The place where [Dick]76-dick had struck the line of [a high - road]1857-a high - road]1856-the place where dick had struck the line of a high - road was not far from [Holywood]14-holywood , and within nine or ten miles of [Shoreby - on - the - Till]39-shoreby - on - the - till ; and here , after making sure that [they]417-his men were pursued no longer , [the two bodies]1858-the two bodies separated . [[Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s followers]1650-lord foxham s followers departed , carrying [[their]1650-lord foxham s followers wounded master]1860-their wounded master towards the comfort and security of [the great abbey]1861-the great abbey ; and [Dick]76-dick , as [he]76-dick saw [them]1650-lord foxham s followers wind away and disappear in the thick curtain of the falling snow , was left alone with [near upon a dozen outlaws]1862-near upon a dozen outlaws , [the last remainder of [[his]76-dick troop of volunteers]1864-his troop of volunteers]1863-the last remainder of his troop of volunteers .

[Some]3511-some were wounded ; one and all were furious at [their]417-his men ill - success and long exposure ; and though [they]417-his men were now too cold and hungry to do more , [they]417-his men grumbled and cast sullen looks upon [[their]417-his men leaders]1741-their leaders . [Dick]76-dick emptied [his]76-dick purse among [them]417-his men , leaving [himself]76-dick nothing ; thanked [them]417-his men for the courage [they]417-his men had displayed , though [he]76-dick could have found it more readily in [his]76-dick heart to rate [them]417-his men for poltroonery ; and having thus somewhat softened the effect of [his]76-dick prolonged misfortune , despatched [them]417-his men to find [their]417-his men way , either severally or in pairs , to [Shoreby]20-shoreby and [the Goat and Bagpipes]42-the goat and bagpipes .

For [his]76-dick own part , influenced by what [he]76-dick had seen on board of [the Good Hope]172-the good hope , [he]76-dick chose [Lawless]132-lawless to be [[his]76-dick companion]540-his companion on the walk . The snow was falling , without pause or variation , in one even , blinding cloud ; the wind had been strangled , and now blew no longer ; and [the whole world]1868-the whole world was blotted out and sheeted down below that silent inundation . There was great danger of wandering by the way and perishing in drifts ; and [Lawless]132-lawless , keeping half a step in front of [[his]132-lawless companion]540-his companion , and holding [his]132-lawless head forward like a hunting dog upon the scent , inquired [his]132-lawless way of every tree , and studied out [their]1870-their path as though [he]132-lawless were conning [a ship]4059-a ship among dangers .

About a mile into [the forest]246-the forest [they]1870-their came to a place where several ways met , under [a grove of lofty and contorted oaks]1873-a grove of lofty and contorted oaks . Even in the narrow horizon of the falling snow , it was a spot that could not fail to be recognised ; and [Lawless]132-lawless evidently recognised [it]1874-it with particular delight .

" Now , [Master Richard]74-master shelton , "[76-dick] said [he]76-dick , " an [y]74-master shelton are not too proud to be the guest of [a man who is neither [a gentleman by birth nor so much as a good Christian]4192-a gentleman by birth nor so much as a good christian , [I]76-dick can offer [you]74-master shelton a cup of wine and a good fire to melt the marrow in [your]74-master shelton frozen bones]4191-a man who is neither a gentleman by birth nor so much as a good christian , i can offer you a cup of wine and a good fire to melt the marrow in your frozen bones . "[76-dick]

" Lead on , [Will]132-lawless , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " A cup of wine and a good fire ! Nay , [I]76-dick would go a far way round to see them . "[76-dick]

[Lawless]132-lawless turned aside under the bare branches of the grove , and , walking resolutely forward for some time , came to [a steepish hollow or den]1875-a steepish hollow or den , that had now drifted a quarter full of snow . On the verge , a great beech - tree hung , precariously rooted ; and here [the old outlaw , pulling aside some bushy underwood]1876-the old outlaw , pulling aside some bushy underwood , bodily disappeared into [the earth]1496-the earth .

The beech had , in some violent gale , been half - uprooted , and had torn up a considerable stretch of turf and it was under this that [old Lawless]132-lawless had dug out [[his]132-lawless forest]1878-his forest hiding - place . The roots served [him]132-lawless for rafters , the turf was [his]132-lawless thatch ; for walls and floor [he]132-lawless had [[his]132-lawless mother]1879-his mother [the earth]1496-the earth . Rude as it was , the hearth in one corner , blackened by fire , and the presence in another of a large oaken chest well fortified with iron , showed [it]1881-it at one glance to be [the den of [a man]3107-a man]1882-the den of a man , and not the burrow of a digging beast .

Though the snow had drifted at the mouth and sifted in upon the floor of [this earth cavern]1884-this earth cavern , yet was the air much warmer than without ; and when [Lawless]132-lawless had struck a spark , and the dry furze bushes had begun to blaze and crackle on the hearth , [the place]3130-the place assumed , even to the eye , an air of comfort and of [home]699-home .

With a sigh of great contentment , [Lawless]132-lawless spread [his]132-lawless broad hands before the fire , and seemed to breathe the smoke .

" Here , then , "[132-lawless] [he]132-lawless said , " is [this old [Lawless]132-lawless s rabbit - hole]4193-this old lawless s rabbit - hole ; pray [Heaven]162-heaven there come [no terrier]4194-no terrier ! Far [I]132-lawless have rolled hither and thither , and here and about , since that [I]132-lawless was fourteen years of [mine]132-lawless age and first ran away from [[mine]132-lawless abbey]4195-mine abbey , with the sacrist s gold chain and a mass - book that [I]132-lawless sold for four marks . [I]132-lawless have been in [England]22-england and [France]50-france and [Burgundy]51-burgundy , and in [Spain]52-spain , too , on a pilgrimage for [my]132-lawless poor soul ; and upon [the sea]1479-the sea , which is [[no man]3113-no man s country]4198-no man s country . But here is [[my]132-lawless place]4199-my place , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton . This is [[my]132-lawless native land]4200-my native land , this burrow in [the earth]1496-the earth ! Come rain or wind and whether it s April , and the birds all sing , and the blossoms fall about [my]132-lawless bed or whether it s winter , and [I]132-lawless sit alone with [my]132-lawless good gossip the fire , and robin red breast twitters in [the woods]783-the woods here , is [[my]132-lawless church and [market]4204-market]4203-my church and market , and [[my]132-lawless wife]4205-my wife and [child]4206-child . It s here [I]132-lawless come back to , and it s here , so please [the saints]3104-the saints , that [I]132-lawless would like to die . "[132-lawless]

" Tis [a warm corner]4208-a warm corner , to be sure , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , " and a pleasant , and a well hid . "[76-dick]

" It had need to be , "[132-lawless] returned [Lawless]132-lawless , " for an [they]3104-the saints found it , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , it would break [my]132-lawless heart . But [here]742-here , "[132-lawless] [he]132-lawless added , burrowing with [his]132-lawless stout fingers in the sandy floor , " here is [[my]132-lawless wine cellar]4210-my wine cellar ; and [ye]76-dick shall have a flask of excellent strong stingo . "[132-lawless]

Sure enough , after but a little digging , [he]132-lawless produced a big leathern bottle of about a gallon , nearly three - parts full of a very heady and sweet wine ; and when [they]1887-they had drunk to [each other]664-each other comradely , and the fire had been replenished and blazed up again , [the pair]805-the pair lay at full length , thawing and steaming , and divinely warm .

" [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[1231-the outlaw] observed [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw , " [y]76-dick ave had two mischances this last while , and [y]76-dick are like to lose [the maid]4055-the maid do [I]1231-the outlaw take it aright ? "[1231-the outlaw]

" [Aright]180-aright ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , nodding [his]76-dick head .

" Well , now , "[132-lawless] continued [Lawless]132-lawless , " hear [an old fool that hath been nigh - hand everything , and seen nigh - hand all]4212-an old fool that hath been nigh - hand everything , and seen nigh - hand all ! [Ye]76-dick go too much on [other people]4213-other people s errands , [Master Dick]76-dick . [Ye]76-dick go on [Ellis]100-ellis s ; but [he]100-ellis desireth rather the death of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . [Ye]76-dick go on [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s ; well [the saints]3104-the saints preserve [him]100-ellis ! doubtless [he]100-ellis meaneth well . But go [ye]76-dick upon [your]76-dick own , [good Dick]76-dick . Come right to [the maid]4055-the maid s side . Court [her]4055-the maid , lest that [she]4055-the maid forget [you]76-dick . Be ready ; and when the chance shall come , off with [her]4055-the maid at the saddle - bow . "[132-lawless]

" Ay , but , [Lawless]132-lawless , beyond doubt [she]4055-the maid is now in [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s own mansion]4216-sir daniel s own mansion . "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" [Thither]181-thither , then , go [we]4217-we , "[1231-the outlaw] replied [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw .

[Dick]76-dick stared at [him]1231-the outlaw .

" Nay , [I]132-lawless mean it , "[132-lawless] nodded [Lawless]132-lawless . " And if [y]132-lawless are of so little faith , and stumble at a word , see here ! "[132-lawless]

And [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw , taking a key from about [his]1231-the outlaw neck , opened the oak chest , and dipping and groping deep among its contents , produced first [a friar]1893-a friar s robe , and next a girdle of rope ; and then a huge rosary of wood , heavy enough to be counted as a weapon .

" Here , "[1231-the outlaw] [he]1231-the outlaw said , " is for [you]132-lawless . On with [them]4218-them ! "[1231-the outlaw]

And then , when [Dick]76-dick had clothed [himself]76-dick in this clerical disguise , [Lawless]132-lawless produced some colours and a pencil , and proceeded , with the greatest cunning , to disguise [his]132-lawless face . The eyebrows [he]132-lawless thickened and produced ; to the moustache , which was yet hardly visible , [he]132-lawless rendered a like service ; while , by a few lines around the eye , [he]132-lawless changed the expression and increased the apparent age of [this young monk]1894-this young monk .

" Now , "[132-lawless] [he]132-lawless resumed , " when [I]132-lawless have done the like , [we]4219-we shall make [as bonny a pair of friars]4220-as bonny a pair of friars as the eye could wish . Boldly to [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s [we]4219-we shall go , and there be hospitably welcome for the love of [Mother Church]4221-mother church . "[132-lawless]

" And how , [dear Lawless]132-lawless , "[309-the lad] cried [the lad]309-the lad , " shall [I]132-lawless repay [you]132-lawless ? "[132-lawless]

" Tut , [brother]3484-brother , "[1231-the outlaw] replied [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw , " [I]1231-the outlaw do naught but for [my]1231-the outlaw pleasure . Mind not for [me]1231-the outlaw . [I]1231-the outlaw am one , by the mass , that mindeth for [himself]1897-the old rogue . When that [I]1231-the outlaw lack , [I]1231-the outlaw have a long tongue and a voice like the monastery bell [I]1231-the outlaw do ask , [[my]1231-the outlaw son]4223-my son ; and where asking faileth , [I]1231-the outlaw do most usually take . "[1231-the outlaw]

[The old rogue]1897-the old rogue made a humorous grimace ; and although [Dick]76-dick was displeased to lie under so great favours to [so equivocal a personage]1898-so equivocal a personage , [he]76-dick was yet unable to restrain [his]76-dick mirth .

With that , [Lawless]132-lawless returned to the big chest , and was soon similarly disguised ; but , below [his]132-lawless gown , [Dick]76-dick wondered to observe [him]132-lawless conceal a sheaf of black arrows .

" Wherefore do [ye]309-the lad that ? "[309-the lad] asked [the lad]309-the lad . " Wherefore arrows , when [ye]309-the lad take no bow ? "[309-the lad]

" Nay , "[132-lawless] replied [Lawless]132-lawless , lightly , " tis like there will be heads broke not to say backs ere [you]76-dick and [I]132-lawless win sound from where [we]4224-our re going to ; and if any fall , [I]132-lawless would [[our]4224-our fellowship]4225-our fellowship should come by the credit on t. A black arrow , [Master Dick]76-dick , is the seal of [[our]4224-our abbey]4226-our abbey ; it showeth [you]76-dick who writ the bill . "[132-lawless]

" An [ye]309-the lad prepare so carefully , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick have here some papers that , for [mine]76-dick own sake , and the interest of those that trusted [me]76-dick , were better left behind than found upon [my]76-dick body . Where shall [I]76-dick conceal them , Will ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[132-lawless] replied [Lawless]132-lawless , " [I]132-lawless will go forth into the wood and whistle [me]132-lawless three verses of a song ; meanwhile , do [you]76-dick bury them where [ye]76-dick please , and smooth the sand upon [the place]3130-the place . "[132-lawless]

" Never ! "[74-master shelton] cried [Richard]74-master shelton . " [I]74-master shelton trust [you]1743-the old outlaw , [man]3147-man . [I]74-master shelton were base indeed if [I]74-master shelton not trusted [you]1743-the old outlaw . "[74-master shelton]

" [Brother]3484-brother , [y]76-dick are but [a child]3529-a child , "[1743-the old outlaw] replied [the old outlaw]1743-the old outlaw , pausing and turning [his]1743-the old outlaw face upon [Dick]76-dick from the threshold of [the den]1901-the den . " [I]1743-the old outlaw am [a kind old Christian]4231-a kind old christian , and [no traitor to men]4232-no traitor to men s blood , and [no sparer of [mine]1743-the old outlaw own]4233-no sparer of mine own in [a friend]3640-a friend s jeopardy . But , [fool]3472-fool , [child]4206-child , [I]1743-the old outlaw am [a thief by trade and birth and habit]4237-a thief by trade and birth and habit . If [my]1743-the old outlaw bottle were empty and [my]1743-the old outlaw mouth dry , [I]1743-the old outlaw would rob [you]4206-child , [dear child]4238-dear child , as sure as [I]1743-the old outlaw love , honour , and admire [your]4206-child parts and person ! Can it be clearer spoken ? No . "[1743-the old outlaw]

And [he]1743-the old outlaw stumped forth through the bushes with a snap of [his]1743-the old outlaw big fingers .

[Dick]76-dick , thus left alone , after a wondering thought upon the inconsistencies of [his]76-dick companion s character , hastily produced , reviewed , and buried [his]76-dick papers . One only [he]1743-the old outlaw reserved to carry along with [him]1743-the old outlaw , since it in nowise compromised [[his]1743-the old outlaw friends]1787-his friends , and yet might serve [him]1743-the old outlaw , in a pinch , against [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . That was [the knight]438-the knight s own letter to [Lord Wensleydale]159-lord wensleydale , sent by [Throgmorton]148-throgmorton , on the morrow of the defeat at [Risingham]184-lord risingham , and found next day by [Dick]76-dick upon the body of [the messenger]484-the messenger .

Then , treading down the embers of the fire , [Dick]76-dick left [the den]1901-the den , and rejoined [the old outlaw]1743-the old outlaw , who stood awaiting [him]76-dick under the leafless oaks , and was already beginning to be powdered by the falling snow . [Each]685-each looked upon [the other]311-the other , and each laughed , so thorough and so droll was the disguise .

" Yet [I]1231-the outlaw would it were but summer and a clear day , "[1231-the outlaw] grumbled [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw , " that [I]1231-the outlaw might see [myself]1231-the outlaw in the mirror of a pool . There be [many of [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s men]486-sir daniel s men that know [me]1231-the outlaw]4239-many of sir daniel s men that know me ; and if [we]1910-we fell to be recognised , there might be two words for [you]4241-you , [brother]3484-brother , but as for [me]1231-the outlaw , in a paternoster while , [I]1231-the outlaw should be kicking in a rope s - end . "[1231-the outlaw]

Thus [they]1910-we set forth together along [the road]257-the road to [Shoreby]20-shoreby , which , in this part of [its]20-shoreby course , kept near along the margin or [the forest]246-the forest , coming forth , from time to time , in [the open country]1318-the open country , and passing beside [poor folks houses]1914-poor folks houses and [small farms]1915-small farms .

Presently at sight of one of these , [Lawless]132-lawless pulled up .

" [Brother Martin]182-brother martin , "[132-lawless] [he]132-lawless said , in a voice capitally disguised , and suited to [his]132-lawless monkish robe , " let [us]1910-we enter and seek alms from [these poor sinners]4243-these poor sinners . Pax vobiscum ! Ay , "[132-lawless] [he]132-lawless added , in [his]132-lawless own voice , " tis as [I]132-lawless feared ; [I]132-lawless have somewhat lost the whine of it ; and by [your]182-brother martin leave , [good Master Shelton]74-master shelton , [ye]182-brother martin must suffer [me]132-lawless to practise in [these country]4244-these country places , before that [I]132-lawless risk [my]132-lawless fat neck by entering [Sir]72-sir daniel Daniel s. But look [ye]182-brother martin a little , what an excellent thing it is to be [a Jack - of - all - trades]4245-a jack - of - all - trades ! An [I]132-lawless had not been [a shipman]3491-a shipman , [ye]182-brother martin had infallibly gone down in [the Good Hope]4065-the good hope ; an [I]132-lawless had not been [a thief]4125-a thief , [I]132-lawless could not have painted [me]132-lawless [your]182-brother martin face ; and but that [I]132-lawless had been [a Grey Friar , and sung loud in the choir]4249-a grey friar , and sung loud in the choir , and ate hearty at the board , [I]132-lawless could not have carried this disguise , but the very dogs would have spied [us]4250-us out and barked at [us]4250-us for shams . "[132-lawless]

[He]1916-he was by this time close to the window of [the farm]1917-the farm , and [he]1916-he rose on [his]1916-he tip - toes and peeped in .

" Nay , "[1916-he] [he]1916-he cried , " better and better . [We]4250-us shall here try [our]4250-us false faces with a vengeance , and have a merry jest on [Brother Capper]183-brother capper to boot . "[1916-he]

And so saying , [he]1916-he opened the door and led the way into [the house]321-the house .

[Three of [[their]1919-three of their own company own company]1920-their own company]1919-three of their own company sat at the table , greedily eating . [Their]1919-three of their own company daggers , stuck beside [them]1919-three of their own company in the board , and the black and menacing looks which [they]1919-three of their own company continued to shower upon [the people of [the house]321-the house]1921-the people of the house , proved that [they]1919-three of their own company owed [their]1919-three of their own company entertainment rather to force than favour . On [the two monks]1923-the two monks , who now , with a sort of humble dignity , entered [the kitchen of [the farm]1917-the farm]1924-the kitchen of the farm , [they]1923-the two monks seemed to turn with a particular resentment ; and one it was [John Capper]166-capper in person who seemed to play the leading part , instantly and rudely ordered [them]1923-the two monks away .

" [We]1923-the two monks want [no beggars]4251-no beggars [here]742-here ! "[166-capper] [he]166-capper cried .

But another although [he]166-capper was as far from recognising [Dick]76-dick and [Lawless inclined to more moderate counsels]1926-lawless inclined to more moderate counsels .

" Not so , "[166-capper] [he]166-capper cried . " [We]1923-the two monks be [strong men]4253-strong men , and take ; these be weak , and crave ; but in the latter end these shall be uppermost and [we]1923-the two monks below . Mind [him]166-capper not , [[my]166-capper father]3558-my father ; but come , drink of [my]166-capper cup , and give [me]166-capper a benediction . "[166-capper]

" [Y]1923-the two monks are [men of a light mind]4255-men of a light mind , carnal , and accursed , "[1927-the monk] said [the monk]1927-the monk . " Now , may [the saints]3104-the saints forbid that ever [I]1927-the monk should drink with [such companions]4257-such companions ! But here , for the pity [I]1927-the monk bear to [sinners]4258-sinners , here [I]1927-the monk do leave [you]4258-sinners a blessed relic , the which , for [your]4258-sinners soul s interest , [I]1927-the monk bid [you]4258-sinners kiss and cherish . "[1927-the monk]

So far [Lawless]132-lawless thundered upon [them]1928-we like [a preaching friar]1929-a preaching friar ; but with these words [he]132-lawless drew from under [his]132-lawless robe a black arrow , tossed it on the board in front of [the three startled outlaws]1930-the three startled outlaws , turned in the same instant , and , taking [Dick]76-dick along with [him]132-lawless , was out of [the room]430-the room and out of sight among the falling snow before [they]1928-we had time to utter a word or move a finger .

" So , "[132-lawless] [he]132-lawless said , " [we]1928-we have proved [our]1928-we false faces , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton . [I]132-lawless will now adventure [my]132-lawless poor carcase where [ye]1928-we please . "[132-lawless]

" Good ! "[74-master shelton] returned [Richard]74-master shelton . " It irks [me]74-master shelton to be doing . Set [we]1928-we on for [Shoreby]167-mary ! "[74-master shelton]

CHAPTER II " IN [MINE]72-sir daniel ENEMIES HOUSE "[132-lawless]

[[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s residence in [Shoreby]20-shoreby]1932-sir daniel s residence in shoreby was [a tall , commodious , plastered mansion , framed in carven oak , and covered by a low - pitched roof of thatch]1933-a tall , commodious , plastered mansion , framed in carven oak , and covered by a low - pitched roof of thatch . To the back there stretched [a garden]654-a garden , full of fruit - trees , alleys , and thick arbours , and overlooked from the far end by [the tower of [the abbey church]1936-the abbey church]1935-the tower of the abbey church .

[The house]321-the house might contain , upon a pinch , the retinue of [a greater person]1938-a greater person than [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ; but even now [it]321-the house was filled with hubbub . [The court]950-the court rang with arms and horseshoe - iron ; [the kitchens]1940-the kitchens roared with cookery like a bees -hive ; [minstrels]1941-minstrels , and [the players of instruments , and the cries of tumblers]1942-the players of instruments , and the cries of tumblers , sounded from [the hall]989-the hall . [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , in [his]72-sir daniel profusion , in the gaiety and gallantry of [[his]72-sir daniel establishment]1944-his establishment , rivalled with [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby , and eclipsed [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham .

[All guests]1945-all guests were made welcome . [Minstrels]1941-minstrels , [tumblers]1947-tumblers , [players of chess]1948-players of chess , [the sellers of relics , medicines , perfumes , and enchantments]1949-the sellers of relics , medicines , perfumes , and enchantments , and along with these every sort of [priest]1950-priest , [friar]1951-friar , or [pilgrim]1952-pilgrim , were made welcome to the lower table , and slept together in [the ample lofts]1953-the ample lofts , or on the bare boards of [the long dining - hall]1954-the long dining - hall .

On the afternoon following the wreck of [the Good Hope]4065-the good hope , the buttery , [the kitchens]1940-the kitchens , [the stables]1363-the stables , [the covered cartshed that surrounded two sides of [the court]950-the court]1958-the covered cartshed that surrounded two sides of the court , were all crowded by [idle people]1960-idle people , partly belonging to [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s establishment]1961-sir daniel s establishment , and attired in [his]72-sir daniel livery of murrey and blue , [partly nondescript strangers attracted to [the town]1301-the town by greed , and received by [the knight]438-the knight]1962-partly nondescript strangers attracted to the town by greed , and received by the knight through policy , and because it was the fashion of the time .

The snow , which still fell without interruption , the extreme chill of the air , and the approach of night , combined to keep [them]1965-them under shelter . Wine , ale , and money were all plentiful ; many sprawled gambling in the straw of [the barn]1966-the barn , many were still drunken from the noontide meal . To the eye of a modern it would have looked like the sack of [a city]1967-a city ; to the eye of [a contemporary]1968-a contemporary it was like [any other rich and noble household at a festive season]1969-any other rich and noble household at a festive season .

[Two monks a young and an old]1970-two monks a young and an old had arrived late , and were now warming [themselves]1970-two monks a young and an old at a bonfire in a corner of [the shed]1638-the shed . [A mixed crowd]1972-a mixed crowd surrounded [them]1970-two monks a young and an old [jugglers]1973-jugglers , [mountebanks]1974-mountebanks , and [soldiers]3887-soldiers ; and with these [the elder of the two]1976-the elder of the two had soon engaged so brisk a conversation , and exchanged so many loud guffaws and country witticisms , that [the group]267-the group momentarily increased in number .

[The younger companion]1978-the younger companion , in whom [the reader]1979-the reader has already recognised [Dick Shelton]76-dick , sat from the first somewhat backward , and gradually drew [himself]1978-the younger companion away . [He]1978-the younger companion listened , indeed , closely , but [he]1978-the younger companion opened not [his]1978-the younger companion mouth ; and by the grave expression of [his]1978-the younger companion countenance , [he]1978-the younger companion made but little account of [[his]1978-the younger companion companion]540-his companion s pleasantries .

At last [his]1978-the younger companion eye , which travelled continually to and fro , and kept a guard upon all the entrances of [the house]321-the house , lit upon a little procession entering by the main gate and crossing [the court]950-the court in an oblique direction . [Two ladies , muffled in thick furs]1983-two ladies , muffled in thick furs , led the way , and were followed by [a pair of waiting - women]1984-a pair of waiting - women and [four stout men - at - arms]1985-four stout men - at - arms . The next moment [they]1983-two ladies , muffled in thick furs had disappeared within [the house]321-the house ; and [Dick]76-dick , slipping through [the crowd of loiterers in [the shed]1638-the shed]1987-the crowd of loiterers in the shed , was already giving hot pursuit .

" The taller of these twain was [Lady Brackley]185-lady brackley , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick thought ; " and where [Lady Brackley]185-lady brackley is , [Joan]117-joanna will not be far . "[76-dick]

At the door of [the house]321-the house [the four men - at - arms]1990-the four men - at - arms had ceased to follow , and [the ladies]1991-the ladies were now mounting the stairway of polished oak , under no better escort than that of [the two waiting - women]1992-the two waiting - women . [Dick]76-dick followed close behind . It was already the dusk of the day ; and in [the house]321-the house the darkness of the night had almost come . On [the stair - landings]1994-the stair - landings , torches flared in iron holders ; down [the long , tapestried corridors]1995-the long , tapestried corridors , a lamp burned by every door . And where the door stood open , [Dick]76-dick could look in upon arras - covered walls and rush - bescattered floors , glowing in the light of the wood fires .

[Two floors]1996-two floors were passed , and at every landing [the younger and shorter of [the two ladies]1998-the two ladies]1997-the younger and shorter of the two ladies had looked back keenly at [the monk]1927-the monk . [He]76-dick , keeping [his]76-dick eyes lowered , and affecting the demure manners that suited [his]76-dick disguise , had but seen [her]1997-the younger and shorter of the two ladies once , and was unaware that [he]76-dick had attracted [her]1997-the younger and shorter of the two ladies attention . And now , on [the third floor]2000-the third floor , [the party]282-the party separated , [the younger lady]2002-the younger lady continuing to ascend alone , the other , followed by [the waiting - maids]2003-the waiting - maids , descending [the corridor]1130-the corridor to the right .

[Dick]76-dick mounted with a swift foot , and holding to the corner , thrust forth [his]76-dick head and followed [the three women]2005-the three women with [his]76-dick eyes . Without turning or looking behind [them]2005-the three women , [they]2005-the three women continued to descend [the corridor]1130-the corridor .

" It is right well , "[76-dick] thought [Dick]76-dick . " Let [me]76-dick but know [[my]76-dick Lady]1030-my lady [[Brackley]185-lady brackley s chamber]4260-brackley s chamber , and it will go hard an [I]76-dick find not [Dame Hatch]155-dame hatch upon an errand . "[76-dick]

And just then a hand was laid upon [his]76-dick shoulder , and , with a bound and a choked cry , [he]76-dick turned to grapple [[his]76-dick assailant]827-his assailant .

[He]76-dick was somewhat abashed to find , in [the person whom [he]76-dick had so roughly seized]2008-the person whom he had so roughly seized , [the short young lady in the furs]2009-the short young lady in the furs . [She]2009-the short young lady in the furs , on [her]2009-the short young lady in the furs part , was shocked and terrified beyond expression , and hung trembling in [his]76-dick grasp .

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , releasing [her]2009-the short young lady in the furs , " [I]76-dick cry [you]4261-madam a thousand pardons ; but [I]76-dick have no eyes behind , and , by the mass , [I]76-dick could not tell [ye]4261-madam were [a maid]3386-a maid . "[76-dick]

[The girl]1127-the girl continued to look at [him]76-dick , but , by this time , terror began to be succeeded by surprise , and surprise by suspicion . [Dick]76-dick , who could read these changes on [her]2009-the short young lady in the furs face , became alarmed for [his]76-dick own safety in [that hostile house]2011-that hostile house .

" [Fair maid]4263-fair maid , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , affecting easiness , " suffer [me]76-dick to kiss [your]4263-fair maid hand , in token [ye]4263-fair maid forgive [my]76-dick roughness , and [I]76-dick will even go . "[76-dick]

" [Y]76-dick are [a strange monk]4264-a strange monk , [young sir]4265-young sir , "[2012-the young lady] returned [the young lady]2012-the young lady , looking [him]76-dick both boldly and shrewdly in the face ; " and now that [my]2012-the young lady first astonishment hath somewhat passed away , [I]2012-the young lady can spy [the layman]4266-the layman in each word [you]4263-fair maid utter . What do [ye]4263-fair maid here ? Why are [ye]4263-fair maid thus sacrilegiously tricked out ? Come [ye]4263-fair maid in peace or war ? And why spy [ye]4263-fair maid after [Lady Brackley]185-lady brackley like [a thief]4125-a thief ? "[2012-the young lady]

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] quoth [Dick]76-dick , " of one thing [I]76-dick pray [you]4261-madam to be very sure : [I]76-dick am [no thief]4269-no thief . And even if [I]76-dick come here in war , as in some degree [I]76-dick do , [I]76-dick make no war upon [fair maids]4270-fair maids , and [I]76-dick hereby entreat [them]4270-fair maids to copy [me]76-dick so far , and to leave [me]76-dick be . For , indeed , [fair mistress]4271-fair mistress , cry out if such be [your]4261-madam pleasure cry but once , and say what [ye]4261-madam have seen , and [the poor gentleman]4272-the poor gentleman before [you]4261-madam is merely [a dead man]3791-a dead man . [I]76-dick can not think [ye]4261-madam would be cruel , "[76-dick] added [Dick]76-dick ; and taking [the girl]1127-the girl s hand gently in both of [his]76-dick , [he]76-dick looked at [her]1127-the girl with courteous admiration .

" Are [ye]4261-madam , then , [a spy]4274-a spy [a Yorkist]4275-a yorkist ? "[4055-the maid] asked [the maid]4055-the maid .

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick replied , " [I]76-dick am indeed [a Yorkist]4275-a yorkist , and , in some sort , [a spy]4274-a spy . But that which bringeth [me]76-dick into [this house]3790-this house , the same which will win for [me]76-dick the pity and interest of [your]4261-madam kind heart , is neither of [York]8-york nor [Lancaster]7-lancaster . [I]76-dick will wholly put [my]76-dick life in [your]4261-madam discretion . [I]76-dick am [a lover]4280-a lover , and [my]76-dick name "[76-dick]

But here [the young lady]2012-the young lady clapped [her]2012-the young lady hand suddenly upon [Dick]76-dick s mouth , looked hastily up and down and east and west , and , seeing [the coast]1802-the coast clear , began to drag [the young man]2017-the young man , with great strength and vehemence , up - stairs .

" Hush ! "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady said , " and come ! Shalt talk hereafter . "[2012-the young lady]

Somewhat bewildered , [Dick]76-dick suffered [himself]76-dick to be pulled up - [stairs]2018-stairs , bustled along [a corridor]2019-a corridor , and thrust suddenly into [a chamber , lit , like so many of the others]2020-a chamber , lit , like so many of the others , by a blazing log upon the hearth .

" Now , "[2012-the young lady] said [the young lady]2012-the young lady , forcing [him]76-dick down upon a stool , " sit [ye]76-dick there and attend [[my]2012-the young lady sovereign]4281-my sovereign good pleasure . "[2012-the young lady]

And with these words , [she]2022-her whipped out of [the room]430-the room and left [Dick]76-dick gaping with wonder , and not very sure if [he]76-dick were dreaming or awake .

" Ta en [my]76-dick belt to [her]2022-her ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick repeated . " Ta en [my]76-dick belt to [her]2022-her ! "[76-dick] And the recollection of that evening in [the forest]246-the forest flowed back upon [his]76-dick mind , and [he]76-dick once more saw [Matcham]128-matcham s wincing body and beseeching eyes .

And then [he]76-dick was recalled to the dangers of the present . In [the next room]2025-the next room [he]76-dick heard a stir , as of [a person]2026-a person moving ; then followed a sigh , which sounded strangely near ; and then the rustle of skirts and tap of feet once more began . As [he]76-dick stood hearkening , [he]76-dick saw the arras wave along the wall ; there was the sound of a door being opened , the hangings divided , and , lamp in hand , [Joanna Sedley]117-joanna entered [the apartment]1077-the apartment .

[She]117-joanna was attired in costly stuffs of deep and warm colours , such as befit the winter and the snow . Upon [her]117-joanna head , [her]117-joanna hair had been gathered together and became [her]117-joanna as a crown . And [she]117-joanna , who had seemed so little and so awkward in the attire of [Matcham]128-matcham , was now tall like a young willow , and swam across the floor as though [she]117-joanna scorned the drudgery of walking .

Without a start , without a tremor , [she]117-joanna raised [her]117-joanna lamp and looked at [the young monk]2028-the young monk .

" What make [ye]2028-the young monk [here]742-here , [good brother]4285-good brother ? "[117-joanna] [she]117-joanna inquired . " [Ye]2028-the young monk are doubtless ill - directed . Whom do [ye]2028-the young monk require ? And [she]117-joanna set [her]117-joanna lamp upon the bracket .[117-joanna]

So [they]2033-they ran on , holding each other by both hands , exchanging smiles and lovely looks , and melting minutes into seconds ; and so [they]2033-they might have continued all night long . " What ails [ye]76-dick at [my]2036-the lady face , [fair sir]3992-fair sir ? " Hide [me]76-dick , then , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " put [me]76-dick behind the arras , shut [me]76-dick in a chest , or what [ye]117-joanna will , so that [I]76-dick may be here on [your]117-joanna return . "[76-dick]

At this [the young lady]2012-the young lady melted ; and when , a little after , the bell summoned [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s household]2041-sir daniel s household to the board , [Dick]76-dick was planted very stiffly against the wall , at a place where a division in the tapestry permitted [him]76-dick to breathe the more freely , and even to see into [the room]430-the room .

[He]76-dick had not been long in this position , when [he]76-dick was somewhat strangely disturbed . The silence , in [that upper storey of [the house]321-the house]2043-that upper storey of the house , was only broken by the flickering of the flames and the hissing of a green log in the chimney ; but presently , to [Dick]76-dick s strained hearing , there came the sound of [some one]3814-some one walking with extreme precaution ; and soon after the door opened , and [a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow , in [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby s colours , pushed first [his]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow head , and then [his]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow crooked body , into [the chamber]1111-the chamber . [His]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow mouth was open , as though to hear the better ; and [his]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow eyes , which were very bright , flitted restlessly and swiftly to and fro . [He]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow went round and round [the room]430-the room , striking here and there upon the hangings ; but [Dick]76-dick , by a miracle , escaped [his]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow notice . Then [he]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow looked below the furniture , and examined the lamp ; and , at last , with an air of cruel disappointment , was preparing to go away as silently as [he]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow had come , when down [he]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow dropped upon [his]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow knees , picked up something from among the rushes on the floor , examined it , and , with every signal of delight , concealed it in the wallet at [his]2046-a little black - faced , dwarfish fellow belt .

[Dick]76-dick s heart sank , for the object in question was a tassel from [his]76-dick own girdle ; and it was plain to [him]76-dick that [this dwarfish spy]2049-this dwarfish spy , who took a malign delight in [his]2049-this dwarfish spy employment , would lose no time in bearing it to [[his]2049-this dwarfish spy master]292-his master , [the baron]1354-the baron . [He]76-dick was half - tempted to throw aside the arras , fall upon [the scoundrel]2052-the scoundrel , and , at the risk of [his]76-dick life , remove the telltale token . And while [he]76-dick was still hesitating , a new cause of concern was added . A voice , hoarse and broken by drink , began to be audible from the stair ; and presently after , uneven , wandering , and heavy footsteps sounded without along [the passage]1107-the passage .

" What make [ye]76-dick here , [[my]132-lawless merry men]3480-my merry men , among the greenwood shaws ? "[132-lawless] sang the voice . " What make [ye]76-dick here ? Hey ! sots , what make [ye]76-dick here ? "[132-lawless] it added , with a rattle of drunken laughter ; and then , once more breaking into song :

" If [ye]76-dick should drink the clary wine , [Fat Friar John]186-fat friar john , [[ye]76-dick friend o [mine]132-lawless]4313-ye friend o mine If [I]132-lawless should eat , and [ye]76-dick should drink , Who shall sing the mass , d [ye]76-dick think ? "[132-lawless]

[Lawless]132-lawless , alas ! rolling drunk , was wandering [the house]321-the house , seeking for a corner wherein to slumber off the effect of [his]132-lawless potations . [Dick]76-dick inwardly raged . [The spy]2055-the spy , at first terrified , had grown reassured as [he]2055-the spy found [he]2055-the spy had to deal with [an intoxicated man]2056-an intoxicated man , and now , with a movement of cat - like rapidity , slipped from [the chamber]1111-the chamber , and was gone from [Richard]74-master shelton s eyes .

What was to be done ? If [he]2055-the spy lost touch of [Lawless]132-lawless for the night , [he]2055-the spy was left impotent , whether to plan or carry forth [Joanna]117-joanna s rescue . If , on the other hand , [he]2055-the spy dared to address [the drunken outlaw]2058-the drunken outlaw , [the spy]2055-the spy might still be lingering within sight , and the most fatal consequences ensue .

It was , nevertheless , upon this last hazard that [Dick]76-dick decided . Slipping from behind the tapestry , [he]76-dick stood ready in the doorway of [the chamber]1111-the chamber , with a warning hand upraised . [Lawless]132-lawless , flushed crimson , with [his]132-lawless eyes injected , vacillating on [his]132-lawless feet , drew still unsteadily nearer . At last [he]76-dick hazily caught sight of [[his]76-dick commander]1579-his commander , and , in despite of [Dick]76-dick s imperious signals , hailed [him]1579-his commander instantly and loudly by [his]76-dick name .

[Dick]76-dick leaped upon and shook [the drunkard]2062-the drunkard furiously .

" [Beast]187-beast ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick hissed " beast and [no man]3113-no man ! It is worse than treachery to be so witless . [We]2064-they may all be shent for [thy]76-dick sotting . "[76-dick]

[But Lawless]132-lawless only laughed and staggered , and tried to clap [young Shelton]74-master shelton on the back .

And just then [Dick]76-dick s quick ear caught a rapid brushing in the arras . [He]76-dick leaped towards the sound , and the next moment a piece of the wall - hanging had been torn down , and [Dick]76-dick and [the spy]2055-the spy were sprawling together in its folds . Over and over [they]2064-they rolled , grappling for each other s throat , and still baffled by the arras , and still silent in [their]2064-they deadly fury . But [Dick]76-dick was by much the stronger , and soon [the spy]2055-the spy lay prostrate under [his]76-dick knee , and , with a single stroke of the long poniard , ceased to breathe .

CHAPTER III [THE DEAD SPY]2066-the dead spy

Throughout this furious and rapid passage , [Lawless]132-lawless had looked on helplessly , and even when all was over , and [Dick]76-dick , already re - arisen to [his]76-dick feet , was listening with the most passionate attention to the distant bustle in [the lower storeys of [the house]321-the house]2067-the lower storeys of the house , [the old outlaw]1743-the old outlaw was still wavering on [his]1743-the old outlaw legs like a shrub in a breeze of wind , and still stupidly staring on the face of [the dead man]1212-the dead man .

" It is well , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , at length ; " [they]2064-they have not heard [us]2064-they , praise [the saints]3104-the saints ! But , now , what shall [I]76-dick do with [this poor spy]4316-this poor spy ? At least , [I]76-dick will take [my]76-dick tassel from [his]4316-this poor spy wallet . "[76-dick]

So saying , [Dick]76-dick opened the wallet ; within [he]76-dick found a few pieces of money , the tassel , and a letter addressed to [Lord Wensleydale]159-lord wensleydale , and sealed with [my]0-i [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby s seal . The name awoke [Dick]76-dick s recollection ; and [he]76-dick instantly broke the wax and read the contents of the letter . It was short , but , to [Dick]76-dick s delight , it gave evident proof that [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby was treacherously corresponding with [the House of [York]8-york]53-the house of york .

[The young fellow]2071-the young fellow usually carried [his]2071-the young fellow ink - horn and implements about [him]2071-the young fellow , and so now , bending a knee beside the body of [the dead spy]2066-the dead spy , [he]2071-the young fellow was able to write these words upon a corner of the paper :

[[My]0-i Lord of [Shoreby]143-lord shoreby]2073-my lord of shoreby , [ye]2073-my lord of shoreby that writt the letter , wot [ye]2073-my lord of shoreby why [[your]2073-my lord of shoreby man]2074-your man is ded ? But let [me]0-i rede [you]2073-my lord of shoreby , marry not .

[Jon Amend]106-jon amend - All .

[He]2071-the young fellow laid this paper on the breast of the corpse ; and then [Lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence , suddenly drew a black arrow from below [his]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence robe , and therewith pinned the paper in its place . The sight of this disrespect , or , as it almost seemed , cruelty to the dead , drew a cry of horror from [young Shelton]74-master shelton ; but [the old outlaw]1743-the old outlaw only laughed .

" Nay , [I]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence will have the credit for [mine]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence order , "[2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence] [he]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence hiccupped . " [[My]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence jolly boys]4317-my jolly boys must have the credit on t the credit , [brother]3484-brother ; "[2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence] and then , shutting [his]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence eyes tight and opening [his]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence mouth like [a precentor]2077-a precentor , [he]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence began to thunder , in a formidable voice :

" If [ye]74-master shelton should drink the clary wine "[2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence]

" Peace , sot ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , and thrust [him]2075-lawless , who had been looking on upon these last manoeuvres with some flickering returns of intelligence hard against the wall . " In two words if so be that [such a man]4319-such a man can understand [me]76-dick who hath more wine than wit in [him]4319-such a man in two words , and , a - [Mary]167-mary s name , begone out of [this house]3790-this house , where , if [ye]74-master shelton continue to abide , [ye]74-master shelton will not only hang [yourself]74-master shelton , but [me]76-dick also ! Faith , then , up foot ! be yare , or , by the mass , [I]76-dick may forget that [I]76-dick am in [some sort [[your]74-master shelton captain]3983-your captain and in some [[your]74-master shelton debtor]4323-your debtor]4321-some sort your captain and in some your debtor ! [The sham monk]2078-the sham monk was now , in some degree , recovering the use of [his]2078-the sham monk intelligence ; and the ring in [Dick]76-dick s voice , and the glitter in [Dick]76-dick s eye , stamped home the meaning of [his]2078-the sham monk words .

" By the mass , "[132-lawless] cried [Lawless]132-lawless , " an [I]132-lawless be not wanted , [I]132-lawless can go ; "[132-lawless] and [he]132-lawless turned tipsily along [the corridor]1130-the corridor and proceeded to flounder down [- stairs]2080-- stairs , lurching against the wall .

So soon as [he]132-lawless was out of sight , [Dick]76-dick returned to [his]132-lawless hiding - place , resolutely fixed to see the matter out . [Wisdom]188-wisdom , indeed , moved [him]132-lawless to be gone ; but love and curiosity were stronger .

Time passed slowly for [the young man]2017-the young man , bolt upright behind [the arras]2082-the arras . The fire in [the room]430-the room began to die down , and the lamp to burn low and to smoke . And still there was no word of the return of [any one]1365-any one to [these upper quarters of [the house]321-the house]2085-these upper quarters of the house ; still the faint hum and clatter of the supper party sounded from far below ; and still , under the thick fall of the snow , [Shoreby town]1667-shoreby town lay silent upon every side .

At length , however , feet and voices began to draw near upon the stair ; and presently after [several of [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s guests]2089-sir daniel s guests]2088-several of sir daniel s guests arrived upon [the landing]2090-the landing , and , turning down [the corridor]1130-the corridor , beheld the torn arras and the body of [the spy]2055-the spy .

[Some]3511-some ran forward and [some back]2094-some back , and [all together]2095-all together began to cry aloud .

At the sound of [their]2095-all together cries , [guests]2096-guests , [men - at - arms]2097-men - at - arms , [ladies]2098-ladies , [servants]2099-servants , and , in a word , all [the inhabitants of that great house]2100-the inhabitants of that great house , came flying from every direction , and began to join [their]2095-all together voices to the tumult .

Soon a way was cleared , and [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel came forth in person , followed by [the bridegroom of the morrow]2101-the bridegroom of the morrow , [[my]0-i [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby]2102-my lord shoreby .

" [[My]72-sir daniel lord]3102-my lord , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " have [I]72-sir daniel not told [you]3102-my lord of this knave Black Arrow ? To the proof , behold it ! " In good sooth , it was [a man of mine]4327-a man of mine , "[143-lord shoreby] replied [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby , hanging back . " [I]143-lord shoreby would [I]143-lord shoreby had more such . [He]4327-a man of mine was keen as [a beagle and secret as a mole]4328-a beagle and secret as a mole . "[143-lord shoreby]

" Ay , gossip , truly ? "[72-sir daniel] asked [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , keenly . " And what came [he]4327-a man of mine smelling up so many stairs in [[my]72-sir daniel poor mansion]4329-my poor mansion ? But [he]4327-a man of mine will smell no more . "[72-sir daniel]

" An t please [you]72-sir daniel , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , "[3600-one] said [one]3600-one , " here is a paper written upon with some matter , pinned upon [his]4327-a man of mine breast . "[3600-one]

Tis like a sickness it still hangeth , hangeth upon the limbs . But let [us]4331-us see what [they]4332-they have written . It is as [I]438-the knight thought , [[my]438-the knight lord]3102-my lord ; y are marked , like an old oak , by [the woodman]4334-the woodman ; to - morrow or next day , by will come the axe . But what wrote [ye]72-sir daniel in a letter ? "[438-the knight]

[Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby snatched the paper from the arrow , read it , crumpled it between [his]143-lord shoreby hands , and , overcoming the reluctance which had hitherto withheld [him]143-lord shoreby from approaching , threw [himself]143-lord shoreby on [his]143-lord shoreby knees beside the body and eagerly groped in the wallet .

[He]143-lord shoreby rose to [his]143-lord shoreby feet with a somewhat unsettled countenance .

" Gossip , "[143-lord shoreby] [he]143-lord shoreby said , " [I]143-lord shoreby have indeed lost a letter here that much imported ; and could [I]143-lord shoreby lay [my]143-lord shoreby hand upon the knave that took it , [he]143-lord shoreby should incontinently grace a halter . [Sentinels]2105-sentinels were posted close around [the house]321-the house and [garden]2107-garden ; [a sentinel on every landing of the stair]2108-a sentinel on every landing of the stair , [a whole troop]2109-a whole troop in [the main entrance - hall]2110-the main entrance - hall ; and yet another about the bonfire in [the shed]1638-the shed . [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s followers]2112-sir daniel s followers were supplemented by [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby s ; there was thus no lack of [men]3205-men or weapons to make [the house]321-the house secure , or to entrap [a lurking enemy]2115-a lurking enemy , should [one]3600-one be there .

Meanwhile , the body of [the spy]2055-the spy was carried out through the falling snow and deposited in [the abbey church]1936-the abbey church .

It was not until these dispositions had been taken , and all had returned to a decorous silence , that [the two girls]2119-the two girls drew [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton from [his]74-master shelton place of concealment , and made a full report to [him]74-master shelton of what had passed . [He]74-master shelton , upon [his]74-master shelton side , recounted the visit of [the spy]2055-the spy , [his]74-master shelton dangerous discovery , and speedy end .

[Joanna]117-joanna leaned back very faint against the curtained wall .

"[2121-her friend]

" Truly , "[76-dick] said [he]76-dick , " [we]4337-we are in straits . Yet , could [I]76-dick but win out of [this house]3790-this house for half an hour , [I]76-dick do honestly tell [myself]76-dick that all might still go well ; and for the marriage , it should be prevented . "[76-dick]

[Dick]76-dick passed [the first sentry]2126-the first sentry with so assured a countenance that [the fellow]677-the fellow merely figeted and stared ; but at the second landing [the man]3175-the man carried [his]3175-the man spear across and bade [him]3175-the man name [his]3175-the man business .

" Like enough , "[1236-the sentry] returned [the sentry]1236-the sentry ; " but to go alone is not permitted [you]76-dick .
