At the foot of [the stair]2130-the stair [he]76-dick found [the guard]2131-the guard afoot and awaiting [his]76-dick arrival ; and when [he]76-dick had once more repeated [his]76-dick story , [the commander of the post]1233-the commander of the post ordered [four men]1331-four men out to accompany [him]76-dick to [the church]262-the church .

" Let [him]76-dick not slip , [[my]1236-the sentry lads]3658-my lads , "[1236-the sentry] [he]1236-the sentry said . " Bring [him]76-dick to [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , on [your]3658-my lads lives ! "[1236-the sentry]

The door was then opened ; [one of [the men]405-the men]693-one of the men took [Dick]76-dick by either arm , another marched ahead with a link , and [the fourth , with bent bow and the arrow on the string]2137-the fourth , with bent bow and the arrow on the string , brought up the rear . In this order [they]405-the men proceeded through [the garden]3861-the garden , under the thick darkness of the night and the scattering snow , and drew near to the dimly - illuminated windows of [the abbey church]1936-the abbey church .

At the western portal a picket of [archers]3503-archers stood , taking what shelter [they]405-the men could find in the hollow of the arched doorways , and all powdered with the snow ; and it was not until [[Dick]76-dick s conductors]2141-dick s conductors had exchanged a word with these , that [they]405-the men were suffered to pass forth and enter [the nave of [the sacred edifice]2143-the sacred edifice]2142-the nave of the sacred edifice .

[The church]262-the church was doubtfully lighted by the tapers upon the great altar , and by a lamp or two that swung from the arched roof before [the private chapels of [illustrious families]2146-illustrious families]2145-the private chapels of illustrious families . In the midst of [the choir]2147-the choir [the dead spy]2066-the dead spy lay , [his]2066-the dead spy limbs piously composed , upon a bier .

A hurried mutter of prayer sounded along the arches ; [cowled figures]2149-cowled figures knelt in the stalls of [the choir]2147-the choir , and on the steps of [the high altar]2151-the high altar [a priest in pontifical vestments]2152-a priest in pontifical vestments celebrated mass .

Upon this fresh entrance , [one of [the cowled figures]2154-the cowled figures]2153-one of the cowled figures arose , and , coming down the steps which elevated the level of [the choir]2147-the choir above that of [the nave]2156-the nave , demanded from [the leader of [the four men]2158-the four men]2157-the leader of the four men what business brought [him]2157-the leader of the four men to [the church]262-the church . Out of respect for the service and [the dead]2160-the dead , [they]2158-the four men spoke in guarded tones ; but the echoes of [that huge , empty building]2161-that huge , empty building caught up [their]2158-the four men words , and hollowly repeated and repeated them along [the aisles]2162-the aisles .

" [A monk]4357-a monk ! "[73-sir oliver] returned [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver for [he]73-sir oliver it was , when [he]73-sir oliver had heard the report of [the archer]3173-the archer . " [[My]73-sir oliver brother]4358-my brother , [I]73-sir oliver looked not for [your]4358-my brother coming , "[73-sir oliver] [he]73-sir oliver added , turning to [young Shelton]74-master shelton . " In all civility , who are [ye]4358-my brother ? and at whose instance do [ye]4358-my brother join [your]4358-my brother supplications to [ours]4359-ours ? "[73-sir oliver]

[Dick]76-dick , keeping [his]76-dick cowl about [his]76-dick face , signed to [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver to move a pace or two aside from [the archers]2164-the archers ; and , so soon as [the priest]338-the priest had done so , " [I]73-sir oliver can not hope to deceive [you]73-sir oliver , [sir]3184-sir , "[73-sir oliver] [he]73-sir oliver said . " [My]73-sir oliver life is in [your]73-sir oliver hands . "[73-sir oliver]

[Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver violently started ; [his]73-sir oliver stout cheeks grew pale , and for a space [he]73-sir oliver was silent .

" [Richard]74-master shelton , "[73-sir oliver] [he]73-sir oliver said , " what brings [you]74-master shelton [here]742-here , [I]73-sir oliver know not ; but [I]73-sir oliver much misdoubt it to be evil . Nevertheless , for the kindness that was , [I]73-sir oliver would not willingly deliver [you]74-master shelton to harm . [Ye]74-master shelton shall sit all night beside [me]73-sir oliver in [the stalls]4362-the stalls : [ye]74-master shelton shall sit there till [[my]73-sir oliver Lord of [Shoreby]191-lady shoreby]2073-my lord of shoreby be married , and [the party]282-the party gone safe [home]699-home ; and if all goeth well , and [ye]74-master shelton have planned no evil , in the end [ye]74-master shelton shall go whither [ye]74-master shelton will . But if [your]74-master shelton purpose be bloody , it shall return upon [your]74-master shelton head . Amen ! "[73-sir oliver]

And [the priest]338-the priest devoutly crossed [himself]338-the priest , and turned and louted to the altar .

With that , [he]338-the priest spoke a few words more to [the soldiers]470-the soldiers , and taking [Dick]76-dick by the hand , led [him]76-dick up to [the choir]2147-the choir , and placed [him]76-dick in the stall beside [his]338-the priest own , where , for mere decency , [the lad]309-the lad had instantly to kneel and appear to be busy with [his]309-the lad devotions .

[His]309-the lad mind and [his]309-the lad eyes , however , were continually wandering . [Three of [the soldiers]470-the soldiers]2170-three of the soldiers , [he]338-the priest observed , instead of returning to [the house]321-the house , had got [them]2170-three of the soldiers quietly into a point of vantage in the aisle ; and [he]338-the priest could not doubt that [they]2170-three of the soldiers had done so by [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver s command . Here , then , [he]338-the priest was trapped . Here [he]338-the priest must spend the night in the ghostly glimmer and shadow of [the church]262-the church , and looking on the pale face of [him]338-the priest [he]338-the priest slew ; and here , in the morning , [he]338-the priest must see [[his]338-the priest sweetheart]1376-his sweetheart married to [another man before [his]338-the priest eyes]2175-another man before his eyes .

But , for all that , [he]338-the priest obtained a command upon [his]338-the priest mind , and built [himself]338-the priest up in patience to await the issue .

CHAPTER IV IN [THE ABBEY CHURCH]1936-the abbey church

In [Shoreby Abbey Church]54-shoreby abbey church the prayers were kept up all night without cessation , now with the singing of psalms , now with a note or two upon the bell .

[Rutter]192-rutter , [the spy]2055-the spy , was nobly waked . There [he]338-the priest lay , meanwhile , as [they]2170-three of the soldiers had arranged [him]338-the priest , [his]338-the priest dead hands crossed upon [his]338-the priest bosom , [his]338-the priest dead eyes staring on the roof ; and hard by , in [the stall]2178-the stall , [the lad who had slain him waited , in sore disquietude , the coming of the morning]2179-the lad who had slain him waited , in sore disquietude , the coming of the morning .

Once only , in the course of the hours , [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver leaned across to [[his]73-sir oliver captive]2180-his captive .

" [Richard]74-master shelton , "[73-sir oliver] [he]73-sir oliver whispered , " [[my]73-sir oliver son]4223-my son , if [ye]74-master shelton mean [me]73-sir oliver evil , [I]73-sir oliver will certify , on [my]73-sir oliver soul s welfare , [ye]74-master shelton design upon [an innocent man]4367-an innocent man . Sinful in the eye of [Heaven]4289-heaven [I]73-sir oliver do declare [myself]73-sir oliver ; but sinful as against [you]74-master shelton [I]73-sir oliver am not , neither have been ever . "[73-sir oliver]

" [[My]76-dick father]3558-my father , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , in the same tone of voice , " trust [me]76-dick , [I]76-dick design nothing ; but as for [your]3558-my father innocence , [I]76-dick may not forget that [ye]3558-my father cleared [yourself]3558-my father but lamely . "[76-dick]

" [A man]3107-a man may be innocently guilty , "[338-the priest] replied [the priest]338-the priest . " [He]3107-a man may be set blindfolded upon a mission , ignorant of its true scope . So it was with [me]338-the priest . [I]338-the priest did decoy [[your]74-master shelton father]3306-your father to [his]3306-your father death ; but as Heaven sees [us]4372-us in [this sacred place]4373-this sacred place , [I]338-the priest knew not what [I]338-the priest did . "[338-the priest]

" It may be , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " But see what a strange web [ye]3558-my father have woven , that [I]76-dick should be , at this hour , at once [[your]3558-my father prisoner]4049-your prisoner and [[your]3558-my father judge]4375-your judge ; that [ye]3558-my father should both threaten [my]76-dick days and deprecate [my]76-dick anger . Methinks , if [ye]3558-my father had been all [your]3558-my father life [a true man]4376-a true man and [good priest]4377-good priest , [ye]3558-my father would neither thus fear nor thus detest [me]76-dick . And now to [your]3558-my father prayers . [I]76-dick do obey [you]3558-my father , since needs must ; but [I]76-dick will not be burthened with [your]3558-my father company . "[76-dick]

[The priest]338-the priest uttered a sigh so heavy that it had almost touched [the lad]309-the lad into some sentiment of pity , and [he]338-the priest bowed [his]338-the priest head upon [his]338-the priest hands like [a man borne down below a weight of care]2184-a man borne down below a weight of care . [He]338-the priest joined no longer in the psalms ; but [Dick]76-dick could hear the beads rattle through [his]338-the priest fingers and the prayers a - pattering between [his]338-the priest teeth .

Yet a little , and the grey of the morning began to struggle through the painted casements of [the church]262-the church , and to put to shame the glimmer of the tapers . The light slowly broadened and brightened , and presently through the south - eastern clerestories a flush of rosy sunlight flickered on the walls . The storm was over ; the great clouds had disburdened their snow and fled farther on , and the new day was breaking on a merry winter landscape sheathed in white .

A bustle of [church officers]2186-church officers followed ; [the bier]2187-the bier was carried forth to [the deadhouse]2188-the deadhouse , and the stains of blood were cleansed from off the tiles , that no such ill - omened spectacle should disgrace the marriage of [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby . At the same time , [the very ecclesiastics who had been so dismally engaged all night]2189-the very ecclesiastics who had been so dismally engaged all night began to put on morning faces , to do honour to the merrier ceremony which was about to follow . And further to announce the coming of the day , [the pious of [the town]1301-the town]2190-the pious of the town began to assemble and fall to prayer before [[their]2190-the pious of the town favourite shrines]2192-their favourite shrines , or wait [their]2190-the pious of the town turn at [the confessionals]2193-the confessionals .

Favoured by this stir , it was of course easily possible for [any man]3919-any man to avoid the vigilance of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s sentries at the door ; and presently [Dick]76-dick , looking about [him]76-dick wearily , caught the eye of no less a person than [Will Lawless]132-lawless , still in [his]132-lawless monk s habit .

[The outlaw]1231-the outlaw , at the same moment , recognised [[his]1231-the outlaw leader]2196-his leader , and privily signed to [him]2196-his leader with hand and eye .

Now , [Dick]76-dick was far from having forgiven [the old rogue]1897-the old rogue [his]76-dick most untimely drunkenness , but [he]76-dick had no desire to involve [him]1897-the old rogue in [his]76-dick own predicament ; and [he]76-dick signalled back to [him]1897-the old rogue , as plain as [he]76-dick was able , to begone .

[Lawless]132-lawless , as though [he]132-lawless had understood , disappeared at once behind a pillar , and [Dick]76-dick breathed again .

What , then , was [his]76-dick dismay to feel [himself]76-dick plucked by the sleeve and to find [the old robber]2198-the old robber installed beside [him]76-dick , upon the next seat , and , to all appearance , plunged in [his]2198-the old robber devotions !

Instantly [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver arose from [his]73-sir oliver place , and , gliding behind [the stalls]4362-the stalls , made for [the soldiers in [the aisle]2201-the aisle]2200-the soldiers in the aisle . If [the priest]338-the priest s suspicions had been so lightly wakened , the harm was already done , and [[Lawless]132-lawless a prisoner in [the church]262-the church]2203-lawless a prisoner in the church .

" Move not , "[76-dick] whispered [Dick]76-dick . " [We]4378-we are in the plaguiest pass , thanks , before all things , to [thy]338-the priest swinishness of yestereven . When [ye]338-the priest saw [me]76-dick [here]742-here , so strangely seated where [I]76-dick have neither right nor interest , what a murrain [I]76-dick could [ye]338-the priest not smell harm and get [ye]338-the priest gone from evil ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , "[132-lawless] returned [Lawless]132-lawless , " [I]132-lawless thought [ye]338-the priest had heard from [Ellis]100-ellis , and were here on duty . "[132-lawless]

" [Ellis]100-ellis ! "[76-dick] echoed [Dick]76-dick . " Is [Ellis]100-ellis , then , returned ?[76-dick]

" For sure , "[1231-the outlaw] replied [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw . " [He]100-ellis came last night , and belted [me]1231-the outlaw sore for being in wine so there [ye]338-the priest are avenged , [[my]1231-the outlaw master]3094-my master . [A furious man]4381-a furious man is [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis ! [He]100-ellis hath ridden [me]1231-the outlaw hot - spur from [Craven]55-craven to prevent this marriage ; and , [Master Dick]76-dick , [ye]338-the priest know the way of [him]100-ellis do so [he]100-ellis will ! "[1231-the outlaw]

" Nay , then , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , with composure , " [you]338-the priest and [I]76-dick , [[my]76-dick poor brother]4382-my poor brother , are [dead men]4383-dead men ; for [I]76-dick sit [here]742-here [a prisoner]915-a prisoner upon suspicion , and [my]76-dick neck was to answer for this very marriage that [he]100-ellis purposeth to mar . [I]76-dick had a fair choice , by the rood ! to lose [[my]76-dick sweetheart]4386-my sweetheart or else lose [my]76-dick life ! Well , the cast is thrown it is to be [my]76-dick life . "[76-dick]

" By the mass , "[132-lawless] cried [Lawless]132-lawless , half arising , " [I]132-lawless am gone ! "[132-lawless]

But [Dick]76-dick had [his]76-dick hand at once upon [his]132-lawless shoulder .

" [Friend Lawless]142-dickon , sit [ye]132-lawless still , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said . " An [ye]132-lawless have eyes , look yonder at the corner by the chancel arch ; see [ye]132-lawless not that , even upon the motion of [your]132-lawless rising , [yon armed men]4387-yon armed men are up and ready to intercept [you]132-lawless ? Yield [ye]132-lawless , [friend]3100-friend . [Ye]132-lawless were bold aboard [ship]4389-ship , when [ye]132-lawless thought to die a sea - death ; be bold again , now that [y]132-lawless are to die presently upon the gallows . "[76-dick]

" [Master Dick]76-dick , "[132-lawless] gasped [Lawless]132-lawless , " the thing hath come upon [me]132-lawless somewhat of the suddenest . But give [me]132-lawless a moment till [I]132-lawless fetch [my]132-lawless breath again ; and , by the mass , [I]132-lawless will be as stout - hearted as [yourself]132-lawless . "[132-lawless]

" Here is [[my]76-dick bold fellow]4390-my bold fellow ! "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " And yet , [Lawless]132-lawless , it goes hard against the grain with [me]76-dick to die ; but where whining mendeth nothing , wherefore whine ? "[76-dick]

" Nay , that indeed ! "[132-lawless] chimed [Lawless]132-lawless . " And a fig for death , at worst ! It has to be done , [[my]132-lawless master]3094-my master , soon or late . And hanging in a good quarrel is an easy death , [they]4392-they say , though [I]132-lawless could never hear of any that came back to say so . "[132-lawless]

And so saying , [the stout old rascal]2206-the stout old rascal leaned back in [his]2206-the stout old rascal stall , folded [his]2206-the stout old rascal arms , and began to look about [him]2206-the stout old rascal with the greatest air of insolence and unconcern .

" And for the matter of that , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick added , " it is yet [our]2207-our best chance to keep quiet . [We]2207-our wot not yet what [Duckworth]100-ellis purposes ; and when all is said , and if the worst befall , [we]2207-our may yet clear [our]2207-our feet of it . "[76-dick]

Now that [they]2207-our ceased talking , [they]2207-our were aware of a very distant and thin strain of mirthful music which steadily drew nearer , louder , and merrier . The bells in [the tower]2208-the tower began to break forth into a doubling peal , and a greater and greater concourse of [people]249-people to crowd into [the church]262-the church , shuffling the snow from off [their]2207-our feet , and clapping and blowing in [their]2207-our hands . The western door was flung wide open , showing a glimpse of [sunlit , snowy street]2211-sunlit , snowy street , and admitting in a great gust the shrewd air of the morning ; and in short , it became plain by every sign that [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby desired to be married very early in the day , and that [the wedding - train]2212-the wedding - train was drawing near .

[Some of [Lord Shoreby]143-lord shoreby s men]2213-some of lord shoreby s men now cleared a passage down [the middle aisle]2214-the middle aisle , forcing [the people]2215-the people back with lance - stocks ; and just then , outside the portal , [the secular musicians]2216-the secular musicians could be descried drawing near over the frozen snow , [the fifers]2217-the fifers and [trumpeters]2218-trumpeters scarlet in the face with lusty blowing , [the drummers]2219-the drummers and [the cymbalists]2220-the cymbalists beating as for a wager .

[These]2221-they , as [they]2221-they drew near the door of [the sacred building]2222-the sacred building , filed off on either side , and , marking time to [their]2221-they own vigorous music , stood stamping in the snow . As [they]2221-they thus opened [their]2221-they ranks , [the leaders of this noble bridal train]2223-the leaders of this noble bridal train appeared behind and between [them]2221-they ; and such was the variety and gaiety of [their]2221-they attire , such the display of silks and velvet , fur and satin , embroidery and lace , that the procession showed forth upon the snow like a flower - bed in a path or a painted window in a wall .

First came [the bride]2224-the bride , a sorry sight , as pale as winter , clinging to [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s arm , and attended , as [brides - maid]2225-brides - maid , by [the short young lady who had befriended [Dick]76-dick the night before]2226-the short young lady who had befriended dick the night before . Close behind , in the most radiant toilet , followed [the bridegroom]3404-the bridegroom , halting on a gouty foot ; and as [he]3404-the bridegroom passed the threshold of [the sacred building]2222-the sacred building and doffed [his]3404-the bridegroom hat , [his]3404-the bridegroom bald head was seen to be rosy with emotion .

And now came the hour of [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis .

[Dick]76-dick , who sat stunned among contrary emotions , grasping the desk in front of [him]76-dick , beheld a movement in [the crowd]2229-the crowd , [people]249-people jostling backward , and eyes and arms uplifted . Following these signs , [he]76-dick beheld [three or four men with bent bows leaning from the clerestory gallery]2231-three or four men with bent bows leaning from the clerestory gallery . At the same instant [they]2221-they delivered [their]2221-they discharge , and before the clamour and cries of [the astounded populace]2232-the astounded populace had time to swell fully upon the ear , [they]2221-they had flitted from [their]2221-they perch and disappeared .

[The nave]2156-the nave was full of swaying heads and voices screaming ; [the ecclesiastics]2234-the ecclesiastics thronged in terror from [their]2234-the ecclesiastics places ; the music ceased , and though the bells overhead continued for some seconds to clang upon the air , some wind of the disaster seemed to find its way at last even to [the chamber where [the ringers]2236-the ringers were leaping on [their]2236-the ringers ropes]2235-the chamber where the ringers were leaping on their ropes , and [they]2236-the ringers also desisted from [their]2236-the ringers merry labours .

Right in the midst of [the nave]2156-the nave [the bridegroom]3404-the bridegroom lay stone - dead , pierced by two black arrows . [The bride]2224-the bride had fainted . [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel stood , towering above [the crowd]2229-the crowd in [his]72-sir daniel surprise and anger , a clothyard shaft quivering in [his]72-sir daniel left forearm , and [his]72-sir daniel face streaming blood from another which had grazed [his]72-sir daniel brow .

Long before any search could be made for [them]2221-they , [the authors of this tragic interruption]2241-the authors of this tragic interruption had clattered down [a turnpike stair]2242-a turnpike stair and decamped by a postern door .

But [Dick]76-dick and [Lawless]132-lawless still remained in pawn ; [they]2221-they had , indeed , arisen on the first alarm , and pushed manfully to gain the door ; but what with the narrowness of [the stalls]4362-the stalls and the crowding of [terrified priests]2244-terrified priests and [choristers]2245-choristers , the attempt had been in vain , and [they]2221-they had stoically resumed [their]2221-they places .

And now , pale with horror , [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver rose to [his]73-sir oliver feet and called upon [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , pointing with one hand to [Dick]76-dick .

" Here , "[73-sir oliver] [he]73-sir oliver cried , " is [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton alas the hour ! blood guilty ! Seize [him]74-master shelton ! bid [him]74-master shelton be seized ! [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel was blinded by anger blinded by the hot blood that still streamed across [his]72-sir daniel face .

[The crowd]2229-the crowd fell back , and [a party of [archers]3503-archers]2247-a party of archers invaded [the choir]2147-the choir , laid rough hands on [Dick]76-dick , dragged [him]76-dick head - foremost from the stall , and thrust [him]76-dick by the shoulders down the chancel steps . [Lawless]132-lawless , on [his]132-lawless part , sat as still as a mouse .

[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , brushing the blood out of [his]72-sir daniel eyes , stared blinkingly upon [[his]72-sir daniel captive]2180-his captive .

" Ay , "[72-sir daniel] [he]72-sir daniel said , " treacherous and insolent , [I]72-sir daniel have [thee]2180-his captive fast ; and by all potent oaths , for every drop of blood that now trickles in [mine]72-sir daniel eyes , [I]72-sir daniel will wring a groan out of [thy]2180-his captive carcase . But [Dick]76-dick , putting off [[his]76-dick captors]2251-his captors , uplifted [his]76-dick voice .

" On what probation ? "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " [They]4397-my fathers do accuse [me]76-dick , indeed , of some complicity , but have not proved one tittle . There was a murmur of approval among [the bystanders]2253-the bystanders , so boldly [Dick]76-dick declared [his]76-dick innocence ; but at the same time [a throng of [accusers]2255-accusers]2254-a throng of accusers arose upon the other side , crying how [he]76-dick had been found last night in [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s house]2256-sir daniel s house , how [he]76-dick wore a sacrilegious disguise ; and in the midst of the babel , [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver indicated [Lawless]132-lawless , both by voice and gesture , as accomplice to the fact . [Dick]76-dick s ears rang and [his]76-dick brain swam dizzily , like [a man struggling in the eddies of a furious river]2262-a man struggling in the eddies of a furious river .

But [the tall man who had already answered [Dick]76-dick]2263-the tall man who had already answered dick , by a prodigious exercise of voice restored silence and order in [the mob]2264-the mob .

Upon [Dick]76-dick [they]2265-we found no weapon but [his]76-dick poniard , and this told in [his]76-dick favour , until [one man]990-one man officiously drew it from its sheath , and found it still uncleansed of the blood of [Rutter]192-rutter . But when it came to the turn of [Lawless]132-lawless , there was found under [his]132-lawless gown a sheaf of arrows identical with those that had been shot .

" [Sir]3184-sir , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick am here in [sanctuary]4406-sanctuary , is it not so ? " [[My]2224-the bride Lord of [Risingham]184-lord risingham]3290-my lord of risingham , "[2224-the bride] [she]2224-the bride cried , " hear [me]2224-the bride , in justice . [Earl Risingham]139-earl risingham had heard in silence , and when the voices ceased , [he]139-earl risingham still stood silent for a space . " [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , "[139-earl risingham] [he]139-earl risingham said , " here is a right intricate affair , the which , with [your]72-sir daniel good leave , it shall be [mine]139-earl risingham to examine and adjust . The air is shrewd , and [I]139-earl risingham would not [ye]72-sir daniel took cold upon these scratches . "[139-earl risingham]

[He]139-earl risingham made a sign with [his]139-earl risingham hand ; it was passed down [the nave]2156-the nave by [obsequious servants]2277-obsequious servants , who waited there upon [his]139-earl risingham smallest gesture . Instantly , without [the church]262-the church , a tucket sounded shrill , and through the open portal [archers]3503-archers and [men - at - arms]2097-men - at - arms , uniformly arrayed in the colours and wearing the badge of [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham , began to file into [the church]262-the church , took [Dick]76-dick and Lawless from [those who still detained [them]2283-them]2282-those who still detained them , and , closing [their]2283-them files about [the prisoners]2260-the prisoners , marched forth again and disappeared .

As [they]2283-them were passing , [Joanna]117-joanna held both [her]117-joanna hands to [Dick]76-dick and cried [him]76-dick [her]117-joanna farewell ; and [the bridesmaid]2285-the bridesmaid , nothing downcast by [[her]117-joanna uncle]2286-her uncle s evident displeasure , blew [him]76-dick a kiss , with a " Keep [your]76-dick heart up , [lion - driver]4350-lion - driver ! "[2285-the bridesmaid] that for the first time since the accident called up a smile to the faces of [the crowd]2229-the crowd .

CHAPTER V [EARL RISINGHAM]139-earl risingham

[Earl Risingham]139-earl risingham , although by far [the most important person then in [Shoreby]20-shoreby]2288-the most important person then in shoreby , was poorly lodged in [the house of]2289-the house of [a private gentleman upon [the extreme outskirts of [the town]1301-the town]2291-the extreme outskirts of the town]2290-a private gentleman upon the extreme outskirts of the town . Nothing but [the armed men at the doors]2293-the armed men at the doors , and [the mounted messengers that kept arriving and departing]2294-the mounted messengers that kept arriving and departing , announced [the temporary residence of [a great lord]2296-a great lord]2295-the temporary residence of a great lord .

Thus it was that , from lack of space , [Dick]76-dick and [Lawless]132-lawless were clapped into [the same apartment]2297-the same apartment .

" Well spoken , [Master Richard]74-master shelton , "[1231-the outlaw] said [the outlaw]1231-the outlaw ; " it was excellently well spoken , and , for [my]1231-the outlaw part , [I]1231-the outlaw thank [you]74-master shelton cordially . Here [we]4435-we are in good hands ; [we]4435-we shall be justly tried , and , some time this evening , decently hanged on the same tree . "[1231-the outlaw]

" Indeed , [[my]76-dick poor friend]4436-my poor friend , [I]76-dick do believe it , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" Yet have [we]4435-we a string to [our]4435-we bow , "[132-lawless] returned [Lawless]132-lawless . " [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis is [a man out of ten thousand]4437-a man out of ten thousand ; [he]100-ellis holdeth [you]74-master shelton right near [his]100-ellis heart , both for [your]74-master shelton own and for [[your]74-master shelton father]3306-your father s sake ; and knowing [you]74-master shelton guiltless of this fact , [he]100-ellis will stir [earth]3521-earth and [heaven]4289-heaven to bear [you]74-master shelton clear . "[132-lawless]

" It may not be , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " What can [he]100-ellis do ? [He]100-ellis hath but a handful . [Alack]147-alack , if it were but to - morrow could [I]76-dick but keep a certain tryst an hour before noon to - morrow all were , [I]76-dick think , otherwise . But now there is no help . "[76-dick]

" Well , "[132-lawless] concluded [Lawless]132-lawless , " an [ye]74-master shelton will stand to it for [my]132-lawless innocence , [I]132-lawless will stand to it for [yours]74-master shelton , and that stoutly . It shall naught avail [us]4441-us ; but an [I]132-lawless be to hang , it shall not be for lack of swearing . "[132-lawless]

And then , while [Dick]76-dick gave [himself]76-dick over to [his]76-dick reflections , [the old rogue]1897-the old rogue curled [himself]1897-the old rogue down into a corner , pulled [his]1897-the old rogue monkish hood about [his]1897-the old rogue face , and composed [himself]1897-the old rogue to sleep . Soon [he]1897-the old rogue was loudly snoring , so utterly had [his]1897-the old rogue long life of hardship and adventure blunted the sense of apprehension .

It was long after noon , and the day was already failing , before the door was opened and [Dick]76-dick taken forth and led up - stairs to where , in a warm cabinet , [Earl Risingham]139-earl risingham sat musing over the fire .

On [his]1897-the old rogue captive s entrance [he]1897-the old rogue looked up .

" [Sir]3184-sir , "[1897-the old rogue] [he]1897-the old rogue said , " [I]1897-the old rogue knew [[your]3184-sir father]3306-your father , who was [a man of honour]4444-a man of honour , and this inclineth [me]1897-the old rogue to be the more lenient ; but [I]1897-the old rogue may not hide from [you]3184-sir that heavy charges lie against [your]3184-sir character . [Ye]3184-sir do consort with [murderers]1408-murderers and [robbers]4446-robbers ; upon a clear probation [ye]3184-sir have carried war against [the king]3103-the king s peace ; [ye]3184-sir are suspected to have piratically seized upon [a ship]4059-a ship ; [ye]3184-sir are found skulking with a counterfeit presentment in [[your]3184-sir enemy s house]4449-your enemy s house ; [a man]3107-a man is slain that very evening "[1897-the old rogue]

" An it like [you]184-lord risingham , [[my]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick interposed , " [I]76-dick will at once avow [my]76-dick guilt , such as it is . [I]76-dick slew [this fellow Rutter]4452-this fellow rutter ; and to the proof "[76-dick] searching in [his]76-dick bosom " here is a letter from [his]76-dick wallet . "[1897-the old rogue]

[Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham took the letter , and opened and read it twice .

" [Ye]76-dick have read this ? "[184-lord risingham] [he]184-lord risingham inquired .

" [I]76-dick have read it , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick .

" Are [ye]76-dick for [York]8-york or [Lancaster]7-lancaster ? "[2300-the earl] [the earl]2300-the earl demanded .

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , it was but a little while back that [I]76-dick was asked that question , and knew not how to answer it , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick ; " but having answered once , [I]76-dick will not vary . [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , [I]76-dick am for [York]8-york . "[76-dick]

[The earl]2300-the earl nodded approvingly .

" Honestly replied , "[2300-the earl] [he]2300-the earl said . " But wherefore , then , deliver [me]2300-the earl this letter ? "[2300-the earl]

" Nay , but against [traitors]4455-traitors , [[my]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , are not all sides arrayed ? "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick .

" [I]2300-the earl would [they]4455-traitors were , [young gentleman]4457-young gentleman , "[2300-the earl] returned [the earl]2300-the earl ; " and [I]2300-the earl do at least approve [your]4457-young gentleman saying . There is more youth than guile in [you]4457-young gentleman , [I]2300-the earl do perceive ; and were not [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel a mighty man upon [our]4459-our side]4458-sir daniel a mighty man upon our side , [I]2300-the earl were half - tempted to espouse [your]4457-young gentleman quarrel . For [I]2300-the earl have inquired , and it appears [ye]4457-young gentleman have been hardly dealt with , and have much excuse . But look [ye]4457-young gentleman , [sir]3184-sir , [I]2300-the earl am , before all else , [a leader in the queen]4461-a leader in the queen s interest ; and though by nature [a just man]4462-a just man , as [I]2300-the earl believe , and leaning even to the excess of mercy , yet must [I]2300-the earl order [my]2300-the earl goings for [my]2300-the earl party s interest , and , to keep [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , [I]2300-the earl would go far about . "[2300-the earl]

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , " [ye]4457-young gentleman will think [me]76-dick very bold to counsel [you]4457-young gentleman ; but do [ye]4457-young gentleman count upon [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s faith ? Methought [he]72-sir daniel had changed sides intolerably often . "[76-dick]

" Nay , it is the way of [England]22-england . What would [ye]4457-young gentleman have ? "[2300-the earl] [the earl]2300-the earl demanded . " But [ye]4457-young gentleman are unjust to [the knight of [Tunstall]5-tunstall]418-the knight of tunstall ; and as faith goes , in [this unfaithful generation]4465-this unfaithful generation , [he]72-sir daniel hath of late been honourably true to [us]4466-us of [Lancaster]7-lancaster . Even in [our]4466-us last reverses [he]72-sir daniel stood firm . "[2300-the earl]

" An it pleased [you]2300-the earl , then , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " to cast [your]2300-the earl eye upon this letter , [ye]2300-the earl might somewhat change [your]2300-the earl thought of [him]72-sir daniel ; "[76-dick] and [he]76-dick handed to [the earl]2300-the earl [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s letter to [Lord Wensleydale]159-lord wensleydale .

The effect upon [the earl]2300-the earl s countenance was instant ; [he]2300-the earl lowered like an angry lion , and [his]2300-the earl hand , with a sudden movement , clutched at [his]2300-the earl dagger .

" [Ye]2300-the earl have read this also ? "[76-dick] [he]76-dick asked .

" Even so , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " It is [[your]2300-the earl lordship s own estate]4467-your lordship s own estate [he]72-sir daniel offers to [Lord Wensleydale]159-lord wensleydale ? "[76-dick]

" It is [[my]2300-the earl own estate]4468-my own estate , even as [ye]2300-the earl say ! "[2300-the earl] returned [the earl]2300-the earl . " [I]2300-the earl am [[your]2300-the earl bedesman]4469-your bedesman for this letter . [It]4470-it hath shown [me]2300-the earl a fox s hole . Command [me]2300-the earl , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton ; [I]2300-the earl will not be backward in gratitude , and to begin with , [York]8-york or [Lancaster]7-lancaster , [true man]4471-true man or [thief]4472-thief , [I]2300-the earl do now set [you]2300-the earl at freedom . Go , a Mary s name ! But judge it right that [I]2300-the earl retain and hang [[your]2300-the earl fellow]4473-your fellow , [Lawless]132-lawless . The crime hath been most open , and it were fitting that some open punishment should follow . "[2300-the earl]

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , [I]76-dick make it [my]76-dick first suit to [you]2300-the earl to spare [him]4473-your fellow also , "[76-dick] pleaded [Dick]76-dick .

" It is [an old , condemned rogue]4475-an old , condemned rogue , [thief]4472-thief , and vagabond , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , "[2300-the earl] said [the earl]2300-the earl . " [He]4473-your fellow hath been gallows - ripe this score of years . And , whether for one thing or another , whether to - morrow or the day after , where is the great choice ? "[2300-the earl]

" Yet , [[my]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , it was through love to [me]76-dick that [he]4473-your fellow came hither , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick , " and [I]76-dick were churlish and thankless to desert [him]4473-your fellow . "[76-dick]

" [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , [ye]74-master shelton are troublesome , "[2300-the earl] replied [the earl]2300-the earl , severely . " It is an evil way to prosper in [this world]4478-this world . Howbeit , and to be quit of [your]74-master shelton importunity , [I]2300-the earl will once more humour [you]74-master shelton . Go , then , together ; but go warily , and get swiftly out of [Shoreby town]1667-shoreby town . For [this Sir Daniel whom may [the saints]3104-the saints confound ! thirsteth most greedily to have [your]74-master shelton blood]72-sir daniel . "[2300-the earl]

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , [I]76-dick do now offer [you]3102-my lord in words [my]76-dick gratitude , trusting at some brief date to pay [you]3102-my lord some of it in service , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , as [he]76-dick turned from [the apartment]1077-the apartment .

CHAPTER VI [ARBLASTER]56-arblaster AGAIN

When [Dick]76-dick and [Lawless]132-lawless were suffered to steal , by a back way , out of [the house where [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham held [his]184-lord risingham garrison]2310-the house where lord risingham held his garrison , the evening had already come .

[They]2311-they paused in shelter of the garden wall to consult on [their]2311-they best course . The danger was extreme . If [one of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s men]2312-one of sir daniel s men caught sight of [them]2311-they and raised the view - hallo , [they]2311-they would be run down and butchered instantly . And not only was [the town of Shoreby]2313-the town of shoreby a mere net of peril for [their]2311-they lives , but to make for [the open country]1318-the open country was to run the risk of [the patrols]2315-the patrols .

A little way off , upon [some open ground]2316-some open ground , [they]2311-they spied [a windmill]2317-a windmill standing ; and hard by that , [a very large granary with open doors]2318-a very large granary with open doors .

" How if [we]2311-they lay there until the night fall ? "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick proposed .

And [Lawless]132-lawless having no better suggestion to offer , [they]2311-they made a straight push for [the granary]2319-the granary at a run , and concealed [themselves]2311-they behind the door among some straw . The daylight rapidly departed ; and presently the moon was silvering the frozen snow . Now or never was [their]2311-they opportunity to gain the Goat and Bagpipes unobserved and change [their]2311-they tell - tale garments . Yet even then it was advisable to go round by [the outskirts]2320-the outskirts , and not run the gauntlet of [the market - place]2321-the market - place , where , in the concourse of [people]249-people , [they]2311-they stood [the more imminent peril to be recognised and slain]2323-the more imminent peril to be recognised and slain .

This course was a long one . It took [them]2311-they not far from [the house]321-the house by [the beach]1341-the beach , now lying dark and silent , and brought [them]2311-they forth at last by [the margin of [the harbour]1281-the harbour]2326-the margin of the harbour . [Many of [the ships]1544-the ships]1543-many of the ships , as [they]2311-they could see by the clear moonshine , had weighed anchor , and , profiting by the calm sky , proceeded for more distant parts ; answerably to this , [the rude alehouses along [the beach]1341-the beach]2330-the rude alehouses along the beach although in defiance of the curfew law , [they]2330-the rude alehouses along the beach still shone with fire and candle were no longer thronged with [customers]2332-customers , and no longer echoed to the chorus of sea - songs .

Hastily , half - running , with [their]2311-they monkish raiment kilted to the knee , [they]2311-they plunged through the deep snow and threaded the labyrinth of marine lumber ; and [they]2311-they were already more than half way round [the harbour]1281-the harbour when , as [they]2311-they were passing close before [an alehouse]1573-an alehouse , the door suddenly opened and let out a gush of light upon [their]2311-they fleeting figures .

Instantly [they]2311-they stopped , and made believe to be engaged in earnest conversation .

[Three men , one after another]2335-three men , one after another , came out of [the ale - house]2336-the ale - house , and [the last]2337-the last closed the door behind [him]2337-the last . [All three]2338-all three were unsteady upon [their]2338-all three feet , as if [they]2338-all three had passed the day in deep potations , and [they]2338-all three now stood wavering in the moonlight , like [men who knew not what [they]2338-all three would be after]2339-men who knew not what they would be after . [The tallest of [the three]2341-the three]2340-the tallest of the three was talking in a loud , lamentable voice .

" Seven pieces of as good Gascony as ever a tapster broached , "[2340-the tallest of the three] [he]2340-the tallest of the three was saying , " [the best ship out o [the port o [Dartmouth]45-dartmouth]4483-the port o dartmouth]4482-the best ship out o the port o dartmouth , a Virgin Mary parcel - gilt , thirteen pounds of good gold money "[2340-the tallest of the three]

" [I]2342-one of the others have bad losses , too , "[2342-one of the others] interrupted [one of [the others]379-the others]2342-one of the others . " [I]2342-one of the others have had losses of [mine]2342-one of the others own , gossip [Arblaster]173-arblaster . [I]2342-one of the others was robbed at [Martinmas]57-martinmas of five shillings and a leather wallet well worth ninepence farthing . "[2342-one of the others]

[Dick]76-dick s heart smote [him]76-dick at what [he]76-dick heard . Until that moment [he]76-dick had not perhaps thought twice of [the poor skipper who had been ruined by the loss of the Good Hope]2344-the poor skipper who had been ruined by the loss of the good hope ; so careless , in those days , were [men who wore arms of the goods and interests of [[their]2345-men who wore arms of the goods and interests of their inferiors inferiors]2346-their inferiors]2345-men who wore arms of the goods and interests of their inferiors . But this sudden encounter reminded [him]76-dick sharply of the high - handed manner and ill - ending of [his]76-dick enterprise ; and both [he]76-dick and [Lawless]132-lawless turned [their]2347-their heads the other way , to avoid the chance of recognition .

The ship s dog had , however , made [his]2348-his escape from [the wreck]2349-the wreck and found [his]2348-his way back again to [Shoreby]20-shoreby . [He]2348-his was now at [Arblaster]173-arblaster s heels , and suddenly sniffing and pricking [his]2348-his ears , [he]2348-his darted forward and began to bark furiously at [the two sham friars]2350-the two sham friars .

[[His]2348-his master]292-his master unsteadily followed [him]2348-his .

" Hey , [shipmates]4484-shipmates ! "[2348-his] [he]2348-his cried . " Have [ye]4484-shipmates ever a penny pie for [a poor old shipman]4485-a poor old shipman , clean destroyed by [pirates]4486-pirates ? [I]2348-his am [a man that would have paid for [you]4484-shipmates both o Thursday morning]4487-a man that would have paid for you both o thursday morning ; and now [here]742-here [I]2348-his be , o Saturday night , begging for a flagon of ale ! Ask [[my]2348-his man]4073-my man [Tom]136-tom , if [ye]136-tom misdoubt [me]2348-his . Seven pieces of good Gascon wine , [a ship that was [mine]2348-his own]4490-a ship that was mine own , and was [[my]2348-his father]3558-my father s before [me]2348-his , [a Blessed Mary of plane - tree wood and parcel - gilt]4492-a blessed mary of plane - tree wood and parcel - gilt , and thirteen pounds in gold and silver . Hey ! what say [ye]136-tom ? [A man that fought the French]4493-a man that fought the french , too ; for [I]2348-his have fought [the French]193-the french ; [I]2348-his have cut more French throats upon [the high seas]4494-the high seas than ever [a man that sails out of [Dartmouth]45-dartmouth]4495-a man that sails out of dartmouth . Come , a penny piece . "[2348-his]

Neither [Dick]76-dick nor [Lawless durst]194-lawless answer [him]76-dick a word , lest [he]76-dick should recognise [their]2352-their voices ; and [they]2352-their stood there as helpless as [a ship ashore]2353-a ship ashore , not knowing where to turn nor what to hope .

" Are [ye]136-tom dumb , [boy]3344-boy ? "[1580-the skipper] inquired [the skipper]1580-the skipper . " [Mates]4497-mates , "[1580-the skipper] [he]1580-the skipper added , with a hiccup , " [they]4497-mates be dumb . [I]1580-the skipper like not this manner of discourtesy ; for [an a man]4498-an a man be dumb , so be as [he]4498-an a man s courteous , [he]4498-an a man will still speak when [he]4498-an a man was spoken to , methinks . "[1580-the skipper]

By this time [the sailor]2355-the sailor , [Tom]136-tom , who was [a man of great personal strength]2356-a man of great personal strength , seemed to have conceived some suspicion of [these two speechless figures]2357-these two speechless figures ; and being soberer than [[his]136-tom captain]2358-his captain , stepped suddenly before [him]136-tom , took [Lawless]194-lawless roughly by the shoulder , and asked [him]194-lawless , with an oath , what ailed [him]194-lawless that [he]194-lawless held [his]194-lawless tongue . To this [the outlaw , thinking all was over]2359-the outlaw , thinking all was over , made answer by a wrestling feint that stretched [the sailor]2355-the sailor on the sand , and , calling upon [Dick]76-dick to follow [him]136-tom , took to [his]136-tom heels among the lumber .

The affair passed in a second . Before [Dick]76-dick could run at all , [Arblaster]173-arblaster had [him]76-dick in [his]173-arblaster arms ; [Tom]136-tom , crawling on [his]136-tom face , had caught [him]76-dick by one foot , and [the third man]2361-the third man had a drawn cutlass brandishing above [his]2361-the third man head .

It was not so much the danger , it was not so much the annoyance , that now bowed down the spirits of [young Shelton]74-master shelton ; it was the profound humiliation to have escaped [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , convinced [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham , and now fall helpless in the hands of [this old , drunken sailor]2362-this old , drunken sailor ; and not merely helpless , but , as [his]136-tom conscience loudly told [him]136-tom when it was too late , actually guilty actually [the bankrupt debtor of [the man whose ship [he]136-tom had stolen and lost]2363-the man whose ship he had stolen and lost .

" Bring [me]173-arblaster [him]136-tom back into [the alehouse]1646-the alehouse]4499-the bankrupt debtor of the man whose ship he had stolen and lost . " bring me him back into the alehouse , till [I]173-arblaster see [his]136-tom face , "[173-arblaster] said [Arblaster]173-arblaster .

" Nay , nay , "[136-tom] returned [Tom]136-tom ; " but let [us]2364-us first unload [his]136-tom wallet , lest [the other lads]4501-the other lads cry share . "[136-tom]

But though [he]136-tom was searched from head to foot , not a penny was found upon [him]136-tom ; nothing but [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s signet , which [they]2364-us plucked savagely from [his]136-tom finger .

" Turn [me]1580-the skipper [him]136-tom to [the moon]4502-the moon , "[1580-the skipper] said [the skipper]1580-the skipper ; and taking [Dick]76-dick by the chin , [he]1580-the skipper cruelly jerked [his]76-dick head into the air . " [Blessed Virgin]195-blessed virgin ! "[1580-the skipper] [he]1580-the skipper cried , " it is [the pirate]4503-the pirate ! "[1580-the skipper]

" Hey ! "[136-tom] cried [Tom]136-tom .

" By [the Virgin of [Bordeaux]58-bordeaux]4504-the virgin of bordeaux , it is [the man]3175-the man [himself]3175-the man ! "[173-arblaster] repeated [Arblaster]173-arblaster . " What , [sea - thief]4506-sea - thief , do [I]173-arblaster hold [you]4506-sea - thief ? "[173-arblaster] [he]173-arblaster cried . " Where is [[my]173-arblaster ship]4507-my ship ? Where is [my]173-arblaster wine ? Hey ! have [I]173-arblaster [you]4506-sea - thief in [my]173-arblaster hands ? [Tom]136-tom , give [me]173-arblaster one end of a cord here ; [I]173-arblaster will so truss [me]173-arblaster [this sea - thief]4508-this sea - thief , hand and foot together , like [a basting turkey marry]4509-a basting turkey marry , [I]173-arblaster will so bind [him]309-the lad up and thereafter [I]173-arblaster will so beat so beat [him]309-the lad ! "[173-arblaster]

And so [he]173-arblaster ran on , winding the cord meanwhile about [Dick]76-dick s limbs with the dexterity peculiar to [seamen]2366-seamen , and at every turn and cross securing it with a knot , and tightening the whole fabric with a savage pull .

When [he]173-arblaster had done , [the lad]309-the lad was a mere package in [his]173-arblaster hands as helpless as the dead . [The skipper]1580-the skipper held [him]309-the lad at arm s length , and laughed aloud . Then [he]1580-the skipper fetched [him]309-the lad a stunning buffet on the ear ; and then turned [him]309-the lad about , and furiously kicked and kicked [him]309-the lad . Anger rose up in [Dick]76-dick s bosom like a storm ; anger strangled [him]309-the lad , and [he]309-the lad thought to have died ; but when [the sailor]2355-the sailor , tired of this cruel play , dropped [him]309-the lad all [his]309-the lad length upon the sand and turned to consult with [[his]309-the lad companions]2370-his companions , [he]309-the lad instantly regained command of [his]309-the lad temper . Here was a momentary respite ; ere [they]2370-his companions began again to torture [him]309-the lad , [he]309-the lad might have found some method to escape from this degrading and fatal misadventure .

Presently , sure enough , and while [[his]309-the lad captors]2251-his captors were still discussing what to do with [him]309-the lad , [he]309-the lad took heart of grace , and , with a pretty steady voice , addressed [them]2370-his companions .

" [[My]309-the lad masters]3124-my masters , "[309-the lad] [he]309-the lad began , " are [ye]3124-my masters gone clean foolish ? Here hath Heaven put into [your]3124-my masters hands as pretty an occasion to grow rich as [ever shipman]4511-ever shipman had such as [ye]3124-my masters might make thirty over - sea adventures and not find again and , by the mass [I]309-the lad what do [ye]3124-my masters ? Beat [me]309-the lad ? nay ; so would [an angry child]4512-an angry child ! But for long - headed [tarry - Johns]196-tarry - johns , that fear not fire nor water , and that love gold as [they]196-tarry - johns love beef , methinks [ye]3124-my masters are not wise . "[309-the lad]

" Ay , "[136-tom] said [Tom]136-tom , " now [y]3124-my masters are trussed [ye]3124-my masters would cozen [us]2370-his companions . "[136-tom]

" Cozen [you]3124-my masters ! "[76-dick] repeated [Dick]76-dick . " Nay , if [ye]3124-my masters be [fools]4513-fools , it would be easy . But if [ye]3124-my masters be [shrewd fellows]4514-shrewd fellows , as [I]76-dick trow [ye]3124-my masters are , [ye]3124-my masters can see plainly where [your]3124-my masters interest lies . When [I]76-dick took [[your]3124-my masters ship]4515-your ship from [you]3124-my masters , [we]2370-his companions were many , [we]2370-his companions were well clad and armed ; but now , bethink [you]3124-my masters a little , who mustered that array ? One incontestably that hath much gold . And if [he]76-dick , being already rich , continueth to hunt after more even in the face of storms bethink [you]3124-my masters once more shall there not be a treasure somewhere hidden ? "[76-dick]

" What meaneth [he]76-dick ? "[693-one of the men] asked [one of [the men]405-the men]693-one of the men .

" Why , if [ye]3124-my masters have lost an old skiff and a few jugs of vinegary wine , "[76-dick] continued [Dick]76-dick , " forget [them]4516-them , for the trash [they]4516-them are ; and do [ye]3124-my masters rather buckle to an adventure worth the name , that shall , in twelve hours , make or mar [you]3124-my masters for ever . But take [me]76-dick up from where [I]76-dick lie , and let [us]2370-his companions go somewhere near at hand and talk across a flagon , for [I]76-dick am sore and frozen , and [my]76-dick mouth is half among the snow . "[76-dick]

" [He]76-dick seeks but to cozen [us]2370-his companions , "[136-tom] said [Tom]136-tom , contemptuously .

" Cozen ! cozen ! "[2361-the third man] cried [the third man]2361-the third man . " [I]2361-the third man would [I]2361-the third man could see [the man that could cozen [me]2361-the third man]4517-the man that could cozen me ! [He]76-dick were [a cozener]4518-a cozener indeed ! Nay , [I]2361-the third man was not born yesterday . [I]2361-the third man can see [a church]4519-a church when [it]4519-a church hath a steeple on [it]4519-a church ; and for [my]2361-the third man part , [gossip Arblaster]173-arblaster , methinks there is some sense in [this young man]4520-this young man . Shall [we]2370-his companions go hear [him]4520-this young man , indeed ? Say , shall [we]2370-his companions go hear [him]4520-this young man ? "[2361-the third man]

" [I]173-arblaster would look gladly on a pottle of strong ale , good [Master Pirret]197-pirret , "[173-arblaster] returned [Arblaster]173-arblaster . " How say [ye]136-tom , [Tom]136-tom ? But then the wallet is empty . "[173-arblaster]

" [I]311-the other will pay , "[311-the other] said [the other]311-the other " [I]311-the other will pay . [I]311-the other would fain see this matter out ; [I]311-the other do believe , upon [my]311-the other conscience , there is gold in it . "[311-the other]

" Nay , if [ye]136-tom get again to drinking , all is lost ! "[136-tom] cried [Tom]136-tom .

" [Gossip Arblaster]173-arblaster , [ye]136-tom suffer [[your]136-tom fellow]4473-your fellow to have too much liberty , "[197-pirret] returned [Master Pirret]197-pirret . " Would [ye]136-tom be led by [a hired man]4522-a hired man ? Fy , fy ! "[197-pirret]

" Peace , [fellow]3263-fellow ! "[173-arblaster] said [Arblaster]173-arblaster , addressing [Tom]136-tom . " Will [ye]136-tom put [your]136-tom oar in ? Truly a fine pass , when [the crew]4524-the crew is to correct [the skipper]1580-the skipper ! "[173-arblaster]

" Well , then , go [your]136-tom way , "[136-tom] said [Tom]136-tom ; " [I]136-tom wash [my]136-tom hands of [you]136-tom . "[136-tom]

" Set [him]1580-the skipper , then , upon [his]1580-the skipper feet , "[197-pirret] said [Master Pirret]197-pirret . " [I]197-pirret know a privy place where [we]4526-we may drink and discourse . "[197-pirret]

" If [I]76-dick am to walk , [[my]76-dick friends]3375-my friends , [ye]3375-my friends must set [my]76-dick feet at liberty , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , when [he]76-dick had been once more planted upright like a post .

" [He]1580-the skipper saith true , "[197-pirret] laughed [Pirret]197-pirret . " Truly , [he]1580-the skipper could not walk accoutred as [he]1580-the skipper is . Give it a slit out with [your]3375-my friends knife and slit it , [gossip]4064-gossip . "[197-pirret]

[Even Arblaster]173-arblaster paused at this proposal ; but as [[his]173-arblaster companion]540-his companion continued to insist , and [Dick]76-dick had the sense to keep the merest wooden indifference of expression , and only shrugged [his]76-dick shoulders over the delay , [the skipper]1580-the skipper consented at last , and cut the cords which tied [[his]1580-the skipper prisoner]1503-his prisoner s feet and legs . Not only did this enable [Dick]76-dick to walk ; but the whole network of [his]76-dick bonds being proportionately loosened , [he]76-dick felt the arm behind [his]76-dick back begin to move more freely , and could hope , with time and trouble , to entirely disengage it . So much [he]76-dick owed already to the owlish silliness and greed of [Master Pirret]197-pirret .

[That worthy]2379-that worthy now assumed the lead , and conducted [them]2380-their to [the very same rude alehouse where [Lawless]194-lawless had taken [Arblaster]173-arblaster on the day of the gale]2381-the very same rude alehouse where lawless had taken arblaster on the day of the gale . [It]2381-the very same rude alehouse where lawless had taken arblaster on the day of the gale was now quite deserted ; the fire was a pile of red embers , radiating the most ardent heat ; and when [they]2380-their had chosen [their]2380-their places , and [the landlord]496-the landlord had set before [them]2380-their a measure of mulled ale , both [Pirret]197-pirret and [Arblaster]173-arblaster stretched forth [their]2380-their legs and squared [their]2380-their elbows like [men]3205-men bent upon a pleasant hour .

The table at which [they]2380-their sat , like [all the others in [the alehouse]1646-the alehouse]2384-all the others in the alehouse , consisted of a heavy , square board , set on a pair of barrels ; and each of [the four curiously - assorted cronies]2386-the four curiously - assorted cronies sat at one side of [the square]2387-the square , [Pirret]197-pirret facing [Arblaster]173-arblaster , and [Dick]76-dick opposite to [the common sailor]2388-the common sailor .

" And now , [young man]4012-young man , "[197-pirret] said [Pirret]197-pirret , " to [your]4012-young man tale . It doth appear , indeed , that [ye]4012-young man have somewhat abused [our]4530-our gossip [Arblaster]173-arblaster ; but what then ? Make it up to [him]173-arblaster show [him]173-arblaster but this chance to become wealthy and [I]197-pirret will go pledge [he]173-arblaster will forgive [you]4012-young man . "[197-pirret]

So far [Dick]76-dick had spoken pretty much at random ; but it was now necessary , under the supervision of [six eyes]2389-six eyes , to invent and tell some marvellous story , and , if it were possible , get back into [his]76-dick hands the all - important signet . To squander time was the first necessity . The longer [his]76-dick stay lasted , the more would [[his]76-dick captors]2251-his captors drink , and the surer should [he]76-dick be when [he]76-dick attempted [his]76-dick escape .

Well , [Dick]76-dick was not much of [an inventor]2391-an inventor , and what [he]76-dick told was pretty much the tale of [Ali Baba]198-ali baba , with [Shoreby]143-lord shoreby and [Tunstall Forest]12-tunstall forest substituted for [the East]59-the east , and the treasures of [the cavern]2392-the cavern rather exaggerated than diminished . As [the reader]1979-the reader is aware , it is an excellent story , and has but one drawback that it is not true ; and so , as [these three simple shipmen]2394-these three simple shipmen now heard it for the first time , [their]2394-these three simple shipmen eyes stood out of [their]2394-these three simple shipmen faces , and [their]2394-these three simple shipmen mouths gaped like codfish at a fishmonger s.

Pretty soon a second measure of mulled ale was called for ; and while [Dick]76-dick was still artfully spinning out the incidents a third followed the second .

Here was the position of [the parties towards the end]2395-the parties towards the end : [Arblaster]173-arblaster , [three - parts drunk and one - half asleep]2396-three - parts drunk and one - half asleep , hung helpless on [his]173-arblaster stool . Even [Tom]136-tom had been much delighted with the tale , and [his]136-tom vigilance had abated in proportion . Meanwhile , [Dick]76-dick had gradually wormed [his]76-dick right arm clear of its bonds , and was ready to risk all .

" And so , "[197-pirret] said [Pirret]197-pirret , " [y]76-dick are one of these ? "[197-pirret]

" [I]76-dick was made so , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , " against [my]76-dick will ; but an [I]76-dick could but get a sack or two of gold coin to [my]76-dick share , [I]76-dick should be [a fool]858-a fool indeed to continue dwelling in [a filthy cave]4532-a filthy cave , and standing shot and buffet like [a soldier]4533-a soldier . Here be [we]4534-we four ; good ! Let [us]4534-we , then , go forth into [the forest]246-the forest to - morrow ere the sun be up . Could [we]4534-we come honestly by a donkey , it were better ; but an [we]4534-we can not , [we]4534-we have [our]4534-we four strong backs , and [I]76-dick warrant [me]76-dick [we]4534-we shall come [home]699-home staggering . "[76-dick]

[Pirret]197-pirret licked [his]197-pirret lips .

" And this magic , "[197-pirret] [he]197-pirret said " this password , whereby [the cave]4537-the cave is opened how call [ye]76-dick it , [friend]3100-friend ? "[197-pirret]

" Nay , none know the word but [the three chiefs]4539-the three chiefs , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick ; " but here is [your]76-dick great good fortune , that , on this very evening , [I]76-dick should be [the bearer of a spell to open it]4540-the bearer of a spell to open it . It is a thing not trusted twice a year beyond [the captain]1604-the captain s wallet . "[76-dick]

" A spell ! "[173-arblaster] said [Arblaster]173-arblaster , half awakening , and squinting upon [Dick]76-dick with one eye . " Aroint [thee]76-dick ! no spells ! [I]173-arblaster be [a good Christian]4542-a good christian . Ask [[my]173-arblaster man]4073-my man [Tom]136-tom , else . "[173-arblaster]

" Nay , but this is white magic , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " It doth naught with the devil ; only the powers of numbers , herbs , and planets . "[76-dick]

" Ay , ay , "[197-pirret] said [Pirret]197-pirret ; " tis but white magic , [gossip]4064-gossip . There is no sin therein , [I]197-pirret do assure [you]76-dick . But proceed , [good youth]4545-good youth . This spell in what should it consist ? "[197-pirret]

" Nay , that [I]76-dick will incontinently show [you]76-dick , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " Have [ye]76-dick there the ring [ye]76-dick took from [my]76-dick finger ? Good ! Now hold it forth before [you]76-dick by the extreme finger - ends , at the arm s - length , and over against the shining of these embers . Tis so exactly . Thus , then , is the spell . "[76-dick]

With a haggard glance , [Dick]76-dick saw [the coast]1802-the coast was clear between [him]76-dick and the door . [He]76-dick put up an internal prayer . Then whipping forth [his]76-dick arm , [he]76-dick made but one snatch of the ring , and at the same instant , levering up the table , [he]76-dick sent it bodily over upon [the seaman]2398-the seaman [Tom]136-tom . [He]76-dick , poor soul , went down bawling under [the ruins]672-the ruins ; and before [Arblaster]173-arblaster understood that anything was wrong , or [Pirret]197-pirret could collect [his]197-pirret dazzled wits , [Dick]76-dick had run to the door and escaped into the moonlit night .

The moon , which now rode in the mid - heavens , and the extreme whiteness of the snow , made the open ground about [the harbour]1281-the harbour bright as day ; and [young Shelton leaping , with kilted robe , among the lumber]2401-young shelton leaping , with kilted robe , among the lumber , was [a conspicuous figure from afar]2402-a conspicuous figure from afar .

[Tom]136-tom and [Pirret]197-pirret followed [him]76-dick with shouts ; from [every drinking - shop]2403-every drinking - shop [they]2404-they were joined by others whom [their]2404-they cries aroused ; and presently [a whole fleet of sailors]2405-a whole fleet of sailors was in full pursuit . But [Jack ashore]128-matcham was [a bad runner]2406-a bad runner , even in the fifteenth century , and [Dick]76-dick , besides , had a start , which [he]76-dick rapidly improved , until , as [he]76-dick drew near the entrance of [a narrow lane]2407-a narrow lane , [he]76-dick even paused and looked laughingly behind [him]76-dick .

Upon the white floor of snow , [all the shipmen of Shoreby]2408-all the shipmen of shoreby came clustering in an inky mass , and tailing out rearward in isolated clumps . [Every man]2409-every man was shouting or screaming ; [every man]2409-every man was gesticulating with both arms in air ; [some one]3814-some one was continually falling ; and to complete the picture , when one fell , a dozen would fall upon the top of [him]76-dick .

The confused mass of sound which [they]2404-they rolled up as high as to the moon was partly comical and partly terrifying to [the fugitive whom [they]2404-they were hunting]2412-the fugitive whom they were hunting . In itself , it was impotent , for [he]76-dick made sure [no seaman in [the port]1540-the port]2413-no seaman in the port could run [him]76-dick down . But the mere volume of noise , in so far as it must awake [all the sleepers in [Shoreby]20-shoreby]2415-all the sleepers in shoreby and bring [all the skulking sentries]2416-all the skulking sentries to [the street]2417-the street , did really threaten [him]76-dick with danger in the front . So , spying a dark doorway at a corner , [he]76-dick whipped briskly into [it]2418-it , and let [the uncouth hunt]2419-the uncouth hunt go by [him]76-dick , still shouting and gesticulating , and all red with hurry and white with tumbles in the snow .

It was a long while , indeed , before this great invasion of [the town]1301-the town by [the harbour]1281-the harbour came to an end , and it was long before silence was restored . For long , [lost sailors]2422-lost sailors were still to be heard pounding and shouting through [the streets]1303-the streets in all directions and in [every quarter of [the town]1301-the town]2424-every quarter of the town . Quarrels followed , sometimes among [themselves]2404-they , sometimes with [the men of the patrols]2426-the men of the patrols ; knives were drawn , blows given and received , and [more than one dead body]2427-more than one dead body remained behind upon the snow .

When , a full hour later , [the last seaman]2428-the last seaman returned grumblingly to [the harbour]1281-the harbour side and [[his]2428-the last seaman particular tavern]2430-his particular tavern , it may fairly be questioned if [he]2428-the last seaman had ever known what manner of man [he]2428-the last seaman was pursuing , but it was absolutely sure that [he]2428-the last seaman had now forgotten . By next morning there were many strange stories flying ; and a little while after , the legend of [the devil]3801-the devil s nocturnal visit was an article of faith with [all the lads of [Shoreby]20-shoreby]2432-all the lads of shoreby .

But the return of [the last seaman]2428-the last seaman did not , even yet , set free [young Shelton]74-master shelton from [his]74-master shelton cold imprisonment in the doorway .

For some time after , there was a great activity of [patrols]2434-patrols ; and [special parties]2435-special parties came forth to make the round of [the place]3130-the place and report to one or other of [the great lords]2437-the great lords , whose slumbers had been thus unusually broken .

The night was already well spent before [Dick]76-dick ventured from [his]76-dick hiding - place and came , safe and sound , but aching with cold and bruises , to the door of [the Goat and Bagpipes]2438-the goat and bagpipes . As the law required , there was neither fire nor candle in [the house]321-the house ; but [he]76-dick groped [his]76-dick way into a corner of [the icy guest - room]2440-the icy guest - room , found an end of a blanket , which [he]76-dick hitched around [his]76-dick shoulders , and creeping close to the nearest sleeper , was soon lost in slumber .

[BOOK V CROOKBACK]199-crookback

CHAPTER I [THE SHRILL TRUMPET

Very]2441-the shrill trumpet very early the next morning , before the first peep of the day , [Dick]76-dick arose , changed [his]76-dick garments , armed [himself]76-dick once more like [a gentleman]4044-a gentleman , and set forth for [Lawless s den in [the forest]246-the forest]2443-lawless s den in the forest . There , it will be remembered , [he]76-dick had left [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s papers ; and to get these and be back in time for the tryst with [the young Duke of [Gloucester]207-dick]2445-the young duke of gloucester could only be managed by an early start and the most vigorous walking .

The frost was more rigorous than ever ; the air windless and dry , and stinging to the nostril . The moon had gone down , but the stars were still bright and numerous , and the reflection from the snow was clear and cheerful . There was no need for a lamp to walk by ; nor , in that still but ringing air , the least temptation to delay .

[Dick]76-dick had crossed the greater part of [the open ground between [Shoreby]20-shoreby and [the forest]246-the forest]2446-the open ground between shoreby and the forest , and had reached [the bottom of [the little hill]2449-the little hill]2448-the bottom of the little hill , some hundred yards below [the Cross of [St. Bride]60-st. bride]2450-the cross of st. bride , when , through the stillness of [the black morn]2451-the black morn , there rang forth the note of a trumpet , so shrill , clear , and piercing , that [he]76-dick thought [he]76-dick had never heard the match of it for audibility . It was blown once , and then hurriedly a second time ; and then the clash of steel succeeded .

At [this young Shelton]2452-this young shelton pricked [his]2452-this young shelton ears , and drawing [his]2452-this young shelton sword , ran forward up [the hill]314-the hill .

Presently [he]2452-this young shelton came in sight of the cross , and was aware of a most fierce encounter raging on [the road]257-the road before [it]2450-the cross of st. bride . There were [seven or eight assailants]2455-seven or eight assailants , and but one to keep head against [them]2455-seven or eight assailants ; but so active and dexterous was this one , so desperately did [he]2452-this young shelton charge and scatter [[his]2452-this young shelton opponents]2456-his opponents , so deftly keep [his]2452-this young shelton footing on the ice , that already , before [Dick]76-dick could intervene , [he]2452-this young shelton had slain [one]3600-one , wounded another , and kept the whole in check .

Still , it was by a miracle that [he]2452-this young shelton continued [his]2452-this young shelton defence , and at any moment , any accident , the least slip of foot or error of hand , [his]2452-this young shelton life would be a forfeit .

" Hold [ye]76-dick well , [sir]3184-sir ! Here is help ! "[74-master shelton] cried [Richard]74-master shelton ; and forgetting that [he]2452-this young shelton was alone , and that the cry was somewhat irregular , " To the Arrow ! to the Arrow ! "[2452-this young shelton] [he]2452-this young shelton shouted , as [he]2452-this young shelton fell upon the rear of [the assailants]774-the assailants .

[These]2459-these were [stout fellows]2460-stout fellows also , for [they]2459-these gave not an inch at this surprise , but faced about , and fell with astonishing fury upon [Dick]76-dick . Four against one , the steel flashed about [him]2452-this young shelton in the starlight ; the sparks flew fiercely ; [one of [the men opposed to [him]2452-this young shelton]2462-the men opposed to him]2461-one of the men opposed to him fell in the stir of the fight [he]2452-this young shelton hardly knew why ; then [he]2452-this young shelton [himself]2452-this young shelton was struck across the head , and though the steel cap below [his]2452-this young shelton hood protected [him]2452-this young shelton , the blow beat [him]2452-this young shelton down upon one knee , with a brain whirling like a windmill sail .

Meanwhile [the man whom [he]2452-this young shelton had come to rescue , instead of joining in the conflict]2463-the man whom he had come to rescue , instead of joining in the conflict , had , on the first sign of intervention , leaped aback and blown again , and yet more urgently and loudly , on that same shrill - voiced trumpet that began the alarm . Next moment , indeed , [[his]2452-this young shelton foes]2464-his foes were on [him]2452-this young shelton , and [he]2452-this young shelton was once more charging and fleeing , leaping , stabbing , dropping to [his]2452-this young shelton knee , and using indifferently sword and dagger , foot and hand , with the same unshaken courage and feverish energy and speed .

But that ear - piercing summons had been heard at last . There was a muffled rushing in the snow ; and in a good hour for [Dick]76-dick , who saw the sword - points glitter already at [his]76-dick throat , there poured forth out of the wood upon both sides a disorderly torrent of [mounted men - at - arms]2465-mounted men - at - arms , each cased in iron , and with visor lowered , each bearing [his]76-dick lance in rest , or [his]76-dick sword bared and raised , and each carrying , so to speak , [a passenger , in the shape of [an archer or page]2467-an archer or page , who leaped one after another from [their]2467-an archer or page perches , and had presently doubled the array .

[The original assailants]2468-the original assailants ; seeing [themselves]2468-the original assailants outnumbered and surrounded]2466-a passenger , in the shape of an archer or page , who leaped one after another from their perches , and had presently doubled the array . the original assailants ; seeing themselves outnumbered and surrounded , threw down [their]2468-the original assailants arms without a word .

" Seize [me]2469-the hero of the trumpet [these fellows]4547-these fellows ! "[2469-the hero of the trumpet] said [the hero of the trumpet]2469-the hero of the trumpet ; and when [his]2469-the hero of the trumpet order had been obeyed , [he]2469-the hero of the trumpet drew near to [Dick]76-dick and looked [him]76-dick in the face .

[Dick]76-dick , returning this scrutiny , was surprised to find in one who had displayed such strength , skill and energy , [a lad no older than [himself]2470-a lad no older than himself]2470-a lad no older than himself slightly deformed , with [one shoulder higher than the other , and of a pale , painful , and distorted countenance]2471-one shoulder higher than the other , and of a pale , painful , and distorted countenance . 2 The eyes , however , were very clear and bold .

" [Sir]3184-sir , "[3775-this lad] said [this lad]3775-this lad , " [ye]3184-sir came in good time for [me]3775-this lad , and none too early . "[3775-this lad]

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , with a faint sense that [he]76-dick was in the presence of [a great personage]2473-a great personage , " [ye]3184-sir are [yourself]3184-sir so marvellous [a good swordsman]4550-a good swordsman that [I]76-dick believe [ye]3184-sir had managed [them]3184-sir single - handed . Howbeit , it was certainly well for [me]76-dick that [[your]3184-sir men]3970-your men delayed no longer than [they]3970-your men did . "[76-dick]

" How knew [ye]3184-sir who [I]1456-the stranger was ? "[1456-the stranger] demanded [the stranger]1456-the stranger .

" Even now , [[my]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick answered , " [I]76-dick am ignorant of whom [I]76-dick speak with . "[76-dick]

" Is it so ? "[311-the other] asked [the other]311-the other . " And yet [ye]3184-sir threw [yourself]3184-sir head first into this unequal battle . "[311-the other]

" [I]76-dick saw [one man]990-one man valiantly contending against [many]1688-many , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , " and [I]76-dick had thought [myself]76-dick dishonoured not to bear [him]990-one man aid . "[76-dick]

A singular sneer played about [the young nobleman]2476-the young nobleman s mouth as [he]2476-the young nobleman made answer :

" These are very brave words . But to the more essential are [ye]3184-sir [Lancaster]7-lancaster or [York]8-york ? "[2476-the young nobleman]

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , [I]76-dick make no secret ; [I]76-dick am clear for [York]8-york , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick answered .

" By the mass ! "[311-the other] replied [the other]311-the other , " it is well for [you]2476-the young nobleman . "[311-the other]

And so saying , [he]2476-the young nobleman turned towards [one of [[his]2476-the young nobleman followers]1134-his followers]2478-one of his followers .

" Let [me]2476-the young nobleman see , "[2476-the young nobleman] [he]2476-the young nobleman continued , in the same sneering and cruel tones " let [me]2476-the young nobleman see a clean end of [these brave gentlemen]4556-these brave gentlemen . Truss [me]2476-the young nobleman [them]4556-these brave gentlemen up . "[2476-the young nobleman]

There were but [five survivors of the attacking party]2480-five survivors of the attacking party . [Archers]3503-archers seized [them]2480-five survivors of the attacking party by the arms ; [they]2480-five survivors of the attacking party were hurried to the borders of the wood , and each placed below a tree of suitable dimension ; the rope was adjusted ; [an archer , carrying the end of it]2482-an archer , carrying the end of it , hastily clambered overhead ; and before a minute was over , and without a word passing upon either hand , [the five men]2483-the five men were swinging by the neck .

" And now , "[2484-the deformed leader] cried [the deformed leader]2484-the deformed leader , " back to [[your]2476-the young nobleman posts]4557-your posts , and when [I]2484-the deformed leader summon [you]2476-the young nobleman next , be readier to attend . "[2484-the deformed leader]

" [[My]990-one man lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[990-one man] said [one man]990-one man , " beseech [you]2476-the young nobleman , tarry not here alone . Keep but a handful of lances at [your]2476-the young nobleman hand . "[990-one man]

" [Fellow]3263-fellow , "[3689-the duke] said [the duke]3689-the duke , " [I]3689-the duke have forborne to chide [you]3263-fellow for [your]3263-fellow slowness . Cross [me]3689-the duke not , therefore . [I]3689-the duke trust [my]3689-the duke hand and arm , for all that [I]3689-the duke be crooked . [Ye]3263-fellow were backward when the trumpet sounded ; and [ye]3263-fellow are now too forward with [your]3263-fellow counsels . But it is ever so ; last with the lance and first with tongue . Let it be reversed . "[3689-the duke]

And with a gesture that was not without a sort of dangerous nobility , [he]3689-the duke waved [them]2487-them off .
