[The footmen]2488-the footmen climbed again to [their]2488-the footmen seats behind [the men - at - arms]2489-the men - at - arms , and [the whole party]343-the whole party moved slowly away and disappeared in twenty different directions , under the cover of [the forest]246-the forest .

The day was by this time beginning to break , and the stars to fade . The first grey glimmer of dawn shone upon the countenances of [the two young men , who now turned once more to face each other]2492-the two young men , who now turned once more to face each other .

" Here , "[3689-the duke] said [the duke]3689-the duke , " [ye]3263-fellow have seen [my]3689-the duke vengeance , which is , like [my]3689-the duke blade , both sharp and ready . But [I]3689-the duke would not have [you]3263-fellow , for all [Christendom]200-christendom , suppose [me]3689-the duke thankless . [You]3263-fellow that came to [my]3689-the duke aid with a good sword and a better courage unless that [ye]3263-fellow recoil from [my]3689-the duke misshapenness come to [my]3689-the duke heart . "[3689-the duke]

And so saying , [the young leader]1637-the young leader held out [his]1637-the young leader arms for an embrace .

In the bottom of [his]1637-the young leader heart [Dick]76-dick already entertained a great terror and some hatred for [the man whom [he]1637-the young leader had rescued]2495-the man whom he had rescued ; but the invitation was so worded that it would not have been merely discourteous , but cruel , to refuse or hesitate ; and [he]1637-the young leader hastened to comply .

" And now , [[my]1637-the young leader lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[1637-the young leader] [he]1637-the young leader said , when [he]1637-the young leader had regained [his]1637-the young leader freedom , " do [I]1637-the young leader suppose aright ? Are [ye]4170-my lord duke [[my]1637-the young leader Lord Duke of [Gloucester]207-dick]201-my lord duke of gloucester ? "[1637-the young leader]

" [I]311-the other am [Richard of [Gloucester]207-dick]4166-richard of gloucester , "[311-the other] returned [the other]311-the other . " And [you]311-the other how call [they]4170-my lord duke [you]311-the other ? "[311-the other]

[Dick]76-dick told [him]76-dick [his]76-dick name , and presented [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s signet , which [the duke]3689-the duke immediately recognised .

" [Ye]4170-my lord duke come too soon , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said ; " but why should [I]76-dick complain ? [Ye]4170-my lord duke are like [me]76-dick , that was here at watch two hours before the day . But this is the first sally of [mine]76-dick arms ; upon this adventure , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , shall [I]76-dick make or mar the quality of [my]76-dick renown . There lie [[mine]76-dick enemies]4562-mine enemies , under [two old , skilled captains [Risingham]184-lord risingham and [Brackley]72-sir daniel]4563-two old , skilled captains risingham and brackley well posted for strength , [I]76-dick do believe , but yet upon two sides without retreat , enclosed betwixt [the sea]1479-the sea , [the harbour]1281-the harbour , and [the river]248-the river . Methinks , [Shelton]74-master shelton , here were a great blow to be stricken , an [we]4567-we could strike it silently and suddenly . "[76-dick]

" [I]76-dick do think so , indeed , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , warming .

" Have [ye]3689-the duke [my]3689-the duke Lord [Foxham]157-lord foxham s notes ? "[3689-the duke] inquired [the duke]3689-the duke .

And then , [Dick]76-dick , having explained how [he]76-dick was without them for the moment , made [himself]76-dick bold to offer information every jot as good , of [his]76-dick own knowledge . " And for [mine]76-dick own part , [[my]76-dick lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added , " an [ye]3689-the duke had [men]3205-men enough , [I]76-dick would fall on even at this present . For , look [ye]3689-the duke , at the peep of day the watches of the night are over ; but by day [they]4570-they keep neither watch nor ward only scour the outskirts with [horsemen]1526-horsemen . Now , then , when the night watch is already unarmed , and [the rest]375-the rest are at [their]375-the rest morning cup now were the time to break [them]4570-they . "[76-dick]

" How many do [ye]3689-the duke count ? "[201-my lord duke of gloucester] asked [Gloucester]201-my lord duke of gloucester .

" [They]4573-they number not two thousand , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick replied .

" [I]3689-the duke have seven hundred in [the woods behind [us]4575-us]4574-the woods behind us , "[3689-the duke] said [the duke]3689-the duke ; " seven hundred follow from [Kettley]75-sir daniel , and will be here anon ; behind these , and further , are four hundred more ; and [[my]3689-the duke Lord [Foxham]157-lord foxham]3850-my lord foxham hath five hundred half a day from here , at [Holywood]14-holywood . Shall [we]4575-us attend [their]4573-they coming , or fall on ? "[3689-the duke]

" [[My]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " when [ye]3102-my lord hanged [these five poor rogues]4578-these five poor rogues [ye]3102-my lord did decide the question . Churls although [they]4578-these five poor rogues were , in these uneasy , times [they]4578-these five poor rogues will be lacked and looked for , and the alarm be given . Therefore , [[my]76-dick lord]3102-my lord , if [ye]3102-my lord do count upon the advantage of a surprise , [ye]3102-my lord have not , in [my]76-dick poor opinion , one whole hour in front of [you]3102-my lord . "[76-dick]

" [I]199-crookback do think so indeed , "[199-crookback] returned [Crookback]199-crookback . " Well , before an hour , [ye]3102-my lord shall be in the thick on t , winning spurs . [A swift man to [Holywood]14-holywood]4580-a swift man to holywood , carrying [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s signet ; another along [the road]257-the road to speed [my]199-crookback laggards ! Nay , [Shelton]74-master shelton , by the rood , it may be done ! "[199-crookback]

Therewith [he]199-crookback once more set [his]199-crookback trumpet to [his]199-crookback lips and blew .

This time [he]199-crookback was not long kept waiting . In a moment the open space about the cross was filled with horse and foot . [Richard of Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester took [his]202-richard of gloucester place upon the steps , and despatched [messenger]2500-messenger after messenger to hasten the concentration of [the seven hundred men that lay hidden in [the immediate neighbourhood among [the woods]783-the woods]2502-the immediate neighbourhood among the woods]2501-the seven hundred men that lay hidden in the immediate neighbourhood among the woods ; and before a quarter of an hour had passed , all [his]202-richard of gloucester dispositions being taken , [he]202-richard of gloucester put [himself]202-richard of gloucester at [their]2501-the seven hundred men that lay hidden in the immediate neighbourhood among the woods head , and began to move down [the hill]314-the hill towards [Shoreby]20-shoreby .

[His]202-richard of gloucester plan was simple . [He]202-richard of gloucester was to seize [a quarter of [the town of Shoreby]2313-the town of shoreby lying on [the right hand of the high road]2507-the right hand of the high road]2505-a quarter of the town of shoreby lying on the right hand of the high road , and make [his]202-richard of gloucester position good there in [the narrow lanes]2508-the narrow lanes until [[his]202-richard of gloucester reinforcements]2509-his reinforcements followed .

If [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham chose to retreat , [Richard]202-richard of gloucester would follow upon [his]202-richard of gloucester rear , and take [him]202-richard of gloucester between two fires ; or , if [he]202-richard of gloucester preferred to hold [the town]1301-the town , [he]202-richard of gloucester would be shut in a trap , there to be gradually overwhelmed by force of numbers .

There was but one danger , but that was imminent and [great Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester s seven hundred might be rolled up and cut to pieces in the first encounter , and , to avoid this , it was needful to make the surprise of [their]2501-the seven hundred men that lay hidden in the immediate neighbourhood among the woods arrival as complete as possible .

[The footmen]2488-the footmen , therefore , were all once more taken up behind [the riders]2512-the riders , and [Dick]76-dick had the signal honour meted out to [him]76-dick of mounting behind [Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester [himself]202-richard of gloucester . For as far as there was any cover [the troops]2513-the troops moved slowly , and when [they]2513-the troops came near the end of the trees that lined [the highway]850-the highway , stopped to breathe and reconnoitre .

The sun was now well up , shining with a frosty brightness out of a yellow halo , and right over against the luminary , [Shoreby]20-shoreby , [a field of snowy roofs and ruddy gables]2515-a field of snowy roofs and ruddy gables , was rolling up [its]20-shoreby columns of morning smoke . [Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester turned round to [Dick]76-dick .

" In [that poor place]4582-that poor place , "[202-richard of gloucester] [he]202-richard of gloucester said , " where [people]249-people are cooking breakfast , either [you]4584-you shall gain [your]4584-you spurs and [I]202-richard of gloucester begin a life of mighty honour and glory in [the world]235-the world s eye , or both of [us]4586-us , as [I]202-richard of gloucester conceive it , shall fall dead and be unheard of . Two Richards are [we]4586-us . Well , then , [Richard Shelton]74-master shelton , [they]4587-their shall be heard about , these two ! [Their]4587-their swords shall not ring more loudly on [men]3205-men s helmets than [their]4587-their names shall ring in [people]249-people s ears . "[202-richard of gloucester]

[Dick]76-dick was astonished at so great a hunger after fame , expressed with so great vehemence of voice and language , and [he]76-dick answered very sensibly and quietly , that , for [his]76-dick part , [he]76-dick promised [he]76-dick would do [his]76-dick duty , and doubted not of victory if [everyone]2516-everyone did the like .

By this time the horses were well breathed , and [the leader]1398-the leader holding up [his]1398-the leader sword and giving rein , [the whole troop of chargers]2518-the whole troop of chargers broke into the gallop and thundered , with [their]2518-the whole troop of chargers double load of [fighting men]2519-fighting men , down [the remainder of [the hill]314-the hill]2520-the remainder of the hill and across [the snow - covered plain]2522-the snow - covered plain that still divided [them]2518-the whole troop of chargers from [Shoreby]20-shoreby .

CHAPTER II THE BATTLE OF [SHOREBY]20-shoreby

The whole distance to be crossed was not above a quarter of a mile . But [they]2518-the whole troop of chargers had no sooner debauched beyond the cover of the trees than [they]2518-the whole troop of chargers were aware of [people]249-people fleeing and screaming in [the snowy meadows]2524-the snowy meadows upon either hand . Almost at the same moment a great rumour began to arise , and spread and grow continually louder in [the town]1301-the town ; and [they]2518-the whole troop of chargers were not yet halfway to [the nearest house]2526-the nearest house before the bells began to ring backward from the steeple .

[The young duke]2527-the young duke ground [his]2527-the young duke teeth together . By these so early signals of alarm [he]2527-the young duke feared to find [[his]2527-the young duke enemies]2528-his enemies prepared ; and if [he]2527-the young duke failed to gain a footing in [the town]1301-the town , [he]2527-the young duke knew that [[his]2527-the young duke small party]2530-his small party would soon be broken and exterminated in the open .

In [the town]1301-the town , however , [the Lancastrians]203-the lancastrians were far from being in so good a posture . It was as [Dick]76-dick had said . [The night - guard]2532-the night - guard had already doffed [their]2532-the night - guard harness ; the rest were still hanging unlatched , unbraced , all unprepared for battle about [[their]2532-the night - guard quarters]2533-their quarters ; and in [the whole of [Shoreby]20-shoreby]2534-the whole of shoreby there were not , perhaps , [fifty men full armed , or fifty chargers ready to be mounted]2535-fifty men full armed , or fifty chargers ready to be mounted .

The beating of the bells , the terrifying summons of men who ran about [the streets]1303-the streets crying and beating upon the doors , aroused in an incredibly short space at least two score out of that half hundred . [These]2537-these got speedily to horse , and , the alarm still flying wild and contrary , galloped in different directions .

Thus it befell that , when [Richard of Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester reached [the first house of [Shoreby]20-shoreby]2538-the first house of shoreby , [he]202-richard of gloucester was met in the mouth of [the street]2417-the street by a mere handful of lances , whom [he]202-richard of gloucester swept before [his]202-richard of gloucester onset as the storm chases the bark .

A hundred paces into [the town]1301-the town , [Dick Shelton]76-dick touched [the duke]3689-the duke s arm ; [the duke]3689-the duke , in answer , gathered [his]3689-the duke reins , put the shrill trumpet to [his]3689-the duke mouth , and blowing a concerted point , turned to the right hand out of the direct advance . Swerving like [a single rider]837-a single rider , [his]202-richard of gloucester whole command turned after [him]202-richard of gloucester , and , still at the full gallop of the chargers , swept up [the narrow bye - street]2544-the narrow bye - street . Only [the last score of [riders]2546-riders]2545-the last score of riders drew rein and faced about in the entrance ; [the footmen]2488-the footmen , whom [they]2545-the last score of riders carried behind [them]2545-the last score of riders , leapt at the same instant to the earth , and began , some to bend [their]2488-the footmen bows , and [others]237-others to break into and secure [the houses]1328-the houses upon either hand .

Surprised at this sudden change of direction , and daunted by the firm front of [the rear - guard]2550-the rear - guard , the few Lancastrians , after a momentary consultation , turned and rode farther into [town]3118-town to seek for reinforcements .

[The quarter of [the town]1301-the town upon which , by the advice of [Dick]76-dick , [Richard of Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester had now seized]2552-the quarter of the town upon which , by the advice of dick , richard of gloucester had now seized , consisted of [five small streets of poor and ill - inhabited houses]2554-five small streets of poor and ill - inhabited houses , occupying a very gentle eminence , and lying open towards the back .

[The five streets]2555-the five streets being each secured by [a good guard]2556-a good guard , [the reserve]2557-the reserve would thus occupy the centre , out of shot , and yet ready to carry aid wherever it was needed .

Such was the poorness of [the neighbourhood]910-the neighbourhood that [none of [the Lancastrian lords]2560-the lancastrian lords]2559-none of the lancastrian lords , and but few of [[their]2560-the lancastrian lords retainers]2561-their retainers , had been lodged therein ; and [the inhabitants]2562-the inhabitants , with one accord , deserted [[their]2562-the inhabitants houses]2563-their houses and fled , squalling , along [the streets]1303-the streets or over [garden walls]2565-garden walls .

In the centre , where [the five ways all]2566-the five ways all met , [a somewhat ill - favoured alehouse]2567-a somewhat ill - favoured alehouse displayed the sign of [the Chequers]2568-the chequers ; and here [the Duke of [Gloucester]207-dick]2569-the duke of gloucester chose [[his]2569-the duke of gloucester headquarters]2570-his headquarters for the day .

To [Dick]76-dick [he]76-dick assigned the guard of [one of [the five streets]2555-the five streets]2571-one of the five streets .

" Go , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " win [your]76-dick spurs . Win glory for [me]76-dick : one [Richard]202-richard of gloucester for another . [I]76-dick tell [you]76-dick , if [I]76-dick rise , [ye]76-dick shall rise by the same ladder . Go , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added , shaking [him]76-dick by the hand .

But , as soon as [Dick]76-dick was gone , [he]76-dick turned to [a little shabby archer]2573-a little shabby archer at [his]76-dick elbow .

" Go , [Dutton]204-dutton , and that right speedily , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick added . " Follow [that lad]4590-that lad . If [ye]76-dick find [him]4590-that lad faithful , [ye]76-dick answer for [his]4590-that lad safety , a head for a head . Woe unto [you]76-dick , if [ye]76-dick return without [him]4590-that lad ! But if [he]4590-that lad be faithless or , for one instant , [ye]76-dick misdoubt [him]4590-that lad stab [him]4590-that lad from behind . "[76-dick]

In the meanwhile [Dick]76-dick hastened to secure [his]76-dick post . [The street]2417-the street [he]76-dick had to guard was very narrow , and closely lined with [houses]2575-houses , which projected and overhung [the roadway]2576-the roadway ; but narrow and dark as it was , since [it]2417-the street opened upon [the market - place of [the town]1301-the town]2577-the market - place of the town , the main issue of the battle would probably fall to be decided on that spot .

[The market - place]2321-the market - place was full of [townspeople]2580-townspeople fleeing in disorder ; but there was as yet no sign of [any foeman ready to attack]2581-any foeman ready to attack , and [Dick]76-dick judged [he]76-dick had some time before [him]76-dick to make ready [his]76-dick defence .

[The two houses at the end]2582-the two houses at the end stood deserted , with open doors , as [the inhabitants]2562-the inhabitants had left [them]2582-the two houses at the end in [their]2582-the two houses at the end flight , and from these [he]76-dick had the furniture hastily tossed forth and piled into a barrier in the entry of [the lane]2584-the lane . [A hundred men]2585-a hundred men were placed at [his]76-dick disposal , and of these [he]76-dick threw the more part into [the houses]1328-the houses , where [they]2585-a hundred men might lie in shelter and deliver [their]2585-a hundred men arrows from the windows . With the rest , under [his]76-dick own immediate eye , [he]76-dick lined the barricade .

Meanwhile the utmost uproar and confusion had continued to prevail throughout [the town]1301-the town ; and what with the hurried clashing of bells , the sounding of trumpets , the swift movement of bodies of horse , the cries of [the commanders]2588-the commanders , and the shrieks of [women]3399-women , the noise was almost deafening to the ear . Presently , little by little , the tumult began to subside ; and soon after , files of [men in armour and bodies of archers]2590-men in armour and bodies of archers began to assemble and form in line of battle in [the market - place]2321-the market - place .

A large portion of [this body]2592-this body were in murrey and blue , and in [the mounted knight who ordered [their]2585-a hundred men array]2593-the mounted knight who ordered their array [Dick]76-dick recognised [Sir Daniel Brackley]72-sir daniel .

Then there befell a long pause , which was followed by the almost simultaneous sounding of four trumpets from [four different quarters of [the town]1301-the town]2594-four different quarters of the town . A fifth rang in answer from [the market - place]2321-the market - place , and at the same moment the files began to move , and a shower of arrows rattled about the barricade , and sounded like blows upon the walls of [the two flanking houses]2597-the two flanking houses .

The attack had begun , by a common signal , on all the five issues of [the quarter]2598-the quarter . [Gloucester]207-dick was beleaguered upon every side ; and [Dick]76-dick judged , if [he]76-dick would make good [his]76-dick post , [he]76-dick must rely entirely on [the hundred men of [his]76-dick command]2599-the hundred men of his command .

Seven volleys of arrows followed one upon the other , and in the very thick of the discharges [Dick]76-dick was touched from behind upon the arm , and found a page holding out to [him]76-dick a leathern jack , strengthened with bright plates of mail .

" It is from [[my]2600-the page Lord of [Gloucester]207-dick]4591-my lord of gloucester , "[2600-the page] said [the page]2600-the page . " [He]4591-my lord of gloucester hath observed , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , that [ye]76-dick went unarmed . "[2600-the page]

[Dick]76-dick , with a glow at [his]76-dick heart at being so addressed , got to [his]76-dick feet and , with the assistance of [the page]2600-the page , donned the defensive coat . Even as [he]76-dick did so , two arrows rattled harmlessly upon the plates , and [a third]2602-a third struck down the page , mortally wounded , at [his]2600-the page feet .

Meantime [the whole body of [the enemy]1415-the enemy]2603-the whole body of the enemy had been steadily drawing nearer across [the market - place]2321-the market - place ; and by this time were so close at hand that [Dick]76-dick gave the order to return [their]2606-their shot . Immediately , from behind the barrier and from the windows of [the houses]1328-the houses , a counterblast of arrows sped , carrying death . But [the Lancastrians]203-the lancastrians , as if [they]203-the lancastrians had but waited for a signal , shouted loudly in answer ; and began to close at a run upon the barrier , [the horsemen]2608-the horsemen still hanging back , with visors lowered .

Then followed an obstinate and deadly struggle , hand to hand . [The assailants]774-the assailants , wielding [their]774-the assailants falchions with one hand , strove with the other to drag down [the structure of [the barricade]2611-the barricade]2610-the structure of the barricade . On the other side , the parts were reversed ; and [the defenders]2612-the defenders exposed [themselves]2612-the defenders like [madmen]2613-madmen to protect [[their]2612-the defenders rampart]2614-their rampart . So for some minutes the contest raged almost in silence , [friend]3100-friend and [foe]2616-foe falling one upon another . But it is always the easier to destroy ; and when a single note upon the tucket recalled [the attacking party]2617-the attacking party from this desperate service , much of the barricade had been removed piecemeal , and the whole fabric had sunk to half its height , and tottered to a general fall .

And now [the footmen]2488-the footmen in [the market - place]2321-the market - place fell back , at a run , on every side . [The horsemen , who had been standing in a line two deep]2620-the horsemen , who had been standing in a line two deep , wheeled suddenly , and made [their]2620-the horsemen , who had been standing in a line two deep flank into [their]2620-the horsemen , who had been standing in a line two deep front ; and as swift as a striking adder , the long , steel - clad column was launched upon [the ruinous barricade]2621-the ruinous barricade .

Of [the first two horsemen]2622-the first two horsemen , [one fell , rider]2623-one fell , rider and steed , and was ridden down by [[his]2623-one fell , rider companions]2370-his companions . [The second]1373-the second leaped clean upon the summit of [the rampart]2626-the rampart , transpiercing [an archer]4124-an archer with [his]4124-an archer lance . Almost in the same instant [he]1373-the second was dragged from the saddle and [his]1373-the second horse despatched .

And then the full weight and impetus of the charge burst upon and scattered [the defenders]2612-the defenders . [The men - at - arms]2489-the men - at - arms , surmounting [[their]2489-the men - at - arms fallen comrades]2630-their fallen comrades , and carried onward by the fury of [their]2489-the men - at - arms onslaught , dashed through [Dick]76-dick s broken line and poured thundering up [the lane beyond]2631-the lane beyond , as a stream bestrides and pours across a broken dam .

Yet was the fight not over . Still , in the narrow jaws of the entrance , [Dick]76-dick and [a few survivors]2632-a few survivors plied [their]2489-the men - at - arms bills like woodmen ; and already , across the width of [the passage]1107-the passage , there had been formed a second , a higher , and [a more effectual rampart of fallen men]2634-a more effectual rampart of fallen men and disembowelled horses , lashing in the agonies of death .

Baffled by this fresh obstacle , [the remainder of [the cavalry]2636-the cavalry]2635-the remainder of the cavalry fell back ; and as , at the sight of this movement , the flight of arrows redoubled from the casements of [the houses]1328-the houses , [their]2635-the remainder of the cavalry retreat had , for a moment , almost degenerated into flight .

Almost at the same time , [those who had crossed the barricade]2638-those who had crossed the barricade and charged farther up [the street]2417-the street , being met before the door of [the Chequers]2568-the chequers by the formidable hunchback and [the whole reserve of [the Yorkists]2642-the yorkists]2641-the whole reserve of the yorkists , began to come scattering backward , in the excess of disarray and terror .

[Dick]76-dick and [[his]76-dick fellows]2643-his fellows faced about , [fresh men]2644-fresh men poured out of [the houses]1328-the houses ; a cruel blast of arrows met [the fugitives]1721-the fugitives full in the face , while [Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester was already riding down [their]1721-the fugitives rear ; in the inside of a minute and a half there was no living Lancastrian in [the street]2417-the street .

Then , and not till then , did [Dick]76-dick hold up [his]76-dick reeking blade and give the word to cheer .

[Meanwhile Gloucester]205-meanwhile gloucester dismounted from [his]202-richard of gloucester horse and came forward to inspect the post . [His]202-richard of gloucester face was as pale as linen ; but [his]202-richard of gloucester eyes shone in [his]202-richard of gloucester head like some strange jewel , and [his]202-richard of gloucester voice , when [he]202-richard of gloucester spoke , was hoarse and broken with the exultation of battle and success . [He]202-richard of gloucester looked at the rampart , which [neither friend]2648-neither friend nor [foe]2616-foe could now approach without precaution , so fiercely did the horses struggle in the throes of death , and at the sight of that great carnage [he]202-richard of gloucester smiled upon one side .

" Despatch these horses , "[202-richard of gloucester] [he]202-richard of gloucester said ; " [they]203-the lancastrians keep [you]4592-ye from [your]4592-ye vantage . [Richard Shelton]129-sir richard , "[202-richard of gloucester] [he]202-richard of gloucester added , " [ye]4592-ye have pleased [me]202-richard of gloucester . Kneel . "[202-richard of gloucester]

[The Lancastrians]203-the lancastrians had already resumed [their]203-the lancastrians archery , and the shafts fell thick in the mouth of [the street]2417-the street ; but [the duke]3689-the duke , minding [them]203-the lancastrians not at all , deliberately drew [his]3689-the duke sword and dubbed [Richard]129-sir richard [a knight upon the spot]2652-a knight upon the spot .

" And now , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , "[202-richard of gloucester] [he]202-richard of gloucester continued , " if that [ye]4592-ye see [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham , send [me]202-richard of gloucester an express upon the instant . Were it [[your]4592-ye last man]4593-your last man , let [me]202-richard of gloucester hear of it incontinently . [I]202-richard of gloucester had rather venture the post than lose [my]202-richard of gloucester stroke at [him]184-lord risingham . For mark [me]202-richard of gloucester , all of [ye]4592-ye , "[202-richard of gloucester] [he]202-richard of gloucester added , raising [his]202-richard of gloucester voice , " if [Earl Risingham]139-earl risingham fall by another hand than [mine]202-richard of gloucester , [I]202-richard of gloucester shall count this victory a defeat . "[202-richard of gloucester]

" [[My]2653-one of his attendants lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[2653-one of his attendants] said [one of [[his]202-richard of gloucester attendants]2654-his attendants]2653-one of his attendants , " is [[your]3689-the duke grace]4595-your grace not weary of exposing [his]4595-your grace dear life unneedfully ? Why tarry [we]4596-we here ? "[2653-one of his attendants]

" [Catesby]206-catesby , "[3689-the duke] returned [the duke]3689-the duke , " here is the battle , not elsewhere . The rest are but feigned onslaughts . Here must [we]4596-we vanquish . And for the exposure if [ye]4592-ye were [an ugly hunchback]4597-an ugly hunchback , and [the children]4598-the children gecked at [you]4592-ye upon [the street]2417-the street , [ye]4592-ye would count [your]4592-ye body cheaper , and an hour of glory worth a life . Howbeit , if [ye]4592-ye will , let [us]4596-we ride on and visit [the other posts]4600-the other posts . [Sir Richard]129-sir richard here , [[my]3689-the duke namesake]4601-my namesake , [he]129-sir richard shall still hold this entry , where [he]129-sir richard wadeth to the ankles in hot blood . [Him]129-sir richard can [we]4596-we trust . But mark it , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , [ye]129-sir richard are not yet done . The worst is yet to ward . Sleep not . "[3689-the duke]

[He]2656-he came right up to [young Shelton]129-sir richard , looking [him]129-sir richard hard in the eyes , and taking [his]129-sir richard hand in both of [his]2656-he , gave it so extreme a squeeze that the blood had nearly spurted . [Dick]76-dick quailed before [his]76-dick eyes . The insane excitement , the courage , and the cruelty that [he]76-dick read therein filled [him]76-dick with dismay about the future . [This young duke s]2657-this young duke s was indeed [a gallant spirit , to ride foremost in the ranks of war]2658-a gallant spirit , to ride foremost in the ranks of war ; but after the battle , in the days of peace and in [the circle of [[his]76-dick trusted friends]2660-his trusted friends]2659-the circle of his trusted friends , that mind , it was to be dreaded , would continue to bring forth the fruits of death .

CHAPTER III THE BATTLE OF [SHOREBY]20-shoreby Concluded

[Dick]76-dick , once more left to [[his]76-dick own counsels]2661-his own counsels , began to look about [him]76-dick . The arrow - shot had somewhat slackened . On all sides [the enemy]1415-the enemy were falling back ; and the greater part of [the market - place]2321-the market - place was now left empty , the snow here trampled into orange mud , there splashed with gore , scattered all over with [dead men]4383-dead men and horses , and bristling thick with feathered arrows .

On [his]76-dick own side the loss had been cruel . The jaws of [the little street]2665-the little street and [the ruins of [the barricade]2611-the barricade]2666-the ruins of the barricade were heaped with [the dead and dying]2668-the dead and dying ; and out of [the hundred men with whom [he]76-dick had begun the battle]2669-the hundred men with whom he had begun the battle , there were not [seventy left who could still stand to arms]2670-seventy left who could still stand to arms .

At the same time , the day was passing . [The first reinforcements]2671-the first reinforcements might be looked for to arrive at any moment ; and [the Lancastrians]203-the lancastrians , already shaken by the result of [their]203-the lancastrians desperate but unsuccessful onslaught , were in an ill temper to support [a fresh invader]2672-a fresh invader .

There was a dial in the wall of [one of [the two flanking houses]2597-the two flanking houses]2673-one of the two flanking houses ; and this , in the frosty winter sunshine , indicated ten of the forenoon .

[Dick]76-dick turned to [the man who was at [his]76-dick elbow]2675-the man who was at his elbow , [a little insignificant archer]2676-a little insignificant archer , binding a cut in [his]2676-a little insignificant archer arm .

" It was well fought , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " and , by [my]76-dick sooth , [they]203-the lancastrians will not charge [us]4602-us twice . "[76-dick]

" [Sir]3184-sir , "[2677-the little archer] said [the little archer]2677-the little archer , " [ye]3184-sir have fought right well for [York]8-york , and better for [yourself]3184-sir . Never hath man in so brief space prevailed so greatly on [the duke]3689-the duke s affections . That [he]2676-a little insignificant archer should have entrusted such a post to one [he]2676-a little insignificant archer knew not is a marvel . But look to [your]3184-sir head , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard ! If [ye]3184-sir be vanquished ay , if [ye]3184-sir give way one foot s breadth axe or cord shall punish it ; and [I]2677-the little archer am set if [ye]3184-sir do aught doubtful , [I]2677-the little archer will tell [you]3184-sir honestly , here to stab [you]3184-sir from behind . "[2677-the little archer]

[Dick]76-dick looked at [the little man]2678-the little man in amaze .

" [You]2678-the little man ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried . " And from behind ! "[76-dick]

" It is right so , "[3173-the archer] returned [the archer]3173-the archer ; " and because [I]3173-the archer like not the affair [I]3173-the archer tell it [you]3184-sir . [Ye]3184-sir must make the post good , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , at [your]3184-sir peril . O , [[our]4605-our [Crookback]199-crookback]4606-our crookback is a bold blade and [a good warrior]4607-a good warrior ; but , whether in cold blood or in hot , [he]199-crookback will have all things done exact to [his]199-crookback commandment . If any fail or hinder , [they]4608-they shall die the death . "[3173-the archer]

" Now , by the saints ! "[129-sir richard] cried [Richard]129-sir richard , " is this so ? And will [men]3205-men follow [such a leader]4610-such a leader ? "[129-sir richard]

" Nay , [they]4608-they follow [him]199-crookback gleefully , "[311-the other] replied [the other]311-the other ; " for if [he]199-crookback be exact to punish , [he]199-crookback is most open - handed to reward . And if [he]199-crookback spare not the blood and sweat of [others]237-others , [he]199-crookback is ever liberal of [his]199-crookback own , still in the first front of battle , still [the last to sleep]4612-the last to sleep . [He]199-crookback will go far , will [Crookback Dick o Gloucester]207-dick ! "[311-the other]

[The young knight]2681-the young knight , if [he]2681-the young knight had before been brave and vigilant , was now all the more inclined to watchfulness and courage . [His]2681-the young knight sudden favour , [he]2681-the young knight began to perceive , had brought perils in its train . And [he]2681-the young knight turned from [the archer]3173-the archer , and once more scanned anxiously [the market - place]2321-the market - place . [It]2321-the market - place lay empty as before .

" [I]2681-the young knight like not this quietude , "[2681-the young knight] [he]2681-the young knight said . " Doubtless [they]2164-the archers prepare [us]4613-us some surprise . "[2681-the young knight]

And , as if in answer to [his]2681-the young knight remark , [the archers]2164-the archers began once more to advance against the barricade , and the arrows to fall thick . But there was something hesitating in the attack . [They]2164-the archers came not on roundly , but seemed rather to await a further signal .

[Dick]207-dick looked uneasily about [him]207-dick , spying for a hidden danger . And sure enough , about half way up [the little street]2665-the little street , a door was suddenly opened from within , and [the house]321-the house continued , for some seconds , and both by door and window , to disgorge a torrent of Lancastrian archers . [These]2164-the archers , as [they]2164-the archers leaped down , hurriedly stood to [their]2164-the archers ranks , bent [their]2164-the archers bows , and proceeded to pour upon [Dick]207-dick s rear a flight of arrows .

At the same time , [the assailants in [the market - place]2321-the market - place]2687-the assailants in the market - place redoubled [their]2687-the assailants in the market - place shot , and began to close in stoutly upon the barricade .

[Dick]207-dick called down [his]207-dick whole command out of [the houses]1328-the houses , and facing [them]1328-the houses both ways , and encouraging [their]1328-the houses valour both by word and gesture , returned as best [he]207-dick could the double shower of shafts that fell about [[his]207-dick post]2690-his post .

[Meanwhile house]2691-meanwhile house after [house]3166-house was opened in [the street]2417-the street , and [the Lancastrians]2694-the lancastrians continued to pour out of the doors and leap down from the windows , shouting victory , until the number of [enemies]3828-enemies upon [Dick]207-dick s rear was almost equal to the number in [his]207-dick face . It was plain that [he]207-dick could hold the post no longer ; what was worse , even if [he]207-dick could have held it , it had now become useless ; and [the whole Yorkist army]2696-the whole yorkist army lay in a posture of helplessness upon the brink of a complete disaster .

[The men behind [him]207-dick]2697-the men behind him formed the vital flaw in the general defence ; and it was upon these that [Dick]207-dick turned , charging at the head of [[his]207-dick men]417-his men . So vigorous was the attack , that [the Lancastrian archers]2699-the lancastrian archers gave ground and staggered , and , at last , breaking [their]2699-the lancastrian archers ranks , began to crowd back into [the houses from which [they]2699-the lancastrian archers had so recently and so vaingloriously sallied]2700-the houses from which they had so recently and so vaingloriously sallied .

Meanwhile [the men from [the market - place]2321-the market - place]2701-the men from the market - place had swarmed across the undefended barricade , and fell on hotly upon the other side ; and [Dick]207-dick must once again face about , and proceed to drive [them]2701-the men from the market - place back . Once again the spirit of [[his]207-dick men]417-his men prevailed ; [they]417-his men cleared [the street]2417-the street in a triumphant style , but even as [they]417-his men did so [the others]379-the others issued again out of [the houses]1328-the houses , and took [them]2701-the men from the market - place , a third time , upon the rear .

[The Yorkists]165-the yorkists began to be scattered ; several times [Dick]207-dick found [himself]207-dick alone among [[his]207-dick foes]2464-his foes and plying [his]207-dick bright sword for life ; several times [he]207-dick was conscious of a hurt . And meanwhile the fight swayed to and fro in [the street]2417-the street without determinate result .

Suddenly [Dick]207-dick was aware of a great trumpeting about [the outskirts of [the town]1301-the town]2709-the outskirts of the town . The war - cry of [York]8-york began to be rolled up to heaven , as by many and triumphant voices . And at the same time [the men in front of [him]207-dick]2711-the men in front of him began to give ground rapidly , streaming out of [the street]2417-the street and back upon [the market - place]2321-the market - place . [Some one]3814-some one gave the word to fly . Trumpets were blown distractedly , some for a rally , some to charge . It was plain that a great blow had been struck , and [the Lancastrians]203-the lancastrians were thrown , at least for the moment , into full disorder , and some degree of panic .

And then , like a theatre trick , there followed the last act of [Shoreby Battle]61-shoreby battle . [The men in front of [Richard]129-sir richard]2715-the men in front of richard turned tail , like a dog that has been whistled [home]699-home , and fled like the wind . At the same moment there came through [the market - place]2321-the market - place [a storm of horsemen]2718-a storm of horsemen , fleeing and pursuing , [the Lancastrians]203-the lancastrians turning back to strike with the sword , [the Yorkists]165-the yorkists riding [them]2715-the men in front of richard down at the point of the lance .

Conspicuous in the mellay , [Dick]207-dick beheld [the Crookback]199-crookback . [He]207-dick was already giving a foretaste of that furious valour and skill to cut [his]207-dick way across the ranks of war , which , years afterwards upon [the field of [Bosworth]62-bosworth]2719-the field of bosworth , and when [he]207-dick was stained with crimes , almost sufficed to change the fortunes of the day and the destiny of the English throne . Evading , striking , riding down , [he]207-dick so forced and so manoeuvred [his]207-dick strong horse , so aptly defended [himself]207-dick , and so liberally scattered death to [[his]207-dick opponents]2456-his opponents , that [he]207-dick was now far ahead of [the foremost of [[his]207-dick knights]2722-his knights]2721-the foremost of his knights , hewing [his]207-dick way , with the truncheon of a bloody sword , to where [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham was rallying [the bravest]2723-the bravest . A moment more and [they]2724-they had met ; [the tall , splendid , and famous warrior against [the deformed and sickly boy]2726-the deformed and sickly boy]2725-the tall , splendid , and famous warrior against the deformed and sickly boy .

Yet [Shelton]129-sir richard had never a doubt of the result ; and when the fight next opened for a moment , the figure of [the earl]2300-the earl had disappeared ; but still , in the first of the danger , [Crookback Dick]208-dick was launching [his]208-dick big horse and plying the truncheon of [his]208-dick sword .

Thus , by [Shelton]129-sir richard s courage in holding the mouth of [the street]2417-the street against the first attack , and by the opportune arrival of [[his]208-dick seven hundred reinforcements]2729-his seven hundred reinforcements , [the lad , who was afterwards to be handed down to the execration of posterity]2730-the lad , who was afterwards to be handed down to the execration of posterity under the name of [Richard III]209-richard . , had won [his]2730-the lad , who was afterwards to be handed down to the execration of posterity first considerable fight .

CHAPTER IV [THE SACK OF SHOREBY]210-the sack of shoreby

There was not [a foe left within striking distance]2731-a foe left within striking distance ; and [Dick]208-dick , as [he]208-dick looked ruefully about [him]208-dick on the remainder of [his]208-dick gallant force , began to count the cost of victory . [He]208-dick was [himself]208-dick , now that the danger was ended , so stiff and sore , so bruised and cut and broken , and , above all , so utterly exhausted by [his]208-dick desperate and unremitting labours in the fight , that [he]208-dick seemed incapable of any fresh exertion .

But this was not yet the hour for repose . [Shoreby]20-shoreby had been taken by assault ; and though [an open town]1313-an open town , and not in any manner to be charged with the resistance , it was plain that [these rough fighters]2733-these rough fighters would be not less rough now that the fight was over , and that the more horrid part of war would fall to be enacted . [[Richard]209-richard of [Gloucester]207-dick]4166-richard of gloucester was not [the captain]1604-the captain to protect [the citizens]2736-the citizens from [[his]209-richard infuriated soldiery]2737-his infuriated soldiery ; and even if [he]209-richard had the will , it might be questioned if [he]209-richard had the power .

It was , therefore , [Dick]208-dick s business to find and to protect [Joanna]117-joanna ; and with that end [he]208-dick looked about [him]208-dick at the faces of [[his]208-dick men]417-his men . [The three or four who seemed likeliest to be obedient and to keep sober]2739-the three or four who seemed likeliest to be obedient and to keep sober [he]208-dick drew aside ; and promising [them]2739-the three or four who seemed likeliest to be obedient and to keep sober a rich reward and a special recommendation to [the duke]3689-the duke , led [them]2739-the three or four who seemed likeliest to be obedient and to keep sober across [the market - place]2321-the market - place , now empty of [horsemen]1526-horsemen , and into [the streets upon the further side]2743-the streets upon the further side .

Every here and there small combats of from two to a dozen still raged upon [the open street]2744-the open street ; here and there [a house]653-a house was being besieged , [the defenders]2612-the defenders throwing out stools and tables on the heads of [the assailants]774-the assailants . The snow was strewn with arms and corpses ; but except for these partial combats [the streets]1303-the streets were deserted , and [the houses]1328-the houses , some standing open , and some shuttered and barricaded , had for the most part ceased to give out smoke .

[Dick]208-dick , threading the skirts of [these skirmishers]2750-these skirmishers , led [[his]208-dick followers]1134-his followers briskly in the direction of [the abbey church]1936-the abbey church ; but when [he]208-dick came the length of [the main street]487-the main street , a cry of horror broke from [his]208-dick lips . [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s great house]2754-sir daniel s great house had been carried by assault . The gates hung in splinters from the hinges , and [a double throng]2755-a double throng kept pouring in and out through the entrance , seeking and carrying booty . Meanwhile , in [the upper storeys]2756-the upper storeys , some resistance was still being offered to [the pillagers]2757-the pillagers ; for just as [Dick]208-dick came within eyeshot of [the building]659-the building , a casement was burst open from within , and [a poor wretch in murrey and blue]2759-a poor wretch in murrey and blue , screaming and resisting , was forced through the embrasure and tossed into [the street below]2760-the street below .

The most sickening apprehension fell upon [Dick]208-dick . [He]208-dick ran forward like one possessed , forced [his]208-dick way into [the house]321-the house among the foremost , and mounted without pause to [the chamber on the third floor where [he]208-dick had last parted from [Joanna]117-joanna]2762-the chamber on the third floor where he had last parted from joanna . It was a mere wreck ; the furniture had been overthrown , the cupboards broken open , and in one place a trailing corner of the arras lay smouldering on the embers of the fire .

[Dick]208-dick , almost without thinking , trod out the incipient conflagration , and then stood bewildered . [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , [Sir Oliver]73-sir oliver , [Joanna]117-joanna , all were gone ; but whether butchered in the rout or safe escaped from [Shoreby]210-the sack of shoreby , who should say ?

[He]208-dick caught [a passing archer by the tabard]2763-a passing archer by the tabard .

" [Fellow]211-fellow , "[208-dick] [he]208-dick asked , " were [ye]211-fellow here when [this house]3790-this house was taken ? "[208-dick]

" Let be , "[3173-the archer] said [the archer]3173-the archer . " A murrain ! let be , or [I]3173-the archer strike . "[3173-the archer]

" Hark [ye]211-fellow , "[209-richard] returned [Richard]209-richard , " two can play at that . Stand and be plain . "[209-richard]

But [the man , flushed with drink and battle]2765-the man , flushed with drink and battle , struck [Dick]208-dick upon the shoulder with one hand , while with the other [he]2765-the man , flushed with drink and battle twitched away [his]2765-the man , flushed with drink and battle garment . Thereupon the full wrath of [the young leader]1637-the young leader burst from [his]208-dick control . [He]208-dick seized [the fellow]677-the fellow in [his]208-dick strong embrace , and crushed [him]677-the fellow on the plates of [his]208-dick mailed bosom like [a child]3529-a child ; then , holding [him]677-the fellow at arm s length , [he]208-dick bid [him]677-the fellow speak as [he]208-dick valued life .

" [I]3173-the archer pray [you]208-dick mercy ! "[3173-the archer] gasped [the archer]3173-the archer . " An [I]3173-the archer had thought [ye]208-dick were so angry [I]3173-the archer would a been charier of crossing [you]208-dick . [I]3173-the archer was here indeed . "[3173-the archer]

" Know [ye]3175-the man [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel ? "[208-dick] pursued [Dick]208-dick .

" Well do [I]3175-the man know [him]72-sir daniel , "[3175-the man] returned [the man]3175-the man .

" Was [he]72-sir daniel in [the mansion]4615-the mansion ? "[3173-the archer]

" Ay , [sir]3184-sir , [he]72-sir daniel was , "[3173-the archer] answered [the archer]3173-the archer ; " but even as [we]4617-we entered by [the yard gate]4618-the yard gate [he]72-sir daniel rode forth by [the garden]3861-the garden . "[3173-the archer]

" Alone ? "[208-dick] cried [Dick]208-dick .

" [He]72-sir daniel may a had a score of lances with [him]72-sir daniel , "[3175-the man] said [the man]3175-the man .

" [Lances]212-lances ! [No women]4620-no women , then ? "[129-sir richard] asked [Shelton]129-sir richard .

" [Troth]213-troth , [I]3173-the archer saw not , "[3173-the archer] said [the archer]3173-the archer . " But there were none in [the house]321-the house , if that be [your]213-troth quest . "[3173-the archer]

" [I]208-dick thank [you]3175-the man , "[208-dick] said [Dick]208-dick . " Here is a piece for [your]3175-the man pains . "[208-dick] But groping in [his]208-dick wallet , [Dick]208-dick found nothing . " Inquire for [me]208-dick to - morrow , "[208-dick] [he]208-dick added " [Richard Shelt Sir Richard Shelton]129-sir richard , "[208-dick] [he]208-dick corrected , " and [I]208-dick will see [you]208-dick handsomely rewarded . "[208-dick]

And then an idea struck [Dick]208-dick . [He]208-dick hastily descended to [the courtyard]1125-the courtyard , ran with all [his]208-dick might across [the garden]3861-the garden , and came to the great door of [the church]262-the church . [It]2777-it stood wide open ; within , every corner of [the pavement]2778-the pavement was crowded with [fugitive burghers]2779-fugitive burghers , surrounded by [[their]2779-fugitive burghers families]2780-their families and laden with the most precious of [their]2779-fugitive burghers possessions , while , at the high altar , [priests in full canonicals]2781-priests in full canonicals were imploring the mercy of [God]79-god . Even as [Dick]208-dick entered , the loud chorus began to thunder in the vaulted roofs .

[He]208-dick hurried through [the groups of [refugees]2783-refugees]2782-the groups of refugees , and came to the door of the stair that led into the steeple . And here [a tall churchman]2784-a tall churchman stepped before [him]208-dick and arrested [his]208-dick advance .

" Whither , [[my]2784-a tall churchman son]4223-my son ? "[2784-a tall churchman] [he]2784-a tall churchman asked , severely .

" [[My]208-dick father]3558-my father , "[208-dick] answered [Dick]208-dick , " [I]208-dick am here upon an errand of expedition . Stay [me]208-dick not . [I]208-dick command here for [[my]208-dick Lord of [Gloucester]207-dick]4591-my lord of gloucester . "[208-dick]

" For [[my]338-the priest Lord of [Gloucester]207-dick]4591-my lord of gloucester ? "[338-the priest] repeated [the priest]338-the priest . " Hath , then , the battle gone so sore ? "[338-the priest]

" The battle , [father]3848-father , is at an end , [Lancaster]7-lancaster clean sped , [[my]338-the priest Lord of Risingham]184-lord risingham Heaven rest [him]7-lancaster ! left upon [the field]306-the field . And now , with [your]3848-father good leave , [I]338-the priest follow [mine]338-the priest affairs . "[338-the priest] And thrusting on one side [the priest]338-the priest , who seemed stupefied at the news , [Dick]208-dick pushed open the door and rattled up the stairs four at a bound , and without pause or stumble , till [he]208-dick stepped upon the open platform at the top .

[Shoreby Church tower]63-shoreby church tower not only commanded [the town]1301-the town , as in a map , but looked far , on both sides , over [sea and land]4189-sea and land . [It]2789-it was now near upon noon ; the day exceeding bright , the snow dazzling . And as [Dick]208-dick looked around [him]208-dick , [he]208-dick could measure the consequences of the battle .

A confused , growling uproar reached [him]208-dick from [the streets]1303-the streets , and now and then , but very rarely , the clash of steel . Not [a ship]4059-a ship , not so much as [a skiff]2792-a skiff remained in [harbour]2793-harbour ; but [the sea]1479-the sea was dotted with sails and [row - boats]2795-row - boats laden with [fugitives]2796-fugitives . On [shore]585-shore , too , the surface of [the snowy meadows]2524-the snowy meadows was broken up with bands of [horsemen]1526-horsemen , some cutting [their]1526-horsemen way towards [the borders of [the forest]246-the forest]2800-the borders of the forest , [others]237-others , who were doubtless of the Yorkist side , stoutly interposing and beating [them]237-others back upon [the town]1301-the town . Over [all the open ground]2804-all the open ground there lay [a prodigious quantity of fallen men]2805-a prodigious quantity of fallen men and horses , clearly defined upon the snow .

To complete the picture , [those of [the foot soldiers as had not found place upon]2807-the foot soldiers as had not found place upon [a ship]4059-a ship]2806-those of the foot soldiers as had not found place upon a ship still kept up an archery combat on [the borders of [the port]1540-the port]2809-the borders of the port , and from the cover of [the shoreside taverns]1542-the shoreside taverns . In [that quarter]2812-that quarter , also , [one or two houses]2813-one or two houses had been fired , and the smoke towered high in the frosty sunlight , and blew off to [sea]3475-sea in voluminous folds .

Already close upon the margin of [the woods]783-the woods , and somewhat in the line of [Holywood]14-holywood , [one particular clump of fleeing horsemen]2816-one particular clump of fleeing horsemen riveted the attention of [the young watcher on the tower]2817-the young watcher on the tower . It was fairly numerous ; in [no other quarter of [the field]306-the field]2818-no other quarter of the field did so many Lancastrians still hold together ; thus [they]2820-they had left a wide , discoloured wake upon the snow , and [Dick]208-dick was able to trace [them]2820-they step by step from where [they]2820-they had left [the town]1301-the town .

While [Dick]208-dick stood watching [them]2820-they , [they]2820-they had gained , unopposed , [the first fringe of [the leafless forest]2823-the leafless forest]2822-the first fringe of the leafless forest , and , turning a little from [their]2820-they direction , the sun fell for a moment full on [their]2820-they array , as it was relieved against the dusky wood .

" [Murrey]214-murrey and blue ! "[208-dick] cried [Dick]208-dick . " [I]208-dick swear it murrey and blue ! "[208-dick]

The next moment [he]208-dick was descending [the stairway]2824-the stairway .

It was now [his]208-dick business to seek out [the Duke of [Gloucester]207-dick]2569-the duke of gloucester , who alone , in the disorder of [the forces]2826-the forces , might be able to supply [him]208-dick with a sufficiency of [men]3205-men . The fighting in [the main town]2828-the main town was now practically at an end ; and as [Dick]208-dick ran hither and thither , seeking [the commander]2829-the commander , [the streets]1303-the streets were thick with [wandering soldiers]2831-wandering soldiers , some laden with more booty than [they]2831-wandering soldiers could well stagger under , [others shouting drunk]2832-others shouting drunk . [None of [them]2820-they]2833-none of them , when questioned , had the least notion of [the duke]3689-the duke s whereabouts ; and , at last , it was by sheer good fortune that [Dick]208-dick found [him]3689-the duke , where [he]208-dick sat in the saddle directing operations to dislodge [the archers]2164-the archers from [the harbour side]2836-the harbour side .

" [Sir Richard Shelton]129-sir richard , [ye]129-sir richard are well found , "[208-dick] [he]208-dick said . " [I]208-dick owe [you]129-sir richard one thing that [I]208-dick value little , [my]208-dick life ; and one that [I]208-dick can never pay [you]129-sir richard for , this victory . [Catesby]206-catesby , if [I]208-dick had ten such captains as [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , [I]208-dick would march forthright on [London]64-london . But now , [sir]3184-sir , claim [your]129-sir richard reward . "[208-dick]

" Freely , [[my]208-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[208-dick] said [Dick]208-dick , " freely and loudly . [One]3600-one hath escaped to whom [I]208-dick owe some grudges , and taken with [him]3600-one one whom [I]208-dick owe love and service . Give [me]208-dick , then , fifty lances , that [I]208-dick may pursue ; and for any obligation that [your]129-sir richard graciousness is pleased to allow , it shall be clean discharged . "[208-dick]

" How call [ye]3689-the duke [him]3600-one ? "[3689-the duke] inquired [the duke]3689-the duke .

" [Sir Daniel Brackley]72-sir daniel , "[129-sir richard] answered [Richard]129-sir richard .

" Out upon [him]3600-one , double - face ! "[207-dick] cried [Gloucester]207-dick . " Here is no reward , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard ; here is fresh service offered , and , if that [ye]129-sir richard bring [his]3600-one head to [me]207-dick , a fresh debt upon [my]207-dick conscience . [Catesby]206-catesby , get [him]3600-one these lances ; and [you]129-sir richard , [sir]3184-sir , bethink [ye]129-sir richard , in the meanwhile , what pleasure , honour , or profit it shall be [mine]207-dick to give [you]129-sir richard . "[207-dick]

Just then [the Yorkist skirmishers]2838-the yorkist skirmishers carried [one of [the shoreside taverns]1542-the shoreside taverns]2839-one of the shoreside taverns , swarming in upon [it]2839-one of the shoreside taverns on three sides , and driving out or taking [its defenders]2841-its defenders . [Crookback Dick]208-dick was pleased to cheer [the exploit]2842-the exploit , and pushing [his]208-dick horse a little nearer , called to see [the prisoners]2260-the prisoners .

There were four or five of [them]2260-the prisoners [two men of [[my]0-i Lord Shoreby s]2845-my lord shoreby s]2844-two men of my lord shoreby s and one of [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham s among the number , and last , but in [Dick]208-dick s eyes not least , [a tall , shambling , grizzled old shipman]2846-a tall , shambling , grizzled old shipman , between drunk and sober , and with a dog whimpering and jumping at [his]2846-a tall , shambling , grizzled old shipman heels .

[The young duke]2527-the young duke passed [them]2260-the prisoners for a moment under a severe review .

" Good , "[2527-the young duke] [he]2527-the young duke said . " Hang [them]2260-the prisoners . "[2527-the young duke]

And [he]2527-the young duke turned the other way to watch the progress of the fight .

" [[My]208-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[208-dick] said [Dick]208-dick , " so please [you]3102-my lord , [I]208-dick have found [my]208-dick reward . Grant [me]208-dick the life and liberty of [yon old shipman]4633-yon old shipman . "[208-dick]

[Gloucester]207-dick turned and looked [the speaker]691-the speaker in the face .

" [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , "[2527-the young duke] [he]2527-the young duke said , " [I]2527-the young duke make not war with peacock s feathers , but steel shafts . Those that are [mine]2527-the young duke enemies [I]2527-the young duke slay , and that without excuse or favour . For , bethink [ye]129-sir richard , in [this realm of [England]22-england]4634-this realm of england , that is so torn in pieces , there is not [a man of mine]4327-a man of mine but hath [a brother]4636-a brother or [a friend upon the other party]4637-a friend upon the other party . If , then , [I]2527-the young duke did begin to grant these pardons , [I]2527-the young duke might sheathe [my]2527-the young duke sword . "[2527-the young duke]

" It may be so , [[my]207-dick lord]3102-my lord ; and yet [I]207-dick will be overbold , and at the risk of [your]3102-my lord disfavour , recall [your]3102-my lord lordship s promise , "[207-dick] replied [Dick]207-dick .

[Richard of Gloucester]202-richard of gloucester flushed .

" Mark it right well , "[2527-the young duke] [he]2527-the young duke said , harshly . " [I]2527-the young duke love not mercy , nor yet [mercymongers]4639-mercymongers . [Ye]129-sir richard have this day laid the foundations of high fortune . If [ye]129-sir richard oppose to [me]2527-the young duke [my]2527-the young duke word , which [I]2527-the young duke have plighted , [I]2527-the young duke will yield . But , by the glory of heaven , there [your]129-sir richard favour dies ![2527-the young duke]

" [Mine]207-dick is the loss , "[207-dick] said [Dick]207-dick .

" Give [him]2527-the young duke [[his]2527-the young duke sailor]4640-his sailor , "[3689-the duke] said [the duke]3689-the duke ; and wheeling [his]3689-the duke horse , [he]3689-the duke turned [his]3689-the duke back upon [young Shelton]129-sir richard .

[Dick]207-dick was nor glad nor sorry . [He]207-dick had seen too much of [the young duke]2527-the young duke to set great store on [his]207-dick affection ; and the origin and growth of [his]207-dick own favour had been too flimsy and too rapid to inspire much confidence . One thing alone [he]207-dick feared that [the vindictive leader]2851-the vindictive leader might revoke the offer of the lances . But here [he]207-dick did justice neither to [Gloucester]207-dick s honour such as it was nor , above all , to [his]207-dick decision . If [he]207-dick had once judged [Dick]207-dick to be [the right man to pursue [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel]2852-the right man to pursue sir daniel , [he]207-dick was not one to change ; and [he]207-dick soon proved it by shouting after [Catesby]206-catesby to be speedy , for [the paladin]4309-the paladin was waiting .

In the meanwhile , [Dick]207-dick turned to [the old shipman]2854-the old shipman , who had seemed equally indifferent to [his]207-dick condemnation and to [his]207-dick subsequent release .

" [Arblaster]173-arblaster , "[207-dick] said [Dick]207-dick , " [I]207-dick have done [you]173-arblaster ill ; but now , by the rood , [I]207-dick think [I]207-dick have cleared the score . "[207-dick]

But [the old skipper]2855-the old skipper only looked upon [him]207-dick dully and held [his]2855-the old skipper peace .

" Come , "[207-dick] continued [Dick]207-dick , " a life is a life , [old shrew]3131-old shrew , and it is more than ships or liquor . Say [ye]173-arblaster forgive [me]207-dick ; for if [your]173-arblaster life be worth nothing to [you]173-arblaster , it hath cost [me]207-dick the beginnings of [my]207-dick fortune . Come , [I]207-dick have paid for it dearly ; be not so churlish . "[207-dick]

" An [I]173-arblaster had had [[my]173-arblaster ship]4507-my ship , "[173-arblaster] said [Arblaster]173-arblaster , " [I]173-arblaster would a been forth and safe on [the high seas]4494-the high seas [I]173-arblaster and [[my]173-arblaster man]4073-my man [Tom]136-tom . But [ye]173-arblaster took [[my]173-arblaster ship]4507-my ship , gossip , and [I]173-arblaster m [a beggar]4646-a beggar ; and for [[my]173-arblaster man]4073-my man [Tom]136-tom , [a knave fellow in russet]4648-a knave fellow in russet shot [him]136-tom down . [Murrain]215-murrain ! quoth [he]136-tom , and spake never again . [Murrain]215-murrain was the last of [his]136-tom words , and the poor spirit of [him]136-tom passed . A will never sail no more , will [[my]173-arblaster [Tom]136-tom]4649-my tom . "[173-arblaster]

[Dick]207-dick was seized with unavailing penitence and pity ; [he]207-dick sought to take [the skipper]1580-the skipper s hand , but [Arblaster]173-arblaster avoided [his]207-dick touch .

" Nay , "[207-dick] said [he]207-dick , " let be . [Y]129-sir richard have played the devil with [me]207-dick , and let that content [you]129-sir richard . "[207-dick]

The words died in [Richard]129-sir richard s throat . [He]207-dick saw , through tears , [the poor old man]2857-the poor old man , bemused with liquor and sorrow , go shambling away , with bowed head , across the snow , and the unnoticed dog whimpering at [his]2857-the poor old man heels , and for the first time began to understand the desperate game that [we]2858-we play in life ; and how a thing once done is not to be changed or remedied , by any penitence .

But there was no time left to [him]2857-the poor old man for vain regret .

[Catesby]206-catesby had now collected [the horsemen]2608-the horsemen , and riding up to [Dick]207-dick [he]206-catesby dismounted , and offered [him]207-dick [his]206-catesby own horse .

" This morning , "[206-catesby] [he]206-catesby said , " [I]206-catesby was somewhat jealous of [your]207-dick favour ; it hath not been of a long growth ; and now , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , it is with a very good heart that [I]206-catesby offer [you]207-dick this horse to ride away with . "[206-catesby]

" Suffer [me]207-dick yet a moment , "[207-dick] replied [Dick]207-dick . " This favour of [mine]207-dick whereupon was it founded ? "[207-dick]

" Upon [your]207-dick name , "[206-catesby] answered [Catesby]206-catesby . " It is [[my]206-catesby lord]3102-my lord s chief superstition . Were [my]206-catesby name [Richard]129-sir richard , [I]206-catesby should be [an earl]4651-an earl to - morrow . "[206-catesby]

" Well , [sir]3184-sir , [I]207-dick thank [you]3184-sir , "[207-dick] returned [Dick]207-dick ; " and since [I]207-dick am little likely to follow these great fortunes , [I]207-dick will even say farewell . [I]207-dick will not pretend [I]207-dick was displeased to think [myself]207-dick upon the road to fortune ; but [I]207-dick will not pretend , neither , that [I]207-dick am over - sorry to be done with it . Command and riches , [they]4653-they are brave things , to be sure ; but a word in [your]3184-sir ear [yon duke of yours]4654-yon duke of yours , [he]76-dick is [a fearsome lad]4655-a fearsome lad . "[207-dick]

[Catesby]206-catesby laughed .

" Nay , "[206-catesby] said [he]206-catesby , " of a verity [he]76-dick that rides with [Crooked Dick]76-dick will ride deep . Well , [God]79-god keep [us]4656-us all from evil ! Speed [ye]3184-sir well . "[206-catesby]

Thereupon [Dick]76-dick put [himself]76-dick at the head of [[his]76-dick men]417-his men , and giving the word of command , rode off .

[He]76-dick made straight across [the town]1301-the town , following what [he]76-dick supposed to be the route of [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , and spying around for any signs that might decide if [he]76-dick were right .

[The streets]1303-the streets were strewn with [the dead]2160-the dead and [the wounded , whose fate , in the bitter frost]2864-the wounded , whose fate , in the bitter frost , was far the more pitiable . [Gangs of [the victors]2866-the victors]2865-gangs of the victors went from [house]3166-house to [house]3166-house , pillaging and stabbing , and sometimes singing together as [they]2865-gangs of the victors went .

From different quarters , as [he]76-dick rode on , the sounds of violence and outrage came to [young Shelton]129-sir richard s ears ; now the blows of the sledge - hammer on some barricaded door , and now the miserable shrieks of [women]3399-women .

[Dick]76-dick s heart had just been awakened . [He]76-dick had just seen the cruel consequences of [his]76-dick own behaviour ; and the thought of the sum of misery that was now acting in [the whole of [Shoreby]20-shoreby]2534-the whole of shoreby filled [him]76-dick with despair .

At length [he]76-dick reached [the outskirts]2320-the outskirts , and there , sure enough , [he]76-dick saw straight before [him]76-dick the same broad , beaten track across the snow that [he]76-dick had marked from [the summit of [the church]262-the church]2872-the summit of the church . Here , then , [he]76-dick went the faster on ; but still , as [he]76-dick rode , [he]76-dick kept a bright eye upon [the fallen men and horses that lay beside [the track]2875-the track]2874-the fallen men and horses that lay beside the track . Many of these , [he]76-dick was relieved to see , wore [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s colours , and the faces of some , who lay upon [their]2876-their back , [he]76-dick even recognised .

About half - way between [the town]1301-the town and [the forest]246-the forest , [those whom [he]76-dick was following]2879-those whom he was following had plainly been assailed by [archers]3503-archers ; for the corpses lay pretty closely scattered , each pierced by an arrow . And here [Dick]76-dick spied among the rest the body of [a very young lad , whose face was somehow hauntingly familiar to [him]76-dick]2881-a very young lad , whose face was somehow hauntingly familiar to him .

[He]76-dick halted [his]76-dick troop , dismounted , and raised [the lad]309-the lad s head . As [he]76-dick did so , the hood fell back , and a profusion of long brown hair unrolled itself . At the same time the eyes opened .

" Ah ! [lion driver]4657-lion driver ! "[76-dick] said a feeble voice . " [She]2883-the poor young lady is farther on . Ride ride fast ! "[76-dick]

And then [the poor young lady]2883-the poor young lady fainted once again .

[One of [[Dick]76-dick s men]2885-dick s men]2884-one of dick s men carried a flask of some strong cordial , and with this [Dick]76-dick succeeded in reviving consciousness . Then [he]76-dick took [[Joanna]117-joanna s friend]2886-joanna s friend upon [his]76-dick saddlebow , and once more pushed toward [the forest]246-the forest .

" Why do [ye]76-dick take [me]1127-the girl ? "[1127-the girl] said [the girl]1127-the girl . " [Ye]76-dick but delay [your]76-dick speed . "[1127-the girl]

" Nay , [Mistress Risingham]217-mistress risingham , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick . " [Shoreby]20-shoreby is full of blood and drunkenness and riot . Here [ye]76-dick are safe ; content [ye]76-dick . "[76-dick]

" [I]1127-the girl will not be beholden to any of [[your]76-dick faction]4658-your faction , "[1127-the girl] [she]1127-the girl cried ; " set [me]1127-the girl down . "[1127-the girl]

" [Madam]4261-madam , [ye]4261-madam know not what [ye]4261-madam say , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " [Y]4261-madam are hurt "[76-dick]

" [I]1127-the girl am not , "[1127-the girl] [she]1127-the girl said . " It was [my]1127-the girl horse was slain . "[1127-the girl]

" It matters not one jot , "[129-sir richard] replied [Richard]129-sir richard . " [Ye]76-dick are here in the midst of open snow , and compassed about with [enemies]3828-enemies . Whether [ye]76-dick will or not , [I]129-sir richard carry [you]76-dick with [me]129-sir richard . Glad am [I]129-sir richard to have the occasion ; for thus shall [I]129-sir richard repay some portion of [our]4661-our debt . "[129-sir richard]

For a little while [she]1127-the girl was silent . Then , very suddenly , [she]1127-the girl asked :

" [[My]1127-the girl uncle]4662-my uncle ? "[1127-the girl]

" [[My]76-dick [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham]4663-my lord risingham ? "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick . " [I]76-dick would [I]76-dick had good news to give [you]1127-the girl , [madam]4261-madam ; but [I]76-dick have none . [I]76-dick saw [him]184-lord risingham once in the battle , and once only . Let [us]4665-us hope the best . "[76-dick]

CHAPTER V NIGHT IN [THE WOODS]65-the woods : [ALICIA RISINGHAM]218-alicia

It was almost certain that [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had made for [the Moat House]260-the moat house ; but , considering the heavy snow , the lateness of the hour , and the necessity under which [he]72-sir daniel would lie of avoiding [the few roads]2890-the few roads and striking across [the wood]3158-the wood , it was equally certain that [he]72-sir daniel could not hope to reach [it]3158-the wood ere the morrow .

There were two courses open to [Dick]76-dick ; either to continue to follow in the knight s trail , and , if [he]76-dick were able , to fall upon [him]76-dick that very night in [camp]3140-camp , or to strike out a path of [his]76-dick own , and seek to place [himself]76-dick between [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel and [his]72-sir daniel destination .

Either scheme was open to serious objection , and [Dick]76-dick , who feared to expose [Joanna]117-joanna to the hazards of a fight , had not yet decided between [them]2893-them when [he]76-dick reached [the borders of [the wood]3158-the wood]305-the borders of the wood .

At this point [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had turned a little to [his]72-sir daniel left , and then plunged straight under [a grove of very lofty timber]2896-a grove of very lofty timber . [[His]72-sir daniel party]2897-his party had then formed to a narrower front , in order to pass between the trees , and the track was trod proportionally deeper in the snow . The eye followed it under the leafless tracery of the oaks , running direct and narrow ; the trees stood over it , with knotty joints and the great , uplifted forest of their boughs ; there was no sound , whether of [man]3147-man or beast not so much as the stirring of a robin ; and over the field of snow the winter sun lay golden among netted shadows .

" How say [ye]405-the men , "[76-dick] asked [Dick]76-dick of [one of [the men]405-the men]693-one of the men , " to follow straight on , or strike across for [Tunstall]5-tunstall ? "[76-dick]

" [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , "[2901-the man - at - arms] replied [the man - at - arms]2901-the man - at - arms , " [I]2901-the man - at - arms would follow the line until [they]405-the men scatter . "[2901-the man - at - arms]

" [Ye]405-the men are , doubtless , right , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick ; " but [we]4666-we came right hastily upon the errand , even as the time commanded . Here are [no houses]4667-no houses , neither for food nor shelter , and by the morrow s dawn [we]4666-we shall know both cold fingers and an empty belly . How say [ye]405-the men , [lads]3497-lads ? Will [ye]405-the men stand a pinch for expedition s sake , or shall [we]4666-we turn by [Holywood]14-holywood and sup with Mother Church ? The case being somewhat doubtful , [I]76-dick will drive [no man]3113-no man ; yet if [ye]405-the men would suffer [me]76-dick to lead [you]405-the men , [ye]405-the men would choose the first . "[76-dick]

[The men]405-the men answered , almost with one voice , that [they]405-the men would follow [Sir Richard]129-sir richard where [he]129-sir richard would .

And [Dick]76-dick , setting spur to [his]76-dick horse , began once more to go forward .

The snow in the trail had been trodden very hard , and [the pursuers]387-the pursuers had thus a great advantage over the pursued . [They]387-the pursuers pushed on , indeed , at a round trot , two hundred hoofs beating alternately on the dull pavement of the snow , and the jingle of weapons and the snorting of horses raising a warlike noise along the arches of the silent wood .

Presently , the wide slot of the pursued came out upon [the high road from [Holywood]14-holywood]2904-the high road from holywood ; it was there , for a moment , indistinguishable ; and , where it once more plunged into the unbeaten snow upon the farther side , [Dick]76-dick was surprised to see [it]2905-it narrower and lighter trod . Plainly , profiting by [the road]257-the road , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had begun already to scatter [his]72-sir daniel command .

At all hazards , one chance being equal to another , [Dick]76-dick continued to pursue [the straight trail]2907-the straight trail ; and that , after an hour s riding , in which it led into the very depths of [the forest]246-the forest , suddenly split , like a bursting shell , into two dozen others , leading to every point of the compass .

[Dick]76-dick drew bridle in despair . The short winter s day was near an end ; the sun , a dull red orange , shorn of rays , swam low among the leafless thickets ; the shadows were a mile long upon the snow ; the frost bit cruelly at the finger - nails ; and the breath and steam of the horses mounted in a cloud .

" Well , [we]387-the pursuers are outwitted , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick confessed . " Strike [we]387-the pursuers for [Holywood]14-holywood , after all . [It]14-holywood is still nearer [us]387-the pursuers than [Tunstall]5-tunstall or should be by [the station of the sun]4670-the station of the sun . "[76-dick]

So [they]387-the pursuers wheeled to [their]387-the pursuers left , turning [their]387-the pursuers backs on the red shield of sun , and made across [country]2909-country for [the abbey]2910-the abbey . But now times were changed with [them]387-the pursuers ; [they]387-the pursuers could no longer spank forth briskly on a path beaten firm by the passage of [[their]387-the pursuers foes]2911-their foes , and for a goal to which that path itself conducted [them]387-the pursuers . Now [they]387-the pursuers must plough at a dull pace through the encumbering snow , continually pausing to decide [their]387-the pursuers course , continually floundering in drifts . The sun soon left [them]387-the pursuers ; the glow of the west decayed ; and presently [they]387-the pursuers were wandering in a shadow of blackness , under frosty stars .

Presently , indeed , the moon would clear [the hilltops]2912-the hilltops , and [they]387-the pursuers might resume [their]387-the pursuers march . But till then , every random step might carry [them]387-the pursuers wider of [their]387-the pursuers march . There was nothing for it but to camp and wait .

[Sentries]2913-sentries were posted ; [a spot of ground]2914-a spot of ground was cleared of snow , and , after some failures , a good fire blazed in the midst . [The men - at - arms]2489-the men - at - arms sat close about [this forest hearth]2916-this forest hearth , sharing such provisions as [they]2489-the men - at - arms had , and passing about the flask ; and [Dick]76-dick , having collected the most delicate of the rough and scanty fare , brought it to [[Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham s niece]2917-lord risingham s niece , where [she]2917-lord risingham s niece sat apart from [the soldiery]2918-the soldiery against a tree .

[She]2917-lord risingham s niece sat upon one horse - cloth , wrapped in another , and stared straight before [her]2917-lord risingham s niece at the firelit scene . At the offer of food [she]2917-lord risingham s niece started , like one wakened from a dream , and then silently refused .

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " let [me]76-dick beseech [you]4261-madam , punish [me]76-dick not so cruelly .
