Wherein [I]76-dick have offended [you]4261-madam , [I]76-dick know not ; [I]76-dick have , indeed , carried [you]4261-madam away , but with a friendly violence ; [I]76-dick have , indeed , exposed [you]4261-madam to the inclemency of night , but the hurry that lies upon [me]76-dick hath for its end the preservation of another , who is no less frail and no less unfriended than [yourself]4261-madam . At least , [madam]4261-madam , punish not [yourself]4261-madam ; and eat , if not for hunger , then for strength . "[76-dick]

" [I]2917-lord risingham s niece will eat nothing at the hands that slew [[my]2917-lord risingham s niece kinsman]3424-my kinsman , "[2917-lord risingham s niece] [she]2917-lord risingham s niece replied .

" [Dear madam]4674-dear madam , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick cried , " [I]76-dick swear to [you]4261-madam upon the rood [I]76-dick touched [him]3424-my kinsman not . "[76-dick]

" Swear to [me]2917-lord risingham s niece that [he]3424-my kinsman still lives , "[2917-lord risingham s niece] [she]2917-lord risingham s niece returned .

" [I]76-dick will not palter with [you]4261-madam , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " [Pity]219-pity bids [me]76-dick to wound [you]4261-madam . In [my]76-dick heart [I]76-dick do believe [him]3424-my kinsman dead . "[76-dick]

" And [ye]76-dick ask [me]2917-lord risingham s niece to eat ! "[2917-lord risingham s niece] [she]2917-lord risingham s niece cried . " Ay , and [they]4675-they call [you]76-dick [sir]3184-sir ! [Y]76-dick have won [your]76-dick spurs by [[my]2917-lord risingham s niece good kinsman]4677-my good kinsman s murder . And had [I]2917-lord risingham s niece not been [fool and traitor]4678-fool and traitor both , and saved [you]76-dick in [[your]76-dick enemy s house]4449-your enemy s house , [ye]76-dick should have died the death , and [he]3424-my kinsman [he]3424-my kinsman that was worth twelve of [you]76-dick were living . "[2917-lord risingham s niece]

" [I]76-dick did but [[my]76-dick man]4073-my man s best , even as [[your]76-dick kinsman]4681-your kinsman did upon [the other party]3567-the other party , "[76-dick] answered [Dick]76-dick . " Were [he]4681-your kinsman still living as [I]76-dick vow to Heaven [I]76-dick wish it ! [he]4681-your kinsman would praise , not blame [me]76-dick . "[76-dick]

" Sir [Daniel]72-sir daniel hath told [me]2919-me , "[2919-me] [she]2919-me replied . " [He]72-sir daniel marked [you]76-dick at the barricade . Upon [you]76-dick , [he]72-sir daniel saith , [their]3567-the other party party foundered ; it was [you]76-dick that won the battle . Well , then , it was [you]76-dick that killed [[my]2919-me good Lord Risingham , as sure as though [ye]76-dick had strangled [him]72-sir daniel]184-lord risingham . And [ye]76-dick would have [me]2919-me eat with [you]76-dick and [your]76-dick hands not washed from killing ? But Sir [Daniel]72-sir daniel hath sworn [your]76-dick downfall . [He]72-sir daniel tis that will avenge [me]2919-me ! "[2919-me]

[The unfortunate Dick]2920-the unfortunate dick was plunged in gloom . [Old Arblaster]220-old arblaster returned upon [his]2920-the unfortunate dick mind , and [he]2920-the unfortunate dick groaned aloud .

" Do [ye]76-dick hold [me]2920-the unfortunate dick so guilty ? "[2920-the unfortunate dick] [he]2920-the unfortunate dick said ; " [you]76-dick that defended [me]2920-the unfortunate dick [you]76-dick that are [[Joanna]117-joanna s friend]2886-joanna s friend ? "[2920-the unfortunate dick]

" What made [ye]76-dick in the battle ? "[2920-the unfortunate dick] [she]2920-the unfortunate dick retorted . " [Y]76-dick are of [no party]4684-no party ; [y]76-dick are but [a lad but legs and body]4685-a lad but legs and body , without government of wit or counsel ! Wherefore did [ye]76-dick fight ? For the love of hurt , [pardy]4686-pardy ! "[2920-the unfortunate dick]

" Nay , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick know not . But as [the realm of [England]22-england]3352-the realm of england goes , if that [a poor gentleman]4688-a poor gentleman fight not upon the one side , perforce [he]4688-a poor gentleman must fight upon the other . [He]4688-a poor gentleman may not stand alone ; tis not in nature . "[76-dick]

" [They]4689-they that have no judgment should not draw the sword , "[2012-the young lady] replied [the young lady]2012-the young lady . " [Ye]76-dick that fight but for a hazard , what are [ye]76-dick but [a butcher]4690-a butcher ? War is but noble by the cause , and [y]76-dick have disgraced it . "[2012-the young lady]

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] said the miserable [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick do partly see [mine]76-dick error . [I]76-dick have made too much haste ; [I]76-dick have been busy before [my]76-dick time . Already [I]76-dick stole [a ship]4059-a ship thinking , [I]76-dick do swear it , to do well and thereby brought about the death of [many innocent]4693-many innocent , and the grief and ruin of [a poor old man whose face this very day]4694-a poor old man whose face this very day hath stabbed [me]76-dick like a dagger . And for this morning , [I]76-dick did but design to do [myself]76-dick credit , and get fame to marry with , and , behold ! [I]76-dick have brought about the death of [[your]4261-madam dear kinsman]4695-your dear kinsman that was good to [me]76-dick . And what besides , [I]76-dick know not . For , alas ! [I]76-dick may have set [York]8-york upon the throne , and that may be the worser cause , and may do hurt to [England]22-england . O , [madam]4261-madam , [I]76-dick do see [my]76-dick sin . [I]76-dick am unfit for life . [I]76-dick will , for penance sake and to avoid worse evil , once [I]76-dick have finished this adventure , get [me]76-dick to [a cloister]4697-a cloister . [I]76-dick will forswear [Joanna]117-joanna and the trade of arms . [I]76-dick will be [a friar]1893-a friar , and pray for [[your]4261-madam good kinsman]4699-your good kinsman s spirit all [my]76-dick days . "[76-dick]

It appeared to [Dick]76-dick , in this extremity of [his]76-dick humiliation and repentance , that [the young lady]2012-the young lady had laughed .

Raising [his]76-dick countenance , [he]76-dick found [her]2012-the young lady looking down upon [him]76-dick , in the fire - light , with a somewhat peculiar but not unkind expression .

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried , thinking the laughter to have been an illusion of [his]76-dick hearing , but still , from [her]2012-the young lady changed looks , hoping to have touched [her]2012-the young lady heart , " [madam]4261-madam , will not this content [you]4261-madam ? [I]2012-the young lady give up all to undo what [I]2012-the young lady have done amiss ; [I]2012-the young lady make heaven certain for [Lord Risingham]184-lord risingham . And all this upon the very day that [I]2012-the young lady have won [my]2012-the young lady spurs , and thought [myself]2012-the young lady [the happiest young gentleman on ground]4702-the happiest young gentleman on ground . "[2012-the young lady]

" [O boy]4703-o boy , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady said " [good boy]3318-good boy ! "[2012-the young lady]

And then , to the extreme surprise of [Dick]76-dick , [she]2012-the young lady first very tenderly wiped the tears away from [his]76-dick cheeks , and then , as if yielding to a sudden impulse , threw both [her]2012-the young lady arms about [his]76-dick neck , drew up [his]76-dick face , and kissed [him]76-dick . A pitiful bewilderment came over simple - minded [Dick]76-dick .

" But come , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady said , with great cheerfulness , " [you]76-dick that are [a captain]3987-a captain , [ye]76-dick must eat . Why sup [ye]76-dick not ? "[2012-the young lady]

" [Dear Mistress Risingham]217-mistress risingham , "[76-dick] replied [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick did but wait first upon [[my]76-dick prisoner]4706-my prisoner ; but , to say truth , penitence will no longer suffer [me]76-dick to endure the sight of food . [I]76-dick were better to fast , [dear lady]3121-dear lady , and to pray . "[76-dick]

" Call [me]2012-the young lady [Alicia]218-alicia , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady said ; " are [we]4708-we not [old friends]4709-old friends ? And now , come , [I]2012-the young lady will eat with [you]76-dick , bit for bit and sup for sup ; so if [ye]76-dick eat not , neither will [I]2012-the young lady ; but if [ye]76-dick eat hearty , [I]2012-the young lady will dine like [a ploughman]4710-a ploughman . "[2012-the young lady]

So there and then [she]2012-the young lady fell to ; and [Dick]76-dick , who had an excellent stomach , proceeded to bear [her]2012-the young lady company , at first with great reluctance , but gradually , as [he]76-dick entered into the spirit , with more and more vigour and devotion : until , at last , [he]76-dick forgot even to watch [[his]76-dick model]2923-his model , and most heartily repaired the expenses of [his]76-dick day of labour and excitement .

" [Lion - driver]4350-lion - driver , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady said , at length , " [ye]129-sir richard do not admire [a maid]3386-a maid in [a man]3107-a man s jerkin ? "[2012-the young lady]

The moon was now up ; and [they]2924-they were only waiting to repose the wearied horses . By the moon s light , [the still penitent but now well - fed]2925-the still penitent but now well - fed [Richard]129-sir richard beheld [her]2012-the young lady looking somewhat coquettishly down upon [him]129-sir richard .

" [Madam]4261-madam "[129-sir richard] [he]129-sir richard stammered , surprised at this new turn in [her]2012-the young lady manners .

"[2012-the young lady]

And [she]2012-the young lady made bright eyes at [him]129-sir richard .

" [Ye]4261-madam are something smallish , indeed "[76-dick] began [Dick]76-dick .

And here again [she]2012-the young lady interrupted [him]129-sir richard , this time with a ringing peal of laughter that completed [his]129-sir richard confusion and surprise .

" Smallish ! "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady cried . "[2012-the young lady]

" Nay , [madam]4261-madam , exceedingly fair , "[2926-the distressed knight] said [the distressed knight]2926-the distressed knight , pitifully trying to seem easy .

" And [a man]3107-a man would be right glad to [we]4718-we d [me]2012-the young lady ? "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady pursued .

" [Alicia]218-alicia , "[2926-the distressed knight] quoth [Sir Richard]129-sir richard .

"[2012-the young lady]

" [I]76-dick do , [madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " Although , upon [my]76-dick heart , [I]76-dick do hold [me]76-dick but partially guilty of [that brave knight]4723-that brave knight s blood . "[76-dick]

" Would [ye]129-sir richard evade [me]2012-the young lady ? "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady cried .

" [Madam]4261-madam , not so . [I]129-sir richard have told [you]129-sir richard ; at [your]129-sir richard bidding , [I]129-sir richard will even turn [me]129-sir richard [a monk]4357-a monk , "[129-sir richard] said [Richard]129-sir richard .

" Then , in honour , [ye]129-sir richard belong to [me]2012-the young lady ? "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady concluded .

" In honour , [I]76-dick do , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick .

" Hear , then , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady continued ; " [Ye]129-sir richard would make but [a sad friar]4727-a sad friar , methinks ; and since [I]2012-the young lady am to dispose of [you]129-sir richard at pleasure , [I]2012-the young lady will even take [you]129-sir richard for [[my]2012-the young lady husband]4728-my husband . Nay , now , no words ! "[2012-the young lady] cried [she]2012-the young lady . " [They]4729-they will avail [you]129-sir richard nothing . For see how just it is , that [you]129-sir richard who deprived [me]2012-the young lady of [one home]4730-one home , should supply [me]2012-the young lady with another . And as for [Joanna]117-joanna , [she]117-joanna will be the first , believe [me]2012-the young lady , to commend the change ; for , after all , as [we]4731-we be [dear friends]4732-dear friends , what matters it with which of [us]4731-we [ye]4731-we [we]4731-we d ? Not one whit ! "[2012-the young lady]

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick will go into [a cloister]4697-a cloister , an [ye]4261-madam please to bid [me]76-dick ; but to [we]4731-we d with anyone in this big world besides [Joanna Sedley]117-joanna is what [I]76-dick will consent to neither for [man]3147-man s force nor yet for [lady]4736-lady s pleasure . Pardon [me]76-dick if [I]76-dick speak [my]76-dick plain thoughts plainly ; but where [a maid]3386-a maid is very bold , [a poor man]4738-a poor man must even be the bolder . "[76-dick]

" [Dick]76-dick , "[2928-i] [she]2928-i said , " [[ye]76-dick sweet boy]4739-ye sweet boy , [ye]76-dick must come and kiss [me]2928-i for that word . Nay , fear not , [ye]76-dick shall kiss [me]2928-i for [Joanna]117-joanna ; and when [we]4731-we meet , [I]2928-i shall give it back to [her]117-joanna , and say [I]2928-i stole it . And as for what [ye]76-dick owe [me]2928-i , why , [dear simpleton]4740-dear simpleton , methinks [ye]76-dick were not alone in that great battle ; and even if [York]8-york be on the throne , it was not [you]76-dick that set [him]8-york there . But for a good , sweet , honest heart , [Dick]76-dick , [y]76-dick are all that ; and if [I]2928-i could find it in [my]2928-i soul to envy [[your]76-dick [Joanna]117-joanna]4741-your joanna anything , [I]2928-i would even envy [her]117-joanna [your]76-dick love . "[2928-i]

CHAPTER VI NIGHT IN [THE WOODS]65-the woods concluded : [DICK]76-dick AND [JOAN

The]117-joanna horses had by this time finished the small store of provender , and fully breathed from [their]2929-their fatigues . At [Dick]76-dick s command , the fire was smothered in snow ; and while [[his]76-dick men]417-his men got once more wearily to saddle , [he]76-dick [himself]76-dick , remembering , somewhat late , true woodland caution , chose a tall oak and nimbly clambered to [the topmost fork]2931-the topmost fork . Hence [he]76-dick could look far abroad on [the moonlit and snow - paven forest]2932-the moonlit and snow - paven forest . On [the south - west]2933-the south - west , dark against the horizon , stood [those upland , heathy quarters where [he]76-dick and [Joanna]117-joanna had met with the terrifying misadventure of [the leper]890-the leper]2934-those upland , heathy quarters where he and joanna had met with the terrifying misadventure of the leper . And there [his]76-dick eye was caught by a spot of ruddy brightness no bigger than a needle s eye .

[He]76-dick blamed [himself]76-dick sharply for [his]76-dick previous neglect . Were that , as it appeared to be , the shining of [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s camp]2936-sir daniel s camp - fire , [he]76-dick should long ago have seen and marched for it ; above all , [he]76-dick should , for no consideration , have announced [his]76-dick neighbourhood by lighting a fire of [his]76-dick own . But now [he]76-dick must no longer squander valuable hours . The direct way to [the uplands]2937-the uplands was about two miles in length ; but [it]2938-it was crossed by a very deep , precipitous dingle , impassable to [mounted men]2939-mounted men ; and for the sake of speed , it seemed to [Dick]76-dick advisable to desert the horses and attempt the adventure on foot .

[Ten men]401-ten men were left to guard the horses ; signals were agreed upon by which [they]401-ten men could communicate in case of need ; and [Dick]76-dick set forth at the head of [the remainder]2941-the remainder , [Alicia Risingham]218-alicia walking stoutly by [his]76-dick side .

[The men]405-the men had freed [themselves]405-the men of heavy armour , and left behind [their]405-the men lances ; and [they]405-the men now marched with a very good spirit in the frozen snow , and under the exhilarating lustre of the moon . The descent into [the dingle]2943-the dingle , where a stream strained sobbing through the snow and ice , was effected with silence and order ; and on the further side , being then within a short half mile of where [Dick]76-dick had seen the glimmer of the fire , [the party halted to breathe before the attack]2944-the party halted to breathe before the attack .

In the vast silence of [the wood]3158-the wood , the lightest sounds were audible from far ; and [Alicia]218-alicia , who was keen of hearing , held up [her]218-alicia finger warningly and stooped to listen . [All]599-all followed [her]218-alicia example ; but besides the groans of the choked brook in the dingle close behind , and the barking of a fox at a distance of many miles among [the forest]246-the forest , to [Dick]76-dick s acutest hearkening , not a breath was audible .

" But yet , for sure , [I]218-alicia heard the clash of harness , "[218-alicia] whispered [Alicia]218-alicia .

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick , who was more afraid of [that young lady]2948-that young lady than of [ten stout warriors]2949-ten stout warriors , " [I]76-dick would not hint [ye]2948-that young lady were mistaken ; but it might well have come from [either of [the camps]4744-the camps]4743-either of the camps . "[76-dick]

" It came not thence . It came from westward , "[218-alicia] [she]218-alicia declared .

" It may be what it will , "[76-dick] returned [Dick]76-dick ; " and it must be as heaven please . Reck [we]2950-they not a jot , but push on the livelier , and put it to the touch . Up , [friends enough breathed]4745-friends enough breathed . "[76-dick]

As [they]2950-they advanced , the snow became more and more trampled with hoof - marks , and it was plain that [they]2950-they were drawing near to the encampment of [a considerable force of [mounted men]2939-mounted men]2951-a considerable force of mounted men . Presently [they]2950-they could see the smoke pouring from among the trees , ruddily coloured on its lower edge and scattering bright sparks .

And here , pursuant to [Dick]76-dick s orders , [[his]76-dick men]417-his men began to open out , creeping stealthily in the covert , to surround on every side [the camp of [[their]417-his men opponents]2955-their opponents]2954-the camp of their opponents . [He]76-dick [himself]76-dick , placing [Alicia]218-alicia in the shelter of a bulky oak , stole straight forth in the direction of the fire .

At last , through an opening of the wood , [his]76-dick eye embraced the scene of [the encampment]2956-the encampment . The fire had been built upon [a heathy hummock of the ground]2957-a heathy hummock of the ground , surrounded on three sides by thicket , and it now burned very strong , roaring aloud and brandishing flames . Around [it]2958-it there sat [not quite a dozen people , warmly cloaked]2959-not quite a dozen people , warmly cloaked ; but though the neighbouring snow was trampled down as by [a regiment]2960-a regiment , [Dick]76-dick looked in vain for any horse . [He]76-dick began to have a terrible misgiving that [he]76-dick was out - manoeuvred . At the same time , in [a tall man with a steel salet]2961-a tall man with a steel salet , who was spreading [his]76-dick hands before the blaze , [he]76-dick recognised [[his]76-dick old friend and still kindly enemy]2962-his old friend and still kindly enemy , [Bennet Hatch]77-bennet ; and in two others , sitting a little back , [he]76-dick made out , even in [their]2963-their male disguise , [Joanna Sedley]117-joanna and [[Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s wife]2964-sir daniel s wife .

" Well , "[76-dick] thought [he]76-dick to [himself]76-dick , " even if [I]76-dick lose [my]76-dick horses , let [me]76-dick get [my]76-dick [Joanna]117-joanna , and why should [I]76-dick complain ? "[76-dick]

And then , from the further side of [the encampment]2956-the encampment , there came a little whistle , announcing that [[his]76-dick men]417-his men had joined , and the investment was complete .

[Bennet]77-bennet , at the sound , started to [his]77-bennet feet ; but ere [he]77-bennet had time to spring upon [his]77-bennet arms , [Dick]76-dick hailed [him]77-bennet .

" [Bennet]77-bennet , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said " [Bennet]77-bennet , [old friend]4746-old friend , yield [ye]77-bennet . [Ye]77-bennet will but spill [men]3205-men s lives in vain , if [ye]77-bennet resist . "[76-dick]

" Tis [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , by [St. Barbary]67-st. barbary ! "[77-bennet] cried [Hatch]77-bennet . " Yield [me]77-bennet ? [Ye]77-bennet ask much . What force have [ye]77-bennet ? "[77-bennet]

" [I]76-dick tell [you]77-bennet , [Bennet]77-bennet , [ye]77-bennet are both outnumbered and begirt , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick . " [Casar]222-casar and [Charlemagne]223-charlemagne would cry for quarter . [I]76-dick have [two score men]3458-two score men at [my]76-dick whistle , and with one shoot of arrows [I]76-dick could answer for [you]77-bennet all . "[76-dick]

" [Master Dick]76-dick , "[77-bennet] said [Bennet]77-bennet , " it goes against [my]77-bennet heart ; but [I]77-bennet must do [my]77-bennet duty . [The saints]3104-the saints help [you]76-dick ! "[77-bennet] And therewith [he]77-bennet raised a little tucket to [his]77-bennet mouth and wound a rousing call .

Then followed a moment of confusion ; for while [Dick]76-dick , fearing for [the ladies]1991-the ladies , still hesitated to give the word to shoot , [[Hatch]77-bennet s little band]2968-hatch s little band sprang to [their]2968-hatch s little band weapons and formed back to back as for a fierce resistance . In the hurry of [their]2968-hatch s little band change of place , [Joanna]117-joanna sprang from [her]117-joanna seat and ran like an arrow to [her]117-joanna lover s side .

" Here , [Dick]76-dick ! "[117-joanna] [she]117-joanna cried , as [she]117-joanna clasped [his]76-dick hand in [hers]117-joanna .

But [Dick]76-dick still stood irresolute ; [he]76-dick was yet young to the more deplorable necessities of war , and the thought of [old Lady Brackley]185-lady brackley checked the command upon [his]76-dick tongue . [[His]76-dick own men]1446-his own men became restive . [Some of [them]1446-his own men]2970-some of them cried on [him]76-dick by name ; [others]237-others , of [their]237-others own accord , began to shoot ; and at the first discharge [poor Bennet]77-bennet bit the dust . Then [Dick]76-dick awoke .

" On ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick cried . " Shoot , [boys]3334-boys , and keep to cover . [England]22-england and [York]8-york ! "[76-dick]

But just then the dull beat of many horses on the snow suddenly arose in the hollow ear of the night , and , with incredible swiftness , drew nearer and swelled louder . At the same time , answering [tuckets]224-tuckets repeated and repeated [Hatch]77-bennet s call .

" Rally , rally ! "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick . " Rally upon [me]76-dick ! Rally for [your]3334-boys lives ! "[76-dick]

But [[his]76-dick men]417-his men afoot , scattered , taken in the hour when [they]417-his men had counted on an easy triumph began instead to give ground severally , and either stood wavering or dispersed into the thickets . And when [the first of the horsemen]2973-the first of the horsemen came charging through [the open avenues]2974-the open avenues and fiercely riding [their]2973-the first of the horsemen steeds into the underwood , [a few stragglers]2975-a few stragglers were overthrown or speared among the brush , but the bulk of [Dick]76-dick s command had simply melted at the rumour of [their]2975-a few stragglers coming .

[Dick]76-dick stood for a moment , bitterly recognising the fruits of [his]76-dick precipitate and unwise valour . [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel had seen the fire ; [he]72-sir daniel had moved out with [his]72-sir daniel main force , whether to attack [[his]72-sir daniel pursuers]2976-his pursuers or to take [them]2976-his pursuers in the rear if [they]2976-his pursuers should venture the assault . [His]72-sir daniel had been throughout the part of [a sagacious captain]2977-a sagacious captain ; [Dick]76-dick s the conduct of [an eager boy]2978-an eager boy . And here was [the young knight]2681-the young knight , [[his]76-dick sweetheart]1376-his sweetheart , indeed , holding [him]76-dick tightly by the hand , but otherwise alone , [his]76-dick whole command of [men]3205-men and horses dispersed in the night and [the wide forest]2982-the wide forest , like a paper of pins in [a bay barn]2983-a bay barn .

" [The saints]3104-the saints enlighten [me]76-dick ! "[76-dick] [he]76-dick thought . " It is well [I]76-dick was knighted for this morning s matter ; this doth [me]76-dick little honour . "[76-dick]

And thereupon , still holding [Joanna]117-joanna , [he]76-dick began to run .

The silence of the night was now shattered by the shouts of [the men of [Tunstall]5-tunstall]2984-the men of tunstall , as [they]2984-the men of tunstall galloped hither and thither , hunting [fugitives]2796-fugitives ; and [Dick]76-dick broke boldly through the underwood and ran straight before [him]76-dick like a deer . The silver clearness of the moon upon the open snow increased , by contrast , the obscurity of the thickets ; and the extreme dispersion of [the vanquished]2986-the vanquished led [the pursuers]387-the pursuers into wildly divergent paths . Hence , in but a little while , [Dick]76-dick and [Joanna]117-joanna paused , in a close covert , and heard the sounds of the pursuit , scattering abroad , indeed , in all directions , but yet fainting already in the distance .

" An [I]76-dick had but kept [a reserve of [them]2984-the men of tunstall]4752-a reserve of them together , "[76-dick] [Dick]76-dick cried , bitterly , " [I]76-dick could have turned the tables yet ! Well , [we]4753-we live and learn ; next time it shall go better , by the rood . "[76-dick]

" Nay , [Dick]76-dick , "[117-joanna] said [Joanna]117-joanna , " what matters it ? Here [we]4753-we are together once again . "[117-joanna]

[He]76-dick looked at [her]117-joanna , and there [she]117-joanna was [John Matcham]119-john matcham , as of yore , in hose and doublet . But now [he]76-dick knew [her]117-joanna ; now , even in that ungainly dress , [she]117-joanna smiled upon [him]76-dick , bright with love ; and [his]76-dick heart was transported with joy .

" [Sweetheart]225-sweetheart , "[76-dick] [he]76-dick said , " if [ye]225-sweetheart forgive [this blunderer]4754-this blunderer , what care [I]76-dick ? Make [we]4753-we direct for [Holywood]14-holywood ; there lieth [[your]225-sweetheart good guardian]4755-your good guardian and [[my]76-dick better friend]4756-my better friend , [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . There shall [we]4753-we be [we]4753-we d ; and whether poor or wealthy , famous or unknown , what , matters it ? This day , dear love , [I]76-dick won [my]76-dick spurs ; [I]76-dick was commended by [great men]4757-great men for [my]76-dick valour ; [I]76-dick thought [myself]76-dick [the goodliest man of war]4758-the goodliest man of war in [all broad England]4759-all broad england . Then , first , [I]76-dick fell out of [my]76-dick favour with [the great]4760-the great ; and now have [I]76-dick been well thrashed , and clean lost [[my]76-dick soldiers]4761-my soldiers . There was a downfall for conceit ! But , [dear]4762-dear , [I]76-dick care not dear , if [ye]4762-dear still love [me]76-dick and will [we]4763-we d , [I]76-dick would have [my]76-dick knighthood done away , and mind it not a jot . "[76-dick]

" [[My]2988-ye Dick]4764-my dick ! "[2988-ye] [she]2988-ye cried . " And did [they]4761-my soldiers knight [you]4764-my dick ? "[2988-ye]

" Ay , [dear]4762-dear , [ye]2988-ye are [[my]2989-my lady]1030-my lady now , "[2989-my] [he]2989-my answered , fondly ; " or [ye]2988-ye shall , ere noon to - morrow will [ye]2988-ye not ? "[2989-my]

" That will [I]2988-ye , [Dick]76-dick , with a glad heart , "[2988-ye] [she]2988-ye answered .

" Ay , [sir]3184-sir ? Methought [ye]4764-my dick were to be [a monk]4357-a monk ! "[2989-my] said a voice in [their]2990-their ears .

" [Alicia]218-alicia ! "[117-joanna] cried [Joanna]117-joanna .

" Even so , "[2012-the young lady] replied [the young lady]2012-the young lady , coming forward . " [Alicia]218-alicia , whom [ye]4764-my dick left for dead , and whom [[your]4764-my dick lion - driver]4769-your lion - driver found , and brought to life again , and , by [my]2012-the young lady sooth , made love to , if [ye]4764-my dick want to know ! "[2012-the young lady]

" [I]117-joanna ll not believe it , "[117-joanna] cried [Joanna]117-joanna . " [Dick]76-dick ! "[117-joanna]

" [Dick]76-dick ! "[218-alicia] mimicked [Alicia]218-alicia . " [Dick]76-dick , indeed ! " [Ye]4764-my dick leave [them]4771-them planted behind oaks . But [they]4771-them say true the age of chivalry is dead . "[2012-the young lady]

" [Madam]4261-madam , "[76-dick] cried [Dick]76-dick , in despair , " upon [my]76-dick soul [I]76-dick had forgotten [you]4261-madam outright . [Madam]4261-madam , [ye]4261-madam must try to pardon [me]76-dick . [Ye]4261-madam see , [I]76-dick had new found [Joanna]117-joanna ! "[76-dick]

" [I]2012-the young lady did not suppose that [ye]76-dick had done it o purpose , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady retorted . " But [I]2012-the young lady will be cruelly avenged . [I]2012-the young lady will tell a secret to [[my]2012-the young lady Lady]1030-my lady Shelton [she]1030-my lady that is to be , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady added , curtseying . " [Joanna]117-joanna , "[2012-the young lady] [she]2012-the young lady continued , " [I]2012-the young lady believe , upon [my]2012-the young lady soul , [[your]117-joanna sweetheart]4302-your sweetheart is [a bold fellow in a fight]4776-a bold fellow in a fight , but [he]4302-your sweetheart is , let [me]2012-the young lady tell [you]117-joanna plainly , [the softest - hearted simpleton in [England]22-england]4777-the softest - hearted simpleton in england . Go to [ye]117-joanna may do [your]117-joanna pleasure with [him]4302-your sweetheart ! And now , [fool children]4778-fool children , first kiss [me]2012-the young lady , either one of [you]117-joanna , for luck and kindness ; and then kiss [each other]664-each other just one minute by the glass , and not one second longer ; and then let [us]4780-us all three set forth for [Holywood]14-holywood as fast as [we]4780-us can stir ; for [these woods]4781-these woods , methinks , are full of peril and exceeding cold . "[2012-the young lady]

" But did [[my]117-joanna [Dick]76-dick]4764-my dick make love to [you]117-joanna ? "[117-joanna] asked [Joanna]117-joanna , clinging to [her]117-joanna sweetheart s side .

" Nay , [fool girl]4783-fool girl , "[218-alicia] returned [Alicia]218-alicia ; " it was [I]218-alicia made love to [him]4302-your sweetheart . [I]218-alicia offered to marry [him]4302-your sweetheart , indeed ; but [he]4302-your sweetheart bade [me]218-alicia go marry with [my]218-alicia likes . These were [his]4302-your sweetheart words . Nay , that [I]218-alicia will say : [he]4302-your sweetheart is more plain than pleasant . But now , [children]4784-children , for the sake of sense , set forward . Shall [we]4785-we go once more over the dingle , or push straight for [Holywood]14-holywood ? "[218-alicia]

" Why , "[76-dick] said [Dick]76-dick , " [I]76-dick would like dearly to get upon a horse ; for [I]76-dick have been sore mauled and beaten , one way and another , these last days , and [my]76-dick poor body is one bruise . But how think [ye]4784-children ? If [the men , upon the alarm of the fighting]4786-the men , upon the alarm of the fighting , had fled away , [we]4785-we should have gone about for nothing . Tis but some three short miles to [Holywood]14-holywood direct ; the bell hath not beat nine ; the snow is pretty firm to walk upon , the moon clear ; how if [we]4785-we went even as [we]4785-we are ? "[76-dick]

" Agreed , "[218-alicia] cried [Alicia]218-alicia ; but [Joanna]117-joanna only pressed upon [Dick]76-dick s arm .

Forth , then , [they]2993-their went , through open leafless groves and down [snow - clad alleys]2994-snow - clad alleys , under the white face of the winter moon ; [Dick]76-dick and [Joanna]117-joanna walking hand in hand and in a heaven of pleasure ; and [[their]2993-their light - minded companion]2995-their light - minded companion , [her]2995-their light - minded companion own bereavements heartily forgotten , followed a pace or two behind , now rallying [them]2993-their upon [their]2993-their silence , and now drawing happy pictures of [their]2993-their future and united lives .

Still , indeed , in the distance of [the wood]3158-the wood , [the riders of [Tunstall]5-tunstall]2997-the riders of tunstall might be heard urging [their]2997-the riders of tunstall pursuit ; and from time to time cries or the clash of steel announced the shock of [enemies]3828-enemies . But in [these young folk , bred among the alarms of war , and fresh from such a multiplicity of dangers]2999-these young folk , bred among the alarms of war , and fresh from such a multiplicity of dangers , neither fear nor pity could be lightly wakened . Content to find the sounds still drawing farther and farther away , [they]2993-their gave up [their]2993-their hearts to the enjoyment of the hour , walking already , as [Alicia]218-alicia put it , in a wedding procession ; and neither the rude solitude of [the forest]246-the forest , nor the cold of the freezing night , had any force to shadow or distract [their]2993-their happiness .

At length , from [a rising hill]3001-a rising hill , [they]2993-their looked below [them]2993-their on [the dell of [Holywood]14-holywood]3002-the dell of holywood . The great windows of [the forest abbey]3003-the forest abbey shone with torch and candle ; [its]3003-the forest abbey high pinnacles and spires arose very clear and silent , and the gold rood upon the topmost summit glittered brightly in the moon . All about [it]3003-the forest abbey , in [the open glade]3004-the open glade , [camp]3140-camp - fires were burning , and the ground was thick with [huts]3006-huts ; and across the midst of the picture [the frozen river]3007-the frozen river curved .

" By the mass , "[74-master shelton] said [Richard]74-master shelton , " there are [[Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s fellows]4787-lord foxham s fellows still encamped . [The messenger]484-the messenger hath certainly miscarried . Well , then , so better . [We]3008-lord foxham s men have power at hand to face [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . "[74-master shelton]

But if [[Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s men]3008-lord foxham s men still lay encamped in [the long holm at [Holywood]14-holywood]4159-the long holm at holywood , it was from a different reason from the one supposed by [Dick]76-dick . [They]3008-lord foxham s men had marched , indeed , for [Shoreby]20-shoreby ; but ere [they]3008-lord foxham s men were half way thither , [a second messenger]3010-a second messenger met [them]3008-lord foxham s men , and bade [them]3008-lord foxham s men return to [[their]3008-lord foxham s men morning s camp]3011-their morning s camp , to bar the road against [Lancastrian fugitives]3012-lancastrian fugitives , and to be so much nearer to [the main army of [York]8-york]3013-the main army of york . For [Richard]74-master shelton of [Gloucester]207-dick , having finished the battle and stamped out [his]74-master shelton foes in [that district]3014-that district , was already on the march to rejoin [[his]74-master shelton brother]3015-his brother ; and not long after the return of [[my]0-i Lord [Foxham]157-lord foxham s retainers]3016-my lord foxham s retainers , [Crookback]208-dick [himself]208-dick drew rein before [the abbey]2910-the abbey door . It was in honour of [this august visitor]3018-this august visitor that the windows shone with lights ; and at the hour of [Dick]208-dick s arrival with [[his]208-dick sweetheart]1376-his sweetheart and [[her]1376-his sweetheart friend]2121-her friend , [the whole ducal party]3021-the whole ducal party was being entertained in [the refectory]3022-the refectory with the splendour of [that powerful and luxurious monastery]3023-that powerful and luxurious monastery .

[Dick]208-dick , not quite with [his]208-dick good will , was brought before [them]3021-the whole ducal party . [Gloucester]207-dick , sick with fatigue , sat leaning upon one hand [his]207-dick white and terrifying countenance ; [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham , half recovered from [his]157-lord foxham wound , was in a place of honour on [his]157-lord foxham left .

" How , [sir]3184-sir ? "[74-master shelton] asked [Richard]74-master shelton . " Have [ye]3184-sir brought [me]74-master shelton [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel s head ? "[74-master shelton]

" [[My]207-dick lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[207-dick] replied [Dick]207-dick , stoutly enough , but with a qualm at heart , " [I]207-dick have not even the good fortune to return with [my]207-dick command . [I]207-dick have been , so please [[your]4170-my lord duke grace]4595-your grace , well beaten . "[207-dick]

[Gloucester]207-dick looked upon [him]207-dick with a formidable frown .

" [I]207-dick gave [you]207-dick fifty lances , [3 sir]4792-3 sir , "[207-dick] [he]207-dick said .

" [[My]2681-the young knight lord duke]4170-my lord duke , [I]2681-the young knight had but [fifty men - at - arms]4794-fifty men - at - arms , "[2681-the young knight] replied [the young knight]2681-the young knight .

" How is this ? "[207-dick] said [Gloucester]207-dick . " [He]4170-my lord duke did ask [me]207-dick fifty lances . "[207-dick]

" May it please [[your]4170-my lord duke grace]4595-your grace , "[206-catesby] replied [Catesby]206-catesby , smoothly , " for a pursuit [we]4796-we gave [him]4170-my lord duke but [the horsemen]2608-the horsemen . "[206-catesby]

" It is well , "[74-master shelton] replied [Richard]74-master shelton , adding , " [Shelton]74-master shelton , [ye]74-master shelton may go . "[74-master shelton]

" Stay ! "[157-lord foxham] said [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " [This young man]4520-this young man likewise had a charge from [me]157-lord foxham . It may be [he]4520-this young man hath better sped . Say , [Master Shelton]74-master shelton , have [ye]74-master shelton found [the maid]4055-the maid ? "[157-lord foxham]

" [I]207-dick praise [the saints]3104-the saints , [[my]207-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[207-dick] said [Dick]207-dick , " [she]4055-the maid is in [this house]3790-this house . "[207-dick]

" Is it even so ? Well , then , [[my]157-lord foxham lord]3102-my lord [the duke]3689-the duke , "[157-lord foxham] resumed [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham , " with [your]3689-the duke good will , to - morrow , before the army march , [I]157-lord foxham do propose a marriage . [This young squire]4805-this young squire "[157-lord foxham]

" [Young knight]4806-young knight , "[206-catesby] interrupted [Catesby]206-catesby .

" Say [ye]4806-young knight so , [Sir William]226-sir william ? "[157-lord foxham] cried [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham .

" [I]207-dick did [myself]207-dick , and for good service , dub [him]4805-this young squire [knight]3471-knight , "[207-dick] said [Gloucester]207-dick . " [He]4805-this young squire hath twice manfully served [me]207-dick . It is not valour of hands , it is [a man s mind of iron]4808-a man s mind of iron , that [he]4805-this young squire lacks . [He]4805-this young squire will not rise , [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . Howbeit , if [he]4805-this young squire is to marry , marry [him]4805-this young squire in the name of [Mary]167-mary , and be done ! "[207-dick]

" Nay , [he]4805-this young squire is [a brave lad]4811-a brave lad [I]157-lord foxham know it , "[157-lord foxham] said [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " Content [ye]207-dick , then , [Sir Richard]129-sir richard . [I]157-lord foxham have compounded this affair with [Master Hamley]227-hamley , and to - morrow [ye]207-dick shall [we]4812-we d. "[157-lord foxham]

Whereupon [Dick]207-dick judged it prudent to withdraw ; but [he]207-dick was not yet clear of [the refectory]3022-the refectory , when [a man , but newly alighted at the gate]3026-a man , but newly alighted at the gate , came running four stairs at a bound , and , brushing through [the abbey servants]3027-the abbey servants , threw [himself]3026-a man , but newly alighted at the gate on one knee before [the duke]3689-the duke .

" Victory , [[my]3026-a man , but newly alighted at the gate lord]3102-my lord , "[3026-a man , but newly alighted at the gate] [he]3026-a man , but newly alighted at the gate cried .

And before [Dick]207-dick had got to the chamber set apart for [him]207-dick as [[Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s guest]3029-lord foxham s guest , [the troops in [the holm]3031-the holm]3030-the troops in the holm were cheering around [their]3030-the troops in the holm fires ; for upon that same day , not twenty miles away , a second crushing blow had been dealt to the power of [Lancaster]7-lancaster .

CHAPTER VII [DICK]207-dick S REVENGE

The next morning [Dick]207-dick was afoot before the sun , and having dressed [himself]207-dick to the best advantage with the aid of [the Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham s baggage , and got good reports of [Joan]117-joanna , [he]207-dick set forth on foot to walk away [his]207-dick impatience .

For some while [he]207-dick made rounds among [the soldiery , who were getting to arms in the wintry twilight of the dawn and by the red glow of torches]3032-the soldiery , who were getting to arms in the wintry twilight of the dawn and by the red glow of torches ; but gradually [he]207-dick strolled further afield , and at length passed clean beyond the outposts , and walked alone in [the frozen forest]3033-the frozen forest , waiting for the sun .

[His]207-dick thoughts were both quiet and happy . [His]207-dick brief favour with [the Duke]3689-the duke [he]207-dick could not find it in [his]207-dick heart to mourn ; with [Joan]117-joanna to [wife]3035-wife , and [[my]0-i [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham]3850-my lord foxham for [a faithful patron]3037-a faithful patron , [he]207-dick looked most happily upon the future ; and in the past [he]207-dick found but little to regret .

As [he]207-dick thus strolled and pondered , the solemn light of the morning grew more clear , [the east]3038-the east was already coloured by the sun , and a little scathing wind blew up the frozen snow . [He]207-dick turned to go [home]699-home ; but even as [he]207-dick turned , [his]207-dick eye lit upon [a figure behind , a tree]3040-a figure behind , a tree .

" Stand ! "[207-dick] [he]207-dick cried . " Who goes ? "[207-dick]

[The figure]3041-the figure stepped forth and waved [its]3041-the figure hand like [a dumb person]3042-a dumb person . [It]3041-the figure was arrayed like [a pilgrim , the hood lowered over the face]3043-a pilgrim , the hood lowered over the face , but [Dick]207-dick , in an instant , recognised [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel .

[He]207-dick strode up to [him]207-dick , drawing [his]207-dick sword ; and [the knight]438-the knight , putting [his]438-the knight hand in [his]438-the knight bosom , as if to seize a hidden weapon , steadfastly awaited [his]207-dick approach .

" Well , [Dickon]142-dickon , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " how is it to be ? Do [ye]142-dickon make war upon [the fallen]4814-the fallen ? "[72-sir daniel]

" [I]309-the lad made no war upon [your]142-dickon life , "[309-the lad] replied [the lad]309-the lad ; " [I]309-the lad was [[your]142-dickon true friend]4815-your true friend until [ye]142-dickon sought for [mine]309-the lad ; but [ye]142-dickon have sought for it greedily . "[309-the lad]

" Nay self - defence , "[438-the knight] replied [the knight]438-the knight . " And now , [boy]3344-boy , the news of this battle , and the presence of [yon]142-dickon crooked devil here in [[mine]309-the lad own wood]4817-mine own wood , have broken [me]438-the knight beyond all help . [I]438-the knight go to [Holywood]14-holywood for sanctuary ; thence overseas , with what [I]438-the knight can carry , and to begin life again in [Burgundy]51-burgundy or [France]50-france . "[438-the knight]

" [Ye]142-dickon may not go to [Holywood]14-holywood , "[207-dick] said [Dick]207-dick .

" How ! May not ? "[438-the knight] asked [the knight]438-the knight .

" Look [ye]3344-boy , [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , this is [my]207-dick marriage morn , "[207-dick] said [Dick]207-dick ; " and yon sun that is to rise will make the brightest day that ever shone for [me]207-dick . [Your]3344-boy life is forfeit doubly forfeit , for [[my]207-dick father]3558-my father s death and [your]3344-boy own practices to [meward]4819-meward . But [I]207-dick [myself]207-dick have done amiss ; [I]207-dick have brought about [men]3205-men s deaths ; and upon this glad day [I]207-dick will be neither [judge nor hangman]4821-judge nor hangman . An [ye]3344-boy were [the devil]3801-the devil , [I]207-dick would not lay a hand on [you]3344-boy . An [ye]3344-boy were [the devil]3801-the devil , [ye]3344-boy might go where [ye]3344-boy will for [me]207-dick . Seek [God]79-god s forgiveness ; [mine]207-dick [ye]3344-boy have freely . But to go on to [Holywood]14-holywood is different . [I]207-dick carry arms for [York]8-york , and [I]207-dick will suffer [no spy within [their]4825-their lines]4824-no spy within their lines . Hold it , then , for certain , if [ye]3344-boy set one foot before another , [I]207-dick will uplift [my]207-dick voice and call the nearest post to seize [you]3344-boy . "[207-dick]

" [Ye]3344-boy mock [me]72-sir daniel , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . " [I]72-sir daniel have no safety out of [Holywood]14-holywood . "[72-sir daniel]

" [I]129-sir richard care no more , "[129-sir richard] returned [Richard]129-sir richard . " [I]129-sir richard let [you]3344-boy go east , west , or south ; north [I]129-sir richard will not . [Holywood]14-holywood is shut against [you]3344-boy . Go , and seek not to return . For , once [ye]3344-boy are gone , [I]129-sir richard will warn every post about [this army]4826-this army , and there will be so shrewd a watch upon [all pilgrims]4827-all pilgrims that , once again , were [ye]3344-boy [the very devil]4828-the very devil , [ye]3344-boy would find it ruin to make the essay . "[129-sir richard]

" [Ye]72-sir daniel doom [me]72-sir daniel , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , gloomily .

" [I]129-sir richard doom [you]3344-boy not , "[129-sir richard] returned [Richard]129-sir richard . " If it so please [you]3344-boy to set [your]3344-boy valour against [mine]129-sir richard , come on ; and though [I]129-sir richard fear it be disloyal to [[my]129-sir richard party]4829-my party , [I]129-sir richard will take the challenge openly and fully , fight [you]3344-boy with [mine]129-sir richard own single strength , and call for none to help [me]129-sir richard . So shall [I]129-sir richard avenge [[my]129-sir richard father]3558-my father , with a perfect conscience . "[129-sir richard]

" Ay , "[72-sir daniel] said [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , " [y]3344-boy have a long sword against [my]72-sir daniel dagger . "[72-sir daniel]

" [I]207-dick rely upon Heaven only , "[207-dick] answered [Dick]207-dick , casting [his]207-dick sword some way behind [him]207-dick on the snow . " Now , if [your]3344-boy ill - fate bids [you]3344-boy , come ; and , under the pleasure of [the Almighty]228-the almighty , [I]207-dick make [myself]207-dick bold to feed [your]3344-boy bones to foxes . "[207-dick]

" [I]438-the knight did but try [you]438-the knight , [Dickon]142-dickon , "[438-the knight] returned [the knight]438-the knight , with an uneasy semblance of a laugh . " [I]438-the knight would not spill [your]438-the knight blood . "[438-the knight]

" Go , then , ere it be too late , "[129-sir richard] replied [Shelton]129-sir richard . " In five minutes [I]129-sir richard will call the post . [I]129-sir richard do perceive that [I]129-sir richard am too long - suffering . Had but [our]4831-our places been reversed , [I]129-sir richard should have been bound hand and foot some minutes past . "[129-sir richard]

" Well , [Dickon]142-dickon , [I]72-sir daniel will go , "[72-sir daniel] replied [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel . " When [we]4831-our next meet , it shall repent [you]438-the knight that [ye]438-the knight were so harsh . "[72-sir daniel]

And with these words , [the knight]438-the knight turned and began to move off under the trees . [Dick]207-dick watched [him]438-the knight with strangely - mingled feelings , as [he]438-the knight went , swiftly and warily , and ever and again turning a wicked eye upon [the lad who had spared [him]438-the knight , and whom [he]438-the knight still suspected]3050-the lad who had spared him , and whom he still suspected .

There was upon one side of where [he]438-the knight went a thicket , strongly matted with green ivy , and , even in its winter state , impervious to the eye . Herein , all of a sudden , a bow sounded like a note of music . An arrow flew , and with a great , choked cry of agony and anger , [the Knight of [Tunstall]5-tunstall]418-the knight of tunstall threw up [his]418-the knight of tunstall hands and fell forward in the snow .

[Dick]207-dick bounded to [his]418-the knight of tunstall side and raised [him]418-the knight of tunstall . [His]418-the knight of tunstall face desperately worked ; [his]418-the knight of tunstall whole body was shaken by contorting spasms .

" Is the arrow black ? "[418-the knight of tunstall] [he]418-the knight of tunstall gasped .

" It is black , "[207-dick] replied [Dick]207-dick , gravely .

And then , before [he]207-dick could add one word , a desperate seizure of pain shook [the wounded man]1005-the wounded man from head to foot , so that [his]1005-the wounded man body leaped in [Dick]207-dick s supporting arms , and with the extremity of that pang [his]1005-the wounded man spirit fled in silence .

[The young man]2017-the young man laid [him]418-the knight of tunstall back gently on the snow and prayed for that unprepared and guilty spirit , and as [he]2017-the young man prayed the sun came up at a bound , and the robins began chirping in the ivy .

When [he]2017-the young man rose to [his]2017-the young man feet , [he]2017-the young man found [another man]675-another man upon [his]2017-the young man knees but a few steps behind [him]2017-the young man , and , still with uncovered head , [he]2017-the young man waited until that prayer also should be over . It took long ; [the man]3175-the man , with [his]3175-the man head bowed and [his]3175-the man face covered with [his]3175-the man hands , prayed like [one in a great disorder or distress of mind]3056-one in a great disorder or distress of mind ; and by the bow that lay beside [him]3175-the man , [Dick]207-dick judged that [he]207-dick was no other than [the archer who had laid [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel low]3057-the archer who had laid sir daniel low .

At length [he]207-dick , also , rose , and showed the countenance of [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis .

" [Richard]129-sir richard , "[207-dick] [he]207-dick said , very gravely , " [I]207-dick heard [you]129-sir richard . [Ye]129-sir richard took the better part and pardoned ; [I]207-dick took the worse , and there lies the clay of [mine]207-dick enemy . Pray for [me]207-dick . "[207-dick]

And [he]207-dick wrung [him]207-dick by the hand .

" [Sir]3184-sir , "[129-sir richard] said [Richard]129-sir richard , " [I]129-sir richard will pray for [you]129-sir richard , indeed ; though how [I]129-sir richard may prevail [I]129-sir richard wot not . But if [ye]129-sir richard have so long pursued revenge , and find it now of such a sorry flavour , bethink [ye]129-sir richard , were it not well to pardon [others]237-others ? Hatch [he]100-ellis is dead , [poor shrew]4834-poor shrew ! [I]129-sir richard would have spared a better ; and for [Sir Daniel]72-sir daniel , here lies [his]100-ellis body . But for [the priest]338-the priest , if [I]129-sir richard might anywise prevail , [I]129-sir richard would have [you]129-sir richard let [him]100-ellis go . "[129-sir richard]

A flash came into the eyes of [Ellis Duckworth]100-ellis .

" Nay , "[100-ellis] [he]100-ellis said , " [the devil]3801-the devil is still strong within [me]100-ellis . But be at rest ; the Black Arrow flieth nevermore the fellowship is broken . [They]4837-they that still live shall come to [their]4837-they quiet and ripe end , in Heaven s good time , for [me]100-ellis ; and for [yourself]129-sir richard , go where [your]129-sir richard better fortune calls [you]129-sir richard , and think no more of [Ellis]100-ellis . "[100-ellis]

CHAPTER VIII CONCLUSION

About nine in the morning , [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham was leading [[his]157-lord foxham ward]473-his ward , once more dressed as befitted [her]473-his ward sex , and followed by [Alicia Risingham]218-alicia , to [the church of Holywood]3059-the church of holywood , when [Richard Crookback]229-richard crookback , [his]229-richard crookback brow already heavy with cares , crossed [their]3060-their path and paused .

" Is this [the maid]4055-the maid ? "[229-richard crookback] [he]229-richard crookback asked ; and when [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham had replied in the affirmative , " [Minion]230-minion , "[229-richard crookback] [he]229-richard crookback added , " hold up [your]473-his ward face until [I]229-richard crookback see its favour . "[229-richard crookback]

[He]229-richard crookback looked upon [her]473-his ward sourly for a little .

" [Ye]473-his ward are fair , "[229-richard crookback] [he]229-richard crookback said at last , " and , as [they]4839-they tell [me]229-richard crookback , dowered . How if [I]229-richard crookback offered [you]473-his ward a brave marriage , as became [your]473-his ward face and parentage ? "[229-richard crookback]

" [[My]117-joanna lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[117-joanna] replied [Joanna]117-joanna , " may it please [[your]4170-my lord duke grace]4595-your grace , [I]117-joanna had rather [we]4842-we d with [Sir Richard]129-sir richard . "[117-joanna]

" How so ? "[229-richard crookback] [he]229-richard crookback asked , harshly . " Marry but [the man [I]229-richard crookback name to [you]117-joanna , and [he]129-sir richard shall be [[my]229-richard crookback lord]3102-my lord , and [you]117-joanna [[my]229-richard crookback lady]1030-my lady]4843-the man i name to you , and he shall be my lord , and you my lady , before night . For [Sir Richard]129-sir richard , let [me]229-richard crookback tell [you]4170-my lord duke plainly , [he]129-sir richard will die [Sir Richard]129-sir richard . "[229-richard crookback]

" [I]117-joanna ask no more of [Heaven]162-heaven , [[my]117-joanna lord]3102-my lord , than but to die [[Sir Richard]129-sir richard s wife]4847-sir richard s wife , "[117-joanna] returned [Joanna]117-joanna .

" Look [ye]117-joanna at that , [[my]207-dick lord]3102-my lord , "[207-dick] said [Gloucester]207-dick , turning to [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " Here be a pair for [you]117-joanna . [The lad]309-the lad , when for good services [I]207-dick gave [him]309-the lad [his]309-the lad choice of [my]207-dick favour , chose but the grace of [an old , drunken shipman]4850-an old , drunken shipman . [I]207-dick did warn [him]309-the lad freely , but [he]309-the lad was stout in [his]309-the lad besottedness . Here dieth [your]117-joanna favour , said [I]207-dick ; and [he]309-the lad , [[my]207-dick lord]3102-my lord , with a most assured impertinence , [Mine]207-dick be the loss , quoth [he]309-the lad . It shall be so , by the rood ! "[207-dick]

" Said [he]309-the lad so ? "[218-alicia] cried [Alicia]218-alicia . " Then well said , [lion - driver]4350-lion - driver ! "[218-alicia]

" Who is this ? "[3689-the duke] asked [the duke]3689-the duke .

" [A prisoner of [Sir Richard s]4854-sir richard s]4853-a prisoner of sir richard s , "[157-lord foxham] answered [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham ; " [Mistress Alicia Risingham]218-alicia . "[157-lord foxham]

" See that [she]218-alicia be married to [a sure man]3227-a sure man , "[3689-the duke] said [the duke]3689-the duke .

" [I]157-lord foxham had thought of [[my]157-lord foxham kinsman]3424-my kinsman , [Hamley]227-hamley , an it like [your]218-alicia grace , "[157-lord foxham] returned [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " [He]227-hamley hath well served the cause . "[157-lord foxham]

" It likes [me]129-sir richard well , "[129-sir richard] said [Richard]129-sir richard . " Let [them]4857-we be wedded speedily . Say , [fair maid]4263-fair maid , will [you]218-alicia [we]4857-we d ? "[129-sir richard]

" [[My]218-alicia lord duke]4170-my lord duke , "[218-alicia] said [Alicia]218-alicia , " so as [the man]3175-the man is straight "[218-alicia] And there , in a perfect consternation , the voice died on [her]218-alicia tongue .

" [He]3175-the man is straight , [[my]129-sir richard mistress]4031-my mistress , "[129-sir richard] replied [Richard]129-sir richard , calmly . " [I]129-sir richard am [the only crookback of [[my]129-sir richard party]4829-my party]4862-the only crookback of my party ; [we]4857-we are else passably well shapen . [Ladies]2098-ladies , and [you]2098-ladies , [[my]129-sir richard lord]3102-my lord , "[129-sir richard] [he]129-sir richard added , with a sudden change to grave courtesy , " judge [me]129-sir richard not too churlish if [I]129-sir richard leave [you]2098-ladies . [A captain , in the time of war]4866-a captain , in the time of war , hath not the ordering of [his]129-sir richard hours . "[129-sir richard]

And with a very handsome salutation [he]129-sir richard passed on , followed by [[his]129-sir richard officers]3063-his officers .

" [Alack]147-alack , "[218-alicia] cried [Alicia]218-alicia , " [I]218-alicia am shent ! "[218-alicia]

" [Ye]2098-ladies know [him]129-sir richard not , "[157-lord foxham] replied [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " It is but a trifle ; [he]129-sir richard hath already clean forgot [your]2098-ladies words . "[157-lord foxham]

" [He]129-sir richard is , then , the very flower of knighthood , "[218-alicia] said [Alicia]218-alicia .

" Nay , [he]129-sir richard but mindeth other things , "[157-lord foxham] returned [Lord Foxham]157-lord foxham . " [Tarry]68-tarry [we]3065-they no more . "[157-lord foxham]

In [the chancel]3064-the chancel [they]3065-they found [Dick]207-dick waiting , attended by [a few young men]3066-a few young men ; and there were [he]207-dick and [Joan]117-joanna united . When [they]3065-they came forth again , happy and yet serious , into the frosty air and sunlight , the long files of [the army]3067-the army were already winding forward up [the road]257-the road ; already [the Duke of Gloucester]2569-the duke of gloucester s banner was unfolded and began to move from before [the abbey]2910-the abbey in a clump of spears ; and behind [it]3071-it , girt by [steel - clad knights]3072-steel - clad knights , [the bold , black - hearted , and ambitious hunchback]3073-the bold , black - hearted , and ambitious hunchback moved on towards [[his]3073-the bold , black - hearted , and ambitious hunchback brief kingdom]3074-his brief kingdom and [his]3073-the bold , black - hearted , and ambitious hunchback lasting infamy . But [the wedding party]3075-the wedding party turned upon the other side , and sat down , with sober merriment , to breakfast . [The father cellarer]3076-the father cellarer attended on [their]3065-they wants , and sat with [them]3065-they at table . [Hamley]227-hamley , all jealousy forgotten , began to ply [the nowise loth Alicia]218-alicia with courtship . And there , amid the sounding of tuckets and the clash of [armoured soldiery]3077-armoured soldiery and horses continually moving forth , [Dick]207-dick and [Joan]117-joanna sat side by side , tenderly held hands , and looked , with ever growing affection , in [each other]664-each other s eyes .

Thenceforth the dust and blood of [that unruly epoch]3079-that unruly epoch passed [them]3065-they by . [They]3065-they dwelt apart from alarms in [the green forest]3080-the green forest where [their]3065-they love began .

[Two old men in the meanwhile]3081-two old men in the meanwhile enjoyed pensions in great prosperity and peace , and with perhaps a superfluity of ale and wine , in [Tunstall hamlet]5-tunstall . [One]3600-one had been all [his]3600-one life [a shipman]3491-a shipman , and continued to the last to lament [[his]3600-one man]1648-his man [Tom]136-tom . [The other , who had been a bit of everything , turned in the end towards piety , and made a most religious death]3085-the other , who had been a bit of everything , turned in the end towards piety , and made a most religious death under the name of [Brother Honestus]231-brother honestus in [the neighbouring abbey]3086-the neighbouring abbey . So [Lawless]194-lawless had [his]194-lawless will , and died [a friar]1893-a friar .
